title: R&D Engineer - Embedded Software developer
description:
**Description**


Hitachi Energy revolutionized the transmission of electricity over long distances with minimal losses over 60 years ago by introducing High Voltage Direct Current (HVDC) technology. Today, HVDC can deliver up to 12 gigawatts of power at voltage levels reaching 1,100 kV, covering distances of over 3,000 kilometres. In the heart of HVDC station, the Modular Advanced Control for High performance (MACH™) system plays a vital role in achieving successful results. MACH™ offers unparalleled calculation capacity and facilitates seamless integration and control of all functions related to protection and control. Additionally, MACH™ control provides advanced fault registration and remote-control capabilities. Designed to operate continuously for thirty years or more, the MACH™ system ensures reliable control and protection of the HVDC system throughout its lifespan.


As a member of the R&D team in the MACH Products unit, you will collaborate with a diverse group of talented engineers from around the world. Working within the SAFe framework, you will contribute to the development of the next generation MACH™ system and maintain both new and existing legacy systems.

**How you’ll make an impact**

* Engage in the development and maintenance of wide range of embedded systems (ARM, DSP, SoC...), from pre-study and design to tests and integration.
* Develop high-quality software modules within specified timelines and efficiently maintain them, including implementing enhancements and bug fixes.
* Create specifications and documentation for software components.
* Ensure code quality through code reviews, test automation, and adherence to up-to-date software development processes.
* Collaborate with internal and external customers working in agile, cross-competent teams.
* Uphold Hitachi Energy's core values of safety and integrity by taking responsibility for your actions and showing care for your colleagues and the business.

**Your background**

* 5+ years of work experience in relevant role and field.
* You hold a Bachelor's or Master's degree in Embedded Systems, Computer Science, Electronics, or Electrical Engineering.
* Profound engineering background in **embedded software development** using **C/C++** on multi-processor systems.
* Overview in **electronics**, FPGA/VHDL to also partner with hardware and FPGA designers in the team.
* Experience with relevant development environments and software tools such as **real time operating systems, microcontroller architecture, GIT, Dev Ops, TFS, static code analysis** etc.
* Knowledge of **C#** and communication protocols like **CAN and EtherCAT** would be advantageous.
* Excellent **English** presentation skills.

**What we offer**

* Collective agreement
* Flexible working time
* Health care and wellness allowance
* Fantastic career possibilities within Hitachi Energy both within Sweden and globally
* Mentor to support you throughout onboard phase
* Various trainings and education supporting employee development
* Diversified company with over 70+ nationalities working in Sweden
* Supplementary compensation for parental leave
* Employee Benefit Portal with thousands of discounts and perks

**Additional information**


Are you ready to join Hitachi Energy for a career with no limits and a place where you can be yourself? We are ready for you!


Welcome to apply by March 25th! Applications will be reviewed on an ongoing basis so the sooner you show your interest the better.


More information: Recruiting Manager Remia Menon, remia.menon@hitachienergy.com, will answer your questions about the position. Union representatives – Sveriges Ingenjörer: Mikael Hjort, +46 107-38 29 86; Unionen: Fredrik Holmgren, +46 107-38 21 85; Ledarna: Frank Hollstedt, +46 107-38 70 43. All other questions can be directed to Talent Acquisition Partner Gustaf Hedström, gustaf.hedstrom@hitachienergy.com

**Qualified individuals with a disability may request a reasonable accommodation if you are unable or limited in your ability to use or access the Hitachi Energy career site as a result of your disability. You may request reasonable accommodations by completing a** **general inquiry form** **on our website. Please include your contact information and specific details about your required accommodation to support you during the job application process.**
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

**This is solely for job seekers with disabilities requiring accessibility assistance or an accommodation in the job application process. Messages left for other purposes will not receive a response.**
---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

title: Embedded Software Developer
description:
**Rollen**


AB Regin är i en spännande tillväxtfas och vi söker nu en ny stjärna till vårt utvecklingsteam! Hos oss får du möjlighet att arbeta i en dynamisk miljö där din insats gör verklig skillnad. Vi värdesätter innovation, samarbete och personlig utveckling – och vi hoppas att du vill vara med på vår resa mot en mer hållbar framtid.


Som Embedded Software Developer hos oss får du ett varierat och utvecklande arbete där du samarbetar med både svenska och internationella kollegor. Du får chansen att arbeta med moderna teknologier och utveckla lösningar som gör skillnad – från idé till färdig produkt.

**Dina arbetsuppgifter:**

* Utveckla och underhålla en realtidsbaserad plattform som hanterar sensorer och flera kommunikationsprotokoll (både trådbundna och trådlösa)
* Designa, implementera och testa ny funktionalitet i både Embedded- och Applikationsmjukvara, huvudsakligen i C/C++ och Python
* Ett nära samarbete med hårdvarudesigners för att säkerställa integration mellan mjukvara och hårdvara
* Arbeta med helhetsansvar i utvecklingsprocessen samtidigt som du fördjupar dig inom specifika teknikområden
* Delta aktivt i felsökning och problemlösning vid supportärenden
* Bidra till och utveckla teamets arbetssätt och processer

**Vem är du?**


För att trivas och lyckas i rollen är du nyfiken, lösningsorienterad och har ett helhetsperspektiv på systemutveckling. Du gillar att utforska nya tekniker och ser varje utmaning som en möjlighet att växa. Med en stark analytisk förmåga och ett strukturerat arbetssätt kan du sätta dig in i tekniska samband och skapa hållbara lösningar. Vi söker dig som är en prestigelös lagspelare med stort eget driv och en vilja att bidra till teamets gemensamma framgång.

**Kvalifikationer:**

* Högskoleutbildning inom datateknik eller motsvarande
* Gedigen erfarenhet av utveckling inom Embedded Software
* Erfarenhet av att designa och utveckla komplexa realtidssystem
* Mycket goda kunskaper i C/C++ och Python
* Vana att arbeta med testdriven utveckling
* Flytande svenska och engelska i tal och skrift (minst nivå B2)

**Meriterande:**

* Kunskap om automationssystem och deras uppbyggnad, gärna i industriell miljö.
* Erfarenhet av arbete med trådlösa system och kommunikationsteknologier.
* Kännedom om kommunikationsprotokollet BACnet.
* Erfarenhet av utveckling eller arbete i Linux-miljöer.

**Varför AB Regin?**


På AB Regin får du möjlighet att vara en del av en spännande framtid. Vi utvecklar innovativa lösningar för fastighetsautomation och bidrar till ett mer energieffektivt samhälle. Hos oss arbetar du i en öppen och inspirerande kultur där vi stöttar, utmanar och hjälper varandra att växa.


Vi erbjuder en dynamisk arbetsmiljö med engagerade kollegor, stort inflytande över ditt arbete och en kultur där vi värdesätter samarbete, innovation och hållbarhet.


Om du vill vara med och skapa framtidens hållbara teknik – då är det här rätt plats för dig!


Sista ansökningsdag är 30/9 – men skicka in din ansökan redan idag och bli en del av vårt team! Vi går igenom ansökningar löpande och tjänsten kan komma att tillsättas innan sista ansökningsdag.

title: Junior Web Developer
description:
We are one of Sweden’s largest SaaS companies, using innovative technology to digitalize the construction industry — making it safer, more productive, and more sustainable. With us, you’ll be part of a creative team where you’ll grow, take on exciting challenges, and have fun along the way! We’re now looking for more colleagues to join us on our journey to digitalize one of the world’s largest industries and contribute to a more sustainable society.
   

  

 Are you a fast learner who embraces change and continuously looks for ways to grow — both as a developer and as a team player? You thrive on diving into new technologies and bring a can-do attitude to every project. This might be an opportunity for you!
   

  

 We’re now hiring a Junior Full-stack Web Developer with strong UX profile and WordPress experience to join our team at Infobric Workforce. You’ll be part of our Marketing team and play a key role in our digital development.
   

  

**Your responsibilities:**
* Build and improve functional, high-performing websites based, among other, on Figma designs
* Proactively provide input and solve development and design challenges related to UX, SEO, content, performance, and conversion
* Continuously refine page structures and components to align with business goals and user needs
* Collaborate across teams to ensure clean and effective technical implementation (frontend, backend, integrations, tracking, etc)
* Integrate external platforms and services via, for instance, APIs


**We are looking for:**
 We’re looking for a Junior Web Full-stack Developer with strong technical skills and a sharp eye for UX design to join our digital product team. Ideally, you have 2–3 years of experience, have worked in WordPress environments, and feel comfortable collaborating closely with development, design, content, and marketing teams to build user-centered, high-performing websites.
   

  

**What we offer :**
* A key role in a growing digital team within a stable tech company rooted in the construction industry
* Real influence on product development, UX, and business results
* Skilled, collaborative, international colleagues in a culture of openness
* Office perks including a fully equipped gym, weekly fika, and Friday breakfasts
* Flat structure with real autonomy, take ownership and lead your work
* Focus on impact and outcomes, not just time at your desk


**The team you will be joining:**
 We are a diverse and dynamic Marketing team where openness, collaboration, and continuous development are part of everyday life. We are passionate about building user-centered, high-performing websites that make life easier for our customers.
   

  

**How to apply:**
 Apply easily using your LinkedIn profile or by attaching your CV. We review applications on an ongoing basis and the position may be filled quickly – so don’t wait to submit your application!

title: Fullstack AI Developer
company_industry: Embedded Software Products, Think Tanks, and Technology, Information and Internet
description:
**We’re Redeploy. A tech consultancy built for people who want to grow, make a difference and have a good time doing it.**
 We design, build, scale and maintain modern solutions across Cloud, Data and AI, helping ambitious companies across the Nordics transform how they work with technology. As a trusted partner to Microsoft, AWS and Databricks, we deliver platforms that are built for impact and built to last.
   

  

 What sets us apart is the way we work. Curiosity runs deep here, as does the drive to keep learning and sharing. You’ll join a team that values ownership, collaboration and high technical standards, and where people genuinely care about doing things well. For our clients. And for each other.
   

  

**What You’ll Do**
 As an Fullstack AI Developer, you’ll join our AI Engineering team, working alongside Oskar, Oskar and Cong - the trio leading some of our most advanced AI deliveries. You’ll build fullstack solutions that integrate with AI services to solve real-world business challenges. This is not a model development role. Your focus will be on turning powerful AI capabilities into seamless web-based applications that deliver real value to users.
   

  

 You’ll work in project-based teams together with cloud, data and AI specialists, building everything from frontend interfaces to backend services that connect AI tools with business data and systems, often in Azure or AWS environments.
   

  

**Examples Of What You Might Build**
* Connect data and AI cloud platforms to marketing automation systems
* Building internal tools for clients, enabling their staff to query their own company data using natural language in Microsoft Teams.
* Web apps that present personalised content based on customer data and AI recommendation


**What You’ll Grow Into**
 This role gives you the opportunity to grow both technically and commercially. Working across diverse client projects, you’ll continuously sharpen your skills in fullstack development, cloud platforms and applied AI, and gain valuable insight into how businesses use technology to drive real impact.
   

  

 You’ll be part of a team that values curiosity, high technical standards and knowledge sharing. We learn together, challenge each other and collaborate closely to build things that last. Whether you want to deepen your craft, take more ownership in client deliveries or broaden your experience across AI-integrated solutions, we’ll support your development every step of the way.
   

  

**Who We’re Looking For**
 We’re looking for someone who not only enjoys building smart, scalable applications but also thrives in a collaborative and client-facing environment. As a consultant, you’re curious, communicative and comfortable adapting to different contexts and challenges. You take ownership of your work, are structured in your approach and always aim to deliver high-quality solutions.
   

  

 You’re a strong developer with a solid technical foundation, and ideally you’ve worked on applications that integrate AI in some way. If not, you’re at least genuinely curious about the possibilities AI brings and keen to explore how it can be used to create real business value.
   

  

**What Experiences You Bring**
* University degree in Computer Science or similar
* 3+ years of experience in modern application or product development
* Proven experience building fullstack solutions with real-world integrations
* Comfortable working with JavaScript/TypeScript, React, Python and SQL
* Experience deploying to cloud environments like Azure or AWS
* Familiar with containerization (Docker) and microservices
* Used to working with CI/CD and Git-based workflows
* Fluency in English, and preferably Swedish, as many of our clients are Swedish-speaking
* Bonus if you’ve worked with services like Azure OpenAI, Databricks or LLM services


 You don’t need a background in AI, but a genuine interest in learning how to apply it in real-world use cases will take you far here.
   

  

**Curious to know more?**
 Have a look around our career site to explore our culture, people and way of working. And if you have any questions, feel free to reach out to our Talent Acquisition Manager, Francisca Andersson.

title: Frontend Developer
description:
**Join SAVR – Disrupting the World of Savings, Together** 




 SAVR is a fast-growing Swedish fintech company on a mission to reinvent investing. We empower investors with a platform that offers
 **lower fees** 
 ,
 **greater transparency** 
 , and a
 **radically improved experience** 
 .
 



  





 We’re not just building another investment service — we’re reimagining how financial products should work for people, not just institutions. As part of our ambitious, innovative and curious team, you’ll help shape the future of investing in Sweden and beyond.
 



  





**The Role** 




 We’re looking for a
 **Software Engineer - Frontend** 
 who is passionate about solving real problems, building great user experiences, and challenging the old norms of the financial world. In this role, you’ll be instrumental in helping us build scalable tech.
 



  





**Your Mission** 



* To contribute to creating an exceptional user experience by closely collaborating with Design and User Experience teams
* The opportunity to enhance our tech stack, architecture, and operational methods while driving innovation from a technical perspective
* By following good engineering practices, you will play a crucial role in building high-quality products
* Collaborate cross-functionally with Software Engineers, Data Scientists, Product Designer and Product Managers
* Analyze and iterate based on feedback, data, and business goals
* You will receive valuable feedback on your code and have the chance to provide feedback to your peers, fostering growth and collaboration within the team



  





 Your work will be managed and supported by our Tech Team Lead.
 **Our tech stack consists of Elm, React Native, Tailwind CSS, hosted on AWS.** 




  





**You’ll Thrive in This Role If You...** 



* Are motivated and talented engineers with a passion for software development
* Have professional team-based software development experience
* Are a team player who values diverse opinions and believes in the power of collaboration
* Have appreciation for an inclusive and vibrant office environment
* Have experience with functional programming languages
* Are fluent in English
* Have Swedish citizenship or a valid EU work permit (unfortunately, we cannot offer visa sponsorship for this role)



  





 If you possess a different profile but believe you have relevant skills and can excel in this role, we encourage you to apply and share your motivation with us.
 



  





**Our Cultural DNA** 




 At SAVR, we’re:
 



  





 🧠
 **Open-minded** 
 – we embrace new ideas, diverse perspectives, and continuous learning
 



 🚀
 **Bold** 
 – we take smart risks, move fast, and aren’t afraid to fail forward
 



 🤝
 **Honest** 
 – we value transparency, feedback, and doing the right thing
 



  





 We’re a startup, so things can be a little messy — and that’s part of the thrill. If you thrive in building as a team and handling uncertainty, you will fit right in.
 



  





**What’s In It for You** 




 You’ll join a product- and design-driven company where your work has real impact. We keep things lean, move fast, and genuinely care about the experience we deliver — for customers and for each other.
 



 Here’s what we offer:
 



  





 💻 Top-tier work gear
 



 💰 Competitive salary
 



 🏃‍♀️ Generous wellness allowance
 



 🤒 Insurance package
 



 🌱 Occupational pension and long-term savings support
 



 🏢
 *Office-first approach* 
 to foster collaboration and quick decision-making — with flexibility when you need it (4+1)
 



 🥗
 *Stocked pantry* 
 , plus regular social gatherings and wellness activities to keep energy and culture high
 



  





**Our Commitment to Diversity** 




 SAVR is an equal opportunity employer. We welcome people from all backgrounds, identities, and experiences. We believe diverse teams build better products and are committed to creating an inclusive workplace where everyone can thrive.
 



  





**Ready to Join Us?** 




 We’d love to hear from you. Apply now or reach out with any questions — and let’s build something meaningful together.
 



  





**Summer time is upon us!** 




 During July and August all posted jobs are on hold and will be picked up during late August again. Thank you for your patience with the time line, and we hope you enjoy your summer too!

title: Game Developer
description:
****More independence, freedom, and better pay****
 Coody believes in combining the freedom and flexibility of freelancing with the security of traditional employment.
   

  

 It's not rocket science.
   

  

 Overpaid managers, fancy offices, and heavily burdened organizations are history.
   

  

 The tech talent of tomorrow deserves a new, independent, and well-paid standard.
   

  

 Welcome to what we call Gravity Free Consulting.
   

  

****Why Coody****
 At Coody, we cut out everything unnecessary to give more back to you as a consultant. And we have done it in the package of a slimmed and efficient organization, meaning no overpaid managers, no fancy offices and no luxurious conferences. But, what does this mean in practice?
   

  

**Maximized Compensation** 
 - Typically a +40% salary increase.
   

  

**Freedom & Flexibility** 
 - No bosses. All digital. Fully remote for those who prefer.
   

  

**Employment Security** 
 - Fixed salary, pension, insurance, paid vacation and a big educational fund.
   

  

**Shaping the Future** 
 - Projects and assignments for digital game changes like Mojang, Spotify, Volumental, Volvo Cars, Varjo, Toca Boca, Hemnet, and exciting startups and scaleups.
   

  

****This is Coody****
 We’re a diverse community of ambitious tech people from more than 14 nationalities working on exciting challenges with customers across Sweden, Finland, USA, and the UK in industries ranging from gaming, AR, EV, AI, Medtech and Fintech.
   

  

 Coody is more of a platform than a traditional consultancy. Everything we do, we do to make sure individuals working here can live according to their own priorities and unique ambitions. A consultant-first environment where you have better control over your career.
   

  

 Explore our
 **Employee Handbook** 
 and discover a company that actually puts consultants first.
   

  

****What you’ll be doing****
 As a consultant in Game Development at Coody, you’ll have the opportunity to work with some of the most inspiring digital entertainment companies in the world, in fields such as Games, AR/VR, Music, and other forms of interactive media. You’ll collaborate with cross-functional teams, including developers, designers, artists, producers, and product managers.
   

  

 You’ll need to be adaptable and ready to hit the ground running in new environments. We see every challenge as an opportunity to grow. Typically, you’ll work on 1-2 assignments per year for companies in industries that you’re passionate about.
   

  

****Who you are****
 We’re after talented game developers who love to build immersive experiences and bring ideas to life. You thrive in fast-paced environments, enjoy pushing technical boundaries, and want the freedom to work on exciting projects - without the corporate nonsense.
   

  

* 5+ years of experience in software development.
* Hands-on experience with building games, VR/AR, or similar interactive experiences.
* Solid skills in modern C++, Lua, AngelScript, or web technologies.
* Experience from Unreal Engine (a bonus).
* A relevant degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Game Development, or similar.
* Based in Sweden - You must have Swedish citizenship, a valid work visa, or permanent residency.
* Fluent in English (spoken and written)


****How to apply****
 Are you excited to take your career to the next level and meet the criterias? Apply now, and we'll be in touch shortly.

title: Software Engineer
description:
**Description & Requirements**
 Electronic Arts creates next-level entertainment experiences that inspire players and fans around the world. Here, everyone is part of the story. Part of a community that connects across the globe. A place where creativity thrives, new perspectives are invited, and ideas matter. A team where everyone makes play happen.
   

  

 Electronic Arts creates next-level entertainment experiences that inspire players and fans around the world. Here, everyone is part of the story. Part of a community that connects across the globe. A place where creativity thrives, new perspectives are invited, and ideas matter. A team where everyone makes play happen.
   

  

 EAX In-game Experiences team is responsible for EA Connect, our social overlay facilitating cross-platform party, voip, quick messaging and game invites, used in most EA Sports titles. We are also responsible for the new Spotify integration recently released in FC 25.
   

  

 We are looking for someone to help us build experiences like this, using JavaScript and C++.
   

  

 You will be based in the Stockholm office in a hybrid work environment. You will report to an engineering lead in the team.
   

  

**Responsibilities**
* You will primarily be working with feature development in JavaScript, using TypeScript and React, running in an embedded JavaScript engine that connects to a C++ SDK in the game engine.
* You will improve our C++ SDK to support our JavaScript feature development.
* You will develop libraries and products used in multiple EA games.
* You will partner with game teams and ensure the code works on several platforms, always with an eye on performance.
* You will be part of the broader engineering group, and an important contributor to the EAX team based in Sweden.
* You will design systems and APIs and contribute to technical design and reviews


**Requirements**
* 7+ years of JavaScript programming experience
* Experience using TypeScript
* Experience using React or React Native
* Experience using Flexbox for layout
* 3+ years of C++ programming experience
* Understand how to adapt C++ code to be used on multiple platforms/compilers
* Experience developing and packaging C++ SDKs/libraries is a bonus


**About Electronic Arts**
 We’re proud to have an extensive portfolio of games and experiences, locations around the world, and opportunities across EA. We value adaptability, resilience, creativity, and curiosity. From leadership that brings out your potential, to creating space for learning and experimenting, we empower you to do great work and pursue opportunities for growth.
   

  

 We adopt a holistic approach to our benefits programs, emphasizing physical, emotional, financial, career, and community wellness to support a balanced life. Our packages are tailored to meet local needs and may include healthcare coverage, mental well-being support, retirement savings, paid time off, family leaves, complimentary games, and more. We nurture environments where our teams can always bring their best to what they do.
   

  

 Electronic Arts is an equal opportunity employer. All employment decisions are made without regard to race, color, national origin, ancestry, sex, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, genetic information, religion, disability, medical condition, pregnancy, marital status, family status, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law. We will also consider employment qualified applicants with criminal records in accordance with applicable law. EA also makes workplace accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities as required by applicable law.

title: Developer - Backend, Devops
company_industry: Venture Capital and Private Equity Principals
description:
**Location:**
 Stockholm - Hybrid/on-site, not fully remote.
   

  

**Why VNTRS?**
 By joining VNTRS, you'll be part of an environment that values innovation, partnership, and shared success. We offer significant growth opportunities and the chance to be at the forefront of technological advancements in a collaborative and dynamic setting.
   

  

 Our mission is to transform innovative ideas into successful companies. Unlike typical consultants, we are hands-on partners sharing both risks and successes with our clients. With a dedicated team of over 40 experts in Stockholm, Tallinn, and Helsinki, we are looking to expand our technical prowess by adding a skilled ML Backend developer to spearhead our development projects and contribute to our technological strategy.
   

  

**About The Role**
 We are looking for a senior Backend developer with experience/interest in Machine learning and DevOps practices.
   

  

 As our Backend Developer, you'll play a crucial role in guiding our organization through the fast-changing AI landscape. Working within our Tech Forum, you will collaborate with a dynamic group of more than 20 professionals, including full-stack developers, DevOps engineers, and architects.
   

  

**What You’ll Do**
* Design and develop scalable backend systems (primarily in Python/Django)
* Build and maintain CI/CD pipelines and infrastructure in cloud environments (GCP, AWS, etc.)
* Lead or support early-stage product development and architecture decisions
* Collaborate closely with product owners, designers, and fellow developers
* Represent VNTRS as a consultant on external projects with larger enterprises
* Explore and integrate ML/AI solutions when appropriate, with support from our ML specialists
* Share knowledge and contribute to internal tech discussions, tools, and standards
* Work closely with the Head of Tech to align AI initiatives with company objectives


**Who You Are / Preferred Qualifications**
* 5+ years of professional experience in software development, specifically backend development
* Strong DevOps experience: CI/CD, cloud infrastructure (GCP preferred), Docker, Terraform, etc.
* Solid experience with Python (especially Django)
* Comfortable working across the stack when needed
* Familiarity or interest in ML/AI. You don’t need to be an expert, but you’re not afraid of the buzzwords
* Excellent communicator and problem solver
* Experience working as a consultant or with different projects/products
* Fluent in Swedish and English
* Comfortable in dynamic environments and working closely with clients


**Nice To Have**
* Experience with ML pipelines, MLOps tools, or vector databases
* Experience in startups, venture studios, or fast-paced product environments
* Familiarity with frontend frameworks (React, Next.js)


**Application**
 If you're ready to play a key role in VNTRS's tech revolution, we want to hear from you. Apply now to contribute to the future success of VNTRS and our clients.
   

  

 VNTRS is a venture studio that helps entrepreneurs and large corporations to build innovative digital products and services. In some cases we invest part of our fee in exchange for equity, so-called sweat equity investments.
   

  

 Our team consists of software developers, UI/UX designers, product and project managers, brand experts, and growth specialists.

title: Developer
description:
*Vi tror på ett samhälle format av framgångsrika företag där entreprenörskap och samhällsnytta går hand i hand. Att vara en del av Fortnox är att vara en del av en ständig förändring - en förändring där du själv bestämmer hur långt du vill nå. Vårt största fokus är att ge dig rätt förutsättningar att få leva din passion tillsammans med oss. Var du kommer ifrån är inte relevant - det är vart du är på väg som är intressant för oss. Precis som vi igår inte kunde drömma om det Fortnox som finns idag, så kan du vara med och forma vilka vi är imorgon.*
**Om tjänsten**
 Nu söker vi Stockholms bästa utvecklare till vårt affärsområde Financial Services. Här bygger vi smarta lösningar som hjälper Sveriges företagare med finansiering och att få betalt för sina tjänster. Som utvecklare hos oss kommer du därför att få arbeta med att utveckla de tjänster som gör oss till Sveriges mest spännande fintech-bolag. Du kommer att ingå i ett mindre team som tar stort ansvar för design och användbarhet av lösningar. Vi arbetar agilt och du kommer att få vara med och påverka arbetssätt, metoder och tekniker vilket ger dig stora möjligheter att utvecklas genom hela teknikstacken. Tillsammans med andra utvecklare, produktägare och testare tar ni affärsområdet Financial Services till nästa nivå.
   

  

**Vi söker dig som**
* Har ett genuint intresse för programmering, drivs av utmanande uppgifter och att förbättra användarupplevelsen för våra kunder!
* Har några års erfarenhet av professionell mjukvaruutveckling.
* Besitter goda kunskaper i moderna programmeringstekniker. Du bör ha några års erfarenhet av Java/Kotlin.
* Är flytande i svenska i såväl tal som skrift


 För att trivas i denna roll ser vi att du är lösningsorienterad och att du trivs med att jobba i en föränderlig miljö. Du är trygg i din kompetens, är självgående och tar gärna lead på kontinuerlig förbättring av metoder, verktyg och leveranser. Du håller dig uppdaterad om relevanta tekniker och verktyg, deltar i teambeslut och sprider gärna vidare din kunskap till dina kollegor på Fortnox.
   

  

**Vi erbjuder**
 Techstack: Java/Kotlin, React, Postgres, Bitbucket/Github
   

  

 Du kommer ingå i ett självgående men sammansvetsat team. Vi träffas ofta och gärna och samarbetar både strategiskt och operativt med team inom samma område. Vi tror på flexibilitet och att arbeta på distans, samtidigt som vi vill erbjuda en kreativ arbetsmiljö för våra medarbetare. Vi sitter i fina lokaler på Linnégatan 89 i Stockholm och träffas på kontoret 3 dagar i veckan.
   

  

**Om Fortnox**
*Fortnox AB (publ) är en företagsplattform som knyter samman människor, företag och organisationer. Vi hjälper företag starta, växa och utvecklas. Med smarta tekniska produkter, lösningar och tjänster, och möjlighet att koppla ihop dem med hundratals externa parter, är vi ett nav för företagande i Sverige. Vår vision är att skapa ett välmående samhälle format av framgångsrika företag. Fortnox grundades 2001 och har huvudkontor i Växjö samt kontor i Malmö, Linköping och Stockholm. Aktien är noterad på Nasdaq Stockholm. För ytterligare information se* 
*www.fortnox.se* 
*.*
**Välkommen med din ansökan!**

title: Organizational Developer
description:
**Company Description**
**Job Description**
**At H&M Tech,** 
 we don’t just adapt to change—we drive it. We’re on a journey to become a truly tech- and data-driven company, and we’re looking for bold thinkers to help us get there.
   

  

 As an Organizational Developer, you’ll be at the heart of this transformation. You’ll partner with tech leaders across the globe to design the structures, capabilities, and ways of working that empower high-performing teams and future-ready leadership.
   

  

 This is your chance to turn complexity into clarity, challenges into opportunities, and ideas into real impact—across the entire H&M Group.
   

  

**Team Responsibilities where you will contribute:**
* Coach and consult leaders to unlock organizational effectiveness
* Design and implement structures that support agility and innovation
* Use data to drive insights, decisions, and action
* Define job architecture and role clarity that scales
* Lead strategic workforce planning to meet tomorrow’s needs
* Build tools, frameworks, and governance that enable growth
* Foster collaboration across tech and business
* Champion a culture of inclusion, safety, and high performance


**Who You Are**
 You’re a strategic thinker with a hands-on mindset. You thrive in a fast-paced environment and enjoy working across teams to find smart, sustainable solutions.
   

  

 We believe you bring:
   

  

* A degree in Organizational Development, Business, HR, Psychology—or similar
* 3–5+ years of experience in Organizational Development, Strategy, HR and/or Managment Consulting (bonus if it’s in tech)
* Strong project management and stakeholder skills
* A sharp analytical mind and a bias for action
* A passion for solving problems and challenging the status quo
* Fluent English, written and spoken


**Additional Information**
 This is a full-time permanent position based at our head office in Stockholm. Ready to take the leap? Apply now with your application latest by
 **20 Jul 2025** 
 . We are excited to welcome you to our team and start this incredible journey together!
   

  

**Who We Are**
 H&M Group is a global company of strong fashion brands and ventures. Our goal is to prove that there is no compromise between exceptional design, affordable prices, and sustainable solutions. We want to liberate fashion for the many, and our customers are at the heart of every decision we make.
   

  

 We are made up of thousands of passionate and talented colleagues united by our shared culture and values. Together, we want to use our power, our scale, and our knowledge to push the fashion industry towards a more inclusive and sustainable future.
   

  

**WHY YOU’LL LOVE WORKING HERE** 
  

  

 At H&M Group, we are proud to be a vibrant and welcoming company. We offer our employees attractive benefits with extensive development opportunities around the globe.
   

  

* 25% Staff discount on all our H&M Group brands, both in stores and online (H&M, COS, Weekday, Monki, H&M HOME, & Other Stories and ARKET).
* H&M Incentive Program – HIP. Learn more about the program here.


**JOIN US**
 Our uniqueness comes from a combination of many things – our inclusive and collaborative culture, our strong values, and opportunities for growth. But most of all, it’s our people who make us who we are.
   

  

 Take the next step in your career together with us. The journey starts here.
   

  

* We are committed to a recruitment process that is fair, equitable, and based on competency. We therefore kindly ask you to not attach a cover letter in your application.

title: Embedded Software Engineer
description:
****More independence, freedom, and better pay****
 Coody believes in combining the freedom and flexibility of freelancing with the security of traditional employment.
   

  

 It's not rocket science.
   

  

 Overpaid managers, fancy offices, and heavily burdened organizations are history.
   

  

 The tech talent of tomorrow deserves a new, independent, and well-paid standard.
   

  

 Welcome to what we call Gravity Free Consulting.
   

  

****Why Coody****
 At Coody, we cut out everything unnecessary to give more back to you as a consultant. And we have done it in the package of a slimmed and efficient organization, meaning no overpaid managers, no fancy offices and no luxurious conferences. But, what does this mean in practice?
   

  

**Maximized Compensation** 
 - Typically a +40% salary increase.
   

  

**Freedom & Flexibility** 
 - No bosses. All digital. Fully remote for those who prefer.
   

  

**Employment Security** 
 - Fixed salary, pension, insurance, paid vacation and a big educational fund.
   

  

**Shaping the Future** 
 - Projects and assignments for digital game changes like Mojang, Spotify, Volumental, Volvo Cars, Varjo, Toca Boca, Hemnet, and exciting startups and scaleups.
   

  

****This is Coody****
 We’re a diverse community of ambitious tech people from more than 14 nationalities working on exciting challenges with customers across Sweden, Finland, USA, and the UK in industries ranging from gaming, AR, EV, AI, Medtech and Fintech.
   

  

 Coody is more of a platform than a traditional consultancy. Everything we do, we do to make sure individuals working here can live according to their own priorities and unique ambitions. A consultant-first environment where you have better control over your career.
   

  

 Explore our
 **Employee Handbook** 
 and discover a company that actually puts consultants first.
   

  

****What you’ll be doing****
 As a consultant in Embedded Software at Coody, you’ll be tackling challenges for companies and products that truly make a difference. Your role will likely include:
   

  

* Developing & Optimizing products within Embedded or Firmware Software.
* Prototyping, Testing & Debugging on real hardware, ensuring top-notch quality and reliability throughout development.
* Collaborating on product and service strategy, engineering best practices, and building strong team spirit with your client.


****Who you are****
 We’re after skilled problem-solvers who love to build, optimize, and innovate in the embedded and firmware space. You thrive in hands-on development and enjoy tackling complex technical challenges.
   

  

* At least 4-5 years of experience as an Embedded Software Engineer.
* Deep expertise in C, C++ or Embedded Python, plus experience with other embedded or firmware related areas.
* A doer’s mentality - You get things done and have a track record to prove it.
* Relevant engineering degree - Background in vehicle, electronics, computer science, mechatronics, or similar fields.
* Based in Sweden - You must have Swedish citizenship, a valid work visa, or permanent residency, to apply.
* Fluent in English (spoken and written).


****How to apply****
 Are you excited to take your career to the next level and meet the criterias? Apply now, and we'll be in touch shortly.

title: C++ Developer
description:
We believe that you are dreaming of using your skills in C++ and your innovative mindset to create a better democratic world. Especially by solving crimes, gathering intelligence, investigating fraud and fighting corruption. At MSAB we make that dream come true!
   

  

 MSAB is one of the world’s leading digital forensic companies. We develop digital forensic solutions for mobile device examination and analysis used globally. Working with programming you will perform demanding tasks that tickles your innovative mindset and challenge your technical skills to find your way forward towards a solution.
   

  

 If you are inspired by extracting and decrypting data, writing decoders and implementations, decoding apps, analyzing data structure and making them readable. Then you are interesting to us.
   

  

 If you also are capable in writing efficient code, embedded programming, have knowledge in Android and iOS operating systems and have skills in reverse engineering or perhaps cryptology. Then we want to know more about you.
   

  

 This is a chance to work in a company culture described as friendly, we listen to new ideas and help each other. You will have freedom to find your way forward and benefit from your innovative thinking. If this is a match and you also are inspired by being pushed beyond your comfort zone. Then we want to talk with you.
   

  

 There is so much to talk about like values, plans forward, benefits, ways of working and technology for example. But we save that for the interview.
   

  

 Send your application now!
   

  

 For more information about MSAB: https://www.msab.com/
   

  

 Department Development Role C++ Developer Locations Stockholm, Sweden Remote status Hybrid

title: Android Engineer
description:
**Job Description**
**WHAT YOU WILL DO:**
 As a Software Engineer - Android in the CX & Sales organization you will be in the center of the action where both design and product meets business. You will work closely with designers, product managers, and fellow engineers to develop high-quality Android applications that deliver outstanding user experiences.
   

  

 You should have a strong technical background, a passion for developing generic and customizable UI components, android mobile application development. Drive to deliver bug-free developer and user experiences as per the business requirement, without compromising on the industry best coding practices.
   

  

 We are looking for highly skilled and experienced developer for the role of Mid-Level Android Software Engineer to join our mobile development team at H&M. As an Android Developer, you will be be expected to contribute to all stages of app development, from concept to deployment and maintenance.
   

  

**You will:**
* Contribute to the design and development of Android app features from concept through implementation.
* Collaborate with product managers, designers, and backend engineers to understand feature requirements and translate them into scalable technical solutions.
* Build and maintain reusable UI components and libraries using Jetpack Compose, ensuring code quality and modularity.
* Write clean, maintainable, and efficient Kotlin code following best practices and architectural guidelines (e.g., MVVM, Clean Architecture).
* Ensure app stability and responsiveness by writing unit and UI tests, debugging, and performance tuning.
* Participate in peer code reviews, contributing to knowledge sharing and quality improvements across the team.
* Troubleshoot and resolve bugs and production issues, collaborating with QA and backend teams to identify root causes.
* Participating in design discussions.
* Stay current with Android development trends and suggest improvements to tools, libraries, and development workflows.
* Take part in Agile ceremonies like sprint planning, retrospectives, and daily stand-ups, and help estimate effort for tasks.


**Who You Are**
*We are looking for people with..*
* 3+ years of professional experience in Android development.
* Proficiency in Kotlin.
* Solid understanding of Android SDK, Material Design, and Jetpack components.
* Hands-on experience with Jetpack Compose.
* Experience working with RESTful APIs, third-party libraries, and JSON.
* Familiarity with Android architectural patterns (e.g., MVVM, Clean Architecture).
* Experience with version control systems, especially Git.
* Knowledge of dependency injection frameworks (e.g., Hilt, Dagger).
* Understanding of mobile app performance, memory management, and debugging tools.
* Familiarity with testing frameworks (e.g., JUnit, Espresso, Mockito).
* Good communication and problem-solving skills.
* Ability to work in an agile development environment.
* Implemented accessible solutions.


**Good to Have:**
* Familiarity with CI/CD pipelines for Android.
* Exposure to mobile analytics tools (e.g., Firebase, Mixpanel).
* Published apps in the Google Play Store.
* Experience working in a cross-platform environment or with teams using iOS.


**Additional Information**
**WHO WE ARE**
 H&M Group is a global company of strong fashion brands and ventures. Our goal is to prove that there is no compromise between exceptional design, affordable prices, and sustainable solutions. We want to liberate fashion for the many, and our customers are at the heart of every decision we make.
   

  

 We are made up of thousands of passionate and talented colleagues united by our shared culture and values. Together, we want to use our power, our scale, and our knowledge to push the fashion industry towards a more inclusive and sustainable future. Read more about us here
   

  

**WHY YOU’LL LOVE WORKING HERE**
 At H&M Group, we are proud to be a vibrant and welcoming company. We offer our employees attractive benefits with extensive development opportunities around the globe.
   

  

 All our employees receive a staff discount card, usable on all our H&M Group brands in stores and online. Brands covered by the discount are H&M (Beauty and Move included), COS, Weekday, Monki, H&M HOME, & Other Stories, ARKET. In addition to our staff discount, all our employees are included in our H&M Incentive Program – HIP. You can read more about our H&M Incentive Program here.
   

  

**JOIN US**
 Our uniqueness comes from a combination of many things – our inclusive and collaborative culture, our strong values, and opportunities for growth. But most of all, it’s our people who make us who we are.
   

  

**Take the next step in your career together with us. The journey starts here.**

title: Scala Developer
description:
**About Rocker**
 Rocker is a part of Nordiska, a fully licensed Swedish bank that delivers innovative financial solutions to both businesses and consumers. Through Nordiska Embedded, our embedded finance platform, we offer savings, lending, and payment functionality that can be delivered under the Rocker brand or fully white-labelled for partners. By joining Rocker, you will help advance our platform and shape how modern banking services are developed and delivered.
   

  

**What We Offer**
 Our code of conduct is the foundation for everything we do. We act with honesty and responsibility to build long-term trust among customers, partners, and employees. We believe that diversity drives innovation and encourage each employee to contribute their unique expertise and perspective. We are driven and dedicated to making a difference. Our employees receive a competitive benefits package.
   

  

**About The Role**
 As a Scala developer at Rocker you will have the opportunity to help us shape the way we build our backend systems and scale it to hundreds of thousands of users.
   

  

 We’re looking for someone with a strong technical foundation who thrives in a fast-paced environment. You should enjoy working closely with designers, product managers, and frontend engineers to deliver a world-class product.
   

  

**What You'll Do**
* Work with modern technologies such as Scala 3, ZIO 2, Tapir
* Functional programming
* Evolve our tech stack. Most of our services are written in ZIO but we have a few legacy ones written in Akka
* Design, build, and maintain APIs
* Think through and help plan systems and services while writing quality code
* Work in a collaborative and agile environment involving different stakeholders and an evolving family of products and services


**We’re Looking For Someone Who Has**
* Professional experience building software and systems. We don’t care much about what programming languages you know, as long as you have a strong interest in learning and working with Scala
* An ability to quickly understand and learn new systems and processes
* An ability to lead, execute, and deliver high-quality technical solutions


**It’s a plus if you**
* Our tech stack includes Kubernetes, Kafka, and Docker, so an understanding of how those work will be beneficial


 This is a hybrid position and we are looking for someone that's based in Stockholm, Sweden.
   

  

**Application and process**
 We will conduct ongoing interviews during the process. For the final candidate, we also perform a background check. For questions about the role and more information, you are warmly welcome to contact Truong Hoang.

title: Senior Backend Engineer – Platform & API Team
description:
**Location:** 
 Stockholm (In-office)
   

  

**Company:** 
 360Player
   

  

**Job Type:** 
 Full-time
   

  

**Join the Global Leader in Sports Technology**
 At 360Player, we are redefining how sports clubs operate, develop players, and manage teams. As the world’s leading all-in-one Club Operating System, we help clubs streamline every aspect of their operations—from scheduling and payments to player development and video analytics. Trusted by top clubs such as Rush Soccer, FC Barcelona, and Rafa Nadal Academy, our platform is transforming the sports world. With offices in Stockholm, Barcelona, and the US, we’re looking for passionate, driven individuals to join our team as we continue to grow globally.
   

  

**About The Role**
 We are looking for a
 **Senior Backend Engineer** 
 to join our
 **Platform & API team** 
 , focusing on building and maintaining the infrastructure, core systems, and our public API product that will enable scalability and success across all teams and features within 360Player.
   

  

 In this role, you will work on
 **internal tooling, API design, building a world-class public API to open up the 360Player ecosystem, and backend infrastructure** 
 , ensuring stability, performance, and scalability for our growing platform. You will collaborate closely with other backend engineers and cross-functional teams to build the foundations that allow our feature teams to move efficiently and reliably.
   

  

 This role will give you the opportunity to shape technical decisions, mentor team members, and work on challenges related to performance optimization, system design, and scalability as we expand globally and open up our ecosystem for external developers and partners.
   

  

**What You’ll Do**
* Design, build, and maintain core backend services and APIs that support all areas of the 360Player platform, including our public API product.
* Develop internal tools to improve developer workflows, system monitoring, and support the external developer ecosystem.
* Work on database design, optimization, and performance tuning.
* Collaborate with frontend and backend teams to support efficient feature delivery and ensure the API meets the needs of internal and external stakeholders.
* Contribute to architecture discussions to ensure system scalability, stability, and a world-class developer experience.
* Support integrations with third-party systems when required.
* Participate in code reviews and provide mentorship to other developers.
* Identify opportunities for technical improvements and drive initiatives to implement them, aligning with the goal of building a world-class public API that opens up the 360Player ecosystem.


**What We’re Looking For**
* 5+ years of experience in backend development.
* Proficiency in Go (Golang) or strong experience in another language with the willingness to work in Go.
* Strong understanding of relational databases and SQL performance optimization.
* Experience with API design and building robust backend systems.
* Familiarity with Docker, Git, CI/CD pipelines, and cloud services (preferably Azure).
* Solid understanding of system performance, scalability, and clean code practices.
* Comfortable collaborating with engineers and stakeholders across teams.
* Strong problem-solving skills and ability to work proactively.
* Fluent in English, both spoken and written.


**Personal Qualities**
* Proactive and structured with a high sense of ownership.
* Strong collaboration and communication skills.
* Curious and committed to continuous learning and improvement.
* Enjoys mentoring others and sharing knowledge.
* Motivated by building systems that support others and scale effectively.


**Why 360Player?**
* Be part of a platform trusted by top sports clubs globally.
* Opportunity to shape and build the technical foundation of a fast-growing company.
* Collaborate with a skilled, supportive, and international team.
* Work on projects that have a direct impact on athletes, coaches, and sports organizations.
* Enjoy a flexible, creative, and collaborative work environment where your input truly matters.


**How To Apply**
 If you are excited about backend infrastructure, building scalable systems, and creating impactful tools that empower feature teams, we would love to hear from you.
   

  

 Apply with your
 **resume and a short cover letter** 
 explaining why you are interested in this role at 360Player. We review applications on a rolling basis, so don’t wait to apply! Please note that due to summer vacations interviews will be conducted in August and responses may be delayed.

title: Backend Developer (Node.js)
description:
At Ubiquiti Inc., we create technology platforms for Businesses, Smart Homes, and Internet Service Providers, driven by our goal to connect everyone, everywhere. To date, Ubiquiti has shipped over 100 million devices worldwide, from ISP networking products to next generation of IT solutions. Our growth is made possible by the dedicated team of hundreds behind the scenes. From software developers and product managers to designers and strategists, Team UI is driven to achieve our common goal: Rethinking IT. At Ubiquiti, you’ll heighten your potential and broaden your horizons - all while shaping the future of connectivity.
   

  

**Join forces with us on our mission to build a better IT industry. We are currently looking for a highly skilled Backend Developer (Node.js) to our team in Stockholm, Sweden.**
***Please note that applicants must live in Sweden and hold a valid work permit at the time of application to be considered for this role.***
**Team**
 We are hiring for the UniFi OS team that develops and maintains the core operating system for UniFi Cloud Gateways, NAS, and NVRs. The team ensures a secure and stable environment for all UniFi applications, spanning networking, camera surveillance, VoIP, and access control.
   

  

**Responsibilities**
* Develop efficient, scalable, and maintainable backend services
* Lead discussions on service architecture and code design
* Do code reviews, execute on branch/merge strategies as well as building and deployment processes
* Maintain a good programming style and stay up-to-date with the latest technology and trends
* Design developer-friendly APIs that are secure, scalable, and well-documented
* Communicate complex technical topics with key stakeholders including PM's, developers (embedded, web, mobile), UX/UI designers and strategists


**Requirements**
* 5+ years of experience with Node.js and TypeScript
* 3+ years of experience with SQL (Postgres or similar)
* Knowledge of web security (OWASP, browser security model, OAuth)
* Excellent debugging skills and familiarity with defensive programming
* Familiar with Git, Unix/Linux and Docker environments
* Ability to work independenty
* Excellent written and verbal communication skills
* Strong sense of ownership of tasks and responsibilities
* Highly proficient in English (written and spoken)


**Nice To Have**
* Well-versed with DevOps and Build pipelines
* Experience with Rust or Go.
* Familiar with gRPC
* Experience with WebRTC


**Benefits**
* International work environment
* Competitive compensation package including wellness allowance, occupational pension, medical insurance, private health insurance, life insurance and work-injury insurance
* Five weeks of holiday per year
* Flexible work hours and hybrid work model
* Modern office space located in Epicenter (Hötorget)
* Access to all the latest Ubiquiti products and prototypes for home use and tests


***Please note that a background check will be conducted in the final stage of the recruitment process***

title: Power BI Developer
description:
**Objective:** 




 To develop and maintain Power BI reports and dashboards by extracting data from ServiceNow, ensuring accurate and insightful data visualization to support business decision-making. 
 



  
 



**Primary Responsibilities:** 




 1. Design, develop, and deploy Power BI reports and dashboards.
 



 2. Extract and transform data from ServiceNow to Power BI.
 



 3. Collaborate with stakeholders to gather requirements and ensure reports meet business needs.
 



 4. Optimize Power BI dashboards with a focus on usability and performance.
 



 5. Maintain and update existing Power BI reports as needed.
 



 6. Provide training and support to end-users on Power BI functionalities.
 







**Required Qualifications:** 




 1. Proven experience with Power BI and ServiceNow.
 



 2. Strong understanding of data modeling, data transformation, and DAX.
 



 3. Experience in creating complex reports and dashboards in Power BI.
 



 4. Proficiency in SQL and data extraction techniques.
 



 5. Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills.
 



  
 



  
 **Preferred Qualifications:** 




 1. Experience in the specific industry of the employer.
 



 2. Familiarity with other data visualization tools.
 



 3. Knowledge of ServiceNow modules and functionalities.
 



 4. Certification in Power BI or related technologies.
 







**Skill & Competencies:** 




 1. Strong communication and collaboration skills.
 



 2. Ability to work independently and as part of a team.
 



 3. Attention to detail and a strong focus on quality.
 



 4. Ability to manage multiple tasks and projects simultaneously.

title: Senior Full Stack Developer
description:
**Bring your expertise as Senior Full Stack Developer and contribute to meaningful work with a team that values your expertise!** 




  





**About The Role** 




 As Senior Full Stack Developer, you will work with development and maintenance in one of our agile teams supporting the Business Support organization at If Skadeförsäkring. This means you will participate in Agile ceremonies, development initiatives, as well as monitoring and handling incidents in the products supported. Your work will involve:
 



  




* Participating and contributing in Agile ceremonies
* Taking responsibility for development tasks assigned to you
* Engaging in requirement dialogues with product owners, end users, and other stakeholders when needed
* Developing and performing unit tests
* Contributing to and developing automated test methodologies
* Participating in manual system tests if needed
* Supporting business in AI development, including choices of technology, possibilities, and risks



  





**We Offer** 




 In the same way that we place high demands on you as an employee, we also expect you to place high demands on us as an employer. Here are some of the benefits of working at If:
 


* An inclusive work environment where everyone is welcome
* Career and development opportunities in the biggest insurance company in the Nordics
* Social activities, as well as a highly skilled professional environment
* Possibility of a hybrid workplace
* Health-promoting workplace with wellness allowance and various sports activities
* Great insurance benefits
* Lunch benefit



  





**About The Team** 




 IT Corporate is made up of several agile teams with 3–10 people who work closely together to reach shared goals and deliver smart solutions. We value teamwork, innovation, and everyone’s contribution. Our team shares knowledge, takes initiative, and focuses on quality. We enjoy juggling multiple tasks and are flexible, solution-oriented, and creative. Our culture is built on If’s core values, which guide how we work and create an inclusive, supportive environment where people grow and take responsibility for the future.
 



  





**Who are You?** 




 We are looking for someone who:
 


* Likes to collaborate and share knowledge with others
* Is driven and proactive
* Has a quality focus and is thorough
* Enjoys having multiple tasks at hand
* Is flexible and solution-oriented
* Is proactive and innovative



  





**You also have:** 



* Relevant education with a university/college degree or comparable skills
* Great interest in cloud development on the Azure platform
* Proven record of AI development or training of models
* At least 5 years of experience as a developer, preferably with lead developer experience
* Technical skills in Microsoft Power Platform and Copilot Studio 365, .NET Platform, C#, Entity Framework, Azure, Azure Functions, Logic Apps, DevOps, and Angular
* Experience in test methodology and AI methodology is a plus



  





**Additional Facts And The Recruitment Process** 




  





**Application deadline:** 
 The application deadline is August 10th, 2025. Screening and interviewing will start after the summer holidays in mid-august.
 



**To apply for the position** 
 : Please attach your CV
 



**Work location:** 
 Bergshamra, Stockholm
 



**Start:** 
 October 1st or by agreement
 



**For more information:** 
 Please contact Sofia Thomsson, Leader Business support solutions, sofia.thomsson@if.se
 



**We look forward to your application!** 








**About Us** 








***We are If. Our purpose is to give people confidence today to shape their tomorrow.***




  





*To make this possible, trust is our backbone. We stay ahead and challenge ourselves to grow. And we always put our hearts into it – because it takes more than bright minds to make brilliant things happen.* 




  





*We are the leading insurance company in the Nordics/Baltics and a stable employer with 7,900 dedicated professionals. But most importantly, we are protectors of people, enablers of companies and encouragers of dreams. With our joint force of expertise and engagement we always stand by our customers’ side. Giving them the security and the confidence to be curious, explore new worlds, start new businesses and live their lives.* 




  





*We are an equal opportunity employer, convinced that a diverse and inclusive work culture boosts innovation and the growth of intellectual capital in many ways. It doesn’t matter who you are, where you come from, or what you look like. It is the different perspectives, backgrounds, and experiences each of us have and share, that will make a difference.* 




*Come and join us!*

title: Software Engineer
description:
**Description & Requirements**
 Electronic Arts creates next-level entertainment experiences that inspire players and fans around the world. Here, everyone is part of the story. Part of a community that connects across the globe. A place where creativity thrives, new perspectives are invited, and ideas matter. A team where everyone makes play happen.
   

  

**Frostbite** 
 is EA's proprietary game engine that comes equipped with tons of technologies designed to build incredible games. Our in-house engine uniquely adapts to each game while working hand-in-hand to prioritize what to build. Our goal is to empower creators all over the world to bring their best ideas to life by creating an engine that amplifies innovation across every discipline.
   

  

 As a
 **Machine Learning Software Engineer** 
 in the Frostbite Quality AI team, you will design machine learning systems that improve engineering efficiency for Frostbite and our games. You will collaborate with other software engineers, data engineers and quality analysts. You will report to the Senior Manager of Engine Development of Quality Engineering. Our team promotes a culture of learning, innovation and continuous improvement.
   

  

**Responsibilities**
* Design machine learning-based solutions to real-world software development workflow problems.
* Build end-to-end systems, including model evaluation, deployment, data collection, debugging, performance improvement, and monitoring.
* Collaborate with data engineers to design real-time data processing that allows dynamic context and improved inference.
* Write clean, well-documented, well-tested code that integrates smoothly with existing codebases.
* Stay up-to-date on advancements in deep learning and generative AI through self-study and internal and external conferences.
* Be an active member of EA's growing AI/ML community, communicating to partners, sharing knowledge, and mentoring other team members to develop their skills.


**Qualifications**
* BSc or MSc degree in Computer Science, Engineering or Mathematics, or equivalent experience.
* 2+ years of experience developing ML systems.
* Proficient in Python.
* Expertise in ML frameworks like PyTorch, TensorFlow, or MLFlow.
* Experience with large-scale machine learning, including big data and model deployment in distributed computing environments.
* Familiarity with the machine learning ecosystems of cloud providers (AWS, Azure).
* Proficiency in good software engineering practices (version control, unit testing, code reviews).


**Bonus if you have...**
* Familiarity with software quality processes, test automation, or game development processes.


 This is a hybrid remote/in-office role.
   

  

**About Electronic Arts**
 We’re proud to have an extensive portfolio of games and experiences, locations around the world, and opportunities across EA. We value adaptability, resilience, creativity, and curiosity. From leadership that brings out your potential, to creating space for learning and experimenting, we empower you to do great work and pursue opportunities for growth.
   

  

 We adopt a holistic approach to our benefits programs, emphasizing physical, emotional, financial, career, and community wellness to support a balanced life. Our packages are tailored to meet local needs and may include healthcare coverage, mental well-being support, retirement savings, paid time off, family leaves, complimentary games, and more. We nurture environments where our teams can always bring their best to what they do.
   

  

 Electronic Arts is an equal opportunity employer. All employment decisions are made without regard to race, color, national origin, ancestry, sex, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, genetic information, religion, disability, medical condition, pregnancy, marital status, family status, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law. We will also consider employment qualified applicants with criminal records in accordance with applicable law. EA also makes workplace accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities as required by applicable law.

title: Software Engineer - Zalando Logistics Technology (ZEOS) - All Genders
company_industry: Technology, Information and Internet, Retail, and IT Services and IT Consulting
description:
Over the last years, we learned that solving fulfilment related challenges for the good of our customers helps us to fuel the growth of our platform. With more partners in Partner Program and Connected Retail joining our platform, we have been developing and testing additional fulfilment services tailored to their needs.
   

  

 The ZEOS Logistics department is responsible for all partner-facing Zalando Logistics Solutions. By unifying and collaborating these services under a single umbrella, we provide a more holistic approach to delivering the optimal fulfilment solution to meet our partners' needs and leverage common services to enable partner program growth.
   

  

 As a Software Engineer in ZEOS Logistics, you will develop and operate business-critical applications for our partners and internal stakeholders that process tens of thousands of events per second powering the critical partner-facing backend APIs and web applications of the partner fulfilment domain. You will work with tools and technologies such as Java, Kotlin, PostgreSQL, AWS, Kubernetes, and Elasticsearch in building high-performance, low-latency systems to create an impact on customers and partners.
   

  

**INCLUSIVE BY DESIGN**
 At Zalando, our vision is to be the starting point for fashion - one that is inclusive by design. We only assess candidates based on qualifications, merit, and business needs. We welcome applications from people of all gender identities, sexual orientations, personal expressions, racial identities, ethnicities, religious beliefs, and disability statuses. We only want to know why you’re great for this role, so please avoid including your picture, age, and marital status in your CV as well.
   

  

 We want to provide you with a great candidate experience. Please feel free to inform us of any accommodations you may need, so we can best support and assist you throughout the hiring process.
   

  

 do.BETTER - our diversity & inclusion strategy
   

  

 https //corporate.zalando.com/en/diversity-inclusion
   

  

 Our employee resource groups
   

  

 https //corporate.zalando.com/en/diversity-inclusion/our-employee-resource-groups
   

  

**WHAT WE’D LOVE YOU TO DO (AND LOVE DOING)...**
* Build and operate large-scale data streaming and processing applications serving fulfilment process relevant data with the latency of tens of milliseconds in magnitude to Zalando partners in using technologies such as Java, Kotlin, Postgres, and Elasticsearch.
* Use a state-of-the-art software development methodology.
* Be part of a newly established engineering team in Stockholm and help to foster an environment of continuous learning.


**WE’D LOVE TO MEET YOU IF..** 
 .
   

  

  

* 5+ years of experience as a Software Engineer in developing APIs and high-volume data streaming and processing systems with either Java or Kotlin.
* Initial hands-on experience with SQL storage technologies.
* Familiarity with AWS, Kubernetes, and Elasticsearch is in addition a plus.
* "You build it, you run it" approach you have had a first experience in managing services end-to-end, from developing to deploying to monitoring and incident support is a big plus.
* Passion for working in an agile, cross-functional team, iterating quickly during the product development cycle. As well as, ability to communicate and collaborate effectively with business stakeholders, product managers, and engineering peers.


**OUR OFFER**
 Zalando provides a range of benefits, please ask your Talent Acquisition Partner to learn more about what we offer.
   

  

**About Zalando**
 It’s the perfect time to join Zalando on our journey, from being a pioneer in the world of e-commerce, to the starting point for fashion in Europe. We connect customers, brands, and partners across 23 markets.
   

  

 Help us drive digital and sustainable solutions for fashion, logistics, advertising and research, bringing head-to-toe fashion to almost 49 million active customers through a team of diverse skill-sets, cultural backgrounds, and interests.
   

  

 Our values https //jobs.zalando.com/en/our-founding-mindset
   

  

 do.More - our sustainability strategy https //corporate.zalando.com/en/sustainability Follow us on Instagram instagram.com/insidezalando
   

  

 Please note that all applications must be completed using the online form - we do not accept applications via email.

title: Join the Funnel Talent Pool — Product, Dev & Design
description:
At Funnel, we're building the future of data-driven marketing and that takes an exceptional team. While we may not have your
 *exact* 
 dream role open today, we’re always looking for brilliant minds to join us in the future.
   

  

 Whether You're a Designer, Developer Or Product Manager, We’d Love To Connect. By Joining Our Talent Pool, You’ll Be The First To Know When Opportunities That Match Your Background And Passion Open Up In Our
   

  

**Development team**
 Craft scalable, high-performance systems with a clean and modern tech stack - Typescript/Javascript, React, Node, Rust, Python and AWS.
   

  

 We love great architecture, elegant code, and a culture of collaboration and continuous learning.
   

  

**Product team**
 Drive clarity in complexity. Collaborate with cross-functional teams to define and shape a product that solves real-world problems for marketers around the world.
   

  

****Design team****
 Create intuitive, elegant, and empowering experiences. From UX research to UI design, our designers shape the way people interact with data every day.
   

  

******What We Value******
* Curiosity: You ask why. And then ask it again.
* Autonomy: You don’t wait for permission to solve a problem.
* Collaboration: You thrive on working closely with others.
* Impact: You want your work to matter- to your team, our users, and the business.


******Why Funnel?******
* 🌍 International team with a strong in office culture
* 👥 Friendly, smart and welcoming people
* 🛠️ Modern tech, continuous delivery, and true product ownership
* 💚 Inclusive, supportive culture that invests in people
* 🧘 Generous time off, team offsites, and wellness benefits


******Learn more about Funnel!******
* Who are we - a founder’s story
* Product development at Funnel - ways of working
* Why we built a data ingestion platform - unique problems we’re solving


 Interested?
   

  

 Let’s not wait for the perfect job ad to get to know each other. Apply to our Talent Pool with your CV or LinkedIn profile and tell us what position/s you would be interested in and what kind of work you enjoy doing.
   

  

 Funnel is a SaaS product designed to help marketing teams own their performance. Founded in 2014 in Stockholm, and still founder-led, the Funnel team has grown with our customers – serving more than 2,000 companies from our Stockholm, Boston, Dublin, Hamburg and Sydney offices. We value increased in-person collaboration, and as such, we work a minimum of four days a week from our offices.
   

  

 We have always put the customer first, expressed in a no-commission sales model and a customer-centric development approach. We are proud to help companies such as Havas Media, Adidas, Sony, and Home Depot to unlock the true impact of their data.

title: Engineering Manager
description:
⭐
 **Ready for a new challenge? Here is what we offer.** 




 At Bannerflow, we build flexible and autonomous teams based on trust. We believe that when people are given the freedom to take ownership and work closely together, great things happen. Our engineering culture is shaped by openness, respect, and a shared drive to keep improving.
 



 We are passionate about solving real problems and making a meaningful impact, and we are always open to exploring new ideas. With us, you will be part of a growing tech company where ideas are valued, feedback is encouraged, and personal development is supported. We bring the energy of a fast-moving company together with the stability of a proven product and a strong customer base.
 



 You will join a team where motivation is high, knowledge is shared openly, and having fun is part of everyday life — whether it’s through hackathons, board game nights, or spontaneous team activities.
 



  





**🦋 Are You + Bannerflow = True?** 




**Role** 




 We are now looking for an Engineering Manager who will inspire, lead and support several of our software engineering teams. In this role, you will have staff responsibility and play a central part in both the day-to-day and long-term success of your teams. While staying connected to technology, your focus will be on creating the conditions for your teams to thrive, deliver great software and develop both professionally and as a team. You will report directly to our CTO and work closely with other leaders across the organization. As an
 **Engineering Manager** 
 at Bannerflow, you will:
 


* Foster a healthy and collaborative engineering culture built on trust, openness and our company values
* Play a key role in attracting, developing and retaining top engineering talent
* Drive continuous improvement and help raise the bar for quality within and across teams
* Enable fast and focused execution without compromising on technical excellence
* Advocate and advance modern, agile software development practices and help develop and evangelize great engineering and organizational practices
* Work closely with other engineering managers and development teams to create great software



  





**So, what are we looking for?** 



* 5 years of experience successfully leading teams and delivering results in roles such as product owner, product manager, scrum master, or technical lead
* Strong leadership and communication skills with a proven track record of fostering a collaborative engineering culture that puts people first
* Ability to inspire, coach, and mentor team members to help them grow and reach their full potential
* Passionate about agile software development and modern engineering practices, with developer experience considered a plus
* Fluent in English and Swedish and eligible to work full-time in Stockholm without restrictions
* Bachelor’s or master’s degree in engineering, project management, or a related field



  





**Why join us? 🤔** 




 As an Engineering Manager at Bannerflow, you will lead a passionate and skilled team, helping us build great products while growing together. You will foster collaboration, drive technical quality, and support agile ways of working in a fun and inclusive environment.
 



 We believe leadership is about enabling others to thrive and creating space for ideas to grow. At Bannerflow, we live our values of
 **passion, collaboration and challenge** 
 in everything we do — from how we build software to how we celebrate success. You will be part of a culture where curiosity is encouraged, feedback flows freely and progress happens every day. If that sounds like you,
 **we would love to hear from you!**

title: Senior Gameplay Programmer - Stellaris
