title: Software Engineer - Mobile apps (iOS or Android)
description:
Join Telavox as a Mobile Developer (iOS or Android)
  
Are you a mobile developer passionate about building intuitive, high-quality apps that users love? We’re expanding our mobile team and are looking for both iOS and Android Developers who enjoy creating seamless mobile experiences, collaborating across disciplines, and building robust telephony features used by thousands of professionals every day. Whether you specialize in Swift for iOS or Kotlin for Android, you’ll play a key role in shaping the future of our companion app that brings the power of Telavox’s telephony services to mobile devices. If you’re ready to build smart, user-focused apps in a collaborative team, we’d love to hear from you!
  
About the job
  
You’ll join our Malmö-based mobile team and work on the Telavox companion app, which enables our users to manage their communications wherever they are. The app is central to our product experience, and we’re continuously improving its performance, usability, and features.
  
Depending on your platform expertise, your day-to-day could include:
  
  

**As an iOS Developer:**  

Building and maintaining features using Swift and SwiftUI
  
  

Collaborating with UX and backend teams to deliver consistent cross-platform functionality
  
  

Managing App Store releases and improving app performance
  
  

Participating in code reviews and architecture discussions
  
  

**As an Android Developer:**  

Developing new features and maintaining the app using Kotlin
  
  

Ensuring excellent UI/UX by following Material Design and Android best practices
  
  

Working closely with iOS and backend teams to ensure consistency across platforms
  
  

Participating in Play Store deployment and CI/CD workflows
  
  

You’ll be part of a diverse, skilled, and fun team where your voice matters and where continuous improvement is a shared goal.
  
About you
  
You're a mobile developer with a strong foundation in either iOS (Swift) or Android (Kotlin) development. You love working in cross-functional teams, are driven by solving real user problems, and enjoy writing clean, maintainable code.
  
  

**Key skills and experience we’re looking for:**  

4+ years of software development experience, with at least 2+ years focused on mobile (iOS or Android)
  
  

Proficiency in Swift (iOS) or Kotlin (Android)
  
  

Experience working with REST APIs and modern app architectures
  
  

Familiarity with CI/CD tools for mobile (e.g., Fastlane, GitHub Actions, Gradle)
  
  

**Good-to-have skills:**  

Interest in cross-platform collaboration and basic knowledge of the other platform
  
  

Experience with call-related APIs (e.g., CallKit for iOS, Telecom API for Android)
  
  

Familiarity with real-time communication technologies like WebRTC or SIP
  
  

You’ll fit right in if you’re curious, collaborative, and motivated to create mobile products that truly improve communication for our users.
  
Join us at Telavox
  
Since Telavox's journey started in 2002, we have strengthened our position as the leading forward-thinking communication platform for businesses. As a digital mobile operator, we develop and own our all-in-one communication platform, which integrates telephony, PBX, messaging, meetings, and contact centers, giving businesses a smarter way to connect. Today, we’re a thriving company with 1.9 billion SEK in revenue and 500+ Telavoxers across nine countries. We embrace AI and automation to push the boundaries of business communication. We offer flexible work options and adaptable hours, giving you the freedom to balance life and career while staying connected to our vibrant Telavox culture.
  
How to apply! At Telavox, we don't focus on fitting in; we focus on making room for everyone. We’re always on the lookout for great talent, so applications are reviewed continuously. If you're ready to be part of an innovative, AI-driven telecom company, apply today with your CV and cover letter in English. A quick heads-up: It’s vacation time over here, so things are moving a little slower than usual. We’re still reviewing applications and will get back to you as soon as possible. Thank you so much for your patience!
  
Learn more about what we do!

title: Senior Product Manager- WFM
description:
Description
  
  

Are you driven by innovation and looking to thrive in a fast-paced, growing environment? Join us at Calabrio and be part of our dynamic team! Help us in reshaping the landscape of customer experience – where every interaction becomes an opportunity, and every insight drives meaningful change.
  
  

Introducing Calabrio – The trailblazers in customer experience intelligence! Revolutionizing the way organizations connect with their customers, we empower businesses to elevate every interaction to new heights. Our cutting-edge cloud platform, coupled with AI-driven analytics tools, unlocks the true essence of customer sentiment, turning data into actionable insights with lightning speed.
  
  

We are seeking an experienced Senior Product Manager to drive strategy, innovation, and growth for our WFM portfolio. This is a high-impact role that partners with cross-functional teams and engages with enterprise customers worldwide.
  
  

What You’ll Do
  
  

Own and lead the product vision, strategy, and execution for a core area within Calabrio’s WFM suite, delivering measurable value to global customers.
  
**Manage the end-to-end product lifecycle:** from ideation and discovery through to launch, adoption, and ongoing optimisation
  
Drive the product roadmap with direct input from contact centre workforce analysts, planners, and operations leaders, ensuring user needs and operational realities shape product priorities.
  
Define and track product KPIs related to forecasting accuracy, shrinkage, schedule efficiency, and service level achievement; use these insights to inform prioritisation and continuous improvement.
  
Represent the needs of contact centre planners in cross-functional product and go-to-market strategies, including enablement and launch planning.
  
Lead product discovery through customer interviews, workflow mapping, and hands-on shadowing of planners to deeply understand daily challenges and pain points.
  
Collaborate with engineering, UX, and data science teams to deliver user-centred features that improve planner productivity and support decision-making.
  
Mentor and support junior product managers and contribute to building a high-performance product culture.
  
Champion data-driven, user-centric product management and foster a deep understanding of customer needs.
  
Drive innovation by leveraging AI, automation, and new technologies to solve workforce management challenges.
  
Define and manage product pricing, early access programmes (EAP), enablement, and go-to-market strategies in partnership with commercial, finance, and senior leadership teams—ensuring product alignment with company objectives and customer success.
  
Stay on top of WFM industry trends, technology advances, and user feedback to guide continuous improvement and innovation.
  
  

**We're Looking For:**  

**Strong product management toolkit:** product thinking, commercial acumen, user empathy, and data-driven decision making.
  
Expertise in workforce planning, forecasting, scheduling, and optimisation.
  
Ability to define, track, and act on product KPIs related to forecasting accuracy, schedule adherence, shrinkage, and other operational metrics.
  
Proven capability to manage the full product lifecycle and drive adoption in a SaaS context.
  
Excellent communication, stakeholder management, and influencing skills—comfortable with executive and technical audiences.
  
  

Requirements
  
10+ years of experience in Workforce Management, Scheduling, or Real-Time Analyst (RTA) roles, preferably within a contact centre environment.
  
7+ years of product management experience, with a proven record of launching and scaling successful SaaS or enterprise products.
  
Experience as a contact centre workforce planner or in a leadership role managing planning/forecasting teams is a strong advantage.
  
Demonstrated experience working with enterprise/global customers and turning operational insights into actionable product strategy.
  
Hands-on familiarity with leading WFM tools such as Calabrio, NICE, Verint, Assembled, or similar platforms.
  
Bachelor’s degree in a technical, business, or related field required; MBA or advanced degree is a plus.
  
Benefits
  
  

**Calabrio People are:** Open, Clear, Ambitious, Accountable, Collaborative, Consistent
  
  

What we value most…workplace diversity and ensuring an environment of mutual respect. We believe that diversity and inclusion are critical to our success, and we are proud to be an equal opportunity employer. Our commitment is to continue to keep our people healthy, focused, and inspire creativity. Our team members are offered comprehensive benefits for various life circumstances and needs, great opportunities for career development, and a balanced work-life to achieve personal and professional success (all benefits are subject to eligibility requirements). As an Innovator with Purpose, you’ll feel motivated and genuinely excited to come to work!
  
  

Calabrio celebrates and fosters a culture that thrives on diversity. We are an Equal Opportunity Employer that prohibits discrimination and harassment of any kind. We provide employees with a work environment free of discrimination and harassment. All employment decisions at Calabrio are based on business needs, job requirements, and individual qualifications, without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, veteran or disability status, parental status, or any other status protected by the laws or regulations in the locations where we operate. We celebrate the >40 nationalities of team members that contribute to our success.
  
  

Ready for Exponential Career Opportunities? Apply now
company_description: Calabrio has joined forces with some of the best minds and most progressive concepts on enriching human interactions through our customer experience intelligence platform.
ceo_name: Joel Martins, Interim CEO and CTO

title: Junior User Researcher
description:
Are you passionate about games, research, and how to best combine the two? Then come join the User Research team at Paradox Interactive! It is a perfect opportunity to grow in the User Research field while helping us make our games better!

**Your Mission**  

At Paradox Interactive, we are committed to creating games that are not only innovative and entertaining, but deeply resonate with the players who engage with them. As a Junior Games User Researcher, you will join a team dedicated to uncovering meaningful insights about player behavior, preferences, and experiences — and applying those insights to make better design decisions.  

  

This role is for individuals early in their careers, with some practical experience, who are eager to learn and develop their skills through hands-on involvement in real research studies. You will work closely with experienced researchers and gain valuable exposure to the practices and workflows of games user research.  

  

**Your Responsibilities**  

In this role, you will support the planning and execution of player-focused research studies. Under supervision, you will:

* Assist in preparing interview guides, surveys, and other research materials
* Contribute to data collection by taking structured notes, observing player behavior, or helping moderate sessions
* Participate in pilot studies and hands-on fieldwork
* Help organize, sort, and code qualitative data
* Support the preparation of preliminary findings and insights
* Document research outcomes clearly and accurately

**Your Profile**


We are looking for a detail-oriented and motivated individual with:

* An academic background in UX, psychology, sociology, human-computer interaction, or a related discipline
* A demonstrated interest in games and player experiences
* A basic understanding of research methods, including interviews, surveys, and data analysis
* A proactive and curious mindset, with a desire to develop as a user researcher
* Strong organizational and communication skills
* Familiarity with gaming communities, genres, or playstyles is considered a plus

**Practical information**  

Scope: Temporary (12 months)  

Reports to: User Research manager  

Location: This position is based in Stockholm, Sweden.  

Remote status: Office-based  

  

If you think that this description matches your background, we highly encourage you to apply. We’re looking at applications as they come in, but just a heads-up that replies might take a bit longer because of the holiday season. In your application, please show us why your previous experiences and skills would work for this role and why you are interested in working at Paradox. If you don't match all the requirements, please demonstrate how your passion, attitude and interest in Paradox might compensate  

for this.

title: E-Commerce Director
description:
#### **E-Commerce Director – Stockholm**

  

Nordic Knots is looking for an E-Commerce Director to join our growing team in Stockholm. This is a key leadership role for someone who wants to drive the performance of our online business, helping to accelerate growth across both our DTC and Trade channels.  

  

We’re building a company around thoughtful and long-lasting design, strong relationships, and great customer experiences. As E-Commerce Director, you’ll help us deliver on that promise—ensuring our website not only reflects our brand but also performs as a best-in-class digital storefront.

#### **About the role**


Reporting to the Chief Growth Officer, you’ll lead the global e-commerce strategy for Nordic Knots, with responsibility for revenue performance, site experience, merchandising, and conversion. This role blends commercial acumen with a sharp eye for digital UX, combining business goals with customer-centric execution.

  

You’ll oversee the full e-commerce funnel—from landing experience to checkout—working closely with growth, CRM, tech, and creative teams to build and optimise a seamless shopping journey. You’ll also lead a small but growing e-commerce team, helping to shape the function as we scale.  

  

As we continue to expand into new markets and product categories, you’ll play a critical role in aligning digital strategy with company-wide growth goals, ensuring our online experience supports both inspiration and conversion.

#### **What you’ll do**

* Responsible for e-commerce performance across DTC and Trade
* Lead the site merchandising, UX, and CRO strategy
* Oversee day-to-day site operations and ensure product launches, promotions, and content updates run smoothly
* Partner with tech and design teams to improve site architecture, navigation, and customer journey
* Use analytics and customer insights to drive conversion and retention improvements
* Collaborate closely with marketing, CRM, and creative teams to align digital storytelling with business goals
* Lead and develop the e-commerce team, ensuring clear focus and accountability
* Help define our omnichannel strategy as we expand into physical retail and new digital experiences
  
* 

#### **What we’re looking for**

* 6+ years of experience in e-commerce, ideally in a DTC brand or high-growth retail environment
* A mix of strategic thinking and operational know-how—you can zoom out and lead, but also roll up your sleeves
* Strong understanding of UX, analytics, and conversion optimisation
* Experience working with cross-functional teams including tech, design, growth, and logistics
* Proven ability to manage and improve an e-commerce P&L
* Experience with merchandising and content planning across global markets
* Comfortable using analytics tools to guide decisions (GA4, Looker, etc.)
* Fluent in English
  

#### **About Nordic Knots**


Nordic Knots was founded in 2016 by Liza Berglund Laserow, Fabian Berglund, and Felix Berglund. We are a fast-growing direct-to-consumer Scandinavian interior design brand. The USA is our largest market, followed by the UK and EU.


Nordic Knots was born from a culture of thoughtful design that lasts beyond seasons and trends. Fusing function and aesthetics with a Scandinavian sensibility, we craft timeless textiles for the modern home. We believe great textiles are foundational—they can transform a house into a harmonious home, framing the most beautifully curated lives.


Our head office is located in Stockholm at our flagship store on Birger Jarlsgatan. In 2024, we opened our first flagship store in New York City. We have a growing team in both Stockholm and New York and are expanding our presence in the UK and EU.

#### **What we offer**


We are a fun and driven team with high ambitions. We have an entrepreneurial and open-minded culture where all new ideas and suggestions for improvements are valued and encouraged. At Nordic Knots everyone should feel that they are a part of and contributing towards our success as we continue to scale up.  

  

At Nordic Knots we stand for a diverse and inclusive workforce. We seek talented individuals who bring a range of perspectives and inspired ideas. We welcome all applicants eager to join a dynamic team.#### **Location**


This is a Stockholm-based role.


Please apply with your CV and cover letter in English.

* 10+ years of experience in Workforce Management, Scheduling, or Real-Time Analyst (RTA) roles, preferably within a contact centre environment.
* 7+ years of product management experience, with a proven record of launching and scaling successful SaaS or enterprise products.
* Experience as a contact centre workforce planner or in a leadership role managing planning/forecasting teams is a strong advantage.
* Demonstrated experience working with enterprise/global customers and turning operational insights into actionable product strategy.
* Hands-on familiarity with leading WFM tools such as Calabrio, NICE, Verint, Assembled, or similar platforms.
* Bachelor’s degree in a technical, business, or related field required; MBA or advanced degree is a plus.

**Benefits**


Calabrio People are: Open, Clear, Ambitious, Accountable, Collaborative, Consistent


What we value most…workplace diversity and ensuring an environment of mutual respect. We believe that diversity and inclusion are critical to our success, and we are proud to be an equal opportunity employer. Our commitment is to continue to keep our people healthy, focused, and inspire creativity. Our team members are offered comprehensive benefits for various life circumstances and needs, great opportunities for career development, and a balanced work-life to achieve personal and professional success (all benefits are subject to eligibility requirements). As an Innovator with Purpose, you’ll feel motivated and genuinely excited to come to work!


Calabrio celebrates and fosters a culture that thrives on diversity. We are an Equal Opportunity Employer that prohibits discrimination and harassment of any kind. We provide employees with a work environment free of discrimination and harassment. All employment decisions at Calabrio are based on business needs, job requirements, and individual qualifications, without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, veteran or disability status, parental status, or any other status protected by the laws or regulations in the locations where we operate. We celebrate the >40 nationalities of team members that contribute to our success.


Ready for Exponential Career Opportunities? Apply now

title: UX/UI Designer Intern
company_industry: Software Development, Manufacturing, and IT System Training and Support
description:
**XR Solutions** 
 is a technology based company that utilizes machine learning and powerful research-based optimizations to provide practical, reliable and optimizing augmented reality solutions to industrial companies.
 



 We believe that our AR technology can change working methods, the way of thinking and enable new innovative solutions that previously was not achievable in industry and machine operation.
 



  





**Role Overview:** 




 We are seeking a passionate and dedicated
 **UX/UI Designer** 
 to join our team for an 6-month Internship. This is an exciting opportunity for someone looking to gain hands-on experience in Design, Marketing and XR within a fast-paced and supportive environment.
 



  





**You will among other things be work with:** 




  




* Be involved in all stages of the design process within projects; from research, workshops, idea generation, concepts to prototypes and delivery of design.
* Create interaction design through customer journeys, sketches, wireframes and prototypes based on insights.
* Use creative tools like Figma and other suitable design software in the XR space.
* Conducting deep interviews and workshops for user research and product testing.
* Monitor and design the interface for head-mounted XR glasses and how the user should integrate with the software (e.g. Hand movements, eye tracking, etc.)



  





**To succeed in this role, you should have** 




  




* Previous of relevant work experience in UX/UI and
 **XR Design** 
 (
 **Meritorious)**
* An ability to easily communicate and work with others in teams, both with colleagues and customers.
* A self-propelled working method
* An ability to choose the tools and methods that best suit each specific situation.
* A user-focused mindset – a passionate drive for understanding and meeting user needs.
* Proficient in Figma
* Open mindset to try new working methods and software tools that just launched on the market.



  





**What we offer** 



* Practical experience of e.g. product development in the AR-Space
* Opportunity to contribute directly to the growth of an exciting Startup
* Remote work and flex Office spaces
* Strategic work and planning
* Be part of a product launch



  





 If you’re excited about this opportunity and eager to learn, please send your resume outlining your interest in the position. We look forward to helping you grow your skills and advance your career in Design and marketing.
 



  





 This is a unpaid internship initially

title: Product Designer (permanent)
description:
We’re looking for a
 **Product Designer** 
 to permanently join our in-house team in Stockholm.
   

  

 We’re building AI-first solutions across our app, and design plays a central role in making these experiences intuitive, useful, and engaging. You’ll work hands-on across mobile and web to shape user journeys, interfaces, and interactions that help millions of people build healthier habits.You’re confident in both UX and UI and enjoy solving real problems through thoughtful, practical design. You’ll work closely with engineers, designers, and other team members to bring ideas from concept to launch.
   

  

**What You’ll Do**
* Design seamless user journeys and conversion-optimized interfaces
* Translate insights into user-centered design solutions
* Create high-quality prototypes and interaction models using modern tools
* Contribute to a consistent design system across platforms


**What You’ll Bring**
* Proven experience in designing digital products (mobile/web), preferably in health tech or SaaS
* Comfort working across the full design process—from concept to delivery
* Ability to move fast while keeping a high bar for craft and clarity
* Confident in using modern technologies, including generative AI, in prototyping, production, and as part of the product experience


 Why Lifesum is your next career move
   

  

 Lifesum is a pioneering consumer health-tech company on a mission to transform healthy living into an inspiring and accessible journey. Trusted by over 60 million users worldwide, we empower individuals to build healthier, more sustainable habits that improve their lives every day. As part of our commitment to innovation, we are becoming an AI-first company, leveraging cutting-edge technologies to revolutionize our tech stack, feature design, and development. Our AI-driven solutions provide personalized insights and smarter tools, making healthy choices easier, more intuitive, and deeply engaging. Through our forward-thinking platform, we spark motivation and inspire positive change, making healthy eating not just easier but truly enjoyable. Together, we’re shaping a future where living well feels effortless, empowering, and powered by the possibilities of AI.
   

  

 We are a hybrid global team headquartered in Stockholm, comprised of passionate and entrepreneurial individuals working together to create something meaningful. At Lifesum, you’ll have the opportunity to make a difference and positively impact millions of lives by helping our users on their personal journeys to look and feel better every day. Expanding our team with skilled and ambitious individuals is key to enhancing the value we provide to people worldwide.
   

  

**We are just getting started**
 Lifesum has over 60 million registered users worldwide, and our journey to building the world’s leading advanced wellness platform is just beginning. We have a strong foundation and a drive to achieve even more. As one unified team of talented individuals with a solution-oriented, “can-do” mindset, we are committed to continuously improving the user experience and delivering greater value to our global Lifesum community
   

  

 What we offer
   

  

* Empowerment and Ownership: Trust and responsibility in a dynamic, fast-paced environment where your contributions truly matter.
* Exciting Projects: Collaborate on impactful projects with some of the world’s most successful companies.
* Career Growth: Dedicated space and support to develop and advance your career.
* Professional Development: An individual training and development budget to fuel your growth.
* Wellness Focus: A wellness allowance to support a healthy lifestyle.
* Health and Wellbeing: Private health insurance to prioritize your peace of mind.
* Community Spirit: Engage in fun and meaningful team activities that foster connection and collaboration
* Time Off: Enjoy 30 paid vacation days per year to recharge and explore.
* Parental Benefits: Comprehensive parental leave pay to support your family journey.
* Financial Security: Pension plans designed to help you plan for the future.


 If this sounds exciting, we’d love to hear from you and get to know you better. Send us your resumé, your portfolio and let us know why you’re interested in the role and why Lifesum feels like the perfect fit for you. We welcome everyone and look forward to receiving your application!
   

  

 Lifesum is one of the fastest-growing global digital health companies. Our product aims to simplify the path to long-term healthy eating, and our technology motivates users to live a more balanced lifestyle with personalized plans for better and healthier eating.

title: UX/UI Designer
job_function: Information Technology, Design, and Product Management
company_industry: Retail, Retail Apparel and Fashion, and Fashion Accessories Manufacturing
description:
Sellpy’s vision is to empower everyone to live circularly. We see a tremendous financial, social and environmental value in making sure unused items are put to use again. We are looking for colleagues who share this vision, and are eager to see their work contribute to a sustainable future.
 



  





**In short, you will** 



* Understand and address user needs, behaviors, and pain points, aligning them with business goals to create seamless and enjoyable experiences.
* Translate research and insights into clear, actionable design decisions.
* Take ideas from concept to prototype to polished UI, by using your creativity, design expertise, and a deep understanding of our design system at every step of the process.
* Contribute to shaping what we build by bringing the user perspective into roadmaps and prioritization discussions.
* Collaborate closely with the product owners, developers, product design team and relevant stakeholders.
* Maintain and further improve Sellpy’s design system to ensure consistency and an effective way of working.
* Help grow awareness and understanding of design’s impact across the organization.
* Advocate for our users while balancing business goals by translating insights into intuitive, effective designs that serve both customer needs and company objectives.



  





**Education & Experience** 



* Degree in UX, Interaction Design, or related field, or equivalent education + work experience
* 3 years of hands-on experience in UX/UI design
* A portfolio showcasing your design work across platforms, with clear articulation of your design process, problem-solving approach, and final solutions.



  





**Design & Tools** 



* Strong design skills for both mobile and web (responsive, mobile-first)
* Proficient in Figma (our primary design tool at Sellpy)
* Experience working with design systems
* Understanding of accessibility standards (WCAG 2.2)



  





**UX & UI Competence** 



* Strong foundation in user-centred design and design thinking methodologies
* Skilled at articulating user problems and defining clear, concise problem statements
* Expertise in crafting seamless, intuitive interactions and user flows across web and app, ensuring consistent and frictionless experiences
* Knowledge of user interface design principles



  





**User Research & Data** 



* Ability to conduct and analyze both qualitative and quantitative research to uncover actionable user insights and set priorities
* Skilled at translating insights into impactful design decisions that address real user needs
* Experience validating design through usability testing, A/B testing, data, and user feedback



  





 You are a strong communicator who can clearly explain and advocate for design decisions. With a collaborative mindset, you easily bridge the needs of design, development, business and users. You’re experienced in contributing to product roadmaps and helping scope and prioritize design work. As a person, you're curious, empathetic, and passionate about being the voice of the user. You’re comfortable receiving and giving feedback, taking responsibility, and thrive in a team-oriented environment. You are a team player and have the ability to work without ego. At Sellpy we are all friends and we care for each other.
 



  





 Fluency in written and spoken English is required, as it’s our company language.
 



  





**We’d be impressed if you have** 



* Worked in a fast-growing, product-focused startup environment.
* Background in re-commerce, e-commerce, or a related digital product domain.
* Experience with Adobe Creative Cloud tools.



  





**You get to** 



* Be part of a tech-minded company that's driving the change towards a sustainable lifestyle. In return, you will get direction, energy, and work on meaningful challenges daily.
* Benefit from hybrid work from our offices at Medborgarplatsen, Rosersberg, and from home.
* Work with highly skilled and motivated colleagues.
* Make use of prepaid vacation.
* Enjoy Sellpy credits and staff discounts at Sellpy and the H&M brands (Arket, COS, Other Stories, Weekday and more).
* Save up with a monthly pension plan.
* Engagement in Sellpy’s social traditions with game nights, interactive planning days, guest speakers and other activities.



  





**Location** 




 You are welcome to do all these things at our new office at Medborgarplatsen in Stockholm, and from home.
 



  





**Form of employment:** 
 Full-time
 



  





**Start:** 
 As agreed upon

title: Product Designer II
description:
We’re looking for a product designer to join Spotify’s central Design Systems team, part of the Platform Mission. In this role, you’ll help craft the future of Encore—Spotify’s design system that powers both our design tools and accessibility efforts. You’ll bring ideas to life with excellent visual design, and find smart, practical ways to improve how designers work—through better tooling, AI, and more efficient ways of building.
   

  

 You care deeply about design systems, collaboration, and inclusive experiences. You listen closely to your teammates and the people who use your work, and you lead with thoughtful, high-quality design that sets a strong example for others.
   

  

 What You'll Do
   

  

* Work day-to-day in a cross-functional team of engineers, designers including content designer and staff typographer, producers and product managers to build and maintain the foundational building blocks of Spotify’s digital applications
* Proactively explore and implement AI-driven solutions where they add value—such as enhancing workflows, streamlining tooling, or making the design system more adaptive and intelligent.
* Partner with product designers around the company to develop new styles and patterns and improve existing styles and patterns.
* Collaborate with other design systems teams on evolving our shared processes and tooling to support a large number of teams working on a diverse array of products.
* Build work that scales and flexes across a variety of audiences, devices, platforms and form factors ranging from phones over laptop computers to game consoles, connected fridges and cars.
* Empower our internal community of 100+ globally distributed designers by providing resources and clarity around Spotify’s design and accessibility standard processes.
* Be autonomous. You take full ownership of your work and drive your personal development. And you take responsibility for every last detail, every step of the way.


 Who You Are
   

  

* Several years of experience working in-house for consumer-facing digital product companies.
* Showcase outstanding visual design abilities that emphasize craftsmanship, clarity, and consistency—injecting creativity into interaction, motion, and visual storytelling.
* Technically-minded, interested in code as the material digital products are made of.
* Familiar and comfortable working within and contributing to large design systems that you may or may not own directly.
* Experience developing custom creative tooling for internal or external audiences.
* You think of interfaces as dynamic and love thinking about motion and flows.
* Intimately familiar with the capabilities and constraints of several of today’s and tomorrow’s digital devices and platforms.
* You value inclusive design and accessibility and don’t believe it has to mean compromising aesthetics.
* A user- and data-focused design mentality. You are constantly looking to hone your team's instincts through user feedback and data insight. You understand the role and importance of qualitative and quantitative methodologies.
* Thoughtful designer and problem solver who questions the status quo and strives for improvement.
* You have an online portfolio, or PDF that you can share with us.


 Where You'll Be
   

  

* This role will ideally be located in the Canada, Sweden, or potentially one of our other EMEA locations \*excluding France for now due to on-call restrictions.
* We offer you the flexibility to work where you work best! For this role, you can be within the EMEA region as long as we have a work location.
* This team operates within the Central European and GMT time zone for collaboration.


 Today, we are the world’s most popular audio streaming subscription service.

title: Integrated Designer / Art Director
description:
**Brinner du för att förvandla kampanjkoncept till starka visuella uttryck i alla kanaler – och dessutom gillar att växla mellan kreativa koncept och praktiskt genomförande? För en av våra största kunder i norden på en digitalbyrå i Stockholm? Då ska du läsa vidare! Vi på Plan.Net Nordics behöver förstärkning av en** 
**Integrated Designer / Art Director** 
**som är van att omvandla kunders briefer till fantastiska kampanjer & leveranser, jobba internationellt och på engelska samt dessutom gärna pratar något av de nordiska språken flytande.** 




  





**Det här innebär jobbet** 





 Som Integrated Designer / Art Director får du jobba med en av våra största kunder, ett premiumvarumärke i bilbranschen, i ett uppdrag där du
 
 förvandlar internationella kampanjkoncept till relevant, lokalanpassad kommunikation för köpta och egna kanaler såsom sociala medier, display, D/OOH, print, TV, radio,
 
 CRM och webb
 
 . Du får
 
 kombinera kreativ frihet i form av ta fram transcreation concept för lokala taktiska kampanjer och kreativa lokala aktiveringsidéer med tydliga ramar i lokalisering och final art av adaptions mockups, skapa mallar och original av ad hoc produktioner
 
 för vidare produktion av andra team – samtidigt som du ibland själv levererar det slutgiltiga materialet.
 



 Du är trygg i produktionen men älskar också att tänka ett steg längre – kring kanaler, kundresor och hur budskap och form samspelar.
 



  






 Du kommer att tillhöra vårt nya kreativa team av Copywriters och produktionsledare på Plan.Net Nordics, samtidigt som du jobbar tätt med kollegor i liknande roller både lokalt, nordiskt och internationellt.
 




  





**Du kommer att:** 



* Arbeta i kampanjer som sträcker sig över flera kanaler, plattformar och faser i köpresan
* Skapa designlösningar som håller både kreativt och tekniskt, och fungerar i alla format
* Ansvara för designriktning i kampanjens olika delar – ibland från scratch, ibland utifrån globala guidelines
* Ta fram mallar, templates och originalmaterial för lokal produktion
* Vara både idédriven och genomförandeorienterad



  





**Kompetenser som tar dig ett steg närmare oss** 



* 4+ års erfarenhet som Art Director, Integrated Designer eller liknande roll i byrå- eller inhousemiljö
* Du har mycket god känsla för form, typografi och storytelling
* Du är van att jobba utifrån centrala guidelines, men kan också ta ut svängarna när det krävs
* Du har erfarenhet av att skapa kampanjmaterial för digitala & traditionella kanaler samt egen kanaler såsom video, TV
 
 , sociala medier, display,
 
 print, OOH,
 
 CRM och webb
* Du har koll på både kanalernas funktion och användarens behov
* Du är självgående, strukturerad och van att leverera i deadline-tunga miljöer
* Du jobbar obehindrat i Adobe CC



  





**Vi tror att du:** 



* Är en formstark och idédriven designer med produktionsvana
* Ser lösningar där andra ser begränsningar
* Trivs med att ha många projekt igång samtidigt, i nära samarbete med andra
* Är noggrann – och vet när “done is better than not overengineering”
* Gillar att arbeta med internationella team och kommunicerar obehindrat på engelska och svenska



  





**Vi blir extra glada om du också:** 



* Har erfarenhet av rörligt innehåll och digital kanaler
* Gillar att jobba med eller har erfarenhet av att använda data & insikter till koncept och kampanjenheter
* Har jobbat med internationella kampanjverktyg och transcreation
* Har förståelse för eller erfarenhet av UX och digitala kundresor
* Pratar något nordiskt språk



  





**Vem är du?** 




 För att trivas hos oss är du nog en kombination av vanlig hederlig härlig människa, formstark och strukturerad samt professionell Designer/Art Director. Du gillar högt i tak och komma med idéer samtidigt som du förstår när det är dags att vara hands-on och får saker gjort. Du är nog överlag en väldigt lättsam och följsam person som uppskattar en familjär byråmiljö utan prestigepanik.
 



  





**Vilka är vi?** 




 Vi är en entreprenöriell digitalbyrå som grundades i januari 2022 som en del i den nordiska etableringen av Serviceplan Group – Europas största oberoende och partnerledda kreativa byrågrupp. Här bygger vi just nu upp ett “House of Communication” som idag består av oss, Plan.Net Nordics, och mediabyrån Mediaplus Nordics. På sikt kan även gruppens reklambyråben etableras under vårt gemensamma tak. Serviceplan Group finns på 21 marknader, har över 25 kontor och 6500 medarbetare världen över.
 



  





 Vi mixar våra arbetsdagar mellan kund, hemmet, affärsresor samt vårt kontor eller byråpartners kontor. Flexibelt arbetsliv när det är som bäst. Hos oss får man vara som man är. Vi jobbar aktivt med att skapa en hållbar arbetsmiljö där alla trivs och mår bra. Här råder också hjärtlig entreprenörsanda (som sig bör när man är i startgroparna av något stort!) där varje individ är med och bidrar till vår framfart och framgång. Du hittar oss i sprillans nya lokaler på Regeringsgatan 109 i Stockholm. 
 



  





**Sök – vi ser fram emot att möta dig!**

title: Architect – Digital Workplace
description:
We are a $13+ billion global technology company, home to more than 224,000 people across 60 countries, delivering industry-leading capabilities centered around digital, engineering, cloud, and AI, powered by a broad portfolio of technology services and products.
 



  





 HCLTech is a globally recognized leader in the Tech and IT industry, but we’ve never forgotten the startup mindset that got us here. We’ve always approached our work with an idea-first attitude because every one of our accomplishments —no matter how big or small —can be traced back to an idea’s single spark.
 



  





 It’s that spark —that inner drive —that sets our people apart from our competitors. It enables us not just to pull off game-changing feat after game-changing feat but to better our world in the process. We want you to find your spark. Because that’s what drives you to be better, be more and ultimately, be more fulfilled.
 



  





 Job Title: Architect – Digital Workplace
 



 Hybrid - 4 days work from office
 



  





**About the Role:** 




 We are seeking a highly skilled
 **Architect – Digital Workplace** 
 to design, implement, and optimize secure, scalable, and user-centric digital workplace environments across Windows, mobile, and virtual platforms. This role is pivotal in leading our transformation toward a modern, cloud-based, secure, and seamless user experience.
 



  





**Key Responsibilities:** 



* Architect and manage Windows 10/11 environments, including Autopilot, Intune, Azure AD, Automation, Application Packaging, Defender and Group Policy
* Lead enterprise endpoint management using
 **Microsoft Endpoint Manager (Intune)**
* Design and suggest improvements in
 **Virtual Desktop Infrastructure (VDI)** 
 solutions including
 **Windows 365** 
 ,
 **Azure Virtual Desktop (AVD)** 
 , and
 **Citrix** 
 environments
* Design solutions and automations using Graph API, Intune Log Analytics & create Dashboards.
* Guide with automations in the environment, which includes Applciation packaging, remediation, script validation etc.
* Manage Github or AZDO repositories for codes and scripts.
* Develop and implement lifecycle strategies for
 **Windows OS** 
 , including large-scale OS migrations
* Integrate and manage
 **Android and iOS** 
 devices via Intune MDM, ensuring secure mobile access
* Implement endpoint security best practices using
 **Microsoft Defender for Endpoint** 
 ,
 **BitLocker** 
 ,
 **Conditional Access** 
 , and
 **Security Baselines**
* Automate provisioning, updates, and reporting with
 **PowerShell** 
 ,
 **Graph API** 
 , and
 **Azure Automation**
* Collaborate with cross-functional teams (Security, Network, Applications) to align policies and user access
* Package and deploy applications via
 **Win32** 
 ,
 **MSIX** 
 , and
 **Winget**
* Maintain documentation of architecture, standards, SOPs, and configuration baselines
* Stay up to date with Microsoft 365 and endpoint management technologies and contribute to continuous improvement initiatives



  





**Required Skills & Experience:** 



* 10+ years of experience in end-user computing or workplace architecture roles
* Deep knowledge of Windows 10/11, Group Policy, Active Directory, and Azure AD
* Strong hands-on experience with Intune, Autopilot, SCCM, and modern endpoint management
* Experience designing and supporting
 **Citrix** 
 ,
 **AVD** 
 , or
 **Windows 365** 
 VDI solutions
* Proficient in managing
 **Android and iOS** 
 mobile endpoints using Microsoft Intune
* Expertise in PowerShell scripting, KQL, DAX and endpoint automation
* Strong understanding of security frameworks: Zero Trust, Conditional Access, Defender for Endpoint, etc.
* Excellent documentation, collaboration, and communication skills



  





**Nice to Have:** 



* Certifications:
* Microsoft Certified: Endpoint Administrator Associate
* Microsoft Certified: Azure Solutions Architect Expert AZ-305
* Citrix Certified Associate/Professional (CCA-V, CCP-V)
* ITIL Foundation

title: Design Lead
description:
**In brief**
 We are growing! That being said, there is a great need of establishing Design Lead role in our team. With this addition we hope to maximize the potential of our design team, strengthen the cross platform collaboration and ensure growth of our Norndet design language consistency between platforms.
   

  

**This is part of the role**
**Business Responsibilities**
 Where design and leadership skills match together! With Nordnet Design Lead responsibilities you act as a Product Designer superstar with a few additional responsibilities including:
   

  

* Establish and maintain consistent Nordnet design experience between the platforms.
* Lead and organise Design team through the work in special projects, cross platform and domain initiatives.
* Lead and organise Design team through Nordnet Design System related projects and initiatives.


**Behavioural Responsibilities**
* Mentor and coach fellow designers.
* Inspire, influence and maximize the potential of Nordnet Design team.
* Organise and support your team in reaching design quality standards.
* Advocate, promote and evangelize Nordnet Design System.
+ Be an active participant in Design System related meetings. Effectively communicate Design team decisions, component updates and delegate tasks coming to and from Design System related meetings.

* Establish close collaboration with Design Lead(s) and HoPD.
* Establish good communication and information flow within leadership group.
+ Discuss the project progress, team organisation and design decisions related to regular Design team work and/or special project initiatives.
+ Communicate changes and ensure that design decisions are aligned with
+ HoPD/Management before final design decision is reached.

* Help Design team grow
+ Helping Design team members grow, bringing out the best in the design department.
+ Contribute to the overall team spirit and support creating the best environment for Nordnet Design team.

* Support HoPD through the hiring process and team growth journey.


**This is you**
**As a Design Lead At Nordnet You**
* Are inspiring disruptor and innovator in your field of specialization with great communication skills.
* Are equally talented in analytics and creativity.
* Are capable of looking at the big picture and diving into details.
* Have the ability to solve difficult design problems in cross domain initiatives.
* Are strong, confident communicator with colleagues below, above, and adjacent to them.
* Have experience leading multiple projects (Web/App) while sharing work with other product designers and collaborating with cross-functional leadership.
* Have experience interacting with and influencing cross-functional teams.
* Base your design decisions by a deep concern for both business and the customer.
* Have a strong ability to lead a design team through influence and inspiration.
* Have multiple years of professional experience working and handling projects in both App and Web platforms.


**Questions and application**
 If you have any questions do not hesitate to contact Sophie Esphagen (sophie.esphagen@nordnet.se). We’ll be happy to support the process and provide all the answers on your questions.
   

  

 As a part of the application please provide your CV and your design portfolio.
   

  

 Looking forward to receiving your application as soon as possible and no later than 15th of July. Please note that interviews will be held on an ongoing basis.

title: Senior Product Designer
description:
Are you a Senior Product Designer? If so, Greenely is looking for an exceptional individual to join our team!
 



 We are looking for a
 **Senior Product Designer** 
 with UX focus to join our team in Stockholm. As we are scaling, this role will be a crucial part of building the next generation of Greenely. In the role, you will lead the UX and UI design of our consumer-facing applications, from early discovery to implementation. Your expertise in creating seamless user experiences and visually compelling designs will play a key role in shaping the future of our products.
 



  





**What you’ll be doing** 



* Lead work end-to-end in the Greenely app as well as in other channels.
* Collaborate closely with product managers, developers, and other stakeholders to define and implement design solutions.
* Conduct user research and usability testing to inform design decisions.
* Create wireframes, prototypes, and high-fidelity designs that enhance user experience.
* Ensure a cohesive design language and maintain consistency across all platforms.
* Drive innovation by staying up-to-date with design trends and best practices.



  





**What you'll need to succeed** 



* 7+ years of experience in UX/UI design, with a proven track record of leading design efforts from discovery to launch.
* Experience working with well-established consumer app companies.
* Strong understanding of UX principles and the ability to simplify complex user flows.
* Expertise in creating visually appealing and functional UI designs.
* Proficiency in design tools such as Figma, Sketch, or Adobe Creative Suite.
* Excellent communication and collaboration skills, with the ability to present and justify design decisions.
* A results-driven mindset, with the ability to thrive in a fast-paced environment.



  





**What We Can Offer You 🏢👩‍💻** 



* Flexibility: We are an office-first company that values in-person collaboration, offering flexible work arrangements to support your work-life balance. Our vibrant office is conveniently located in the heart of Stockholm at Vasagatan 40.
* Growth: Elevate your career with opportunities for skill development, challenging projects, and advancement within our forward-thinking organization.
* Influence and Impact: Your voice matters. Shape the future of energy by contributing your ideas, expertise, and playing a key role in decision-making.
* Innovative Environment: Thrive in an ever-changing industry, working on cutting-edge projects and staying ahead of the curve in a dynamic and pioneering work atmosphere.



  





**About Greenely** 




 Greenely is on a mission to create the best customer experience for the modern energy consumer through technology. As a digital energy provider, we help people reduce their electricity costs by optimizing their home and car's electricity usage with our smart app. Supported by Nordic venture capital companies, we aim to enable households worldwide to connect, control, and optimize their energy usage. We believe that the best electricity is the one that is never used - a win-win for both wallets and the environment!
 



  





 WE ARE
 **bold and push the limit.** 




 WE BELIEVE THAT
 **fast is better than slow.** 




 WE
 **think like owners.** 




 WE
 **lead with knowledge.** 




  





*Kindly, we do not accept applications via email as we protect your privacy. Thank you for your understanding.*

title: Product Analyst
description:
**In this role you will have the opportunity to drive and develop product analytics in the consumer domain, an area that evolves around the search experience on hemnet.se and in our apps. You will play an important role in the cross functional team that aims to develop and improve our products with a well-proven data and insight driven work method. It is all about understanding user behavior by gathering, interpreting and visualizing data to get powerful insights.
   

  

 🛑 Last application day August 4th** 
  

  

**What You’ll Do** 
  

  

 As a Product Analyst at Hemnet, you’ll turn data into actionable insights that drive smarter decisions and shape the future of our product. You’ll be a key part of a cross-functional product team, bringing data into the heart of decision-making to improve user experiences and deepen our understanding of user behavior.
   

  

 You’ll also be part of Hemnet’s Analytics team, working with other analysts and BI developers to support the entire organization with insights that help us reach our business goals. Together, you’ll contribute to the evolution of our analytics function and drive Hemnet in making faster and better decisions.
   

  

 In this role, we place a strong emphasis on communication—you’re not just supporting product development, you’re actively driving it forward through insight and collaboration.
   

  

**You’ll get to:** 
  

  

* Drive the analytics work in the Consumer domain and act as a strategic partner on everything from prioritizations to hypothesis testing and insight-driven product development
* Analyze user behavior and trends to uncover opportunities and inform product improvements
* Build dashboards and reports that provide clear, actionable insights to your team
* Design, run and evaluate A/B tests and other experiments to optimize the user experience
* Be part of the broader Analytics team at Hemnet – collaborating with other product analysts and BI developers to strengthen how we work with data and insight across the whole company


  

  

**What We Think You Bring** 
  

  

 We’re looking for someone who can clearly communicate complex analyses to a wide range of stakeholders. Your ability to tailor messages, build trust, and turn data into action will be key to shaping product strategy and elevating the user experience.
   

  

* Extensive experience as a product analyst, preferably in a tech environment, agile team, or data-driven company
* Strong communication skills – you know how to turn data into clear insights and guide others to act on them
* Solid skills in working with raw data and writing SQL queries
* Experience using tools like Google BigQuery, Amplitude, Google Analytics, GTM, Looker Studio or or other similar analytics tools
* Experience with experimentation, conversion optimization, and A/B testing
* A curious and solution-oriented mindset – you enjoy finding new ways forward and challenging the status quo
* For this role, we are looking for someone who has a professional proficiency in both Swedish and English


  

  

****🏡** 
 Your career at Hemnet** 
  

  

 Are you ready to play a meaningful role in one of the biggest decisions people make in life? If so – welcome to Hemnet! Since 1998, we’ve taken pride in making the life-changing, often stressful journey of finding a new home as smooth and enjoyable as possible.
   

  

 At Hemnet, our mission is to connect every seller with every buyer, empower buyers to discover every home for sale, and enable real estate agents to match seamlessly with sellers. With over 40 million monthly visits, we’re Sweden’s most popular property platform and the first choice for Swedes looking to buy or sell a home. Together, we’re creating an open, transparent housing market, making home transactions in Sweden among the most efficient in the world.
   

  

 Our success is built on a strong, friendly culture that values creativity, inclusivity, and collaboration. Hemnet is a place where everyone has a voice, and our welcoming environment helps you thrive and grow as you work alongside passionate colleagues from around the globe.
   

  

**A Hybrid Way of Working** 
  

  

 Our vibrant office in central Stockholm is the hub of our collaboration and culture, providing a lively space that fosters team spirit. We come together in the office three days a week, with two flexible remote days. To be part of our team, it’s essential to be based in or near Stockholm.

title: DIGITAL DESIGN & ART DIRECTOR TO WORKSHOP!
description:
***WorkShop offers you an exciting job in an international and dynamic organization where there is a short time gap from idea to action. Would you like to join us?***
 We are one of the fastest growing retail agencies in Europe and to support this growth, we are looking for you! A creative, inspiring and forward-thinking Digital Design & Art Director with love for content. The position is based in Stockholm and is a 40% parental cover from September to the end of December.
   

  

 As a Digital Design & Art Director at WorkShop you will be responsible for coming up with and creating world-class ideas, as well as bringing them to life in one of our client’s digital platforms. You will have a leading role in moving the creative development forward, from brief to presentation and into production. You’ll be directing everything from weekly content to video, brand activations and events.
   

  

 You will have a crucial part of both guiding and working in our team, where you’ll help our team of creatives achieve success, both with concepts and production.
   

  

 You will be reporting to our current Design Director and be part of a team consisting of Art Directors, Designers, Motion Graphics and Production Managers. We can offer you a creative, dynamic and modern workplace, giving our employees the opportunity to grow while working with global market leading brands.
   

  

 We can’t wait to meet you!
   

  

**WE BELIEVE THAT THE RIGHT PERSON FOR THIS ROLE HAS:**
* A minimum of 5 years experience as a digital Art Director with a strong design eye
* Relevant studies
* Experience leading junior creatives
* Confident in script and storyboard creation
* Excellent knowledge working with the relevant adobe programs, Figma/Sketch and Power Point. After Effects is a plus
* Understanding of different types of digital communication channels
* Comfortable with presenting and explaining your ideas
* Excellent written and verbal communication skills in Swedish and English (English is the company language)
* A positive mind set and a social team player with a solution oriented “can do” attitude


**Start** 
 : September or according to agreement
   

  

**Working hours** 
 : 40% parental cover
   

  

**Employment** 
 : Time limited from September to December (with the possibility of extension)
   

  

**Work place** 
 : Stockholm HQ (https://www.nextgenretailhub.com/)
   

  

 We are looking forward to hearing from you! Selection and interview process is ongoing; therefore, please apply as soon as possible. We don't accept applications on email. Last application day is 2025-07-31.
   

  

*We are WorkShop: the Consumer Experience Agency – a leading retail agency in the Nordics, dedicated to creating and delivering innovative customer experience for the world's biggest brands. We do that by offering a complete portfolio of services including data & insights, concept, field marketing and much more – so that we can be a partner to our clients in every step. Join one of our teams around the globe and explore your potential through unique projects, pop-ups, store concepts or our brand ambassador programs!*
**Learn more about our company at WorkShop and follow us on Facebook, LinkedIn and Instagram!**

title: Product Lead, Conversational AI
description:
**About Wolt**
 At Wolt, we create technology that brings joy, simplicity and earnings to the neighborhoods of the world. In 2014 we started with delivery of restaurant food. Now we’re building the delivery of (almost) everything and you’ll find us in over 500 cities in 30 countries around the world. In 2022 we joined forces with DoorDash and together we keep on dreaming big and expanding across the globe.
   

  

 Working at Wolt isn’t always easy, but it’s definitely exciting. Here you’ll learn more, build more, and ship more than in most other companies. You’ll be challenged a lot, but also have a lot of fun on the way. So, if you’re a self-starter with drive and entrepreneurial spirit, this could be the ride of your life.
   

  

 We are looking for an experienced Product Lead to join the
 **Conversational AI Team** 
 within the support product group.
 **The** 
**Support Group** 
 consists of
 **5** 
 different teams building products and tools that power Wolt’s customer support.
   

  

 Delightful customer experience is one of the cornerstones of Wolt, and we see Wolt’s high quality support as an important part of the overall customer experience. Over the years, we have invested a lot in our in-house built support tooling and products, as we believe it’s the best way for us to provide a world-class support experience and ensure satisfaction for our consumers, courier partners, and merchants across the 30 countries we operate in.
   

  

 In this role, you’ll be leading Wolt’s strategic efforts in exploring AI opportunities in the support domain. As Product Lead, you will own the vision and roadmap for a team within the support group. This involves leading multiple projects and cross-team product initiatives across the entire product lifecycle, partnering with business and operations stakeholders as well as understanding our end-users better than anyone. You’ll build an in-depth understanding of Wolt’s support operations and our users, including consumers, merchants, courier partners, and our internal support operations teams. You will work with a cross-functional team of incredibly talented engineers, designers, and data experts in a high-visibility role.
   

  

**Our humble expectations**
 You could come to this role from a multitude of different backgrounds, but ideally, you have
   

  

* Proven experience as a Product Lead / Product Manager, preferably with experience from the consumer and/or AI space - you know what it takes to develop great consumer products
* Excellent written and verbal communication skills, and have proven ability to influence cross-functional teams and senior stakeholders/executives.
* Desire to be in a high-ownership, high-visibility role. You need to be comfortable with both driving the strategic vision for the domain but also getting hands-on and diving into the details.
* A mixture of data analysis skills, engineering understanding and business savvy with the go-getter attitude of a "could-be start-up CEO"
* Expertise in how to work with and lead cross-functional teams, at least with developers, design, data experts and with engineering teams


**Next steps**
 The position will be filled as soon as we find the right person, so make sure to apply as soon as you realize you really, really want to join us!
   

  

 The compensation will be a negotiable combination of monthly pay and DoorDash RSUs. The latter makes it exceptionally easy to be excited about our company growing and doing well, as you’ll own a piece of the pie.
   

  

 Our Commitment to Diversity and Inclusion
   

  

 We’re committed to growing and empowering a more inclusive community within our company, industry, and cities. That’s why we hire and cultivate diverse teams of people from all backgrounds, experiences, and perspectives. We believe that true innovation happens when everyone has room at the table and the tools, resources, and opportunity to excel.

title: Product Lead, Live - Contraband
description:
Contraband, our upcoming AAA co-op open world action game and new IP published by Microsoft Xbox Game Studios, is now looking for a Product Lead to join the team!
   

  

**The Position**
 As the Product Lead for Live, you are responsible for the player acquisition, engagement, retention and monetization strategy of our Live service. You will own the product vision for Live, optimize player value for our Live KPIs, manage a small team of Product Managers, and lead Marketing, Community and Analytics for the project.
   

  

 You will also be a key stakeholder of the Development team on new Live game features, content, and platform capabilities, and represent Live towards our publisher. Your primary focus will be on prioritizing the development roadmap and ensuring all releases meet their targets.
   

  

**What You'll Do**
* Define and drive the product strategy for the Live service.
* Optimize player value to improve acquisition, engagement, retention and monetization KPIs.
* Identifying opportunities through live data, community playtests, market research and player insights
* Define and realise a high-fidelity Live plan for the next 6 months. Manage the Live features backlog
* Hire, manage and mentor a team of Product Managers.
* Lead collaboration with the Marketing and Community teams; serve as the main client for Data Science.
* Act as a major stakeholder of the Development team to help define new Live game features, content, and platform capabilities.
* Provide regular Live performance updates and recommendations to the game leadership.
* Represent the Live service towards Microsoft.


**Who You Are**
* A strategic product leader with a deep understanding of gamers’ desires and preferences, and a keen eye for market trends.
* Experienced in overseeing the entire lifecycle of a Live service, from conception to release and live operation, with a focus on continuous updates, expansions, and events.
* Ideally on 1 Live AAA title or more, with a large publisher.
* Adept at bridging creative vision with business objectives to deliver unrivaled player experiences while meeting financial goals.
* Skilled in navigating the evolving landscape of gaming platforms, player communities, and emerging technologies.
* Proven ability to lead a team and to collaborate effectively with Development, Marketing, Community, and Analytics.
* Proficient in data-informed decision-making, utilizing analytics, player insights, and market research.
* Knowledgeable about personalization and player-centric approaches to deliver tailored gameplay and customized content.


*Note: Research shows under-represented groups in the industry (especially women) might not apply to a job if they don’t check off every requirement. At Avalanche, we’re more about your drive to learn and interest in tackling challenges than what’s on your resume! So don’t stress if you don’t tick every box— shoot us your application anyway! Diverse opinions and different experiences are what make our teams so great, not itemized lists of qualifications.*
**The Stockholm location**
 Our Stockholm office is situated in Södermalm, the beating heart of the city’s game industry. It’s a physical representation of our games – the lush vegetation of Just Cause and theHunter: Call of the Wild meets corroded metal straight out of Mad Max. It has everything you need to make it your creative base camp.
   

  

**Our values**
 At Avalanche Studios Group, we create worlds beyond limits. But that’s not exclusive to our games, so we’re committed to developing a diverse and inclusive workplace. All Avalanchers have a shared responsibility to create an open work environment where everyone is treated equally and respectfully. Being part of our world is not contingent on your heritage, your gender, or sexual orientation. It’s all about your passion and creativity.
   

  

**How To Apply**
 To apply for this position, please register below and provide your CV in English. We review applications continuously. All further studio-related information is provided under a non-disclosure agreement.
   

  

*At Avalanche Studios Group we're always on the lookout for talented individuals to join our passionate team, but please note that relocation assistance is not available for this role.*

title: Frontend Engineer – Payments
description:
**Location:** 
 Stockholm (In-office)
   

  

**Company:** 
 360Player
   

  

**Job Type:** 
 Full-time
   

  

**Join the Global Leader in Sports Technology**
 At 360Player, we are redefining how sports clubs operate, develop players, and manage teams. As the world’s leading all-in-one Club Operating System, we help clubs streamline every aspect of their operations—from scheduling and payments to player development and video analytics. Trusted by top clubs such as Rush Soccer, FC Barcelona, and Rafa Nadal Academy, our platform is transforming the sports world. With offices in Stockholm, Barcelona, and the US, we’re looking for passionate, driven individuals to join our team as we continue to grow globally.
   

  

**About The Role**
 We are looking for a
 **Frontend Engineer** 
 to join our
 **Payments team** 
 , focusing on designing and building clear, user-friendly, and visually engaging interfaces that power payment flows within the 360Player platform.
   

  

 In this role, you will work on
 **building checkout flows, reporting interfaces, and payment management tools** 
 that clubs around the world rely on to manage their payments seamlessly. You will collaborate closely with designers, backend engineers, and product managers to ensure payment-related interfaces are intuitive, visually polished, and provide a smooth user experience for clubs and their members.
   

  

 This is a role where your design eye and technical skills will directly impact key flows for the platform, ensuring that payments are easy, transparent, and efficient for users globally.
   

  

**What You’ll Do**
* Develop and maintain modern, responsive payment-related interfaces using React.
* Design and build checkout flows and payment reporting dashboards.
* Collaborate with designers to implement clean, clear, and user-friendly UI/UX.
* Work closely with backend engineers to integrate APIs and payment services.
* Optimize payment flows for performance, accessibility, and scalability.
* Continuously improve payment user experiences based on feedback and analytics.
* Participate in code reviews and contribute to frontend architecture decisions.


**What We’re Looking For**
* 3+ years of experience as a Frontend Engineer or similar role.
* Strong proficiency in TypeScript, HTML, and CSS.
* Experience with React (or similar frameworks like Vue or Angular).
* Familiarity with modern frontend tooling (Webpack, Vite, etc.).
* Understanding of responsive design, accessibility, and cross-browser compatibility.
* Experience with Git and collaborative development workflows.
* A good eye for design and detail-oriented approach to building user interfaces.
* Fluent in English, both spoken and written.


**Personal Qualities**
* Creative and detail-oriented with a user-focused mindset.
* Collaborative and clear communicator.
* Curious and eager to learn and grow.
* Passionate about clean design and intuitive user experiences.
* Interest in sports or technology that supports communities is a plus.


**Why 360Player?**
* Be part of a mission-driven company redefining how sports clubs operate, develop players, and manage teams worldwide.
* Build payment experiences that are a critical part of our all-in-one Club Operating System used by clubs all over the world.
* Collaborate with a skilled, supportive, and international team that values creativity and quality.
* Work on a modern tech stack with real-world impact for coaches, players, and communities globally.
* Enjoy a flexible, open, and collaborative environment where your input shapes the future of sports technology.


**How To Apply**
 If you are excited about frontend development and want to design impactful payment interfaces for sports clubs worldwide, we would love to hear from you.
   

  

 Apply with your
 **resume and a short cover letter** 
 explaining why you are interested in this role at 360Player. We review applications on a rolling basis, so don’t wait to apply! Please note that due to summer vacations interviews will be conducted in August and responses may be delayed.

title: Co-Founder - Social Media & Events
description:
💚 About Chamberly AB
 



 Founded in 2023, Chamberly AB is a fast-growing Swedish startup on a mission to make mental well-being more accessible and supportive through technology. Our mobile app which is available on iOS and coming soon to Android, offers a safe, anonymous space for mental support. With over 100K downloads and an outstanding 4.8/5 rating globally, we’re proud to be making a meaningful impact. Join us in shaping the future of mental health support.
 



  





 We sometimes call Chamberly the tinder of mental health due to its highly interactive UI that connects listeners with users that want to vent about certain topics. Chamberly isn’t just a mental health platform, it’s a place to find your permanent emotional well-being partner that shares the same interest and life experiences as you, allowing users to wander off with their new found best friend.
 



  





 We are young founders that leverage the latest AI technologies to build powerful features that make Chamberly a safe, highly-effective and fun place to be in.
 



  





 📌 Note:
 



 This is an unpaid opportunity until Chamberly can manage to pay it's partners a salary. We encourage you to have a part-time job during your contributions with us to support you through this journey!
 



  





 🧠 Responsibility
 



*Social Media Strategy & Content Creation* 




 Take the lead on managing Chamberly’s presence on LinkedIn, Instagram, Tiktok, (and beyond!). You'll create thoughtful, engaging content and develop a clear strategy to grow our visibility, drive meaningful engagement, and build a strong online community around mental health.
 



  





*Event Planning & Community Engagement* 




 Plan and organize interactive events, both in-app (to keep our users inspired and engaged) and within the team (think about fun meetups, bonding activities, and team-building moments). You’ll be both the planner and the motivator who helps bring people together with purpose and joy.
 



  





*Culture Shaping* 




 Establish a culture of safety, kindness, creativity, and collaboration, for both our users and our team. You’ll help define and nurture the spirit of Chamberly, making sure it’s a place where people feel seen, supported, and empowered to grow.
 



  





 💼 Your Experience (Required):
 


* Experience in creating content on multiple platforms and growing a followers base.
* Experience leading communities on Instagram, Tiktok, LinkedIn, or similar platforms.
* Are an active and curious user on various social media platforms, with a strong understanding of how different platforms work and what makes content truly connect with people.
* Have hands-on experience creating engaging content, and are comfortable using tools like Canva, CapCut, Adobe Express, Figma or similar for image and video editing.
* Have the ability to lead, motivate, and mentor teams.
* Bring a vibrant personality to the table: You're outgoing, empathetic, charismatic, and full of positive energy that uplifts both users and teammates.
* Communicate fluently in English (our working language), both in writing and speaking.



  





 ⭐ Bonus Experience (Nice to have):
 


* Experience or passion for mental health, wellness, or emotional well-being
* Active involvement in community-driven causes (e.g., mental health advocacy, LGBTQ+ support, sustainability, animal welfare)
* A neutral public profile when it comes to political or geopolitical topics.
* Experience collaborating across cultures or remote, international teams.
* An international background with ability to communicate fluently in Swedish, both in writing and speaking.



  





 🕐 Flexibility & Freedom
 


* Choose your own working hours
* Hybrid: Mostly remote
* Easily fits alongside studies or other commitments



  





 By the way, even if you’re a half baked red velvet 🍰 and don’t fulfill all the above, we may still find you super interesting!
 



  





 At Chamberly, we’re committed to creating an inclusive and respectful workplace. Your gender, ethnicity, religion, or any other personal trait will never affect your opportunity with us.
 



  





 🔁 Know someone perfect for this?
 



 Feel free to share this opportunity with them!
 



  





 📩 Interested?
 



 Apply by submitting the Google form 😍

title: Power BI
description:
**Work Location – Sweden, Stockholm Hybrid** 




**Role: Power BI** 




  





**Objective:** 




 To develop and maintain Power BI reports and dashboards by extracting data from ServiceNow, ensuring accurate and insightful data visualization to support business decision-making.
 







**Primary Responsibilities:** 




 1. Design, develop, and deploy Power BI reports and dashboards.
 



 2. Extract and transform data from ServiceNow to Power BI.
 



 3. Collaborate with stakeholders to gather requirements and ensure reports meet business needs.
 



 4. Optimize Power BI dashboards with a focus on usability and performance.
 



 5. Maintain and update existing Power BI reports as needed.
 



 6. Provide training and support to end-users on Power BI functionalities.
 







**Required Qualifications:** 




 1. Proven experience with Power BI and ServiceNow.
 



 2. Strong understanding of data modeling, data transformation, and DAX.
 



 3. Experience in creating complex reports and dashboards in Power BI.
 



 4. Proficiency in SQL and data extraction techniques.
 



 5. Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills.
 







**Preferred Qualifications:** 




 1. Experience in the specific industry of the employer.
 



 2. Familiarity with other data visualization tools.
 



 3. Knowledge of ServiceNow modules and functionalities.
 



 4. Certification in Power BI or related technologies.
 







**Skill & Competencies:** 




 1. Strong communication and collaboration skills.
 



 2. Ability to work independently and as part of a team.
 



 3. Attention to detail and a strong focus on quality.
 



 4. Ability to manage multiple tasks and projects simultaneously.

title: Product Lead, Autonomous Deliveries
description:
**About Wolt**
 At Wolt, we create technology that brings joy, simplicity and earnings to the neighborhoods of the world. In 2014 we started with delivery of restaurant food. Now we’re building the delivery of (almost) everything and you’ll find us in over 500 cities in 30 countries around the world. In 2022 we joined forces with DoorDash and together we keep on dreaming big and expanding across the globe.
   

  

 Working at Wolt isn’t always easy, but it’s definitely exciting. Here you’ll learn more, build more, and ship more than in most other companies. You’ll be challenged a lot, but also have a lot of fun on the way. So, if you’re a self-starter with drive and entrepreneurial spirit, this could be the ride of your life.
   

  

 We are looking for a Product Lead to join the
 **Autonomous Deliveries** 
 Team,
 **Courier** 
 group. The Courier group at Wolt operates with the mission of providing a high-quality delivery experience for our Consumers, becoming the most-loved platform for Couriers, and being the most efficient logistics engine in the industry.
   

  

 Autonomous deliveries is a new team within the Courier group that is focused on revolutionizing logistics by integrating autonomous vehicles, such as drones and robots, into Wolt’s delivery operations.  As a Product Lead, you will work with a cross-functional team of incredibly talented engineers, designers, product people, and analysts in a high-visibility role.  You could come to this role from a multitude of different backgrounds, but ideally, you have
