title: Quality Assurance Manager
company_industry: Transportation, Logistics, Supply Chain and Storage
description:
This role will be based in Stockholm. This is a role for an experienced Quality Assurance Manager within the
 **logistics Industry** 
 - Sweden.
 


  


 Applicants must have permission to reside and work in Sweden.
 


  

  

  


**About the Company** 



  

  

  

  

  


 Be part of a forward-thinking logistics provider specialising in mission-critical IT infrastructure delivery. We are committed to operational excellence, innovation, and delivering exceptional service to our clients. Join us and take the lead in shaping a zero-defect, high-performance logistics environment. Crane Worldwide logistics is a global leader delivering mission-critical server infrastructure with a commitment to excellence, safety, and customer satisfaction. At the forefront of technical logistics, we empower our teams to set the standard in quality and operational safety across EMEIA.
 


  

  

  

  

  


**About the Role** 



  

  

  

  

  


 We are seeking a highly skilled and detail-oriented Quality and Assurance Manager Logistics to oversee the end-to-end quality control processes related to the logistics, handling, and delivery of server racks and associated IT infrastructure. This role plays a key part in maintaining high standards in service quality, damage prevention, compliance with ISO and GDP standards, and continuous improvement across our logistics operations. The Quality Assurance Manager-logistics will be responsible for the quality management program and ongoing maintenance/adherence to said program relating to cloud services including supporting the operations management to ensure compliance with operating procedures and client needs.
 


  

  

  

  

  


**Responsibilities** 



  

  

  

  

  

  
* **Quality Management System (QMS):**
  
* Develop, implement, and maintain QMS aligned with ISO 9001 and relevant
 **logistics** 
 /IT infrastructure quality standards.
  
* Ensure all operations related to the transport and delivery of server racks adhere to internal and customer-defined quality standards.
  
* Conduct weekly reviews to ensure quality is being maintained and review with Operations Manager.
  
* Establish Quality Operations and Quality Control function at given location, including assisting in hiring, developing, and conducting training.
  
* Determine process validation and maintenance of controlled requirements. This process to be documented and retained based on good documentation processes as established.
  
* Partner with relevant internal and external teams to compliance. To be reviewed weekly.
  
* Inspection processes and to ensure those inspections are commensurate with the associated level of risk.
  
* Work with Operations Management as needed to achieve root cause corrective action.
  
* Develops and analyzes reports to monitor and evaluate quality performance in meeting established goals related to the quality management work plan and contractual requirements.
  
* Coordinates guidelines, studies, and performance improvement activities in concert with the utilization management, quality management, case management and device management programs.
  
* Assists in the tracking and monitoring of processes for quality improvement activities according to regulatory requirements, policies and procedures, and contractual agreements.
  
* Provides regular feedback and support to staff in meeting performance expectations.
  
* Prepares, compiles, reviews, and submits monthly and quarterly reports to the leadership team.
  
* Participate in internal and external audits as a subject matter expert on quality operations and quality control functions.
  
* Identify problems, and propose resolutions that are timely, cost-effective, and meet quality requirements.
  
* All other duties as assigned.
  


  

  

  

  
* **Operational Quality Assurance:**
  
* Monitor and audit warehouse and transport processes to ensure safe handling of high-value IT equipment.
  
* Establish and enforce packaging, loading, and unloading standards to minimize transit damage or contamination.
  
* Track damage rates, non-conformities, and corrective/preventive actions (CAPA).
  


  

  

  

  
* **Supplier and Vendor Oversight:**
  
* Collaborate with transport providers, subcontractors, and warehouse teams to ensure consistent quality in handling and delivery performance.
  
* Evaluate and audit logistics partners for adherence to SLAs and quality KPIs.
  


  

  

  

  
* **Customer Satisfaction and Reporting:**
  
* Address customer quality and safety concerns and lead root cause analysis and resolution plans.
  
* Provide regular performance and compliance reports to internal stakeholders and clients.
  


  

  

  

  
* **Training and Development:**
  
* Train warehouse and logistics staff on quality procedures, handling standards, and escalation protocols.
  
* Promote a quality-focused culture across all touchpoints in the delivery process.
  


  

  

  

  
* **Safety and Compliance:**
  
* Champion safety protocols in warehousing, transportation, and delivery activities, ensuring alignment with local health & safety regulations, EU standards, and internal HSE policies.
  
* Perform risk assessments and enforce safe loading/unloading procedures for high-value IT hardware.
  
* Ensure full compliance with GDP (Good Distribution Practice) and relevant regulatory standards for server rack distribution.
  
* Oversee proper use of personal protective equipment (PPE) and ensure logistics partners and employees adhere to all HSE requirements.
  
* Maintain safety audit schedules and lead incident investigations related to logistics operations.
  


  

  

  


**Safety Requirements:** 



  

  
* In-depth knowledge of HSE regulations, logistics risk management, and warehouse safety practices.
  
* Experience with manual handling guidelines, equipment safety, and secure transit standards for IT infrastructure.
  
* Ability to lead incident investigations and implement immediate containment and long-term prevention measures.
  
* Understanding of environmental and occupational safety standards applicable to international logistics.
  
* Certification in health & safety management (e.g., NEBOSH, IOSH, or equivalent) is highly desirable.
  


  

  

  


**Qualifications** 



  

  
* 5 years of supervisory experience.
  
* Bachelor's degree in Logistics, Supply Chain, Engineering, Occupational Safety, or a related field.
  
* Minimum 5 years’ experience in quality and/or safety assurance within logistics or technical goods delivery.
  
* Proven expertise in ISO 9001, GDP standards, and warehouse safety protocols.
  
* Six Sigma certification or experience in continuous improvement methodologies is advantageous.
  
* Strong interpersonal and communication skills to engage frontline staff, contractors, and senior stakeholders internal and external.
  
* Fluent in English; additional European languages a plus.

title: Cloud Architect
company_industry: IT Services and IT Consulting, Business Consulting and Services, and IT System Design Services
description:
***Cloud Architect & Engineers - AWS***




***Leading Nordic IT Consultancy Company - Sweden***




  





 Would you like the opportunity to join Sweden's fastest-growing IT organizations in the Nordics, renowned for delivering secure and cutting-edge Cloud solutions to high-profile enterprises and public entities.
 



  





 In the last 3 years they have grown their market leading business to over 500 colleagues, with significant growth and investment occurring in their cloud division. They work with the largest enterprises in the Nordics and cover the entire spectrum from public cloud to private cloud, including air-gapped solutions for defense and national security. Some of the assignments may therefore require security clearance.
 



  





**Requirements:** 




  




* 3-5+ years experience of Cloud Architecture in AWS.
* Nice to have - Cloud Adoption Framework (CAF) or Well-Architected Framework (WAF)
* Swedish speaking, Swedish citizenship.
* Infrastructure-as-Code (Terraform or CloudFormation)
* DevOps & CI/CD - GitHub Actions or similar tools



  





 You don't have to be an expert and know all of this, but you must be both curious and willing to learn.
 



  





**Some of what they offer:** 




  




* 6 weeks vacation and certification bonuses
* Good pension and insurance schemes
* Contribution to SATS membership and access to company cabins
* One of the Nordic's largest professional community within cloud technologies, where knowledge sharing is central



  





  





*Thank you for your interest in this opportunity. If your application is successful, we will contact you to discuss the position in more detail within 48 hours of receiving your CV. Please assume your application has been unsuccessful if you do not hear back from us within 48 hours.*

title: Security Engineer - Global role in Cybersecurity
description:
This is a global role based in Europe, with a hybrid setup that combines remote work with regular on-site presence. Preferred locations are Spain, Germany, Sweden, and Slovakia, but Finland, France, and the UK are also possible provided you can work from a Camfil office.
   

  

***Do you want to play a key role in shaping cybersecurity for a global, sustainability-driven, and tech-oriented company? Camfil is looking for a Security Engineer to join our global IT team - with the flexibility to work from anywhere in Europe.***
 Camfil is a global leader in clean air solutions. Our products improve human health and performance by providing clean air in hospitals, data centers, and more. Headquartered in Stockholm, we operate 30 production sites worldwide and are committed to innovation and sustainability. We invest in our employees, and we constantly evaluate and develop the leadership, our work environment, processes, and methods to ensure a healthy and efficient workplace. We are also investing heavily in IT, aiming to be the best digital destination in our industry.
   

  

**The role**
 As Security Engineer at Camfil you will play a central role in shaping and strengthening our global security capabilities. Your responsibilities will span from architecture and design proposals to hands-on implementation, as you manage and improve our security platforms and processes in close collaboration with IT and business stakeholders across the organization.
   

  

**Responsibilities**
 As Security Engineer, your responsibilities include:
   

  

* Developing, implementing, and maintaining security solutions such as SIEM, EDR, and PAM
* Writing and maintaining code for automation and integrations using PowerShell or Python
* Supporting with incident response and threat hunting
* Designing and reviewing security architecture for projects
* Performing risk assessments and advising on security controls
* Ensuring security is integrated into business processes


**Personal qualities**
 You are self-motivated, curious, and structured in your way of working. With strong analytical skills, you are comfortable working both independently and as part of a team. Your communication skills, both written and verbal, are excellent, and you collaborate easily with people from different functions. You pay attention to detail without losing sight of the bigger picture. You enjoy managing multiple tasks simultaneously and have a strong desire to develop and continuously learn.
   

  

**You likely bring**
 To succeed in this role, you have hands-on experience in security engineering, preferably with security solutions such as SIEM, EDR, and PAM You also possess strong scripting skills, preferably in PowerShell or Python, and have experience with API integration and automation. Additionally, you have experience implementing and configuring security platforms and have a solid understanding of cloud environments and current threat tactics. For this position we prioritize the following three areas:
   

  

* Scripting knowledge, preferably in Powershell (or Python), with experience writing code that consumes APIs, performs data transformations, and automates tasks.
* Experience working with creating detection playbooks within SIEM, which involves understanding the right log sources, setting up relevant queries in the SIEM, and automating response actions. Additionally, you should have knowledge within SIEM administration, including strong knowledge of SIEM querying languages, designing SIEM architectures, and experience setting up full SIEM solutions (from agent deployment and configuration to log forwarders, event filtering, and SIEM server or service configuration).Experience setting up, configuring, and operating security platforms/systems, including Privileged Access Management (PAM), Endpoint Detection and Response (EDR), and Data Loss Prevention (DLP).


 Furthermore, you need:
   

  

* Strong knowledge of operating system security, network security, and cyber threats
* Experience in performing risk assessments and working with security frameworks
* Knowledge of incident handling practices and security incident management tools
* Excellent language skills in English


**We also consider it a plus if you have** 
 experience working with cloud-based security solutions and tools, as well as knowledge of security testing.
   

  

**What We Look For In You**
 You are self-driven and organized, with strong analytical and problem-solving skills. You have excellent written and verbal communication skills and thrive both independently and as part of a team. You are capable of handling multiple assignments simultaneously and collaborating across functional areas. A willingness to learn and grow is key to your approach.
   

  

**Ready to make an impact?**
 Apply now! In this recruitment, we collaborate with Experis. For questions about the position, you are welcome to contact recruitment consultant Pia Boström, 0703-146866. Please note that candidate selection will be ongoing throughout the application period, and that you therefore should apply as soon as possible.
   

  

**Please note:** 
 To be eligible for this role, you must already hold a valid work permit for the country you are applying from. Preferred locations for this position are Spain, Germany, Sweden, and Slovakia. Candidates based in Finland, France, or the UK may also be considered, provided they meet this requirement and can work partly from a Camfil office.
   

  

 We look forward to receiving your application!

title: BESS Engineer
description:
Engineering
   

  

* Stockholm
* Fully Remote


 BESS Engineer
   

  

**Are you an energy engineer passionate about solving complex technical challenges and accelerating the clean energy transition?**
 Fantastic – welcome to Alight! We're a fast-growing scale-up with a bold purpose: to kick carbon off the grid by helping businesses save money with solar — and now also storage — from day one. As one of Europe’s leading solar IPPs, we’re scaling up our BESS capabilities and need brilliant minds to help us make it happen.
   

  

 That’s where you come in. As our
 **first BESS Engineer** 
 , you’ll play a central role in shaping Alight’s battery storage offering. This is a rare opportunity to take part in both project execution and product design — building our BESS capabilities from the ground up and creating a true impact on the energy system of tomorrow.
   

  

**Your impact**
 This is a hybrid position combining
 **Product Engineer** 
 and
 **Project Engineer** 
 responsibilities. At the start, your focus will be on integrating BESS into current projects (~70% project execution / ~30% product development). As internal knowledge grows, the role will shift towards 100% product ownership — defining our system architecture and guiding the full BESS lifecycle.
   

  

 What You'll Do
   

  

**Across All Stages**
* Design and optimize BESS solutions: system sizing, architecture, component selection
* Ensure compliance with grid codes, safety standards, and certifications
* Develop and maintain design guidelines, technical specifications, FAT procedures, and commissioning protocols
* Support supplier selection and contract negotiations, especially technical annexes
* Align with Revenue, Development, and Construction teams on technical and commercial viability


**When Focused On Product Engineering**
* Lead the full product lifecycle of our BESS systems — from concept to commissioning
* Propose innovative solutions to complex challenges in design and integration
* Mentor and train internal teams on BESS technologies and standards
* Translate regulatory, market, and grid requirements into technical designs


**When Focused On Project Engineering**
* Lead or support design reviews to ensure technical compliance and performance
* Coordinate with EPCs, Owner’s Engineers, and Technical Advisors on execution and testing
* Modify and adapt base designs to project-specific needs
* Ensure smooth handoffs across Development, Engineering, and Construction teams


 We’re looking for you
   

  

 You’re probably a BESS or energy systems engineer with a strong technical background and a genuine interest in clean tech innovation. Whether you come from a project delivery or product development angle — or ideally both — you love solving problems, building systems, and working across departments.
   

  

**Must-haves**
* Bachelor's degree in Electrical Engineering or similar
* 4+ years in BESS or related energy sector roles
* Deep understanding of BESS technologies (especially LFP), system design, grid integration
* Experience with SCADA, QA/QC, and CAD tools
* Comfortable communicating across suppliers, contractors, and internal teams
* Fluent in English (C1 Level)


**Nice-to-haves**
* Experience in the Nordic market
* Familiarity with ancillary services (FCR, aFRR, etc.)
* Nordic language skills (Swedish, Finnish)


**What's In It For You**
 You’ll join a diverse, mission-driven team in a flat, transparent, and coaching culture. With full flexibility and lots of autonomy, we make sure you have the tools, time, and support to thrive. Our culture rewards curiosity, ambition, and collaboration.
   

  

**Other Things We Want You To Know**
* At Alight, we know the benefits that follow a diverse team, hence we’re looking broadly for talent!
* Our largest hubs are in Stockholm and Madrid, but our staff is spread across Europe, and our hybrid ways of working provide everyone with a fully flexible work setup
* We have a fun office vibe with regular team dinners, breakfasts and AWs, and sports activities. For example, we have a session with a running coach every Tuesday, and other ad hoc sports activities organized by employees, always paid for by the company
* Quarterly company events where we gather our remote team for a few days. This always includes some fun activities such as sailing, skiing etc.
* Flexible working hours and full flexibility to decide when to work remotely/at the office


 Sounds like a fit?
   

  

 Apply today!
   

  

 Department Engineering Remote status Fully Remote
   

  

 Contact Marcela Ramirez Talent Acquisition Manager – People Operations
   

  

 What's in it for you?
   

  

* At Alight, you’ll make a real, tangible impact on a global scale by accelerating the transition to a fossil fuel-free world. Your work will be more than a job; it will be a meaningful contribution to ensuring the sustainability of our planet.
* We’re proud to have a flat and autonomous organizational culture where everyone takes accountability for their own work. You'll have the flexibility to work remotely from anywhere in Europe, or you can decide to work hybrid/fully onsite at one of our offices in Stockholm, Madrid, Gothenburg, Paris or Malmö. We’ll support your home office setup, including subsidies for equipment like adjustable desks and office chairs.
* To ensure we attract the best talent out there, we don't limit ourselves to a specific location. Alighters are based across Europe and our diverse backgrounds and skills complement each other well.


 We know that having a diverse team drives better collective decisions and superior business performance. Today our gender split is 44/56, with 15 nationalities and employees in 6 countries.
   

  

* At Alight, you’ll be a part of an entrepreneurial culture in which you’re encouraged to “think like an owner,” which means that we trust you to call the shots and excel in your role. Many Alighters are also shareholders, and we believe in giving our employees incentives to create the best possible impact.


 Historically we’ve regularly had warrant/option programs that give our employees the option to own a part of Alight. We also give our employees the option to buy shares when the opportunity arises (e.g. when any of our owners sells shares, we're not a listed company).
   

  

* As an Alighter, you’ll have 30 days of paid vacation and the option to exchange public holiday days for other days off. We also offer market-leading insurance programs for all our employees, together with an annual wellness allowance of €500 (5000 SEK).


 At our HQ in Stockholm, we also have weekly activities like lunch runs and Thursday yoga sessions.
   

  

* While we take our role in driving the green transition seriously, we know how to have fun. We believe that a positive team spirit enhances our collective impact. Some examples of planned activities are Friday breakfast every second week, Guest lecturers with dinner, team dinners, and sports activities. But there are also a lot of spontaneous activities driven by our employees!


 Each quarter we also have "Alight Next," our company-wide meetup, a two-day strategy day with workshops, lectures, and team building in which we focus on the next quarter. We also always have some fun activities planned during those meetup days, examples being ski trips, sailing, dinners, and parties
   

  

* We’re committed to helping you grow and embrace new areas of responsibility, whether vertically or horizontally.


 It’s common for our team members to be promoted to leadership roles or transition into entirely new domains. We have structured career coaching, internal training programs, performance reviews, and goal-setting frameworks to help you develop your career.
   

  

**About Alight**
 At Alight, we’re on a mission to kick carbon off the grid by helping energy-intensive businesses switch to solar. We develop, own, and operate onsite and offsite solar projects across Europe and sell clean energy to businesses at a low, fixed cost backed by a power purchase agreement (PPA), always independent of government funding or subsidies. By 2030, we aim to have an installed capacity of at least 5 GW, paving the way for a more sustainable future.
   

  

 Join us fully remote or from our offices!
   

  

 Founded in 2013
   

  

 Co-workers 80
   

  

 Engineering
   

  

* Stockholm
* Fully Remote


 BESS Engineer
   

  

 Already working at Alight?
   

  

 Let’s recruit together and find your next colleague.

title: IT-tjänsteansvarig
description:
**Vill du ha en central roll i att ansvara för IT-tjänsterna till en av Sveriges viktigaste digitala plattformar?** 




  





**minPension är Sveriges oberoende pensionstjänst – ett samarbete mellan staten och pensionsbolagen och används av över fem miljoner individer årligen. Som tjänsteansvarig säkerställer du att minPensions IT-tjänster levereras med hög kvalitet och kostnadseffektivitet, samtidigt som du bygger långsiktig kapacitet för en trygg och effektiv IT-leverans.** 




  





**Om rollen** 




 MinPension befinner sig i en spännande utvecklingsfas – och du har chansen att vara med och göra verklig skillnad. Nu tar de nästa steg mot framtidens plattformar för pensionsinformation: mer individanpassade, lättillgängliga och sömlöst integrerade i det digitala ekosystemet. Med över 48 miljoner prognoser per år är tjänsten en viktig del av Sveriges digitala samhällsinfrastruktur.
 



  





 Det här är en ny och strategiskt viktig roll där du får vara med från start och sätta strukturen för hur man på minPension styr sina IT-tjänster. Som tjänsteansvarig får du helhetsansvar för att de digitala tjänsterna levereras med rätt funktion, kvalitet och kostnad – i linje med både verksamhetsmål och regulatoriska krav. Du blir en nyckelspelare i ett samhällsviktigt uppdrag, där du driver samverkan mellan verksamhet, teknik och leverantörer för att skapa hållbara och effektiva IT-lösningar.
 



  





 Hos minPension är beslutsvägarna är korta och du blir en del av ett engagerat, mindre team i en verksamhet med stor passion för uppdraget. Du har ett stort mandat inom ditt område och erbjuds alla möjligheter till att initiera, utmana, utveckla och själv utvecklas.
 



  





**Huvudsakliga arbetsuppgifter** 



* Ha helhetsansvar för IT-tjänsternas funktion, SLA, kostnad och livscykel
* Koordinera leverantörsstyrning och följa upp SLA, licenser och avtal
* Etablera och förbättra ITSM-processer tillsammans med drift, utveckling och säkerhet
* Driva förbättringsarbete, roadmap och prioritering i samverkan med verksamheten
* Följa upp nyckeltal, kostnader och risker – samt bidra till planering och budget
* Stödja upphandling, onboarding och kravställning av leverantörer
* Säkerställa efterlevnad av regulatoriska krav och bidra i revisionsarbete
* Dokumentera tjänsteinformation, processer och beroenden



  





 Tjänsten utgår ifrån minPensions kontor i Stockholm med möjlighet att arbeta del av tiden på distans.
 



  





**Är det här du?** 




 Du är både strategisk och operativ – en initiativtagande do:er som skapar struktur och driver förbättringar. Du trivs i gränsytan mellan teknik, verksamhet och leverantörer, och har lätt för att förklara komplexa frågor på ett tydligt och anpassat sätt.
 



  





 Du bygger goda samarbeten och bidrar till en kultur där man lyckas tillsammans – något som är extra viktigt i en liten och samarbetsorienterad organisation som minPension.
 



  





**Du har:** 



* Gedigen erfarenhet av tjänste- och leverantörsstyrning i komplexa eller reglerade IT-miljöer, gärna i mindre eller hybridorganisationer
* God förståelse för ITSM-processer, SLA, licenshantering och kostnadsuppföljning
* Praktisk erfarenhet av att driva förändringsarbete, förbättringar och releaseplanering kopplat till IT-tjänster
* Förmåga att strukturera och dokumentera tjänsteportföljer, processer och teknisk information
* Vana att kommunicera tydligt och anpassat med både tekniska och icke-tekniska intressenter
* Erfarenhet av att kravställa och följa upp avtal, leverantörsrelationer och budget
* God förståelse för hur teknik, verksamhet, säkerhet och ekonomi samverkar i en IT-tjänsteleverans



  





**Meriterande:** 
 Erfarenhet från finans-, försäkrings- eller pensionssektor med fokus på reglerade miljöer. Kunskap om och arbete med ramverk som DORA, ISO 27001 eller NIS2.
 



  





**Intresserad av att ansöka eller få veta mer?** 




 I denna rekrytering samarbetar minPension med IDG Recruitment.
 



 Vid intresse eller frågor är du varmt välkommen att kontakta Britta Liljegren, Rekryteringskonsult på 070-771 18 11, britta.liljegren@foundryco.com eller Alexandra Tihinen, Rekryteringskonsult på 070-447 92 24, alexandra.tihinen@foundryco.com.
 



  





 För att ansöka, vänligen skicka in ditt CV eller ansök med Linkedin.
 



  





**Om minPension** 




*På minPension får alla som har jobbat i Sverige bättre koll på sina pensioner, oavsett kunnighet och ålder. Sedan starten 2004 har närmare 5 miljoner användare registrerat sig till tjänsten. minPension är ett samarbete mellan staten och pensionsbolagen och är ett icke-vinstdrivande bolag. Varje dag arbetar vi för att skapa oberoende och tillförlitlig pensionsinformation som är enkel och begriplig för alla. På minPension är arbetstempot högt och beroendena många. Projekten går parallellt och kräver ofta kreativitet och lösningar utanför boxen. Veckorna flyger fram och sällan är den ena dagen lik den andra.* 




  





*minPension är ett helägt dotterbolag till Svensk Försäkring, som är försäkringsföretagens branschorganisation.* 




  





*Läs gärna mer på* 
***minPension.se***

title: IT-driftansvarig
description:
**Var med och säkra driften av kritiska IT-tjänster som gör pensionsinformation tillgänglig och trygg för över fem miljoner användare årligen.** 




  





**minPension är Sveriges oberoende pensionstjänst – ett samarbete mellan staten och pensionsbolagen. Som IT-driftansvarig har du en central roll i att upprätthålla en stabil, säker och effektiv driftmiljö som stödjer både dagens och framtidens tjänster.** 




  





**Om rollen** 




 MinPension befinner sig i en spännande utvecklingsfas – och du har chansen att vara med och göra verklig skillnad. Nu tar de nästa steg mot framtidens plattformar för pensionsinformation: mer individanpassade, lättillgängliga och sömlöst integrerade i det digitala ekosystemet. Med över 48 miljoner prognoser per år är tjänsten en viktig del av Sveriges digitala samhällsinfrastruktur.
 



  





 Som IT-driftansvarig hos minPension tar du ansvar för att säkerställa en stabil och säker driftmiljö för deras IT-tjänster. Rollen innebär ett nära samarbete med externa leverantörer och interna team för att effektivt hantera incidenter, förändringar och löpande driftsleveranser. Du arbetar både operativt och strategiskt för att förbättra driftsprocesser och har en viktig roll i att bidra till organisationens övergripande IT-strategi.
 



  





 Hos minPension är beslutsvägarna är korta och du blir en del av ett engagerat, mindre team i en verksamhet med stor passion för uppdraget. Du har ett stort mandat inom ditt område och erbjuds alla möjligheter till att initiera, utmana, utveckla och själv utvecklas.
 



  





**Huvudsakliga arbetsuppgifter:** 



* Säkerställa en robust och säker driftmiljö för minPensions IT-tjänster med fokus på tillgänglighet och kontinuitet
* Leda och samordna incidenthantering enligt etablerade ITIL-processer
* Driva förändringsprocessen (CAB) med riskbedömning, prioritering och godkännande
* Planera och koordinera tekniska releaser tillsammans med utveckling, verksamhet och leverantörer
* Följa upp driftavvikelser, SLA och säkerhetshändelser samt initiera förbättringsåtgärder
* Etablera och underhålla kontinuitets- och återställningsplaner (DRP) inklusive test och dokumentation
* Vara brygga mellan teknik, säkerhet och verksamhet för att skapa samstämmighet och effektivitet
* Rapportera och dokumentera från operativa forum och driftmöten
* Bidra till riskhantering och internkontroll inom IT-driftområdet



  





 Tjänsten utgår ifrån minPensions kontor i Stockholm med möjlighet att arbeta del av tiden på distans.
 



  





**Är det här du?** 




 För att vara framgångsrik i rollen är du både strategisk och operativ, en handlingskraftig do:er som snabbt sätter dig in i tekniska detaljer. Du tar ansvar, skapar struktur och trivs i en komplex miljö. Du har förmåga att bygga goda samarbeten och bidra till ett klimat där man lyckas tillsammans, vilket är särskilt viktigt i en liten och samarbetsorienterad organisation som minPension.
 



  





 Du kommunicerar tydligt och skapar förtroende mellan teknik, verksamhet och leverantörer.
 



  





**Du har:** 



* Gedigen erfarenhet av driftledning i outsourcade eller leverantörsstyrda miljöer
* Praktisk kunskap om ITIL-processer (incident-, change-, problemhantering)
* God teknisk förståelse för infrastruktur, applikationsdrift och säkerhet, gärna från mindre IT-organisationer
* Erfarenhet av att leda CAB-möten och koordinera tekniska releaser
* Förmåga att samordna mellan teknik, säkerhet och verksamhet
* Van att dokumentera och driva förbättringsarbete



**Meriterande:** 



* Erfarenhet av att införa ITSM-processer i mindre organisationer
* Kunskap om regulatoriska krav som ISO 27001, NIS2 eller erfarenhet från reglerad verksamhet



  





**Intresserad av att ansöka eller få veta mer?** 




 I denna rekrytering samarbetar minPension med IDG Recruitment.
 



 Vid intresse eller frågor är du varmt välkommen att kontakta Britta Liljegren, Rekryteringskonsult på 070-771 18 11, britta.liljegren@foundryco.com eller Alexandra Tihinen, Rekryteringskonsult på 070-447 92 24, alexandra.tihinen@foundryco.com.
 



  





 För att ansöka, vänligen skicka in ditt CV eller ansök med Linkedin.
 



  





**Om minPension** 




*På minPension får alla som har jobbat i Sverige bättre koll på sina pensioner, oavsett kunnighet och ålder. Sedan starten 2004 har närmare 5 miljoner användare registrerat sig till tjänsten. minPension är ett samarbete mellan staten och pensionsbolagen och är ett icke-vinstdrivande bolag. Varje dag arbetar vi för att skapa oberoende och tillförlitlig pensionsinformation som är enkel och begriplig för alla. På minPension är arbetstempot högt och beroendena många. Projekten går parallellt och kräver ofta kreativitet och lösningar utanför boxen. Veckorna flyger fram och sällan är den ena dagen lik den andra.*
