title: Senior Mobile Engineer
description:
**Job Description**
**WHAT YOU WILL DO:**
 As a Senior Software Engineer - Mobile in the organization you will be in the center of the action where both design and product meet business. You will be working closely with Product Managers, Engineering Managers, all product teams, iOS and Android community. You should have a strong technical background, a passion for developing SDKs, mobile application development, and a drive to deliver bug-free developer and user experiences as per the business requirement without compromising on the industry best coding practices. We are looking for highly skilled and experienced for the role of Senior Software Engineer - Mobile to lead the development team of our internal tools. As an Mobile Developer, you will be responsible for designing and delivering robust and scalable solutions. You will also provide technical leadership, mentorship, and guidance to junior members in the iOS and Android community.
   

  

**Team Description**
 The Experimentation and Visual Analytics team is dedicated to the creation of advanced internal tools designed for analyzing various test variations and interpreting data effectively. This team plays a pivotal role in collaborating with all product teams across H&M, ensuring that they develop and implement the most optimized solutions for launching new features. By leveraging data-driven insights, they aim to enhance the overall efficiency and effectiveness of feature releases, ultimately contributing to H&M’s commitment to innovation and excellence in customer experience.
   

  

**You will:**
* Lead the end-to-end development of complex native and multiplatform solutions, from concept to development including testing, distribution and writing documentation.
* Drive technical decision-making, provide architectural guidance, and ensure the implementation of best practices.
* Collaborate closely with iOS and Android community, cross-functional teams, including product managers, designers, and backend developers, to define requirements and translate them into technical specifications.
* Develop scalable and maintainable libraries, ensuring adherence to coding best practices, design patterns, and architectural guidelines.
* Provide technical guidance and mentor junior iOS and Android developers, reviewing their PRs and providing constructive feedback.
* Perform thorough code reviews to ensure code quality, performance, and adherence to established coding standards.
* Ensure the performance, quality, and responsiveness of UI components and iOS/Android applications through thorough testing, debugging, and optimization. Troubleshoot and resolve complex technical issues and performance bottlenecks.
* Collaborate with other teams to understand and guide developers.
* Define test plans and ensure comprehensive test coverage.
* Drive innovation by researching and implementing cutting-edge technologies.
* Stay up to date with the latest trends and advancements in mobile development, evaluate new tools and frameworks, and promote their adoption when appropriate. Also, share knowledge and best practices with the iOS and Android community.
* Participate in architectural discussions, providing insights and proposing solutions to enhance system architecture and overall product quality.
* Contribute to the continuous improvement of development processes and workflows.
* Participate in Agile/Scrum development processes, contribute to sprint planning, and provide accurate estimations for project timelines.
* Collaborate with Security and Compliance teams to ensure that mobile solutions adhere to internal policies and industry regulations.
* Contribute to CI/CD pipelines and automation strategies to improve development workflows and reduce manual efforts.


**Who You Are**
*We are looking for people with..*
* 6+ years of experience in mobile development (Android and/or iOS).
* Hands-on experience with Kotlin Multiplatform (KMP) for shared codebases
* Strong proficiency in Kotlin for Android and Multiplatform module development.
* Proficiency in Swift, Objective-C and Kotlin for iOS and Android application and SDK integration.
* Familiarity with Jetpack Compose and SwiftUI.
* Experience in building and publishing mobile SDKs/libraries for internal or external use.
* Deep understanding of platform-specific architecture and constraints (Android/iOS).
* Experience with unit testing, integration testing, and UI testing in both platforms.
* Familiarity with KMP testing strategies including using expect/actual declarations.
* Comfortable with debugging native iOS and Android issues within shared and platform-specific code.
* Experience with modular architecture, clean code principles, and design patterns like MVVM.
* Strong understanding of dependency injection, coroutines/flows, and asynchronous programming.
* Ability to collaborate closely with cross-functional teams (iOS, Android, backend, product).
* Comfortable contributing to API design, versioning, and developer experience for SDKs.
* Familiarity with tools such as GitHub Actions for CI/CD in mobile projects.
* Experience working in Agile/Scrum team, actively participating in ceremonies and contributing to continuous delivery
* Proven experience in leading cross-platform mobile teams or initiatives, especially in contexts involving KMP or shared codebases. Experience with mobile analytics tools (e.g., Firebase or similar) and feature flagging/experimentation frameworks.


**Additional Information**
**WHO WE ARE**
 H&M Group is a global company of strong fashion brands and ventures. Our goal is to prove that there is no compromise between exceptional design, affordable prices, and sustainable solutions. We want to liberate fashion for the many, and our customers are at the heart of every decision we make.
   

  

 We are made up of thousands of passionate and talented colleagues united by our shared culture and values. Together, we want to use our power, our scale, and our knowledge to push the fashion industry towards a more inclusive and sustainable future. Read more about us here
   

  

**WHY YOU’LL LOVE WORKING HERE**
 At H&M Group, we are proud to be a vibrant and welcoming company. We offer our employees attractive benefits with extensive development opportunities around the globe.
   

  

 All our employees receive a staff discount card, usable on all our H&M Group brands in stores and online. Brands covered by the discount are H&M (Beauty and Move included), COS, Weekday, Monki, H&M HOME, & Other Stories, ARKET. In addition to our staff discount, all our employees are included in our H&M Incentive Program – HIP. You can read more about our H&M Incentive Program here.
   

  

**JOIN US**
 Our uniqueness comes from a combination of many things – our inclusive and collaborative culture, our strong values, and opportunities for growth. But most of all, it’s our people who make us who we are.
   

  

**Take the next step in your career together with us. The journey starts here.**

title: Financial Controller
description:
**About Us**
 Welcome to
 ***Netigate***
 , a dynamic platform at the forefront of revolutionizing employee and customer engagement. Our mission is to provide organizations with the insights they need to foster meaningful interactions and achieve outstanding outcomes. Through our innovative interface and advanced analytics, we enable companies to comprehend and act on feedback from both their workforce and customers. Join our dedicated team and help transform business connections and growth in today's digital age. Together, we will unlock the full potential of organisational engagement and customer success.
   

  

**Your Role at a Glance**
 We are looking for a curious and analytical Financial Controller who thrives on turning numbers into meaningful insights. In this role, you’ll play a key part in driving business performance through data-driven analysis, clear communication, and actionable recommendations. Reporting to the Head of Financial Reporting and Accounting, your primary focus will be on cost control, budgeting, and financial analysis.
   

  

 You will collaborate closely with budget owners across the organization, helping them make smarter, insight-led decisions. You value data quality, automation, and setting clear KPI targets, and you're always looking for ways to enhance financial reporting and forecasting processes.
   

  

 This is a role with room to grow – over time, you’ll have the opportunity to deepen your expertise in business controlling or broaden your responsibilities, depending on your interests and the evolving needs of the company.
   

  

**Your Key Responsibilities**
* Lead budgeting and forecasting
* Analyze variances and track budget performance
* Partner with teams to support financial decisions
* Develop and maintain insightful financial reports using BI tools
* Help set targets and align actions with strategic goals


**Your Profile**
* Minimum 2 years of experience in financial controlling or a similar finance role
* Strong analytical skills with solid understanding of financial statements, KPIs, and accounting principles
* Comfortable working across both strategic and operational levels
* Proficient in Excel and familiar with modern BI tools
* Fluent in English and Swedish, in both written and verbal communication
* Hands-on, structured, and solution-oriented approach
* Positive energy, creative mindset, and a collaborative attitude
* Experience in a SaaS or subscription-based business is a plus


**What You Can Expect**
* An inclusive and supportive work environment where diversity and creativity are celebrated.
* An environment where your ideas are valued, and you have the opportunity to make a meaningful contribution from the start.
* Opportunities for professional growth and career advancement within an international growing company.
* No matter your role, whether you're just starting out or in a leadership position, we focus on the value you bring to the table. Creativity and impact are what matter most.
* We believe in celebrating our achievements. Wether it's a summer festival or New Year party: we make sure to enjoy our successes and build strong team connections.


 Our Culture
   

  

 At Netigate, we pride ourselves on our collaborative, imaginative, and learning-focused culture. We believe in the collective strength of diverse perspectives - the "power of WE." We cultivate an atmosphere where fresh ideas are shared, challenges are embraced, and individual growth is encouraged.
   

  

**We encourage all applicants to consider submitting an anonymous CV as part of our commitment to fostering a non-discriminatory and inclusive recruitment process. In line with this, we aim to ensure transparency around compensation and will share indicative salary ranges during the initial conversation.**

title: Automationsspecialist AD
description:
Har du gedigen erfarenhet av Active Directory och vill bidra till en säker och effektiv IT-miljö i en teknikintensiv och säkerhetsmedveten organisation? Nu söker vi på
 **Akkodis** 
 en Automationstekniker AD för ett längre Konsultuppdrag inom infrastruktur och säker access
 



  





**Om uppdraget** 




 I rollen som Automationstekniker AD kommer du att tillhöra ett erfaret team inom access- och identitetshantering (IAM). Du arbetar med drift, automation, härdning och utveckling av AD-infrastrukturen med fokus på säkerhet, effektivitet och tillförlitlighet.
 



  





 Uppdraget omfattar arbete i en säkerhetsklassad miljö, vilket innebär att du behöver vara svensk medborgare och kunna genomgå säkerhetsprövning. Arbetet sker både självständigt och i nära samarbete med andra specialister inom infrastruktur och säkerhet.
 



  





**Dina arbetsuppgifter** 



* Drift och underhåll av Active Directory med hjälp av automation
* Uppsättning och härdning av AD-miljöer
* Delegering och hantering av behörigheter
* Felsökning och incidenthantering i komplexa IT-miljöer
* Drift av relaterad infrastruktur
* Övervakning, patchning och säkerställande av stabil drift
* Bidra med teknisk expertis inom access- och IAM-frågor
* Förbättra dokumentation och effektivisera processer



  





**Kvalifikationer** 




 Vi söker dig som:
 


* Har flerårig erfarenhet av avancerad administration i Active Directory
* Har gedigen kunskap inom IAM (Identity & Access Management)
* Har goda färdigheter i PowerShell eller annat liknande scriptspråk
* Är självgående, samarbetsvillig och lösningsorienterad
* Behärskar svenska och engelska flytande i tal och skrift



  





 Meriterande kompetenser
 


* Erfarenhet av ADFS och Keycloak
* Vana att arbeta med Microsoft Defender-sviten och loggverktyg
* Kännedom om Azure Landing Zone
* Kunskaper i Terraform, Python och Ansible
* Erfarenhet av GitOps och Infrastructure as Code (IaC)



  





 kompetensmatris beaktas
 



  





**Om Akkodis** 




**Akkodis** 
 är en global aktör inom teknologi- och ingenjörstjänster, med uppdrag att förena människor och teknik för att skapa hållbara lösningar. Genom vårt nätverk av experter levererar vi spetskompetens inom IT, teknik och digital transformation. Som konsult hos oss får du arbeta med ledande kunder, kontinuerligt utvecklas och vara en del av framtidens tekniklösningar.
 



  





**Övrig information** 



* **Placeringsort:** 
 Linköping, Järfälla, Göteborg eller Karlskoga (Möjlighet till annan ort, tas under intervju)
* **Tillträde:** 
 Enligt överenskommelse
* **Omfattning:** 
 Heltid, långt konsultuppdrag
* **Säkerhetsklassning:** 
 Godkänd säkerhetsprövning krävs (svenskt medborgarskap)



  





 Ansökan
 



 Vi går igenom ansökningar löpande (Löpande urval tillämpas). Skicka in din ansökan redan idag för att öka dina chanser till detta spännande och säkerhetsklassade uppdrag. Välkommen till Akkodis

title: Incident manager
description:
**Att jobba som incident manager**
 I rollen kommer du tillsammans med teamet att leda incidenthanteringen och ha befogenhet att snabbt kalla in resurser, fatta beslut om go/no go vid akuta förändringar samt stoppa planerade releaser vid behov för att säkerställa en stabil drift och minimera risker. Vid incidenter med hög prioritet ansvarar du för kommunikation, information och ledning av arbetet för Skandias räkning. Tjänsten innebär beredskap dygnet runt vilket gör att du behöver kunna vara på fysiskt på plats vid behov. Därav ser vi att du idag bor i Stockholmsregionen.
   

  

 Du blir en nyckelperson i vårt arbete för att skapa långsiktig kvalitet och driftstabilitet på Skandia. Ditt fokus är att ständigt utveckla och säkerställa effektiva processer och arbetssätt, med målet att vi alltid ska kunna återställa en stabil IT-drift så snabbt och säkert som möjligt.
   

  

 Du kommer att tillhöra vårt Incident managers & problem team som idag består av fem Incident Managers. Alla utgår från vårt huvudkontoret på Kungsholmen. Här får du kollegor som tror på samarbete, öppenhet och ett gemensamt driv för att alltid leverera bästa möjliga resultat. Tillsammans samarbetar vi nära med andra interna team särskilt inom process & leveransstöds området och främst med vårt release & change team samt ServiceNow team.
   

  

 Vi arbetar hybrid vilket innebär arbete på kontoret varvat med distansarbete. I rollen kommer du att rapportera till gruppchef för IT process & leveransstöd.
   

  

**För att lyckas i rollen**
 Som person tror vi att du är stresstålig, har god kommunikativ förmåga och kan anpassa din dialog till olika intressenter inom organisationen. Du kan leda andra i deras arbete, informera och utbilda andra medarbetare på Skandia inom incidenthantering. Likaså bygger du starka relationer med både kollegor och stakeholders internt.
   

  

 För att lyckas i rollen har du erfarenhet av att arbeta som Incident manager i komplexa IT miljöer med flertalet team samt leverantörer. Du har en god förståelse gällande ITIL processerna, specifikt Incident, Problem samt Change och förstår hur man behöver arbeta med dessa för att säkerställa god kvalitet och driftstabilitet. Ett grundkrav är att du kan flytande svenska och engelska både i tal och skrift. Vi ser det som nödvändigt att du även bor i Stockholmsregionen miximalt 2 timmar från vårt kontor på Lindhagensgatan.
   

  

 Meriterande för rollen är erfarenhet av ärendehanteringssystem som exempelvis ServiceNow och arbetar med ITIL processer i en agil kontext.
   

  

**Vad händer nu?**
 Vi jobbar med löpande urval så tveka inte att skicka in din ansökan redan idag. I ansökan kommer vi att ställa ett antal urvalsfrågor som ligger till grund för första urvalet. För att göra rekryteringsprocessen så rättvis och objektiv som möjligt kommer det att ingå intervjuer, tester, bakgrundskontroll samt digital referenstagning.
   

  

 Om du har frågor kring rollen, vänligen kontakta rekryterande chef Monica Eriksson på monica.eriksson@skandia.se.
   

  

 Om du har frågor kopplat till rekryteringsprocessen ta kontakt med Talent Acquisition Partner Harald Brehmer på harald.brehmer@skandia.se.
   

  

 Vi kommer att återkoppla till alla som söker oavsett om du går vidare eller inte.
   

  

*Vi tar nu en kort paus för sommarledighet. Urvalet påbörjas i augusti och vi kontaktar dig så snart vi är tillbaka.*
 Vi ser fram emot din ansökan!
   

  

**Mer om IT**
 Vi på Skandia IT är stolta över att vara en kundorienterad enhet som levererar effektiva och säkra lösningar för våra kunder. Med cirka 600 engagerade medarbetare är vi mitt i en spännande transformationsresa, där vi utvecklas tillsammans och har kul på vägen. Framåt tillsammans är vårt motto!
   

  

 Vi arbetar agilt och har sedan 2017 använt oss av SAFe (Scaled Agile Framework) ramverket, där leverans och kundvärde alltid står i centrum. Våra tågledningar och team, jobbar verksamhetsbaserat med aktiviteter som sprintplanering, daily stand-ups, team-synk, code reviews och retrospektiv.
   

  

 Var 12:e vecka samlas vi alla i vår ljusa och inspirerande Ljusgård på kontoret i Stockholm för 2 planeringsdagar. Planeringsperioden består av 6 tvåveckorssprintar, där den sista sprinten är en innovationssprint. Här får du chansen att, själv eller tillsammans med ditt team, utveckla och förfina våra system.

title: Sales Director
company_industry: IT Services and IT Consulting, Business Consulting and Services, and Outsourcing and Offshoring Consulting
description:
**Job Opportunity: Director, Consult Partner – Application Services (Stockholm)** 




**Location:** 
 Sweden
 



**Job Type:** 
 Full-Time
 



**Industry:** 
 IT Consulting / Digital Transformation
 



  





**About the Role** 




  





 An exciting opportunity has emerged for a Director-level Consult Partner to lead high-impact transformation initiatives within a fast-growing consulting business. This is a strategic leadership role that blends technology expertise with business acumen, aimed at delivering complex, cross-functional solutions across large enterprise clients.
 



  





 As a Consult Partner, you will be instrumental in driving profitable growth, developing CXO-level relationships, and delivering value through innovative application services and digital strategies. You will lead multi-disciplinary teams, work directly with executive stakeholders, and influence business-critical outcomes at scale.
 



  





**Key Responsibilities** 




  





**Business Growth & Commercial Strategy** 



* Drive significant revenue outcomes through consulting signings and pipeline conversion
* Manage profitability, margins, and backlog for sustainable financial success
* Lead scoping, pricing, and commercial negotiations on large-scale engagements



  





**Client Engagement & Relationship Management** 



* Establish trusted advisor status with CXO-level executives
* Lead client interactions across the full consulting lifecycle
* Deliver high-quality, tailored consulting solutions in fast-paced environments



  





**Delivery Excellence & Operations** 



* Achieve utilization targets while maintaining delivery excellence
* Design, oversee, and assure the success of complex consulting projects
* Ensure client satisfaction and continuous performance improvement



  





**Leadership & People Development** 



* Inspire and develop high-performing consulting teams
* Foster a culture of curiosity, innovation, and collaboration
* Champion personal and professional growth across the organization



  





**Strategic Contribution** 



* Shape strategic transformation initiatives with deep industry and technology insight
* Drive thought leadership and build a recognized presence in the consulting space
* Support innovation and strategic alignment with broader business goals



  





**Ideal Candidate Profile** 



* Extensive experience in IT consulting, with a focus on application services
* Proven ability to engage and influence CXO-level stakeholders
* Demonstrated success in pre-sales, commercial negotiations, and project delivery
* Strong financial acumen, including revenue growth and margin management
* Deep understanding of industry and technology trends
* Track record of innovation, leadership, and transformation delivery
* Excellent interpersonal skills and presence in both client and internal settings



  





**What’s on Offer** 



* Opportunity to work with leading enterprise clients on transformative projects
* Access to world-class learning programs and industry certifications
* A culture of flexibility, diversity, and continuous development
* Meaningful work with purpose-driven outcomes in a collaborative environment
* Strong support for career progression and thought leadership

title: Commercial Enablement/Ops Manager
description:
**About Impulso** 




 Impulso is revolutionizing how fashion and lifestyle brands access and share sell-through and stock data across retail partners. By sharing real-time sales and inventory data, we help brands, agencies and suppliers increase sell-through, optimize operations to create a more sustainable retail landscape.
 



  
 



 We recently closed a €6M seed round led by 42Cap, with backing from Spintop Ventures and One S. With a growing number of global retailers and brands onboard, we are building the infrastructure for real-time retail visibility and collaboration.
 



 We are a Stockholm-based team of 8, combining startup energy with deep industry expertise.
 



 Now, we're hiring a Commercial / Revenue Enablement Manager to help us scale sales operations, processes, and tooling — and to lay the foundation for a future high-performing revenue team.
 








**The Role** 




 We’re looking for someone to build and own our commercial and revenue enablement function from the ground up. You’ll work closely with the CEO (focused on enterprise sales) and COO (driving internal execution) to:
 



 - Improve sales productivity
 



 - Ensure repeatable, scalable processes
 



 - Implement RevOps tooling
 



 - Support onboarding and coaching
 



 - Prepare us for international growth
 



 This is a great opportunity for someone who has hands-on experience in RevOps or Sales Enablement at a SaaS company and is ready to take the next step toward leadership as the company scales.
 








**What You Will Do** 




 Sales & GTM Enablement
 



 - Develop and manage the onboarding process for new sales and customer success hires
 



 - Create and maintain sales playbooks, training material, pitch decks, templates and tools
 



 - Support the CEO in key enterprise sales cycles with collateral and insights
 



  





 Revenue Operations
 



 - Own our CRM (Pipedrive) and ensure it's structured for reporting, forecasting, and pipeline management
 



 - Define and track key metrics across the funnel (top-of-funnel through expansion)
 



 - Identify bottlenecks and implement tooling or process improvements
 



  





 Cross-Functional Execution
 



 - Partner with Marketing to ensure campaign and messaging alignment
 



 - Collaborate with Product to feed insights from sales into roadmap discussions
 



 - Work with Customer Success to support expansion and upsell efforts
 








**What We are Looking For** 




 - 2–5 years of experience in Sales Enablement, Revenue Operations, or Commercial Enablement at a B2B SaaS
 



 company
 



 - Excellent understanding of SaaS sales cycles (especially enterprise and mid-market)
 



 - Experience managing or implementing CRM and sales enablement tools (Pipedrive, Showpad, etc.)
 



 - Familiarity and proficiency with the MEDDPICC sales methodology
 



 - Strong project management and cross-functional communication skills
 



 - Proactive, hands-on and comfortable working in an early-stage environment
 



 - Fluent in English (Swedish not required, but Stockholm-based is a must)
 








**What You Will Get** 




 - A front-row seat at one of Europe’s most promising retail data infrastructure startups
 



 - A key role in shaping how we scale our GTM operations
 



 - Equity package and competitive salary
 



 - Collaborative, mission-driven culture with high ownership and transparency
 



 - Office in central Stockholm
 



  





 Apply now if you’re ready to help us build a revenue engine from the ground up — and grow into a leadership role as we scale across Europe.

title: Tink - Engineering Manager - Customer Experience
description:
Visa is a world leader in payments and technology, with over 259 billion payments transactions flowing safely between consumers, merchants, financial institutions, and government entities in more than 200 countries and territories each year. Our mission is to connect the world through the most innovative, convenient, reliable, and secure payments network, enabling individuals, businesses, and economies to thrive while driven by a common purpose – to uplift everyone, everywhere by being the best way to pay and be paid.
   

  





 Make an impact with a purpose-driven industry leader. Join us today and experience Life at Visa.
   

  

  

  




**Job Description**

  

  





**Visa’s Technology Organization** 
 is a community of problem solvers and innovators reshaping the future of commerce. We operate the world’s most sophisticated processing networks capable of handling more than 65k secure transactions a second across 80M merchants, 15k Financial Institutions, and billions of everyday people. While working with us you’ll get to work on complex distributed systems and solve massive scale problems centered on new payment flows, business and data solutions, cyber security, and B2C platforms.
   

  





 We are seeking a Engineering Manager to Tink - delivering open banking solutions as a part of Visa, to the Customer Experience team. The Customer Experience team has a clear mission: to deliver world-class product experiences to its customers. We provide powerful solutions to developers and their consumers. By solving the right problem, crafting a scalable solution, and providing great experiences, we make the platform easy to use, quick to onboard, and we ensure reliable outcomes for the end-user. That is why front-end development and UX design are core to us at Customer Experience. The Customer Experience area is unique with its set up of front-end and full-stack teams. With this, you will have the opportunity to not only develop the people and products we own but also how Tink as a whole work with frontend development and UX. We believe that there are a lot of things to be done and an opportunity for someone to grow within their role.
   

  





**What you will do:**




 Even though we have a broad mandate, there are some parts of the Tink experience we are especially passionate about. See more of the work we do and a few use cases here.
   

  





 We use React, TypeScript, Golang, MySQL, node.js and all our microservices run on Kubernetes in AWS. We regularly deploy to production and assure quality by automated tests and monitoring. The team is responsible for the availability of the services it owns, has SLOs/SLIs in place as well as an on-call rotation.
   

  





**Responsibilities**



* Drive technical development and provide leadership in an innovative and fast-paced environment


* Build high performing teams to support a cross-functional team composed of backend and frontend engineers


* Work closely with product manager and designers to ensure we're building products in the best way


* Enable the team to reach their targets by removing impediments, clarifying goals and initiatives, and fostering ownership and accountability


* Facilitate a culture of learning, trust, responsibility, and friendliness


* Be responsible for the overall planning, execution and deliver on agreed timelines


* Make sure the team has the talent it needs to succeed long-term by hiring great people



 We strongly believe in the power of collaboration, both within our team and in partnership with other teams and stakeholders. Working together is the cornerstone of building exceptional teams, delivering outstanding products, and fostering personal growth. It forms the very essence of our work culture and defines how we operate.
   

  





 This is a hybrid position. Expectation of days in office will be confirmed by your Hiring Manager.
   

  





  

  

  

  




**Qualifications**

 Basic Qualifications
   

  

 5+ years of relevant work experience and a Bachelors degree, OR 8+ years of relevant work experience
   

  

  

  

 Preferred Qualifications
   

  

 5+ years of relevant work experience with a Bachelor’s Degree or at least 2 years of work experience with an Advanced degree (e.g. Masters, MBA, JD, MD) or 0 years of work experience with a PhD, OR 8+ years of relevant work experience.
   

  

  

  

 We are looking for an Engineering Manager who has a business-oriented mindset, understands how projects and delivery influences business growth and sees the link between engineering and product development. Someone who is great at managing change and changing priorities.
   

  




* Experience from an Engineering Manager position, leading a cross-functional engineering team.
* Experience from frontend and backend engineering
* A track record of operational excellence and have led a change initiative, for example taking a project or team from A to B.
* Solid experience from working in an agile development environment, preferably from a fintech/payments industry.
* Strong organizational and prioritization skills along with outstanding written and verbal communication skills.
* We are looking for an Engineering Manager who has a business-oriented mindset, understands how projects and delivery influences business growth and sees the link between engineering and product development. Someone who is great at managing change and changing priorities.


**Additional Information**

 Visa is an EEO Employer. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability or protected veteran status. Visa will also consider for employment qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with EEOC guidelines and applicable local law.

title: IT Platform Owner - IFS Cloud
job_function: Product Management, Information Technology, and Engineering
description:
*At OX2, you work for a professional and ambitious company that is committed to accelerating access to renewable energy to speed up the transition to clean energy. We are multi-specialists to the core, offering a dynamic and inspiring workplace and enabling seamless, cross-functional collaboration to achieve optimal results.* 




  





**IT Product Owner – IFS Cloud** 




 OX2’s IT organization is hiring an IT Product Owner to lead the development and continuous improvement of our ERP system, IFS Cloud. You’ll play a key role in OX2’s digital transformation, supporting project execution, procurement, and financial processes.
 



  





 As part of the IT Business Solution Team, you will work close with other colleagues working with IFS Cloud Implementation. You will collaborate closely with process specialists, internal stakeholders, IT teams, and external IT partners. This position requires technical expertise, project management skills, and an understanding of business needs.
 



  





 OX2 is in a high-growth phase, transitioning to a hybrid IPP business model, which means you’ll work in a fast-paced environment with constant opportunities to implement new features with an extra focus on Asset Management, Service Management and Supply Chain.
 



  





**Main responsibilities** 



* Collaborate with stakeholders, process specialists, and IT teams to align IFS Cloud solutions with business goals.
* Drive initiatives that translate the business needs to technical solutions in IFS Cloud.
* Together with business process specialists, own the roadmap and backlog for IFS Cloud and related tools, ensuring clear deliverables for internal IT team and IT partners.
* Collaborate with other IT product owners to build cross-platform functionality as well as resolving cross-functional issues.
* Plan and oversee product releases, manage risks, and foster continuous improvements.
* Manage budgets for licenses and consultant services related to ERP system.
* Ensure systems comply with OX2’s IT security framework.
* Stay up to date with industry trends and advancements in IFS Cloud.



  





**Your qualifications and experience** 




 We are looking for a candidate who has genuine interest and experience in leading the development of IFS Cloud Solutions. A prerequisite for the job is that you have broad technical competence and project management / leadership skills.
 



  





**Must have:** 



* Relevant education in Computer Science, Information Technology, Business Engineering, or a related field
* Proven experience in roles such as Product Owner, Platform Lead, or System Maintenance Lead.
* Strong knowledge of IFS Cloud solutions (preferably any of the areas around Asset Management, Supply Chain and service management)
* Experience working in Agile/Hybrid development environments and familiar with IT management tools, such as JIRA
* Analytical mindset and problem-solving abilities
* Excellent communication skills in both Swedish and English.



  





 We attach great importance to personal qualities and are looking for you who have high ability to take initiatives, high driving capability and sense of responsibility for your own work. We believe you are service-minded, structured, and proactive with the ability to balance details and the bigger picture. You thrive in a collaborative, fast-paced environment and enjoy working across diverse teams.
 



  





 Experience within the following areas is valuable but not required:
 


* IT security frameworks.
* Large ERP implementations or digital transformation projects.
* Knowledge of IFS Cloud Financial processes
* Knowledge in OneStream budget and consolidation processes



  





**Why Join OX2** 



* An exciting IT career in renewables, taking part in "powering the great shift."
* A knowledgeable team of experts and an energetic, fun workplace located at the center of Stockholm.
* A great compensation and benefits package including for example: 5000 SEK per year in wellness allowance, 30 days paid vacation and a competitive pension plan.



  





**About OX2** 




 OX2 is a fully integrated provider of renewable energy solutions at scale. We are an international multi-technology company bringing together the brightest minds and most ambitious team players to address the defining challenge of our time: the shift from fossil fuels to clean energy, the greater shift to a sustainable society and economy. We accelerate the access to renewable energy. The company has around 500 employees and is headquartered in Stockholm, Sweden. For more information visit: www.ox2.com

title: Sales Executive UK
description:
**About Us**
 Welcome to
 ***Netigate***
 , a dynamic platform at the forefront of revolutionizing employee and customer engagement. Our mission is to provide organizations with the insights they need to foster meaningful interactions and achieve outstanding outcomes. Through our innovative interface and advanced analytics, we enable companies to comprehend and act on feedback from both their workforce and customers. Join our dedicated team and help transform business connections and growth in today's digital age. Together, we will unlock the full potential of organisational engagement and customer success.
   

  

**Your Role at a Glance**
 This role is a pure new business sales position — ideal for a true hunter who thrives on building something from the ground up. As a
 **Sales Executive UK** 
 , you will take full ownership of identifying, engaging, and closing new customers in the UK market. You’ll work independently to develop opportunities, manage the full sales cycle, and bring in new logos. As a proactive self-starter with a passion for solution selling, you will play a key role in Netigate’s international growth - with the autonomy, responsibility, and momentum to make a real impact. This is a
 **hybrid role** 
 , with an expectation of
 **three days per week in our Stockholm office** 
 to foster collaboration and team engagement.
   

  

**Your Key Responsibilities**
* Identify and target potential B2B clients in the UK market
* Generate new leads through outbound prospecting, networking, and market research
* Present tailored solutions and conduct effective sales meetings
* Prepare proposals and negotiate contract terms
* Build and maintain a healthy, high-conversion pipeline
* Represent the company at trade shows, events, and client meetings
* Regularly reporting to the Head of New Sales


**Your Profile**
* Proven track record of success in B2B sales in the UK market
* 5+ years of relevant sales experience, preferably in SaaS
* Native-level communication and negotiation skills in English
* Strong understanding of the UK business landscape and decision-making structures
* Self-motivated, goal-driven, and able to work independently
* CRM experience (e.g., Salesforce, HubSpot) and strong analytical skills


**What You Can Expect**
* An inclusive and supportive work environment where diversity and creativity are celebrated.
* An environment where your ideas are valued, and you have the opportunity to make a meaningful contribution from the start.
* Opportunities for professional growth and career advancement within an international growing company.
* No matter your role, whether you're just starting out or in a leadership position, we focus on the value you bring to the table. Creativity and impact are what matter most.
* We believe in celebrating our achievements. Wether it's a summer festival or New Year party: we make sure to enjoy our successes and build strong team connections.


 Our Culture
   

  

 At Netigate, we pride ourselves on our collaborative, imaginative, and learning-focused culture. We believe in the collective strength of diverse perspectives - the "power of WE." We cultivate an atmosphere where fresh ideas are shared, challenges are embraced, and individual growth is encouraged.
   

  

**We encourage all applicants to consider submitting an anonymous CV as part of our commitment to fostering a non-discriminatory and inclusive recruitment process. In line with this, we aim to ensure transparency around compensation and will share indicative salary ranges during the initial conversation.**

title: Specialist Technical Account Manager - Cloud Operations, AWS North, EMEA EU North
description:
**Description**
 Are you a Technologist with deep expertise in Cloud Operations? We're looking for Cloud Operations experts to help our customers achieve operational excellence at scale with their AWS cloud environments. As a Specialist Technical Account Manager (STAM), you act as a Cloud Operations Architect for your designated technology domain. You'll provide strategic guidance to customers on implementing robust operational practices, cloud financial management capabilities, and observability solutions, applying your knowledge of best practices to enhance architectural health, optimize cloud resources, and allow customers to get the most out of their AWS implementation.
   

  

 You'll help customers navigate complex operational challenges through the AWS Observability Ambassador Program principles, design resilient cloud architectures that meet performance standards, and implement effective monitoring and optimization controls. You'll guide customers through the lens of Cloud Financial Management (CFM) framework, helping them combine tools, processes, and practices to plan, manage, and optimize cloud costs while enabling innovation and scaling to meet business objectives within budget.
   

  

 This is a post-sales advisory role within our Enterprise Support team, where you can further develop your technical, leadership, and consulting skills while working with organizations facing sophisticated cloud operations challenges. You'll leverage Cloud Optimization best practices, guidance, and solutions, including AWS Well-Architected Framework, AWS Trusted Advisor, AWS Health and Operations Reviews to help customers maximize the value they derive from AWS.
   

  

 The AWS Global Support team interacts with leading companies and believes that world-class support is critical to customer success, especially when navigating the evolving landscape of cloud operations. AWS Support also partners with a global list of customers that are building mission-critical applications on top of AWS services while maintaining efficient and optimized cloud environments.
   

  

 AWS Sales, Marketing, and Global Services (SMGS) is responsible for driving revenue, adoption, and growth from the largest and fastest growing small- and mid-market accounts to enterprise-level customers including public sector and other regulated industries. Join us in helping customers build operationally excellent cloud environments that enable innovation while optimizing performance and cost.
   

  

 This role is open in Stockholm and Amsterdam
   

  

 Key job responsibilities
   

  

* Provide customers with deep technical expertise in your domain to achieve operational excellence.
* Collaborate with Generalist Technical Account Managers, Solutions Architects, Account Managers and Customer Solutions Manager to ideate around your customers’ most challenging business problems.
* Act as a trusted advisor to line of business and C-suite leaders.
* Lead architectural reviews and workshops to advance your customer’s technical objectives.
* Act as a thought leader sharing best practices through forums such as AWS blogs, whitepapers, reference architectures and public-speaking events such as AWS Summit, AWS re: Invent, etc. Participate as a leader in AWS Technical Field communities.
* Educate and Advice customers on the value proposition of AWS Services and Support products, and participate in architectural discussions to ensure solutions are designed for successful deployment in the cloud.
* Provide data and anecdotes on what is working and what is not back to the larger specialist community and product teams. Act as primary point of contact for urgent customer issues in your technical specialty.


 A day in the life
   

  

 In this role, you'll leverage your extensive technical knowledge to ensure our customers' cloud environments are efficient, optimized, and resilient on the AWS platform. As a trusted advisor, you'll play a pivotal role in ensuring customer success as they implement operational best practices and cloud financial management strategies. This includes providing deep process and technical expertise to help customers overcome complex operational challenges. With your in-depth operations experience and knowledge, you'll guide customers in understanding and implementing best practices for operating in the cloud. This involves assisting customers in mitigating operational risks using scalable and cost-effective solutions on AWS, while applying principles from the AWS Observability Ambassador Program to enhance visibility into their environments. Additionally, you'll develop content and conduct enablement sessions with customers, such as Well-Architected workshops and Cloud Financial Management immersion days, to further enhance their operational capabilities and help them achieve architectural health and cloud optimization across their AWS footprint.
   

  

**About The Team**
 Diverse Experiences
   

  

 Amazon values diverse experiences. Even if you do not meet all of the preferred qualifications and skills listed in the job description, we encourage candidates to apply. If your career is just starting, hasn’t followed a traditional path, or includes alternative experiences, don’t let it stop you from applying.
   

  

 Why AWS
   

  

 Amazon Web Services (AWS) is the world’s most comprehensive and broadly adopted cloud platform. We pioneered cloud computing and never stopped innovating — that’s why customers from the most successful startups to Global 500 companies trust our robust suite of products and services to power their businesses.
   

  

 Work/Life Balance
   

  

 We value work-life harmony. Achieving success at work should never come at the expense of sacrifices at home, which is why we strive for flexibility as part of our working culture. When we feel supported in the workplace and at home, there’s nothing we can’t achieve in the cloud.
   

  

 Inclusive Team Culture
   

  

 Here at AWS, it’s in our nature to learn and be curious. Our employee-led affinity groups foster a culture of inclusion that empower us to be proud of our differences. Ongoing events and learning experiences, including our Conversations on Race and Ethnicity (CORE) and AmazeCon (gender diversity) conferences, inspire us to never stop embracing our uniqueness.
   

  

 Mentorship and Career Growth
   

  

 We’re continuously raising our performance bar as we strive to become Earth’s Best Employer. That’s why you’ll find endless knowledge-sharing, mentorship and other career-advancing resources here to help you develop into a better-rounded professional
   

  

**Basic Qualifications**
* 4+ years of design/implementation/operations/consulting of Cloud Operations frameworks
* 4+ years of experience building operational solutions across monitoring, alerting, and automation systems or experience with observability tools and practices such as CloudWatch, Prometheus, and distributed tracing
* Experience in internal enterprise or external customer-facing environment as a technical operations lead
* Experience in Cloud operations such as Cloud Financial Management, architectural optimization, and large-scale operational transformations.


**Preferred Qualifications**
* Deep experience in Cloud Operations architecture design, build, deploy and maintenance
* Deep experience implementing and managing Cloud Financial Management practices
* Expertise in AWS observability solutions and the AWS Observability Ambassador Program principles
* Experience conducting Well-Architected Reviews and implementing recommendations
* Proficiency with AWS Trusted Advisor and AWS Health or Operations Reviews
* Demonstrated ability to optimize cloud environments for performance, reliability, and cost
* AWS Certifications, e.g. AWS Solutions Architect Associate / Professional / Speciality highly desirable.
* Internal enterprise experience working with a wide range of internal stakeholders on operations implementation or migration with a company-wide impact.
* Ability to understand complex application data flows and bridge the gap between technical and business app requirements.
* Strong written communication skills as well as a proven track record of writing clear process and technical documentation


 Amazon is an equal opportunities employer. We believe passionately that employing a diverse workforce is central to our success. We make recruiting decisions based on your experience and skills. We value your passion to discover, invent, simplify and build. Protecting your privacy and the security of your data is a longstanding top priority for Amazon. Please consult our Privacy Notice (https://www.amazon.jobs/en/privacy\_page) to know more about how we collect, use and transfer the personal data of our candidates.
   

  

 Our inclusive culture empowers Amazonians to deliver the best results for our customers. If you have a disability and need a workplace accommodation or adjustment during the application and hiring process, including support for the interview or onboarding process, please visit https://amazon.jobs/content/en/how-we-hire/accommodations for more information. If the country/region you’re applying in isn’t listed, please contact your Recruiting Partner.
   

  

  

**Company** 
 - AWS EMEA SARL (Sweden Branch)

title: Systemintegratör
description:
Vill du bidra och verka i en framtidsbransch där megatrender som IoT, hållbarhet, energibesparing och digitalisering är vardag? I rollen som Systemintegratör arbetar du med att utveckla och förbättra den tekniska infrastrukturen och fastighetsdriften i några av samhällets viktigaste byggnader.
   

  

**Hos Oss Får Du**
* Arbeta med innovativ teknik i ett etablerat bolag med stort fokus på hållbarhet
* Goda utvecklingsmöjligheter där du själv äger din egen utveckling i bolaget
* Ett sammansvetsat team med hög teknisk kompetens med ett gemensamt mål att lyckas tillsammans


 Arbetsbeskrivning
   

  

 I denna roll samarbetar du nära våra automationsingenjörer och projektledare inom PLC/DUC-programmering. Du kommer att arbeta med ett brett spektrum av fabrikat och kommunikationsprotokoll och ha en ledande roll i projekt där du ansvarar för tekniken och att kundens förväntningar på kvalitet och ekonomi uppnås. Eftersom arbetet är kundnära, kommer du även att spela en aktiv roll i att bygga och utveckla kundrelationer samt leda projekt mot slutkund.
   

  

 Kvalifikationer
   

  

 För att lyckas i rollen ser vi att du har:
   

  

* Akademisk examen inom teknik eller motsvarande kompetens som vi bedömer som likvärdig
* Minst 2 års arbetslivserfarenhet inom en liknande roll, gärna inom fastighetsautomation, industriell automation eller relaterat IT-område
* Erfarenhet av att arbeta med nätverk och IP-konfigurationer
* B-körkort
* Flytande svenska och engelska i både tal och skrift


 Meriterande
   

  

* Erfarenhet av att serva och underhålla teknisk utrustning, särskilt inom fastighetsautomation och SCADA-system.
* Erfarenhet av att programmera, konfigurera och integrera SCADA- och PLC-system, inklusive datamodellering, signalmappning, felsökning och arbete med vanliga nätverksprotokoll (t.ex. BACnet, Modbus, TCP/IP).
* Tidigare arbetslivserfarenhet inom fastighetsbranschen, industriarbete eller som drifttekniker samt kunskap inom VVS och fastighetsteknik


 Som person är du lösningsorienterad, analytisk och noggrann. Du identifierar snabbt problem och hittar effektiva lösningar samtidigt som du säkerställer hög kvalitet. Du är kommunikativ och samarbetar lätt med både kollegor och kunder. Vidare är du strukturerad, arbetar effektivt mot deadlines och kan hantera dokumentation noggrant och korrekt.
   

  

 Observera att rekryteringsprocessen kan ta lite längre tid än vanligt under sommaren på grund av semestrar. Vi återkommer så snart vi kan!
   

  

 Att vara anställd hos Nordomatic kan innebära att behöva ge samtycke till sekretessbevis och registerkontroll.

title: Quality Engineer Teamleader
description:
Vill du bli en del av ett härligt team och jobba med kvalitetsfrågor på ett företag i tillväxt?
 **MilDef** 
 , en global ledare inom ruggade IT-lösningar, söker nu en
 **Teamleader för Kvalitet** 
 till vårt team i Stockholm (Rosersberg). Hos oss får du en roll med både operativt ansvar och möjlighet att utveckla teamet och våra kvalitetsprocesser – i en bransch som gör skillnad varje dag.
   

  

**Din nya utmaning**
 Som Teamleader för Kvalitet får du en nyckelroll i att leda och stötta ett kompetent team inom projektkvalitet. Du arbetar både strategiskt och operativt, med fokus på att vidareutveckla vårt arbetssätt, våra processer och våra medarbetare inom kvalitetssäkring. Du fungerar som ett stöd till projektledare och övriga funktioner i kvalitetsrelaterade frågor och är ansvarig för att kvalitetsperspektivet genomsyrar hela verksamheten.
   

  

**Huvudsakliga arbetsuppgifter**
* Leda och coacha teamet inom projektkvalitet och säkerställa kompetensutveckling
* Delta i kontrakts- och designgranskningar och säkerställa efterlevnad av interna och externa kvalitetskrav.
* Sätta riktning och vidareutveckla kvalitetsstrategier, processer och arbetssätt.
* Ansvara för utveckling och implementering av kvalitetsplaner samt leveranskontroller.
* Driva förbättringsinitiativ och vara ansvarig för hantering av avvikelser och korrigerande åtgärder.
* Fungera som kontaktperson i kvalitetsfrågor mot kund, leverantörer och interna intressenter.


****Det här bidrar du med****
 Du har några års erfarenhet av kvalitetsarbete i en projektbaserad miljö, gärna med erfarenhet av ledarskap eller en ambition att ta klivet in i en ledande roll. Du är strukturerad, har en god samarbetsförmåga och brinner för att utveckla både processer och människor.
   

  

 Du har:
   

  

* Erfarenhet av kvalitetsledning, gärna inom teknikintensiv industri.
* Kunskap om relevanta kvalitetsstandarder och arbetssätt (t.ex. ISO 9001).
* God förmåga att uttrycka dig på svenska och engelska i både tal och skrift.
* Svenskt medborgarskap (krav för säkerhetsklassning).
* B-körkort, då resor i tjänsten förekommer.


**Varför MilDef?**
 På MilDef får du arbeta i en engagerad och stöttande miljö där dina idéer och insatser värdesätts. Du kommer att ha möjligheter till kontinuerligt lärande och karriärutveckling samt arbeta i en teamorienterad miljö som främjar innovation och samarbete.
   

  

**Vad vi erbjuder dig**
* En engagerande och utvecklande roll i ett ledande företag.
* Möjlighet att arbeta med projekt som bidrar till nationell säkerhet och försvar.
* En samarbetsvillig och stöttande arbetsmiljö med engagerade kollegor.
* Kollektivavtal inkl. bra försäkringar
* Friskvårdsbidrag
* Regelbundna hälsoundersökningar
* Happiness team som ordnar roliga aktiviteter


**Ansökan**
 Om du är redo för en ny utmaning och vill bli en del av vårt framgångsrika team, skicka din ansökan snarast. Vi ser fram emot att höra från dig!
   

  

 Läs mer om oss på MilDef.com.
   

  

 Vi jobbar med löpande urval, sista ansökningsdag är den 17 augusti.
   

  

**Viktig information**
 Vi genomför bakgrundskontroller och drogtest på alla våra blivande kollegor innan anställning.
   

  

***MilDef - WE ARMOR IT.***
*MilDef is a global systems integrator and full-spectrum provider specializing in rugged IT for military, government and critical infrastructure sectors. MilDef provides hardware, software, and services that shield and protect critical information streams and systems, when and where the stakes are the highest. MilDef’s products are sold to more than 200 customers through companies in Sweden, Norway, Finland, Denmark, United Kingdom, Germany, Switzerland, the United States and Australia, and through partner networks in more than 40 countries. MilDef was founded in 1997 and is listed on Nasdaq Stockholm since 2021.*
**Vi undanber oss vänligen kontakt från annons- och rekryteringsförsäljning.**

title: Head of Business Applications Sweden - Tietoevry Tech Services (m/f/d)
description:
**You may apply to Tietoevry by selecting Apply and fill your application details to the form. You may also Apply by using LinkedIn and populate details to your application from your LinkedIn profile.**
 Vi söker en erfaren ledare som kommer att ha det övergripande ansvaret för att leda och utveckla vår Business Applications-verksamhet i Sverige, med huvudfokus på ERP-lösningen från Unit4.
   

  

 Tietoevry Tech Services är Nordens största leverantör av Unit4-tjänster och den ledande globala partnern till Unit4. Vi arbetar som ett sammansvetsat team över landsgränserna och levererar högkvalitativa lösningar med innovation i fokus. Business Applications har idag cirka 30 anställda i Sverige och flera stora och viktiga kunder inom segmenten bank och offentlig sektor. Det finns tydliga ambitioner att växa på den svenska marknaden inom Business Applications.
   

  

 Hos Tietoevry Tech Services blir du en del av en dynamisk och inkluderande miljö där ledarskap handlar om att göra skillnad. Du får möjlighet att forma framtiden för ERP-tjänster i Sverige och internationellt, med stöd från ett starkt nordiskt och globalt nätverk.
   

  

**När du börjar på Tietoevry Tech Services som Head of Business Applications:**
* Blir du en viktig del av den globala ledningsgruppen i Business Applications för att nå våra gemensamma mål över landsgränser.
* Har du ett övergripande ansvar för alla medarbetare i Business Applications teamet, kunderna och leveranserna.
* Ansvarar för enhetens mål och att resultat uppnås.
* Driva strategiska initiativ och affärsutveckling med fokus på Unit4 ERP.
* Främjar samarbete och kunskapsdelning över gränser inom Tietoevry Tech Services.
* Säkerställer kundnöjdhet och långsiktiga partnerskap genom tillförlitlig rådgivning och leverans.
* Främjar innovation och kontinuerlig utveckling för att säkerställa vår konkurrenskraft


**Vi Söker Dig Som**
* Har ledarerfarenhet och dokumenterad erfarenhet av att leda konsult- och leveransmiljöer, helst inom ERP-applikationsområdet.
* Har ett starkt kundfokus och bygger förtroendefulla relationer.
* Har en naturlig förmåga att skapa och leda högpresterande team.
* Inspirerar till tillväxt och utveckling samt driver innovation och förbättringar.
* Är en ledare med passion, samarbetsvilja och förmåga att tydligt kommunicera riktlinjer.
* Du är flytande i svenska och engelska, i tal och skrift.


**Vi erbjuder dig**
 Vi erbjuder dig professionell tillväxt, meningsfulla projekt, öppen kultur och en enastående balans mellan arbete och privatliv! Vi erbjuder dig en möjlighet att skapa framtiden för en snabbt växande och viktig sektor. Vi tror att vår organisationskultur är en viktig del för att du ska bli framgångsrik. Vi tillhandahåller en flexibel hybrid arbetsmodell som en del av vår kultur och vårt sätt att arbeta. Slutligen tror vi också på nyfikenhet och konstant lärande som en livsstil där du behöver skola om dig varje dag när nya möjligheter dyker upp.
   

  

**Blev du inspirerad?**
 Vi ser fram emot din ansökan!
   

  

 Bifoga ditt CV eller LinkedIn-profil så kontaktar vi dig. Om du har några frågor angående denna roll, vänligen kontakta rekryterande chef: Bård Jørgen Haaland, baard.haaland@tietoevry.com (På semester till 5 aug). På grund av semestertider kan det dröja längre tid än vanligt till återkoppling.
   

  

*Hoppas vi hörs snart!*
*Vi utför bakgrundskontroller av alla slutkandidater.*
*Tietoevry tackar nej till samtal från rekryteringsföretag.*
**Om Tietoevry Tech Services**
 Tietoevry Tech Services är en ledande leverantör av transformations- och IT-drifttjänster, med fokus på nordiska privata och offentliga kunder inom olika branscher. Med vårt kompletta utbud av digitala lösningar – inklusive applikationer, multicloud, data & AI samt säkerhetstjänster – hjälper vi företag att utvecklas och håller de nordiska samhällena i gång.
   

  

 Vi är ett globalt team med över 7 000 experter från mer än 50 nationaliteter och levererar tjänster till våra kunder genom att kombinera globala kapabiliteter med nordisk närhet. Ledd av våra värderingar – jämlikhet, transparens och tillit – strävar vi efter att vara den bästa möjliga arbetsplatsen.
   

  

 Nu söker vi talangfulla personer som vill följa med oss på vår spännande resa mot att bli ett självständigt bolag och tillsammans forma det digitala landskapet i Norden.
   

  

 At Tietoevry, we believe in the power of diversity, equity, and inclusion. We encourage applicants of all backgrounds, genders (m/f/d), and walks of life to join our team, as we believe that this fosters an inspiring workplace and fuels innovation. Our commitment to openness, trust, and diversity is at the heart of our mission to create digital futures that benefit businesses, societies, and humanity. Diversity, equity and inclusion (tietoevry.com)

title: Senior Learning & Development Specialist
company_industry: Defense and Space Manufacturing, Security and Investigations, and IT Services and IT Consulting
description:
*Are you passionate about shaping the future of learning in an organization where competence development is a strategic priority? We are looking for a proactive and collaborative individual who thrives on taking full ownership – from analysis to execution – and who knows when to act independently and when to bring key stakeholders into the process.*
 Your role
   

  

 As part of our Learning & Development team within Group Human Resources, you will play a key role in shaping and evolving Saab’s Learning Landscape. You will work closely with Group Strategy, internal competence owners in critical technology areas, and learning stakeholders across our Business Areas and Operational Companies to lead and drive learning initiatives in critical competence areas
 **.**
**In this role, you will also:**
* Consult with key stakeholders - including business leaders, technical competence owners, subject matter experts and external partners - to develop and design strategic learning solutions
* Explore innovative approaches and apply learning technologies to design, deliver and scale comprehensive learning solutions. Curate content for the target audience, manage suppliers, develop learning pathways, programs, and campaigns to enhance the overall learning experience.
* Leverage data and insights for strategic decision-making, to continuously improve offerings and support data-driven decision-making


 You will be part of a dedicated Learning & Development team that works cross-functionally to drive Saab’s overall learning strategy. We are responsible for company-wide, learning and development guidelines and processes including strategic workforce planning. Learning & Development serves as a key interface towards competence owners, Business Areas and Operational Countries ensuring that our learning strategy is aligned with Saab’s Strategic Business Plan
 *.*
 Your profile
   

  

 We are looking for someone with a strong drive, a holistic mindset, and the ability to take ownership of complex initiatives from start to finish. You know when to take action independently and when to involve key stakeholders. You are an excellent communicator, a natural networker, a team player and a strategic problem solver who knows how to deliver business value through learning.
   

  

**Required skills and experiences:**
* Extensive experience in learning performance consulting in large organisations
* Excellent communication skills in both Swedish and English, written and spoken.
* Strong collaboration, networking and stakeholder management skills
* Self-leadership with the ability to drive initiatives independently
* Proven ability to apply learning technologies and digital platforms to enhance learning


**Desired skills and experiences:**
* Leading learning transformation and change initiatives
* Learning experience design and digital learning ecosystems (e.g. LXPs, LMS, authoring tools)
* People Analytics and Metrics within L&D or other HR perspectives
* Supplier management and procurement of learning services.
* Leading learning initiatives in technology-intensive companies, preferably from Manufacturing, Production and / or Logistics.
* Experience from industry and academy collaboration with a focus on learning.


 The position can be located either in Stockholm at Saab HQ, Linköping, Gothenburg or Malmö.
   

  

 This position requires that you pass a security vetting based on the current regulations around/of security protection. For positions requiring security clearance additional obligations on citizenship may apply.
   

  

 Kindly observe that this is an ongoing recruitment process and that the position might be filled before the closing date of the advertisement. You can send us your application in either Swedish or English.
   

  

 Contact person: Alexander Lindstrand, Head of Learning & Development, mobile: +46 73 4187855
   

  

 What you will be a part of
   

  

 Behind our innovations stand the people who make them possible. Brave pioneers and curious minds. Everyday heroes and inventive troubleshooters. Those who share deep knowledge and those who explore sky-high. And everyone in between.
   

  

 Joining us means making an impact together, contributing in our own unique ways. From crafting complex code and building impressive defence and security solutions to simply sharing a coffee with a colleague, every action counts. We encourage you to take on challenges, to create smart inventions and grow in our friendly and tech-savvy workspace. We have a solid mission to keep people and society safe.
   

  

 Saab is a leading defence and security company with an enduring mission, to help nations keep their people and society safe. Empowered by its 22,000 talented people, Saab constantly pushes the boundaries of technology to create a safer and more sustainable world.
   

  

 Saab designs, manufactures and maintains advanced systems in aeronautics, weapons, command and control, sensors and underwater systems. Saab is headquartered in Sweden. It has major operations all over the world and is part of the domestic defence capability of several nations. Read more about us here

title: LIA/Internship within SEO
company_industry: Advertising Services, Marketing Services, and Technology, Information and Internet
description:
**About WPP Media**
 WPP is the creative transformation company. We use the power of creativity to build better futures for our people, planet, clients and communities. For more information, visit wpp.com.
   

  

 WPP Media is WPP’s global media collective. In a world where media is everywhere and in everything, we bring the best platform, people, and partners together to create limitless opportunities for growth. For more information, visit wppmedia.com.
   

  

 At WPP Media, we believe in the power of our culture and our people. It’s what elevates us to deliver exceptional experiences for both our clients and each other. In this role it will be critical to embrace WPP & WPP Media’s shared core values:
   

  

* Be Extraordinary by Leading Collectively to Inspire transformational Creativity.
* Create an Open environment by Balancing People and Client Experiences by Cultivating Trust.
* Lead Optimistically by Championing Growth and Development to Mobilize the Enterprise.


**Ongoing intake, but limited spots available**
 As an intern in our SEO & Content Engineering team at WPP Media, you’ll be working with a focus on SEO.
   

  

 You’ll get to experience all aspects of SEO - from strategy and implementation to follow-up and analysis. You'll work actively in our client teams, helping some of the largest companies in Sweden and around the world. We believe in continuous learning and skill development, and we encourage sharing knowledge within the team.
   

  

 Our office is located on Birger Jarlsgatan in Stockholm, and for the right candidate, there may be opportunities to continue your career with us after the internship.
   

  

**Who are you?**
 We believe you’re a student in media, web, marketing, finance, or someone with relevant work experience and a strong interest in digital marketing. You’re eager to learn, enjoy problem-solving, and can contribute new ideas. You’re proactive and can work both independently and collaboratively with others. Experience with SEO tools isn’t required, but being comfortable in Microsoft Excel is a plus.
   

  

**To join our team as an intern, you need to:**
* Be available for at least 8 weeks
* Do your internship through a school or the Swedish Public Employment Service (Arbetsförmedlingen)
* Be available full-time during standard office hours
* Be fluent in Swedish and comfortable using English
* Be available full-time to work on-site at our Stockholm office


 Please note: this internship is unpaid.
   

  

**Interested?**
 Apply with your CV and include a short note about why you’d like to intern with us. Be sure to include the period you're applying for.
   

  

**Contact**
 If you have questions about the SEO internship, contact Sandra Mellqvist, Senior Consultant & Intern Manager, SEO & Content Engineering. Due to GDPR, we do not accept applications via email – please submit your application through Jobvite.

title: Enhetschef System- och analysutveckling inom IT-avdelningen, Riksgälden
description:
**Enhetschef till System- och analysutveckling inom IT-avdelningen, Riksgälden**
 Är du erfaren ledare inom IT-utveckling och vill vara med på vår förändringsresa? Vill du driva systemutveckling inom IT-avdelningen i en myndighet med viktiga samhällsfunktioner för Sverige? Vi erbjuder ett utvecklande och spännande uppdrag där Sveriges finansiella stabilitet står i fokus. Du får möjlighet att samarbeta med kunniga och engagerade kollegor. Du kan vara den vi söker.
   

  

**Vi erbjuder dig**
 IT-avdelningen inom Riksgälden söker enhetschef till enhet IT System- och Analysutveckling. Med erfarenhet som personalansvarig chef inom IT-området kommer du att leda förvaltning och förändringsarbete inom systemutveckling. Du ingår i IT-ledningsgrupp, tillsammans med avdelningschef och tre enhetschefer, IT-service, IT Infrastruktur och IT-Systemutveckling. Du rapporterar direkt till avdelningschefen. Rollen innebär att utveckla enhetens verksamhet i enlighet med avdelningens uppdrag och med en hög grad av samarbete och samverkan, såväl med interna, som externa parter. Inom Riksgälden är vi ca 240 medarbetare som sitter i centrala Stockholm.
   

  

 På Riksgälden har du möjlighet att arbeta på distans upp till 50 procent. Det förutsätter att arbetsuppgifterna tillåter det och att du har goda förutsättningar att arbeta utanför kontoret.
   

  

 Enheten består idag av 10-15 medarbetare, för vilka du har personalansvar inkluderat arbetsmiljöansvar och att säkerställa nödvändig administration för enhetens medarbetare i aktuellt personalsystem inom myndigheten.
   

  

 Du ansvarar för att ta fram och följa upp medarbetarnas kompetensutveckling för att säkra att medarbetarna bidrar och är motiverade. Du leder genom andra och planerar samt fördelar resurser till utvecklings- och projektteam. Som enhetschef bidrar du i det strategiska arbetet att driva den pågående digitala verksamhetsutvecklingen framåt.
   

  

 Ansvaret innebär även att planera för enhetens och avdelningens verksamhetsplanering, där mål är väl definierade och tidsatta.
   

  

 Arbetet innebär framtagande av enhetens risker samt planering för åtgärder och tidplan. Du ansvarar för tekniska verktyg relaterat till systemutvecklingsprocessen. I rollen ansvarar du även för att systemens och utvecklingsteamens styrandedokument är uppdaterade enligt plan. Som enhetschef omvärldsbevakar du inom enhetens ansvarsområde. Vid behov kan det bli aktuellt att leda mindre projekt eller förvaltningsobjekt.
   

  

**Din profil**
**Krav**
* Akademisk utbildning inom datavetenskap eller systemutveckling eller motsvarande arbetslivserfarenhet som Riksgälden bedömer likvärdig.
* Minst tre års aktuell och dokumenterad erfarenhet som chef med personal- och arbetsmiljöansvar, inklusive budgetansvar.
* Erfarenhet av att leda på distans.
* Erfarenhet av förändringsledning.
* Kommunikativ, med mycket god förmåga att uttrycka sig väl i tal och skrift, på svenska.
* Svenskt medborgskap


**Meriterande**
* Minst tre års aktuell och relevant erfarenhet av att leda agila utvecklingsteam eller tekniska projekt.
* Minst två års erfarenhet av systemutveckling.
* Erfarenhet av arbete som utvecklare, teknisk arkitekt eller liknande tekniska roller.
* Erfarenhet som chef inom offentlig sektor.
* Erfarenhet av IT-tekniker såsom: Git, Jenkins, Docker, Kubernetes, .NET och Qlik Sense.
* Erfarenhet av programmeringsspråk såsom C# och Python etc.


 För att lyckas i rollen utgår du från helheten och tar hänsyn till det större perspektivet genom att bidra strategiskt i utvecklingsarbetet. Du motiveras av att arbeta mot uppsatta mål som genererar goda resultat till verksamheten.
   

  

 Som ledare är du trygg, stabil och behåller lugnet och kan prioritera och fokusera på rätt saker. I ditt ledarskap skapar du goda förutsättningar för medarbetarna att känna motivation, engagemang och delaktighet i enhetens arbete och i sina individuella utvecklingsplaner. Du har god förmåga att samarbeta med din omgivning och lyssnar och kommunicerar tydligt utifrån aktuell målgrupp.
   

  

 Vi kommer att lägga stor vikt vid pålitlighet och lämplighet till tjänsten samt dina personliga egenskaper.
   

  

**Övrig information**
 Välkommen med din ansökan som innehåller CV, personligt brev, examensbevis och relevanta betyg. För att du ska få en så rättvis och korrekt bedömning som möjligt är det av stor vikt att du uppger år och månad för varje anställning samt en kort beskrivning av arbetsuppgifterna i ditt CV. Som en del av rekryteringsprocessen, kommer vi att använda oss av tester. Urval och intervjuer planeras att genomföras i augusti.
   

  

 Skicka ansökan senast
 **den 8 augusti 2025** 
 Ange referens 2025/529 om du skickar in ansökan på annat sätt än digitalt via Riksgäldens hemsida.
   

  

 Vi erbjuder en tillsvidaretjänst med inledande sex månaders provanställning.
   

  

 För information om tjänsten är du välkommen att kontakta avdelningschef Ingela Rindå, 08 613 47 25 och kring rekryteringsprocessen HR-partner Ann Holgersson, tfn 08-613 46 45. Fackliga representanter är: Linn Hedman Saco-S och Lena Niklasson ST-Riksgälden som nås via växeln: 08-613 45 00.
   

  

**Om Riksgälden**
 Riksgälden spelar en viktig roll i samhällsekonomin och på den svenska finansmarknaden. Vi bidrar till att statens pengar och finansiering hanteras effektivt och att det finansiella systemet är stabilt. Vårt kontor finns i centrala Stockholm och vi är drygt 240 anställda. Vår vision är att tillsammans göra Riksgälden till en förebild både i Sverige och internationellt. Våra värderingar präglas av öppenhet, trygghet och professionalitet i utförande av vårt arbete. Riksgälden strävar efter att vara en hållbar och attraktiv arbetsgivare, där mångfald, olika erfarenheter, kompetens och bakgrunder tas tillvara. För mer information se riksgalden.se
