title: Senior Engagement Manager, ProServe EMEA North
job_function: Project Management, Management, and Product Management
description:
****DESCRIPTION****
 The Amazon Web Services Professional Services (ProServe) team is seeking a highly skilled and versatile Engagement Manager (EM) to join our team and lead the delivery of complex cloud solution projects.
   

  

 In this role you will combine technical expertise with strong project leadership skills to drive successful implementations of AWS-based solutions for our clients. You will bridge business requirements with technical solutions, facilitating technical discussions and ensuring alignment with customer outcomes. Applying AWS frameworks like Well-Architected and Cloud Adoption Framework while demonstrating technical credibility across diverse stakeholders, you will distill customer needs into clear technical requirements, decompose complex problems, and make informed trade-off decisions considering performance, scalability, security, and business impact.
   

  

 Possessing strong technology and program/project management experience, you will validate technical solutions against business goals, recognize when additional technical evaluation is needed, and manage technical risks. You will be expected to achieve and maintain relevant AWS certifications, develop domain-specific expertise, and effectively communicate technical concepts to both technical and business audiences. As you progress, you’ll lead increasingly complex technical projects, shape cross-organizational technical strategies, and establish best practices in your domain. In this role you will apply your management and leadership capabilities to successfully execute project plans, proactively identify and manage risks, resolve issues, escalate when appropriate, and drive projects to successful completion, while exceeding customer expectation The AWS Professional Services organization is a global team of experts that help customers realize their desired business outcomes when using the AWS Cloud.
   

  

 We work together with customer teams and the AWS Partner Network (APN) to execute enterprise cloud computing initiatives. Our team provides assistance through a collection of offerings which help customers achieve specific outcomes related to enterprise cloud adoption. We also deliver focused guidance through our global specialty practices, which cover a variety of solutions, technologies, and industries.
   

  

**Eligibility Requirement:**
* This role requires you to be a Swedish National and have business level proficiency in the Swedish language


 Key job responsibilities
   

  

* Leading and managing complex cloud migration and implementation projects
* Leveraging comprehensive knowledge of AWS services, architectures, and best practices to guide technical decisions and strategic planning  Bridging business requirements with technical solutions, facilitating engineering discussions and ensuring alignment with customer business outcomes
* Distilling customer needs into clear technical requirements and map them to business outcomes - Decomposing complex technical problems into actionable, deliverable solutions
* Contributing to technical documentation and define documentation standards


**About The Team**
 A day in the life
   

  

 AWS Sales, Marketing, and Global Services (SMGS) is responsible for driving revenue, adoption, and growth from the largest and fastest growing small- and mid-market accounts to enterprise-level customers including public sector. The AWS Global Support team interacts with leading companies and believes that world-class support is critical to customer success. AWS Support also partners with a global list of customers that are building mission-critical applications on top of AWS services.
   

  

**About The Team**
 Diverse Experiences:
   

  

 AWS values diverse experiences. Even if you do not meet all of the preferred qualifications and skills listed in the job below, we encourage candidates to apply. If your career is just starting, hasn’t followed a traditional path, or includes alternative experiences, don’t let it stop you from applying.
   

  

 Why AWS?
   

  

 Amazon Web Services (AWS) is the world’s most comprehensive and broadly adopted cloud platform. We pioneered cloud computing and never stopped innovating — that’s why customers from the most successful startups to Global 500 companies trust our robust suite of products and services to power their businesses.
   

  

**Inclusive Team Culture:**
 Here at AWS, it’s in our nature to learn and be curious. Our employee-led affinity groups foster a culture of inclusion that empower us to be proud of our differences. Ongoing events and learning experiences, including our Conversations on Race and Ethnicity (CORE) and AmazeCon (diversity) conferences, inspire us to never stop embracing our uniqueness.
   

  

**Mentorship & Career Growth:**
 We’re continuously raising our performance bar as we strive to become Earth’s Best Employer. That’s why you’ll find endless knowledge-sharing, mentorship and other career-advancing resources here to help you develop into a better-rounded professional.
   

  

 Work/Life Balance
   

  

 We value work-life harmony. Achieving success at work should never come at the expense of sacrifices at home, which is why we strive for flexibility as part of our working culture. When we feel supported in the workplace and at home, there’s nothing we can’t achieve.
   

  

****BASIC QUALIFICATIONS****
* 7+ years Project Management hands-on experience in managing and delivering enterprise level IT projects, with external customers or equivalent experience
* Demonstrated ability to successfully manage multiple and concurrent projects/customers.
* Led teams and engagements utilizing agile approaches, value and principles as well as Scrum framework
* Understands the value proposition of cloud services and has delivered cloud engagements
* Experience with Agile and Project Management (APM) toolsets (Jira, RallyDev, VersionOne, Taiga, etc).


****PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS****
* Has at least one active project management certification (e.g., APM, CSM, PMI-ACP, PRINCE2)
* Managed technical projects consisting of 8 or more people totaling over $1,000,000 budget
* Managed and delivered IT engagements for Nordic large enterprise customers.
* Managed engagements using Agile/Iterative methodologies and possesses a deep knowledge of Agile and Scaled program management best practices and how to pragmatically apply across large, complex projects.
* Has presented to C-level executives (CIO, CEO, CTO, CISO, etc.) as well as to technical subject matter experts.


 Amazon is an equal opportunities employer. We believe passionately that employing a diverse workforce is central to our success. We make recruiting decisions based on your experience and skills. We value your passion to discover, invent, simplify and build. Protecting your privacy and the security of your data is a longstanding top priority for Amazon. Please consult our Privacy Notice (https://www.amazon.jobs/en/privacy\_page) to know more about how we collect, use and transfer the personal data of our candidates.
   

  

 Our inclusive culture empowers Amazonians to deliver the best results for our customers. If you have a disability and need a workplace accommodation or adjustment during the application and hiring process, including support for the interview or onboarding process, please visit https://amazon.jobs/content/en/how-we-hire/accommodations for more information. If the country/region you’re applying in isn’t listed, please contact your Recruiting Partner.
   

  

  

**Company** 
 - AWS EMEA SARL (Sweden Branch)
   

  

 Job ID: A3025193

title: Senior Specialist, Paid Search
description:
*Are you an experienced paid search specialist who wants to join the leading performance marketing agency in the Nordics?*
 We're driven by a passion for pushing the boundaries of Paid Search, and we want you to be part of that journey.
   

  

**Drive performance and accelerate growth**
 As a Senior Paid Search Specialist at s360, you'll be part of a senior team and work with some of the most advanced brands and retailers in Sweden. You will drive innovation together with the clients and within s360, developing cutting-edge processes and technologies to solve paid search problems.
   

  

**Specifically, You Can Look Forward To**
* Leading paid search client engagements managing a portfolio of clients
* Translating business priorities into paid search strategies
* Planning, setting up and optimising paid search campaigns
* Co-creation with the client to ensure we consistently innovate, develop, and improve paid search performance
* Working with first-party data to ensure we maximize the impact of the advertising algorithms
* Daily optimization and maintenance of campaigns across clients and markets
* Working with channel innovation in Sweden and across s360


**Join our team of specialists**
 S360 acquired Docklin in 2025, combining two senior paid search teams in Stockholm. As part of s360 you’ll join our strong team of experienced specialists working closely with a shared passion for paid search. We set the bar high and look for smart and talented people who want to be the best within the field, joining a culture where individuals strive to be better each day.
   

  

 We work with some of the leading brands and retailers in Sweden and the Nordics, and focus on creating value-driven solutions with our clients by leveraging the latest technology, strong consulting skills, business insights, and execution from A to Z.
   

  

 Our team of Paid Search specialists spans multiple countries and diverse backgrounds, giving you the unique chance to learn from some of the best in the field every single day. We work closely together across markets, and we constantly share learnings to drive innovation and success.
   

  

**Eager to learn and always looking for growth opportunities**
 A key aspect of your role will be to identify growth opportunities and think innovatively. Therefore, we envision you as someone who is both ambitious and curious. You share our passion for paid search and have an interest and understanding of data and tech.
   

  

**You Can Probably Recognise The Following About Yourself**
* Have spent the last +4 years working as a Paid Search specialist in an agency or in-house
* Proven track-record of managing complex ecommerce clients
* Strong analytical and numerical skills and a proficiency within Excel/Sheets
* Project and client management skills
* Are a skilled communicator who thrives on engaging with clients both in person and digitally
* Are a team player who understands the importance of collaboration and knowledge sharing
* Fluent in Swedish (written and verbal)
* Relevant university degree within Business Administration, Industrial Engineering, or other relevant area


**Join our fast-paced environment**
 At s360 you will shape the development of one of the Nordics' leading and fastest-growing consultancies in digital marketing, tech, and data. You’ll be part of a strong team of some of the country’s top specialists, all striving to make each delivery better than the last. What sets us apart is our vibrant team culture. Throughout the year, we host social events and organize meetups with all our offices from around the world and have special interest communities ranging from Counter-Strike and running clubs to kitesurfing and knitting.
   

  

**Become a Part Of Our Team And Experience Everyday**
* Adown-to-earth culture where constructive feedback and collaboration drive success.
* Freedom with responsibility.
* Exciting, high-impact projects, working with some of the biggest brands in the Nordics.
* A high-expertise environment where you can develop alongside top professionals in digital marketing.


**We’d love to hear from you**
 Is this the right fit for you? Do you have any questions? Then don’t hesitate to apply or reach out to Erik Bolmstrand at [email protected].
   

  

 We review applications on an ongoing basis and hire as soon as the right candidate is found, so please send your CV and application as soon as possible. All inquiries are treated confidentially.
   

  

**About S360**
 s360 is a leading Northern European digital marketing agency that helps brands and retailers grow by providing a strong tech foundation, best-in-class execution, and deep industry expertise. With a team of +330 digital specialists, s360 operates ten offices across seven countries: Denmark, Finland, Norway, Sweden, the United Kingdom, the Netherlands, and Spain. In recent years, s360 has been recognised with numerous national and European awards, making it one of Europe's most award-winning digital marketing agencies.

title: Senior Informationssäkerhetskonsult
description:
**Är du en driven och erfaren informationssäkerhetskonsult som vill göra verklig skillnad?**
 Vill du vara med och skydda affärskritisk information, stärka våra kunders motståndskraft mot cyberhot och forma framtidens digitala säkerhetslösningar? Hos oss får du chansen att arbeta i teknikens absoluta framkant i en roll där din expertis verkligen gör skillnad.
   

  

 Vi söker dig som brinner för informationssäkerhet och som vill vara en nyckelspelare i våra kunders resa mot tryggare digitala miljöer. Du får arbeta i varierande uppdrag, ofta nära kundens ledning och IT-organisation, där du bidrar med både strategisk höjd och operativ skärpa.
   

  

 Om rollen inom informationssäkerhet
   

  

 Som informationssäkerhetskonsult hos oss blir du en nyckelperson i vårt säkerhetsteam. Du arbetar nära våra kunder för att förstå deras behov och levererar skräddarsydda lösningar inom informationssäkerhet, riskhantering, regelefterlevnad och incidenthantering. Du är rådgivande i säkerhetsfrågor, stöttar vid revisioner och leder förbättringsarbeten för säkerhetsåtgärder. Arbetet är både strategiskt och operativt, ofta i samarbete med specialister inom IT, juridik och ledning.
   

  

 Primära arbetsuppgifter – informationssäkerhet och riskhantering
   

  

* Genomföra analyser för att kartlägga kunders informationssäkerhet och identifiera möjliga förbättringsområden
* Utveckla och implementera processer för informationssäkerhet, exempelvis rutiner kring accesshantering, klassificering och incidenthantering
* Stötta kunder i arbete med regelefterlevnad (ISO 27001, NIS2, DORA)
* Utbilda och främja säkerhetskultur hos såväl ledning som medarbetare
* Delta vid och leda säkerhetsrelaterade projekt och workshops
* Genomföra riskbedömningar och ta fram rapporter samt rekommendationer
* Stödja vid hantering av kontinuitets planer och åtgärder


 Krav och kvalifikationer för informationssäkerhetskonsult
   

  

* Minst 3 års erfarenhet av arbete med informationssäkerhet, cybersäkerhet eller IT-säkerhet
* God förståelse för svenska standarder, regleringar och lagkrav
* Kunskap om ISO 27001, CIS Controls eller motsvarande säkerhetsramverk
* Vana att leda eller delta i säkerhetsprojekt samt utföra riskanalyser
* Har förmåga att agera både självständigt i en konsultroll och integrerat med kundens verksamhet.
* Mycket god kommunikativ förmåga på svenska och engelska, både i tal och skrift
* Meriterande: Certifieringar inom informations- eller IT-säkerhet, exempelvis CISSP, CISM
* Erfarenhet av säkerhetsarbete i molnmiljöer eller hybridmiljöer


 Såhär är det att arbeta hos oss som informationssäkerhetskonsult
   

  

* En inkluderande och hybrid arbetsplats med stort fokus på balans mellan arbete och fritid
* Ständiga möjligheter till kompetensutveckling, utbildningar och certifieringar inom informationssäkerhet
* Stort eget ansvar och möjlighet att påverka både arbetsdag och utvecklingen framåt
* Innovativ och säker arbetsmiljö där kvalitet och säkerhet alltid står i centrum
* Team med kollegor som delar med sig av kunskap – vi utvecklas tillsammans
* Uppdrag och kunder inom flera samhällsviktiga och tekniskt avancerade områden


**Varför kommer du att trivas på IT-Total?**
 IT-Total föddes ur idén att vara det bästa företaget för medarbetare inom sin bransch, därför välkomnar vi dig till en arbetsplats som ger dig glädje, stimulans och möjlighet att växa inom det område du brinner för. Vi är en innovativ arbetsgivare som satsar på din framtid och jobbar i teknikens framkant med ett högt säkerhetstänk. Med säkerhetsprövade medarbetare och säkerhetsklassade lokaler- och datahallar garanterar vi trygghet och integritet för våra kunder.
   

  

**Vi Erbjuder**
 🥪 En himmelsk fredagsfrukost med kollegorna
   

  

 🌍 Hybrid arbetsplats
   

  

 💑 Roligt på jobbet - allt från träning till resor och spelkvällar
   

  

 🍏 Ett välfyllt lager av frukt, nötter, gudomligt kaffe från en Kunglig Hovleverantör om så önskas.
   

  

 🍰 Fredagsfika tillsammans
   

  

 🏡 Ett stenkast till både shopping på Mall of Scandinavia och natursköna Brunnsviken som är perfekt för löpning och lunchpromenader
   

  

 ✔ Goda och trygga anställningsvillkor.
   

  

 🙌 Frihet att styra din egen utveckling och ditt eget arbete, vi tror på "Work life balance"
   

  

 👩🏽‍🤝‍🧑🏼 Kollegor i världsklass som bryr sig 💛
   

  

 🚗 Goda parkeringsmöjligheter
   

  

 🏌️‍♂️ Generöst friskvårdsbidrag
   

  

 Här kan du även läsa mer om våra värderingar
   

  

**Varmt välkommen med din ansökan i formuläret nedan.**
**Har du några frågor gällande tjänsten?**
 Tveka då inte att höra av dig till ansvarig rekryterare:
   

  

 Kajsa Jordansson, Talent Acquisition Manager, IT-Total
   

  

 Mail: kajsa.jordansson@it-total.se
   

  

 Tel: 070 -729 19 82

title: Behandlingsassistent
description:
Stockholm – vår huvudstad med miljoner drömmar, förväntningar och ambitioner. Vi jobbar för alla som lever här idag och i framtiden. Nu söker vi dig som vill tänka stort, nytt och annorlunda med oss – för stockholmarna.
   

  

 Socialförvaltningen i Stockholms stad har en övergripande och samordnande roll för socialtjänstens individ och familjeomsorg och funktionshinderområdet. Här skapas goda förutsättningar för att möta invånare i behov av socialtjänstens stöd. I nära samarbete med stadsdelsförvaltningarna bidrar vi till en modern, digital, rättssäker, likställd och kunskapsbaserad socialtjänst och vi har ett starkt utvecklingsfokus. Inom förvaltningen erbjuds ett stort utbud av stödinsatser till stadens invånare och utbudet förändras utifrån stockholmarnas behov och stadsdelsförvaltningarnas önskemål. Arbetet sker ofta i nära samverkan med andra myndigheter, civilsamhälle och näringsliv. Socialförvaltningen ansvarar också för stadens serverings- och tobakstillstånd och utför tillsyn.
   

  

 Arbetsplatsbeskrivning
   

  

 Syrenen är ett drogfritt, skyddat stödboende för kvinnor 18 år och uppåt som till följd av hemlöshet, våldsutsatthet, missbruk, psykisk ohälsa eller andra svårigheter behöver stöd från socialtjänsten. Syrenen har 24st platser. Personalen består av Enhetschef, gruppledare, administratör och 10st behandlingsassistenter. Verksamheten är bemannad dygnet runt.
   

  

 Syrenen är beläget centralt i city.
   

  

 Vi erbjuder friskvårdsbidrag och semesterväxling.
   

  

 Arbetsbeskrivning
   

  

 Tjänsten erbjuder varierande arbetsuppgifter och utgår från klientens behov och beställarens uppdrag samt andra förekommande sysslor på ett boende.
   

  

 Dina arbetsuppgifter kommer bland annat att vara:
   

  

* Vara kontaktperson och hantera tillhörande uppgifter
* Genomföra in- och utskrivningar av klienter
* Stödja klienter med dagliga aktiviteter (ADL)
* Att dokumentera och journalföra insatser utifrån gällande regler och föreskrifter
* Kontakt med handläggare och myndigheter
* Delta i SIP-möten
* Utföra alkohol- och urinprovstagningar
* Att tillsammans med dina kollegor verka för att skapa goda förutsättningar och uppnå resultat enligt uppdraget för klienten
* Specifika arbetsuppgifter/rutiner finns för hantering av säkerhet/skydd för klienter på skyddat boende


 Du hjälper också till med praktiska sysslor som måltidshantering och städning.
   

  

 Metoder vi arbetar med:
   

  

* ESL (Ett självständigt liv)
* MI (Motiverande samtal)
* Lågaffektivt bemötande
* FREDA


 Kvalifikationer
   

  

 Vi söker dig som som vill vara en del utav vårt team och som är behandlingsassistent eller har annan utbildning som arbetsgivaren bedömer likvärdig.
   

  

 Annan nödvändig erfarenhet och kunskap:
   

  

* Vi söker dig som tidigare har arbetat med kvinnor med missbruk och/eller psykisk ohälsa samt med våld i nära relation och FREDA. Du behöver också ha erfarenhet av att ha arbetat med;
* MI
* Lågaffektivt bemötande
* Beroendekunskap
* Kunskap om psykisk ohälsa
* Grundläggande IT kunskap
* Svenska språket i både tal och skrift


 Vi behöver dig som är självgående, trygg och har en god samarbetsförmåga. Utöver det behöver du även vara:
   

  

* Professionell
* Flexibel
* Kommunikativ


 För att trivas och lyckas i tjänsten behöver du också ha förmågan att organisera, planera och prioritera dina arbetsuppgifter i det dagliga arbetet, både självständigt och tillsammans med dina kollegor. Provanställning kan komma att tillämpas.
   

  

 Övrigt
   

  

 Intervjuer kan ske fortlöpande.
   

  

 Arbetstiderna är rullande 6 veckors schema, dag kl. 7.30-16, kväll kl. 13.30-22, helg kl. 7.30-20.30. Du arbetar 2st helger på 6 veckor.
   

  

 Stockholms stad arbetar med kompetensbaserad rekrytering som syftar till att se till varje persons kompetens och därmed motverka diskriminering.
   

  

 Anställningsform: tillsvidareanställning | Anställningens omfattning: heltid | Antal lediga befattningar: 1 | Sysselsättningsgrad: 100% | Ort: Stockholm | Län: Stockholms län | Land: Sweden | Referensnummer: 2025/4196 | Kontakt: Källström Helena 0850825020, | Facklig företrädare: Per Broman Vision 08-50825580, Gisela Norrman, Kommunal 08-50825188, Sandra Qvist, Akademikerförbundet SSR , | Publicerat: 2025-07-04 | Sista ansökningsdag: 2025-07-18

title: Human Resources Director
description:
At Optimizely, we're on a mission to help people unlock their digital potential. We do that by reinventing how marketing and product teams work to create and optimize digital experiences across all channels. With Optimizely One, our industry-first operating system for marketers, we offer teams flexibility and choice to build their stack their way with our fully SaaS, fully decoupled, and highly composable solution.
   

  

 We are proud to help more than 10,000 businesses, including H&M, PayPal, Zoom, and Toyota, enrich their customer lifetime value, increase revenue and grow their brands. Our innovation and excellence have earned us numerous recognitions as a leader by industry analysts such as Gartner, Forrester, and IDC, reinforcing our role as a trailblazer in MarTech.
   

  

 At our core, we believe work is about more than just numbers -- it's about the people. Our culture is dynamic and constantly evolving, shaped by every employee, their actions and their stories. With over 1500 Optimizers spread across 12 global locations, our diverse team embodies the "One Optimizely" spirit, emphasizing collaboration and continuous improvement, while fostering a culture where every voice is heard and valued.
   

  

 Join us and become part of a company that's empowering people to unlock their digital potential!
   

  

**Introduction**
 The Human Resources Regional Lead will play a key role in driving transformation and innovation in Optimizely’s organization. This position will be instrumental to strategically drive key people initiatives in region in alignment with the global people strategy which is formulated in conjunction with the business strategy.
   

  

 This role will be responsible for overseeing a regional view of HR practices and programs to ensure Optimizers based in EMEA have a positive and rewarding employee experience. The HR Regional Lead will drive high impact work that includes oversight, management and coordination of global activities related to their region, including development, attraction and retention of employees. The HR Regional Lead will have the opportunity to work on transformational projects to improve the efficiency, effectiveness, and strategic position of the HR team.
   

  

**Job Responsibilities**
* Influence decisions made by the centers of excellence such as benefit landscape, employee branding, compensation strategies, policy, process, etc. Incumbent effectively influences peer leaders and business leaders to consider regional implications on business decisions. Working with appropriate teams within and outside of HR on proposals through implementation.
* May support the execution and change management of global practices within the assigned region, such as regional benefits, health and safety, compensation structures, succession planning, talent cycles, retention initiatives, organization development and design, etc. Effectively escalate areas of risk and bring solutions to mitigate risk.
* Act as an adviser or lead changes in the business that impacts the organization in the region, including potential redundancies, negotiations with unions and contact with authorities.
* Manage employee relations cases and escalations as well as performance management cases (PIPs) within the region.
* Serves as an advisor to HR Central and the greater HR team for questions related to employment law, policy creation, legal training requirements, etc.
* Represent the region on behalf of HR when participating or leading global projects, company-wide all-hands, external communications, welcoming new hires, training and development, etc.
* Represents the company region externally. This includes a strong social media presence and establishing themselves as an HR thought leader in the industry and region. Includes active attendance at external events (where budgeted), established HR networking, and regular methods to bring external thought leadership into Optimizely. Presence should influence attraction of high calibre talent attracted to Optimizely, and recognition of Optimizely’s brand and culture in the region (winning best employer awards, etc)
* Support Chief People Officer and other members of the Executive Leadership team on important aspects to improve culture and talent retention. May include executive leadership coaching, partnership with HRBPs on cross regional activities like assessments, ERGs, regional events, stay interviews, career pathing across functions, etc.
* Responsible for having a regional / country view of employee pulse surveys with key activities to improve low areas. Research and present survey actions at country / regional all hands.
* Be active member of senior leadership committees at a regional or site level.
* Signing authority for regional documentation including, offer letters, immigration cases, policy updates, etc.
* May design / facilitate leadership interventions, workshops, or offsites to improve organizational effectiveness.
* Responsible for understanding HR metrics in region and leveraging metrics to influence program design or evaluation of existing programs.


**Knowledge And Experience**
* 8+ years of experience on a global HR team in the technology industry with regional specific expertise
* Strong business acumen to understand business strategy, desired business outcomes and balance people focus.
* Experience driving change processes and legal discussions including negotiations with unions and legal representatives.
* Ability to drive innovation within the region to bring in industry best practices.
* Previous experience partnering with and supporting Executives and senior leaders within a rapidly changing, high growth environment
* Excellent communication skills with ability to handle situations diplomatically and with executive presence.
* Very organized, and highly responsive with ability to drive projects and manage multiple communication channels and global teams.
* Ability to operate independently in region and establish network of trusted colleagues to maintain accurate pulse on region. Ability to work across a highly matrixed HR organization to influence without direct people responsibility.
* Ability to effectively address complex employee relations topics or specific legal matters, partnering with external and internal legal counsel and related stakeholders. This may include government officials.
* Passion to foster an inclusive and diverse culture through initiatives, training & education, communications, and implementing optimizations based on high-level goals.
* Flexibility to meet varying time zones and to work outside normal hours when required
* Ability to achieve results while working under the pressures of shifting priorities in a dynamic and agile environment.
* 20% travel as required
* University/college degree in Human Resources or another relevant discipline.
* Fluent in Swedish


**Education**
**Minimum Of 4 Years Of HR Experience**
 Bachelors Degree, HR qualification preferred
   

  

**Competencies**
 Accepting Responsibility
   

  

 Demonstrating Initiative
   

  

 Establishing Relationships
   

  

 Evaluating and Implementing Ideas
   

  

 Following Policies and Procedures
   

  

 Making Accurate Judgments and Decisions
   

  

 Thinking Broadly
   

  

 Our culture is the most important thing we offer. We continuously aim to provide a high-growth space, both virtually and in person, where you can do your best work and, in the process, unlock your boundless potential. We are dedicated to providing meaningful rewards and development opportunities for our employees, recognizing performance and creating a supportive working environment.
   

  

 Optimizely is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Optimizely is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, protected veteran status, disability, age, or other legally protected status.

title: (Senior) Project Manager in Procurement / Supply Chain Management
description:
At Inverto, we specialize in strategic procurement and supply chain management. We work globally with market-leading companies, developing transformational strategies and implementing them to make their businesses stronger. And you can too – with our continued success, this is your chance to grow as we grow. Our teams want to succeed – and you’ll be in great company, working with people and in a business that supports you to thrive. There’s never been a better time to join us as we develop and build our future together. Are you in?
   

  

**How You'll Impact.**
**Holistic project management.**
 You will be responsible for the development and successful implementation of suitable strategies to optimize the supply chain and strategic procurement process. You will demonstrate your entrepreneurial talent in project controlling and in the acquisition of new customers.
   

  

**Broad range of challenges.**
 Broad customer portfolios and project assignments at home and abroad for a wide variety of industries and customers. From start-ups, retail, and consumer goods, to the energy and automotive industries or the pharmaceutical and healthcare sectors.
   

  

**Intensive customer consulting.**
 You will work closely with customers, be their main contact person and be responsible for conducting your team's workshops, negotiations and presentations.
   

  

**Specific development.**
 Your professional expertise will help to drive forward the development of knowledge in our company.
   

  

**Far-reaching responsibility.**
 You will ensure that your team develops both professionally and personally. As a member of the Inverto management team, you can help shape the development of our entire company and give it the necessary impetus.
   

  

**What You'll Bring.**
**University degree with above-average grades** 
 and 4-8 years of relevant professional experience.
   

  

**Extensive expertise in consulting,** 
 ideally in procurement / supply chain management and a passion for strategic and operational work.
   

  

**You have already proven your analytical and conceptual skills** 
 at management level in demanding projects. You show full commitment, are customer-oriented and cooperative. You have shown that you can successfully lead teams professionally and personally.
   

  

**You thrive in a team** 
 , stay grounded, treat others with fairness, and bring authenticity to every interaction.
   

  

 Confident appearance in an international environment,
 **business fluent in English and any other Nordic language** 
 , flexible in your professional mobility.
   

  

 TOGETHER, WE BENEFIT.
   

  

* Tailored training programs and personalized coaching designed to help you grow and thrive
* Flexible working hours and travel options that support parents and promote work-life balance
* A comprehensive insurance package for your peace of mind
* Access to mental coaching to foster your well-being, resilience, and personal growth
* Individual mobility packages
* Seasonal parties, team events, and get-togethers to foster collaboration and celebrate success
* A rewarding Employee Referral Program that allows you to help grow our team


 APPLY NOW!

title: Senior Sustainability Manager
description:
**We’ve signed up to an ambitious journey. Join us!**
*As Arrive, we guide customers and communities towards brighter futures and more livable cities, it isn’t a challenge just anyone could take on. Luckily, we have something to help us make it happen. Our people and our values. We Arrive Curious, Focused and Together. Just as our entire brand is inspired by the North Star, the shining light leading travelers to their destinations since time began, our values guide us. They help us be at our best. For our customers. For the cities and communities we serve. For ourselves. As a global team, we are transforming urban mobility. Let’s grow better, together.*
 Are you ready to make a lasting impact on sustainability in a growing global company? We are looking for an energetic and hands-on
 **Senior** 
**Sustainability Manager** 
 to join our Communications & Sustainability Team. This is a unique opportunity to help shape our sustainability journey from the ground up, directly contributing to our vision of making cities more livable.
   

  

**The Role**
 As Senior Sustainability Manager at Arrive, you will take on a role with significant responsibility in which you will be the driving force behind our sustainability strategy. This is a new role within the Group and we’re just at the start of building our sustainability program - making this a unique opportunity where your contributions will have a direct impact on the company’s growth and direction.
   

  

 You’ll work closely with our
 **Global Head of Communications & Sustainability,** 
 setting the strategic direction, implementing a climate transition plan, safeguarding human rights in our value chain and driving tangible emissions reduction efforts across all scopes. You will ensure every day brings new and impactful change and you’ll be a key influencer both internally and externally - from operational tasks to presenting strategic initiatives to our Executive Leadership Team.
   

  

 This role is based in Stockholm, Sweden, but you’ll collaborate with colleagues across the globe, ensuring that sustainability becomes an integral part of our culture and operations.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities**
* Create and implement Arrive’s sustainability strategy and roadmap and ensure its successful execution, driving the company toward aligned environmental goals.
* Lead greenhouse gas emission reduction initiatives and champion environmental improvements across the organization.
* Partner with our ESG Reporting Manager to ensure accurate and impactful sustainability reporting and audits.
* Serve as the subject matter expert, providing training and guidance to internal and external stakeholders at all levels and representing Arrive to investors, suppliers, customers and the media.
* Lead initiatives to ensure the organization fully understands and engages in our sustainability objectives.


**Who Are You?**
 You are a sustainability enthusiast with strong communication skills and a proven ability to influence others. You thrive in an entrepreneurial environment where you can take ownership and enact change, while working closely with a small, collaborative team. You are flexible, hands-on and passionate.
   

  

**Key Traits Include**
* You can translate complex sustainability concepts into actionable strategies and drive their implementation.
* You possess excellent communication skills, enabling you to engage and influence diverse internal and external stakeholders.
* You can balance high-level strategy with day-to-day execution.
* You’re comfortable being a self-starter in a new role, taking ownership and collaborating effectively within a small, dynamic team.
* You are structured, persistent, and focused on delivering high-quality, impactful outcomes.
* You embrace change and thrive in a fast-paced environment where sustainability knowledge is evolving.
* You are passionate about making sustainability a key focus for the company, engaging and inspiring others to get involved.


**Key Qualifications**
* Minimum of five years of experience in sustainability including consulting or corporate roles, preferably within international organizations.
* A degree in business, engineering, communications, or a related field, with a focus on climate or environmental studies preferred.
* Excellent verbal and written communication skills in English and Swedish is a plus.
* Proven track record of managing projects and driving change management initiatives.
* Proficient in carbon accounting and the GHG protocol, sustainability reporting standards, and a broad understanding of ESG.
* A record of influencing senior executive opinion, advising and shaping approaches to managing commercial issues.


 About us Arrive, including brands like EasyPark, Flowbird, RingGo, ParkMobile and Parkopedia, is a leading global mobility platform. Present in over 90 countries and 20,000 cities, the company helps people and decision-makers make smarter decisions about urban mobility and ease the experience of travel worldwide. Arrive delivers a unique combination of the core ingredients to make cities more livable: from smart payments and optimized car parks to data-driven traffic reduction and support for reinvestment in public transport and green space. It’s about more than function, it’s about saving time and simplifying the experience of travel for everyone. Travel is more than a journey, it’s how you Arrive.
   

  

 Arrive, including brands like EasyPark, Flowbird, RingGo, ParkMobile and Parkopedia, is a leading global mobility platform. Present in over 90 countries and 20,000 cities, the company helps people and decision-makers make smarter decisions about urban mobility and ease the experience of travel worldwide. Arrive delivers a unique combination of the core ingredients to make cities more livable: from smart payments and optimized car parks to data-driven traffic reduction and support for reinvestment in public transport and green space. It’s about more than function, it’s about saving time and simplifying the experience of travel for everyone. Travel is more than a journey, it’s how you Arrive.

title: Account Manager Siemens Smart Infrastructure Buildings, Stockholm
description:
Vill du vara med och forma framtidens smarta byggnader och samtidigt bidra till en mer hållbar värld? På Siemens Smart Infrastructure utvecklar vi innovativa lösningar som kopplar samman energi, byggnader och människor – och vi söker nu en engagerad Account Manager till vårt team i Stockholm.
   

  

**Din roll – skapa värde, bygga relationer, driva affärer**
 Som Account Manager är du en nyckelperson i vår fortsatta tillväxtresa. Du ansvarar för att identifiera affärsmöjligheter, utveckla långsiktiga kundrelationer och erbjuda lösningar som skapar verkligt värde för våra kunder. Genom värdebaserad försäljning hjälper du våra kunder att nå sina mål, samtidigt som du driver Siemens affär framåt.
   

  

**Du kommer att:**
* Arbeta nära kunder på ledningsnivå inom fastighetssektorn och industrin
* Ansvara för hela säljprocessen från prospektering till avtal
* Utforma erbjudanden, prissätta och förhandla
* Ha budgetansvar och arbeta strukturerat i vårt CRM-system
* Vara en del av ett engagerat team med höga ambitioner och starkt kundfokus


**Vad du tar med dig**
 Vi söker dig som är affärsdriven, lyhörd och har ett genuint intresse för teknik och kundrelationer. Du trivs i en miljö där innovation och hållbarhet står i centrum, och du har förmågan att omsätta kundens behov till konkreta lösningar.
   

  

**Vi ser gärna att du har:**
* Flera års erfarenhet av försäljning, gärna inom industri eller fastighetsautomation
* Kunskap inom fastighetsautomation, brand- och säkerhetssystem eller IT är en bonus för oss!
* Erfarenhet av digitala lösningar och molnplattformar
* B-körkort
* Goda kunskaper i svenska och engelska, både i tal och skrift


**Vad vi erbjuder dig**
* Ett flexibelt arbetssätt som främjar balans mellan arbete och privatliv
* Friskvårdsbidrag på 5 000 SEK och tillgång till företagshälsovård
* Bonusprogram och individuella utvecklingsmöjligheter
* En inkluderande företagskultur där du får vara dig själv
* Tillgång till marknadsledande teknik och kontinuerlig kompetensutveckling


**Om Siemens**
 Siemens är ett globalt teknikföretag med över 351 000 medarbetare världen över, varav cirka 4 200 i Sverige. Vi är ledande inom elektrifiering, digitalisering och automatisering, och har som mål att vara klimatneutrala till år 2030. Hos oss får du vara med och skapa framtidens samhälle.
   

  

**Ansök redan idag** 
 – Observera att återkoppling kan dröja under semesterperioden, men vi ser fram emot din ansökan och återkopplar så snart vi är tillbaka efter semestern!
   

  

 För frågor om tjänsten, kontakta rekryterande chef Ulrik Persson på ulrik.persson@siemens.com
   

  

 För frågor om rekryteringsprocessen, kontakta ansvarig rekryterare Ellen Ahlberg på ellen.ahlberg@siemens.com
   

  

 I denna rekrytering undanber vi oss alla samtal rörande annonsering och rekryteringsstöd.

title: Workplace Strategist
description:
*Letar du efter din nästa utmaning inom arbetsplatsutveckling? Drivs du av att omvandla kunders visioner till konkret förändring? Vill du vara med och skapa framtidens arbetsplatser tillsammans med branschens ledande aktör?* 




  





**Vi söker nu efter en Workplace Strategist till Coor Advisory Sverige** 




 Coor Advisory söker en erfaren projektledare med god vana att självständigt driva transformationsprojekt. Vill du vara en nyckelperson i ett framåtlutat team som formar innovativa arbetsmiljöer för både dagens och framtidens behov? Hos Coor Advisory får du en central roll i Sveriges och Nordens ledande satsning på arbetsplatsstrategisk rådgivning, och bidrar till att Coor stärker sin marknadsposition som Facility Management-leverantör.
 



  





 Rapporterar till: Tillförordnad Chef Coor Advisory Sverige.
 



 Placeringsort: Coors nya toppmoderna huvudkontor i Solna Arenastaden/Haga Norra.
 



  





**Rollens fördelning** 



* Strategisk rådgivning och självständigt driva arbetsplatsprojekt (ca 75%)
* Bedriva aktivt säljarbete och bygga kundrelationer (ca 15%)
* Positionera Coor som strategisk partner (ca 10%)
* Bidra till interna utvecklingsinitiativ



  





**Huvudsakliga arbetsuppgifter och ansvar** 



* Självständigt leda och driva utvecklings- och förändringsprojekt för arbetsplatser, från strategi och förstudie till transformation.
* Utveckla arbetsplatsstrategier och koncept i nära dialog med kundens ledningsgrupp och specialister.
* Ansvara för workshops, analyser, projektledning, samt processutveckling.
* Aktivt säljarbete: stärka och underhålla långsiktiga kundrelationer, arbeta med anbud och offerter.
* Positionera Coor som strategisk rådgivare genom deltagande i kundmöten, forum och mässor, samt bidra med artiklar och referenscase.
* Omvärldsbevakning och kontinuerlig kompetensdelning inom kollegiet.



  





**Kravprofil** 




 Bakgrund och erfarenheter:
 


* 4–10 års relevant erfarenhet, t.ex. som managementkonsult eller projektledare inom arbetsplatsutveckling/strategi.



  





 Meriterande:
 


* Tekniskt eller digitalt intresse, erfarenhet av dataanalys.
* Erfarenhet av att kravställa för t.ex. AV/IT, säkerhet, inredning.
* Certifiering i förändringsledning (t.ex. Proci).



  





 Färdigheter:
 


* Mycket goda kunskaper i Excel och PowerPoint.
* Flytande svenska och engelska, i tal och skrift.



  





 Personliga egenskaper:
 


* Stark självledare, initiativtagande och modig.
* Kommunikativ och pedagogisk.
* Affärsdriven, lojal och lösningsorienterad.
* Noggrann och ansvarstagande.
* Relationsbyggare, flexibel i samarbete.



  





**Om Coor Advisory** 




 Coor Advisory har på tre år vuxit från en svensk satsning till en nordisk verksamhet med cirka 20 arbetsplatsstrateger, där Sverige är störst. Coor Advisory drivs som en självbärande, tillväxtorienterad del av Coor och hjälper företag att utveckla strategier för attraktiva, moderna och hållbara arbetsplatser, anpassade efter kundens unika behov och mål. Coor Advisory ansvarar för hela förändringsresan och skapar arbetsmiljöer som inspirerar och stödjer framtidens hybrida arbetssätt.

title: Data Platform Architect
description:
Title: Data Platform Architect
Reports to: Head of Architecture
Entity: Digital and Synthetic
Group: Digital and Synthetic Capability: Architecture
Work Arrangement: Hybrid


Company Overview


Metrea is a defense company dedicated to translating commercial innovation into solutions for the hardest problems in national security. With deep mission expertise, Metrea focuses on delivering effects-as-a-service across Aerospace, Electromagnetic & Cyber, Digital & Synthetic domains via its capability groups. Metrea also consists of six support groups (Operations, People, Finance, Legal, Strategy and Solutions) that guide the development of specific capabilities that Metrea's files (product, projects, programs etc) leverage to achieve their targets.

  

Group Overview


The Digital and Synthetic Capability Unit (D&S) is committed to providing mission-driven information solutions that seamlessly bridge the digital and physical realms. Leveraging cutting-edge technologies and advanced platforms, we empower operational readiness and elevate situational awareness across diverse domains—including air, maritime, and space.

  

Position Summary


We are seeking an experienced Data Platform Architect to lead a cross-functional data & cloud engineering team in the design and implementation of our next-generation cloud-native data platform.
  

This role will be responsible for architecting a comprehensive data ecosystem that supports diverse data ingestion and consumption patterns, advanced data structures, and appropriate storage solutions while owning and adhering to our data ontology.  

Role and Responsibilities  

Architecture & Design* Design and architect scalable, cloud-native data platform solutions supporting both real-time and batch processing workloads
* Define data architecture patterns, data models, and integration strategies across heterogeneous data sources
* Establish API-first design principles and create comprehensive API specifications for data services
* Design data governance frameworks, security models, and compliance strategies
* Create technical roadmaps and guide technology stack decisions

  

Technical Leadership* Lead a cross-functional team including data engineers, cloud engineers, and software engineers
* Collaborate with data scientists and analytics teams to understand platform requirements for advanced use cases
* Drive architectural reviews and technical decision-making processes
* Mentor engineering teams on best practices for data platform development
* Establish coding standards, design patterns, and operational procedures

  

Platform Strategy* Evaluate and recommend technologies for data ingestion, processing, storage, and serving layers
* Design multi-tenant, self-service data platform capabilities
* Architect solutions for data lineage, quality monitoring, and observability
* Plan for platform scalability, performance optimization, and cost management
* Ensure platform supports diverse data types (structured, semi-structured, streaming)

  

Stakeholder Collaboration* Work closely with product managers to translate business requirements into technical solutions
* Partner with security and compliance teams to ensure data protection and regulatory adherence
* Collaborate with infrastructure teams on cloud resource planning and optimization
* Present architectural decisions and trade-offs to leadership and technical teams

  

Skills and Experience

* 8+ years of experience in data engineering, platform architecture, or related fields
* Technologist with proven experience in building innovative and ground-breaking data solutions.
* Proven experience architecting large-scale data platforms in cloud environments (AWS, Azure, GCP) and leading technical teams
* Deep understanding of data processing frameworks (Spark, Kafka, Flink, Airflow)
* Strong knowledge of data storage technologies (data lakes, data warehouses, NoSQL, streaming)
* Experience with containerization, orchestration (Kubernetes, Docker), and microservices and event-driven architectures
* Proficiency in API design and development (REST, GraphQL, gRPC, JSON, Kafka)
* Understanding of data governance, security, and compliance frameworks
* Excellent communication skills with ability to present complex technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders
* Solid programming fundamentals with ability to review code and guide technical decisions across multiple languages
* Experience with Infrastructure as Code (Terraform, CloudFormation)
* Familiarity with CI/CD pipelines and DevOps practices
* Knowledge of monitoring and observability tools (Prometheus, Grafana, ELK stack)
* Experience with data catalog and metadata management tools

  

Additional Eligibility Qualifications

* Advanced degree in Computer Science or Engineering
* Understanding of analytics and data science workflows
* Certification in major cloud platforms
* Experience with data mesh or federated data architecture patterns

  

Our Culture


Metrea’s single core value, “rooted in humility,” is supported by four key attributes: entrepreneurial, systematic, discerning, and over-deliver. These attributes, combined, form our Teammate Firmware, our culture. We explore these attributes during the hiring process when we grow our teams and continually support the growth of our culture. We are a hyper-collaborative, dynamically hierarchical organization united by a passion for what we do, how we do it, who we do it with, and who we do it for.

  

Benefits


D&S - UK
Private Medical Insurance
Subsided gym membership / plans through Wellhub
Electric Car scheme
Cycle to work scheme
£1500 Training Allowance
30 days annual PTO plus b/h
Eye Tests  

D&S Sweden
Friskvård of 5K annually
Personal development budget (2K for books, courses, subscriptions etc)
Parental leave
5% occupational pension (swe. tjänstepension),
30 days of leave
Discretionary Bonus  

Right to Work


The employee will have the legal right to work in the United Kingdom and will be able to produce right to work documentation.

  

Work Authorization / Security Clearance


Ability to achieve and maintain a Security Clearance.  




  

Equal Opportunities Statement
  

Metrea is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Employment decisions are made without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or other characteristics protected by law.

  

Position Type and Expected Hours of Work
  

This is a full-time non-exempt position with typical working hours of Monday through Friday, 9:00 a.m. to 6:00 p.m. Hours and work shifts may change in accordance with department and business needs. Exempt Employees must have the ability to be on-call and available, as business needs require. Non-Exempt employees may be required to work over 40 hours per week with approval from the department manager.

  

Work Location
  

UK / Sweden

  

Work Environment
  

This job operates in an office setting

title: ERP Project Manager
description:
We’re looking for an experienced Project Manager with a strong track record of leading ERP deployments, particularly Microsoft Dynamics 365 (F&O, CE, or Business Central). You’ll manage end-to-end implementation projects, coordinate cross-functional teams, and ensure delivery meets scope, budget, and timeline. This role requires someone who understands both the technical and functional sides of ERP delivery and can effectively communicate with stakeholders at all levels.
  
  

Candidates must be required to work hybrid from Stockholm, Sweden or Kolding, Denmark
  
  

Tasks
  
  

* Lead the full project lifecycle of ERP implementations (planning, execution, monitoring, and closure)
* Manage scope, timelines, and budgets using Agile, Waterfall, or hybrid methodologies
* Coordinate with technical consultants, functional leads, and client-side teams
* Serve as the primary point of contact for client communication and issue resolution
* Oversee UAT planning, execution, and sign-off with business users
* Conduct risk assessments and implement mitigation strategies
* Ensure adherence to change management and governance standards
* Provide pre-sales support and input on project estimations and proposals
* Advise clients on ERP best practices and process improvements
* Manage documentation, reporting, and stakeholder updates


Requirements
  
  

* Proven experience as an ERP Project Manager, ideally with D365 F&O/CE/BC
* Strong understanding of ERP project phases, from discovery to go-live and support
* Experience working with cross-functional teams including business analysts, developers, and QA
* Strong communication, leadership, and stakeholder management skills
* Familiarity with UAT processes, integrations, data migration, and cutover planning
* Hands-on experience with Microsoft Project, DevOps, or similar tools
* PMP, Prince2, or Agile certification is a plus

title: TECHNICAL INITIATIVE MANAGER – ENABLE THE JOURNEY TO SAP S/4HANA AND BEYOND
description:
**Drive meaningful digital change in a global company.**


Duni Group is now recruiting a Technical Initiative Manager – a skilled project manager with strong experience in IT delivery and a solid understanding of SAP and enterprise platforms. In this role, you'll lead impactful technical projects in a dynamic IT environment – from SAP-related initiatives (including our ongoing S/4HANA journey) to broader technology and infrastructure projects that shape our digital foundation.

**About the role**


As Technical Initiative Manager, you will be responsible for planning, leading, and delivering technical projects – often involving multiple systems, vendors, and internal teams. While SAP is a core part of our landscape, your scope will not be limited to SAP. Projects may include integrations, upgrades, infrastructure improvements, and platform transformations.


You will work closely with architects, internal IT, external partners, and business stakeholders to ensure that each project is delivered on time, within scope, and aligned with Duni Group’s technology standards. This is a hands-on role that requires strong project management skills, technical understanding, and the ability to coordinate across diverse teams.

**Your responsibilities include, but are not limited to**

* **Lead key technical initiatives** – Drive major IT projects like the SAP S/4HANA migration, or other non SAP technical initiatives, from planning to execution.
* **Cross-functional collaboration** – Work closely with architects, IT teams, and business stakeholders to turn technical vision into reality. Represent technical interests, review solutions, and contribute to architectural decisions.
* **Integrations and SAP tenant landscape** – Ensure a consistent system architecture and optimal environment planning (DEV/QAS/PROD) in close collaboration with our integration architect, BASIS and SAP team.
* **Cloud security and readiness** – Collaborate with cybersecurity teams to ensure a secure and compliant cloud setup.
* **Governance and tooling** – Own SAP Cloud ALM and support project tracking, testing, and reporting.
* **Risk and progress oversight** – Identify risks, track progress, and communicate effectively with management.
* **Documentation and knowledge sharing** – Maintain clear technical documentation and support team learning.

**To succeed in the role, we believe you have**

* Strong track record of technical project leadership – especially in SAP environments.
* App. 5-10 years of combined SAP technical and project management experience.
* Understanding of SAP, preferable S/4HANA migrations, including architecture and simplification.
* Familiarity with key SAP tools (e.g., SUM, Readiness Check, ATC, Custom Code Analyzer).
* Working knowledge of integration technologies like IDocs, APIs, CPI, and SAP BTP.
* Experience in coordinating cross-functional teams, including internal and external stakeholders (on- and offshore delivery models).
* Excellent communication and stakeholder management skills – you can translate technical topics into clear business language.

**Meritorious**

* Project management certifications (e.g., PMP, PRINCE2).
* SAP certifications (e.g., System Conversion to S/4HANA).
* Experience with SAP Activate methodology and SAP Cloud ALM.
* Familiarity with enterprise architecture tools like LeanIX or SAP Signavio.
* Experience with DevOps, hybrid agile delivery models.

**Why Duni Group?**

* Be part of a high-impact transformation that touches every part of the business.
* Work with enthusiastic, skilled colleagues in a collaborative and empowering environment.
* Shape the future of IT at a company that values innovation, quality, and long-term thinking.
* Enjoy flexibility, autonomy, and the opportunity to gain experience professionally while making a real difference.
* Opportunity to work in a global environment.


Ready to take the lead? Apply today and help us build the foundation for tomorrow. We are excited to meet the person who will take our SAP landscape – and our digital journey – to the next level.

**Application**


In this recruitment process, we co-operate with the recruitment company ComCube. If you are interested and match the profile, please send us a cover letter and a CV in English where you describe your experience and expertise in the areas outlined above. Please answer the following questions in your cover letter:

* **Why are you interested in the position as Technical Initiative Manager at Duni Group?**
* **What do you think you can contribute with as Technical Initiative Manager at Duni Group?**


If you have any questions regarding the recruitment process or the position, you are very welcome to contact Helena Heijmink, +46 70 554 03 42, helena.heijmink@comcube.se or Helena Fransson, +46 70 554 05 04 or who are our consultants in this process. Please apply for the position as soon as possible but no later than the 31st of August. Note! The position may be filled prior to the application deadline. You apply the for position by following this link:  

https://comcube.varbi.com/se/what:job/jobID:842258/We can only accept applications through the link above.

**About Duni Group**  

Duni Group is a market leader in sustainable dining and food packaging solutions for the restaurant market. The Group markets and sells its products under primarily the brands Duni, BioPak and Paper+Design, which are represented in more than 40 markets. Duni Group has around 2,700 employees in 26 countries, its headquarters in Malmö and production units in Sweden, Germany, Poland, Slovenia, United Kingdom and Thailand. Duni Group is listed on NASDAQ Stockholm under the ticker “DUNI”.  

  

If you have not already gotten a good feeling for who we are, go to our website https://www.dunigroup.com/. Here you can read more about who we are and what we are enthusiastic about. Hopefully, you want to be part of our team!  

  

Duni Group is a Career Company  

Duni Group has been recognized as one of Sweden’s top 100 employers for the fourth year in a row. The recognition comes from Karriärföretagen (Career Company), an organization that has been presenting Sweden’s most attractive employers since 2011. Companies go through a selection process by an expert panel and a qualified jury, to be named a Career Company by Karriärföretagen. Duni Group has been recognized for creating a joyful and passionate workplace, offering our employees opportunities to gain experience personally and professionally. We have also been acknowledged for our strong focus on innovation and sustainability.

title: DevOps Enablers till Gripen
description:
*Drivs du av att se dina idéer bli verklighet? Välkommen till vår spännande och teknikintensiva värld.*


Din Roll


Som DevOps Enabler är du spindeln i nätet mellan mjukvaruutveckling och IT operations, som förstår, för dialog med, och ser till att våra utvecklare har bästa möjliga förutsättningar att jobba smart, snabbt och effektivt. Du är kittet, kommunikatören och möjliggöraren som säkerställer att behov och förmåga går hand i hand i vår ständigt föränderliga vardag.


Du trivs med att lösa komplexa, mångfacetterade problem, även när all information inte är tillgänglig. Du kan hitta lösningar som är både praktiska och genomförbara. Du kommer främst att arbeta på kontoret, men räkna med att även tillbringa viss tid i simulatorer och flygplansriggar.


Din Profil


I arbetet ingår många kontaktytor och där kommer din kommunikations- och samarbetsförmåga och din styrka att skapa och vårda relationer att vara en viktig del. Ett väl utvecklat självledarskap med förmåga och vilja att strukturera ditt arbete och ta egna initiativ kommer att vara en framgångsfaktor. Du ser lösningar i problem och kan fånga upp andras behov.


Vi kommer tillsammans att bygga upp en engagerad och kompetent grupp och säkerställa att vi gemensamt skapar moderna, skalbara och användarvänliga miljöer som stödjer utvecklingsprocesserna och affärsmålen.


Arbetet sker både internt inom avdelningen och i nära samarbete med motsvarande organisationer inom BU Gripen, AN IT och Group IT.


TADS, Tactical, Avionics and Display Systems, har verksamhet både i Tannefors och Järfälla, och tjänsten kräver att du tillbringar viss tid på plats i Järfälla.


Befattningen kräver att du genomgår och godkänns enligt vid var tid gällande bestämmelser för säkerhetsskydd. För befattningar där Saab har krav på säkerhetsklassinplacering kan, i förekommande fall, medföra krav på visst medborgarskap.


Vad du blir en del av


Bakom våra innovationer finns alla de som har gjort det möjligt. Modiga pionjärer och kluriga tänkare. Vardagshjältar och kreativa problemlösare. De som delar djup kunskap och de som utforskar nya områden. Och alla däremellan.


Här har du chansen att påverka och bidra på ditt unika sätt. Allt från att utveckla kod och bygga imponerande försvars- och säkerhetslösningar till att ta en kaffe med en kollega. Varje bidrag räknas. Vi ger dig möjlighet att anta utmaningar och skapa smarta innovationer. I vår vänliga och tekniksmarta värld finns plats för dig att växa. Vi finns här för att tillsammans skapa trygghet för människor och samhällen.


Saab är ett ledande försvars- och säkerhetsföretag med uppdrag att hjälpa nationer att skydda sin befolkning och bidrar till trygghet för människor och samhällen. Med 25,500 talangfulla medarbetare utvecklar Saab teknik och lösningar för en säkrare och mer hållbar värld.


Saab utvecklar, tillverkar och underhåller avancerade system inom flygteknik, vapen, ledningssystem, sensorer och undervattenssystem. Saab har sitt huvudkontor i Sverige men en global verksamhet där Saab är en del av många nationers försvarsförmåga. Läs mer om oss här.


.


Vänligen observera att vi arbetar med löpande urval och tjänsten kan komma att tillsättas innan sista ansökningsdatum har gått ut.
company_description: Saab serves the global market with world-leading products, services and solutions from military defense to civil security.

title: Teknisk skribent– bidra till en säkrare framtid
description:
Om tjänsten
  
Vår kund i Stockholm fortsätter att växa och söker en engagerad och driven teknisk skribent som vill göra skillnad. I denna roll finns möjligheten att arbeta i spännande uppdrag hos branschledande kunder, framför allt inom försvarsindustrin och inom avancerad IT-infrastruktur.
  
  

Som teknisk skribent får du en central roll i att skapa struktur och tydlighet inom komplex teknisk information. Arbetet innebär att både ta fram, uppdatera och underhålla teknisk dokumentation för olika system och produkter, vilket kan inkludera allt från monteringsanvisningar och användarmanualer till avancerade instruktioner inom IT och infrastruktur.
  
  

Du erbjuds
  
* Möjlighet att utvecklas tekniskt i en vardag där ingen dag är den andra lik
* Arbeta i ett inkluderande team där kunskapsdelning och kollegialt stöd är en självklarhet
* Vara en del av ett företag med ett starkt samhällsuppdrag, där du får göra konkret skillnad


Arbetsuppgifter
  
Uppdraget utförs både självständigt och i nära samarbete med tekniska experter och systemadministratörer. Dokumentationen kan rikta sig till både interna användare, myndigheter och externa kunder, vilket ställer höga krav på språklig precision, teknisk förståelse och pedagogisk förmåga.
  
* Skapa och uppdatera teknisk produktdokumentation, exempelvis systembeskrivningar, användarinstruktioner, underhållsmanualer och utbildningsmaterial
* Strukturera, enhetliggöra och kvalitetssäkra dokumentationens tekniska nivå
* Migrera dokumentation mellan olika verktyg och plattformar
* Samarbeta med tekniska experter, systemadministratörer och övriga specialister för att samla in, förstå och verifiera information
* Arbeta i verktyg som exempelvis Azure DevOps, Confluence, Visio och Office-paketet


Din profil
  
  

**Krav:**  

* Eftergymnasial utbildning inom teknik, exempelvis maskin, elektronik, IT eller motsvarande område
* Flera års erfarenhet av arbete som teknisk skribent
* Mycket god förmåga att förstå och förklara tekniska lösningar i text
* Flytande svenska och engelska i både tal och skrift
* Goda kunskaper i Office-paketet


**Meriterande:**  

* Erfarenhet av standarder som S1000D och ASD-STE
* Förståelse för terminologi inom Försvarsmakten och FMV
* Tidigare arbete med XML-verktyg
* Erfarenhet av dokumentation inom IT-infrastrukturmiljöer (t.ex. servrar, nätverk, databaser, virtualisering)
* Erfarenhet från försvarsindustrin eller militär bakgrund, särskilt inom ILS (Integrated Logistics Support)


Den vi söker är nyfiken, lösningsorienterad och strukturerad med en naturlig drivkraft att leverera kvalitet. Det är viktigt att kunna organisera sitt arbete effektivt, samtidigt som samarbete och kommunikativ förmåga är avgörande.
  
Tjänsten omfattas av försvarssekretess, vilket innebär att godkänd säkerhetsprövning med registerkontroll är ett krav. För vissa uppdrag kan krav på visst medborgarskap förekomma.
  
  

Övrigt
  
**Start:** Enligt överenskommelse
  
**Omfattning:** Heltid
  
**Placering:** Stockholm
  
  

Om oss
  
På Cleverex Bemanning arbetar vi med att rekrytera och hyra ut rätt medarbetare till rätt kund. Vårt största fokus ligger på våra kunder, konsulter och kandidater och vårt mål är att du som kandidat ska känna att du hamnat helt rätt!
