title: Data Scientist
description:
**Description**
**What We're Looking For:**
 We are looking for a passionate Data Scientist specializing in Natural Language Processing (NLP) and Machine Learning (ML) to contribute to Data Enrichment efforts within Meltwater. As a part of this role, you will work with experienced team members and product managers to design, test, and implement machine learning solutions.
   

  

 Through Meltwater's innovative social listening platform, we ensure our clients never miss any mention of their brand or essential topics across various platforms, automating the entire social listening process.
   

  

 Partner with us and be part of a diverse community that values your unique contributions, empowering you to reach new heights. Join us in crafting something extraordinary.
   

  

**What You’ll Do:**
* Contribute to the development of scalable algorithms for processing large datasets, implement and evaluate machine learning and deep learning algorithms for tasks such as text classification, sentiment analysis, entity recognition, and summarization.
* Assist in the design, development, and testing of ML models for real-time processing of unstructured data.
* Collaborate with senior team members to analyze the impact of algorithm changes.
* Learn and grow under mentorship, gaining exposure to industry-standard NLP tools and techniques.


**What You’ll Bring:**
* Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science or a related field, with 2-4 years working experience OR a Master’s Degree in Computer Science or a related field, with 0-2 years working experience.
* Programming Language: Proficiency in Python.
* Solid understanding of data structures and algorithms.
* Proficient in Machine Learning, including understanding Neural Networks and foundational concepts of NLP tasks such as Tokenization, Named Entity Recognition (NER), Sentiment Analysis, Part-of-Speech (POS) Analysis.
* Experience or coursework in Deep Learning frameworks like TensorFlow or PyTorch.
* Strong problem-solving skills and a curiosity for learning new technologies.
* Good verbal and written communication skills.
* Familiarity with cloud platforms (e.g., Azure (preferable), AWS, or Google Cloud).
* Basic knowledge of containerization tools like Docker and orchestration platforms like Kubernetes.
* Interest in infrastructure-as-code tools like Terraform.
* Passion for exploring the intersection of NLP and emerging fields such as generative AI or multimodal systems.


**What We Offer:**
* Enjoy 25 days of annual paid time off plus an additional day off on your birthday!
* Gain exclusive access to Avanza Avanza, enhancing your financial opportunities and investment options
* Enjoy automatic enrollment into the comprehensive PlanSjuk Silver and PlanLov, ensuring seamless access to healthcare benefits and financial security.
* Complimentary CalmApp subscription for you and your loved ones, because mental wellness matters.
* Energetic work environment with a hybrid work style, providing the balance you need
* Benefit from our family leave program, which grows with your tenure at Meltwater.
* Thrive within our inclusive community and seize ongoing professional development opportunities to elevate your career.


**Where You'll Work:** 
 Brahegatan 10, 11437 Stockholm
   

  

**Our Story**
 The sky is the limit at Meltwater.
   

  

 At Meltwater, we believe that when you have the right people in the right working environment, great things happen. Our best-in-class technology empowers our 27,000 customers around the world to analyze over a billion pieces of data each day and make better business decisions.
   

  

 Our award-winning culture is our north star and drives everything we do – from striving to create an environment where all employees do their best work, to delivering customer value by continuously innovating our products — and making sure to celebrate our successes and have fun along the way.
   

  

 We’re proud of our diverse team of 2,300+ employees in 50 locations across 25 countries around the world. No matter where you are, you’ll work with people who care about your success and get the support you need to reach your goals.
   

  

 So, in a nutshell, that's Meltwater. We love working here, and we think you will too.
   

  

**Equal Employment Opportunity Statement**
*Meltwater is an Equal Opportunity Employer and Prohibits Discrimination and Harassment of Any Kind: At Meltwater, we are dedicated to fostering an inclusive and diverse workplace where every employee feels valued, respected, and empowered. We are committed to the principle of equal employment opportunity and strive to provide a work environment that is free from discrimination and harassment.*
*All employment decisions at Meltwater are made based on business needs, job requirements, and individual qualifications, without regard to race, color, religion or belief, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, marital status, veteran status, or any other status protected by the applicable laws and regulations.*
*Meltwater does not tolerate discrimination or harassment of any kind, and we actively promote a culture of respect, fairness, and inclusivity. We encourage applicants of all backgrounds, experiences, and abilities to apply and join us in our mission to drive innovation and make a positive impact in the world.*

title: Consultant, Technology Enabled Transformation
company_industry: IT Services and IT Consulting, Information Services, and Research Services
description:
**About the role:**
 Gartner’s Consulting business is an
 ***extension***
 of Gartner’s industry-leading IT Research. From CIOs, to leaders in business and government, we help Gartner clients across enterprises translate insights into transformational actions and achieve their mission-critical priorities. Leveraging the breadth of Gartner’s resources, Consulting is growing rapidly, with unlimited potential to continue expanding our client base.
   

  

 Technology Strategy Consulting. We help the C-suite make the right decisions based on how technology can transform their businesses. In today’s world, a consulting firm that is “born digital”, (with the ability to directly leverage the full power of Gartner’s research and insights) has relevance to the most important strategic decisions any business will make.
   

  

**What You’ll Do**
 As a Consultant working at the highest senior levels within our clients’ organizations you will have the opportunity to make a real difference in shaping, managing and delivering real value assisting our clients in successfully managing their technology and defining their IT strategies.
   

  

**What you’ll do:**
* Identify, develop and document issues and recommendations using independent judgment concerning engagement areas being reviewed.
* Conduct research, interviews and presentations for clients (executive and/or board level)
* Assist with the comprehensive cost / benefits analysis and preparation of business cases for technology investments.
* Assist in coordinating and communicating the results of engagements via written reports and oral presentations to client management and key stakeholders
* Contribute to the development of project management, quality assurance and professional consulting and auditing approaches/methodologies.
* Participate in delivery of strategic IT consulting engagements, within a given timeframe and budget, for a variety of clients, which include IT benchmarking and general IT consulting.


**What you’ll need:**
* Diversified strategic IT experience (technology, organization and processes).
* A strong skillset in Architecture or Cloud or Infrastructure or Application development or AI.
* Consulting experience in a similar role in a professional services firm or industry. experience at a strategic or management level.
* Analytical skills.
* Flexibility and adaptability; able to change direction quickly and thoughtfully under changing client needs.
* Minimum of a Bachelor’s degree.
* Excellent project management skills, team work capacity, strong work ethic and willingness to travel and work in a diverse international environment.
* Fluent in Swedish language.
* Swedish security clearable.


**Who you are:**
* Excellent presentation and communication skills, both written and spoken
* Ability to articulate IT strategies and understand business strategies
* Comfortable influencing and building trust-based, value-added relationships with senior executives
* Coachable and embracing of best practices and feedback as a means of continuous improvement
* Consistently high achiever marked by perseverance, humility and a positive outlook in the face of challenges
* Maintain a senior consultant level expertise and currency in industry leading information management technologies
* You will have a natural aptitude for critical and analytical thinking, as well as the capacity to accept out-of-the box solutions


**Who are we?**
 At Gartner, Inc. (NYSE:IT), we guide the leaders who shape the world.
   

  

 Our mission relies on expert analysis and bold ideas to deliver actionable, objective insight, helping enterprise leaders and their teams succeed with their mission-critical priorities.
   

  

 Since our founding in 1979, we’ve grown to more than 21,000 associates globally who support ~14,000 client enterprises in ~90 countries and territories. We do important, interesting and substantive work that matters. That’s why we hire associates with the intellectual curiosity, energy and drive to want to make a difference. The bar is unapologetically high. So is the impact you can have here.
   

  

**What makes Gartner a great place to work?**
 Our sustained success creates limitless opportunities for you to grow professionally and flourish personally. We have a vast, virtually untapped market potential ahead of us, providing you with an exciting trajectory long into the future. How far you go is driven by your passion and performance.
   

  

 We hire remarkable people who collaborate and win as a team. Together, our singular, unifying goal is to deliver results for our clients.
   

  

 Our teams are inclusive and composed of individuals from different geographies, cultures, religions, ethnicities, races, genders, sexual orientations, abilities and generations.
   

  

 We invest in great leaders who bring out the best in you and the company, enabling us to multiply our impact and results. This is why, year after year, we are recognized worldwide as a great place to work.
   

  

**What do we offer?**
 Gartner offers world-class benefits, highly competitive compensation and disproportionate rewards for top performers.
   

  

 In our hybrid work environment, we provide the flexibility and support for you to thrive — working virtually when it's productive to do so and getting together with colleagues in a vibrant community that is purposeful, engaging and inspiring.
   

  

 Ready to grow your career with Gartner? Join us.
   

  

 The policy of Gartner is to provide equal employment opportunities to all applicants and employees without regard to race, color, creed, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital status, citizenship status, age, national origin, ancestry, disability, veteran status, or any other legally protected status and to seek to advance the principles of equal employment opportunity.
   

  

 Gartner is committed to being an Equal Opportunity Employer and offers opportunities to all job seekers, including job seekers with disabilities. If you are a qualified individual with a disability or a disabled veteran, you may request a reasonable accommodation if you are unable or limited in your ability to use or access the Company’s career webpage as a result of your disability. You may request reasonable accommodations by calling Human Resources at +1 (203) 964-0096 or by sending an email to ApplicantAccommodations@gartner.com.
   

  

 Job Requisition ID:100549
   

  

 By submitting your information and application, you confirm that you have read and agree to the country or regional recruitment notice linked below applicable to your place of residence.
   

  

 Gartner Applicant Privacy Link: https://jobs.gartner.com/applicant-privacy-policy

title: Project Manager
description:
**Join PDSVISION – Lead the Digital Transformation Journey as a Project Manager**
 Are you an experienced Project Manager passionate about delivering impactful enterprise system solutions? PDSVISION is expanding in the Nordic region, and we’re looking for a dynamic Project Manager to lead complex customer implementation projects across the PTC, Ansys, and PDSVISION product portfolios
   

  

**About Us**
 PDSVISION is a global technology partner helping companies successfully navigate their digital transformation journeys. We specialize in:
   

  

* 3D Design (CAD)
* Product Lifecycle Management (PLM)
* Product Data Management (PDM)
* Simulation & Modeling (CAE)
* Internet of Things (IoT)
* Augmented Reality (AR)
* Aftermarket Solutions


 With offices across Europe and the US, and partnerships with industry leaders PTC and Ansys, we support over 950 customers globally—from innovative local firms to large multinational enterprises.
   

  

**Your Role: Project Manager**
 As a Project Manager, you’ll be the driving force behind the successful delivery of enterprise-level system implementation projects. You’ll manage cross-functional teams, oversee timelines and budgets, and ensure projects deliver real value to our customers.
   

  

**Responsibilities:**
* Lead end-to-end delivery of customer projects involving PLM, CAD, CAE, and related enterprise systems
* Own project planning, resource coordination, risk management, and stakeholder communication
* Collaborate closely with technical consultants, architects, and customers to align solutions with business goals
* Maintain strong customer relationships and act as the primary point of contact throughout the project lifecycle
* Facilitate post-implementation reviews to capture learnings and continuously improve delivery practices
* Contribute to the development and refinement of internal project methodologies and best practices


**What’s In It For You**
 Many of our employees have been with us for a long time, mainly because of what we offer:
   

  

* A clear career path: We have a solid plan to help you grow and take the next steps in your career.
* Continuous learning and mentorship: You’ll be supported by experienced colleagues who guide you through training, certifications, and real-world challenges that broaden your skills.
* A strong professional network: Build valuable connections with peers, experts, and a wide range of companies, from global enterprises to innovative local firms across our 950+ customers.
* Technical variety: Work hands-on with a diverse mix of technologies including, large-scale PLM enterprise systems, databases, on-premise and cloud servers, and Active Directory.
* A knowledge-sharing culture: Join a team that values collaboration and continuous improvement, where you’ll grow both technically and as a trusted advisor to our customers.


**What You Bring**
* Proven experience as a Project Manager in enterprise system implementation projects (e.g., PLM, ERP, CAD, CAE)
* Ability to manage multiple workstreams in parallel, while keeping stakeholders engaged and informed
* Solid understanding of IT systems and software delivery, ideally in industrial or engineering contexts
* Strong leadership, organizational, and communication skills
* Collaborative mindset and ability to navigate diverse technical and business environments
* Bachelor’s degree in Engineering, Computer Science, Information Systems, or a related field


**Bonus if you also have experience with:**
* PTC Windchill, Creo, or Ansys solutions
* Agile or hybrid project methodologies
* Working in multi-vendor or multi-system customer environments
* Certifications such as PMP, PRINCE2 or Scrum Master


**Other Information:**
 Full-time probation period for 6 months to move over to permanent employment.
   

  

**Salary:**
**Individual Salary Dependent On Skills And Experience**
**Excited?**
 Please apply for the job here.
   

  

 Recommendations, resumes and diplomas should be brought if you are selected for an interview. We will not contact your current employer without your consent.
   

  

 PDSVISION does not offer sponsorship to non-European applicants.

title: AI & Innovation Lead
description:
**Sambla Group is a fintech company with a clear goal – to make loans better for all. We need you, your ambition and your skills on our journey. We have become the fast-growing fintech company that we are today - bridging the gap between borrowers and lenders - thanks to all the 300+ amazing people who work here.**
**Our success is the result of the commitment to deliver the best customer journey and consumer finance products in the industry. Our vision is to democratize lending and empower customers to improve their personal finances. Through our well known brands such as Sambla, Advisa, Rahalaitos, Omalaina, Rahoitu and DigiFinans we support customers in consolidating and getting the best terms on their loans.**
**As the AI & Innovation Lead at Sambla Group** 
 , your primary focus will be on driving business transformation and growth through AI and innovation initiatives. You will be at the heart of our quest to push boundaries and redefining what is possible for our company. You will work across all aspects of the business to enable innovative solutions that enhance efficiency, customer experience and our competitive advantage and lead the agenda for development and deployment of Generative AI, Intelligent Agents, Robotic Process Automation (RPA) and advanced analytics. Your role combines strategic vision with technical leadership to foster a culture of continuous innovation, identify new value opportunities, and unlock the full potential of AI to accelerate business success.
   

  

**Responsibilities**
* Lead the AI & Innovation team and own the AI & Innovation strategy and roadmap across the business
* Identify opportunities for value creation and efficiency across the business through use of AI, automation and advanced analytics
* Develop use cases and business cases and recommend prioritisation of initiatives to Sambla Group Management and Board
* Lead development and deployment of AI & Innovation projects from scoping through deployment and scaling to transition projects from idea to proof-of-concept/value to production
* Lead and drive the adoption of various Gen AI solutions, Intelligent Agents, and RPA initiatives across Sambla Group, including developer experience, end-customer solutions, and automation via multi-agent workflows.
* Maintain effective stakeholder management to ensure alignment, support and progress
* Design and guide best practices and architectural guidelines for AI model development, testing, deployment, monitoring, and auditing, with a focus on responsible tech


**Must-Have Requirements**
* Deep demonstrable expertise in AI, particularly in LLM and RPA, with a strong background in data science or engineering
* An academic degree in software engineering or data science.
* Proven track record in leading digital transformation projects and AI product development/deployment
* Strong knowledge in Generative AI technologies, platforms, and Intelligent Agents
* Excellent managerial and organisational skills and demonstrated ability to lead teams and complex projects effectively
* Expertise in project management and agile methodologies
* Excellent communication and stakeholder management skills
* Ability to work collaboratively in a fast-paced environment


**In addition to the must-have requirements,** 
 candidates with experience in cloud-based AI solutions, familiarity with data privacy regulations, a background in machine learning and data analytics, and a vision aligned with redefining personal finances through cutting-edge technology will be highly regarded.
   

  

**What We Offer**
* Business in mind & people at heart – we deliver results together and celebrate our achievements.
* A varied and challenging role in a multinational and highly innovative company, where we value the development of our employees
* We are strong believers in creating a fun workplace where people enjoy coming to work.
* A friendly culture with openness and respect for one another, with the possibility to influence and make a difference on society and people’s everyday lives.


 Sambla Group is the new generation of brokers. Our ambition has always been the same - to challenge the banks’ offers so that our customers, regardless of the conditions, should always have the same opportunity to obtain the best possible loan solution. Sambla Group has grown to over 350 employees, established itself in Sweden, Norway, Finland and Denmark with offices in Sweden, Finland and Denmark.

title: Senior Consultant
description:
*Vill du vara med och driva arbetet inom molntjänster och IT-infrastruktur?
   

  

 På Advania hjälper vi våra kunder att modernisera sina IT-miljöer, optimera leveransen och skapa säkra, skalbara IT-lösningar. Här får du möjlighet att arbeta i ett team av experter och vidareutveckla din kompetens i samarbete med andra specialister.*
 Senior Consultant på Advania 🚀
   

  

 Som Senior Consultant hos oss spelar du en central roll i att initiera, implementera och förvalta moderna IT-lösningar som möter kundernas verksamhetsbehov.
   

  

**Dina huvudsakliga arbetsuppgifter inkluderar:**
* Teknisk rådgivning för ett antal kunder med fokus på säkerhet och proaktivitet.
* Design och implementering av tekniska lösningar on-prem och i cloud.
* Drift och utveckling av centrala servermiljöer och managerade tjänster.


**Du ansvarar även för att:**
* Äga och driva mindre förbättringsprojekt för nya och befintliga tjänster mot kund.
* Förbereda, leda och handleda workshops med kund som teknisk rådgivare.


 Rollen är baserad i Solna och du rapporterar till Head of Delivery Teams. Teamet som du ingår i består av ett mindre team på 4-6 personer och är en del av en större grupp med bred specialistkompetens inom exempelvis Nätverk, Windows Server, Klient, Microsoft SQL och Microsoft 365. Du samarbetar nära andra konsulter samt med våra sälj- och projektteam.
   

  

 Vad som gör denna roll unik⭐
   

  

 Det här är en roll för dig som vill arbeta i en teknisk miljö där din expertis inom Microsofts plattformar verkligen kommer till sin rätt. Du får möjlighet att arbeta med avancerade molnprojekt, samarbeta med andra specialister och kontinuerligt fördjupa din specialistkunskap. Här finns stora möjligheter att påverka och driva innovation tillsammans med våra kunder och likasinnade kollegor.
   

  

 Vad vi söker hos dig ✨
   

  

 För att du ska trivas och lyckas hos oss söker vi dig med en bakgrund inom konsultrollen och tydligt affärsfokus. Du arbetar idag som Technical Account Manager eller tekniskt ansvarig och trivs i en roll där teknik och kundfokus möts.
   

  

 Du är ansvarstagande, har ett starkt driv och en entreprenöriell ådra. Du motiveras av att hjälpa kunder att förverkliga sina verksamhetsbehov och att driva tekniken framåt.
   

  

 Hos oss får du arbeta i team där laget går före jaget. Din vardag kommer i stor utsträckning att handla om att lösa problem tillsammans, i en miljö där du använder din specialistkunskap för att skapa verkligt kundvärde.
   

  

**Vi söker dig som har:**
* Som har erfarenhet av Microsofts infrastruktur, med fokus på servermiljöer och Azure.
* Certifiering inom AZ-104 Azure Administrator Associate eller AZ-800 Administering Windows Server Hybrid Core Infrastructure är meriterande.
* Erfarenhet av MSP-branschen är meriterande.


 Vi ser fram emot din ansökan! 👋
   

  

 Visa gärna ditt intresse så snart som möjligt då vi intervjuar löpande. Vi välkomnar sökanden med olika bakgrunder, erfarenheter och synsätt, eftersom vi vet att en bredare mångfald berikar var och en av oss och stärker såväl effektivitet som kreativitet i vårt arbete.
   

  

 Som en del av vår rekryteringsprocess genomgår våra slutkandidater en obligatorisk bakgrundskontroll, en för oss kvalitativ kontroll inför ett anställningsbeslut. Advania samarbetar även med Ljung & Sjöberg för en proaktiv arbetsplats kopplat till alkohol och droger.
   

  

 Tveka inte att höra av dig om du har några frågor eller funderingar.

title: Data Scientist
company_industry: IT Services and IT Consulting and Climate Data and Analytics
description:
**Data Scientist** 




  





 Do you want to design cutting-edge AI and ML solutions, work with advanced data models, and empower businesses with innovative analytics?
 



  





 Nexer Insight is looking for a talented Data Scientist to join our team in Stockholm, Malmö, or Gothenburg. We invite you to embark on an exciting journey where you'll work with fascinating clients, tackle varied and challenging tasks, and enjoy exceptional benefits. At Nexer Insight, we are committed to leveraging advanced analytics, machine learning, and AI to drive innovation and deliver impactful solutions for our clients.
 



  





**Nexer Insight** 




 Nexer Insight is a company that embodies entrepreneurship and innovation. As a Data Scientist with us, you'll work with cutting-edge technologies, including LLMs (Large Language Models), RAG (Retrieval-Augmented Generation), and advanced AI solutions. We value teamwork, professional growth, and a vibrant community spirit. With us, you'll have the opportunity to work on exciting projects, collaborate with experts in the field, and make a meaningful impact in the intersection of data science and AI.
 



  





**Key Responsibilities** 



* Develop advanced AI/ML models and design solutions leveraging LLMs for various AI use cases, including RAG and intelligent agents.
* Apply machine learning, statistical methods, and predictive modeling to solve real-world problems.
* Build and deploy data pipelines and cloud-based architectures for ML workloads and MLOps.
* Innovate and collaborate with clients to discover new business opportunities and develop tailored solutions.
* Work with NLP, computer vision, and containerized applications to deliver high-impact projects.
* Leverage platforms like Azure Databricks, Azure Data Lake, and Azure ML for scalable and efficient workflows.
* Promote best practices for data science, from architecture and data quality to reliability and performance.



  





**Who You Are** 




 We expect you to have:
 


* Minimum 4 years within Data Science
* Strong understanding of LLMs and experience building solutions on top of them for AI-driven solutions.
* Experience with RAG and AI-driven agents.
* An analytical mindset and strong business acumen.
* Problem-solving aptitude and a proactive mindset.
* Hands-on experience with applied ML, statistics, and cloud architectures for MLOps.
* Proficiency in Python, PySpark, and familiarity with tools like Databricks.
* Knowledge of computer vision, NLP, SQL, and containerized apps.
* Experience with Azure cloud services such as Azure ML and Azure Data Lake.
* Fluency in Swedish and English.



  





**Why Nexer Insight?** 




 At Nexer Insight, we invest in our employees by providing professional development, certifications, and a vibrant working culture. With us, you'll be part of a team pushing boundaries and using advanced data science to create meaningful solutions for leading clients.
 



  





 Are you ready to take the next step in your career and explore the forefront of AI and data science? Apply today and join us on this exciting journey!

title: Cyber Security Operations Analyst
description:
Odevo is a group of exciting brands with a shared vision of challenging status quo in the property management industry. We are committed to revolutionizing the industry with innovative software solutions that make managing properties easier, more efficient, and more effective. Our rapidly growing product and engineering organization now includes more than 150 highly skilled professionals.
   

  

 Our cloud-based platform is unique, and in a brief time, we have proven ourselves as a leading and innovative player on the market. Our product development department acts as a SaaS supplier to all the companies in the Odevo group and several other players in the industry. Together, we will continue to challenge and change this industry. To continue our ambitious growth journey, we seek more great people to join us to build market-leading property management software products. Are you one of them?
   

  

 Are you passionate about safeguarding digital landscapes and ensuring the intregity of critical systems and data? We're committed to building a strong Information Security function to empower our organization with effective protection strategies. Our team is dedicated to developing reliable security platforms, implementing business enabling practices, and delivering impactful security solutions across the company.
   

  

 We're seeking a Cyber Security Operations Analyst to join our IT Operations Information Security team, with a focus on enhancing our security posture. In this role, you'll collaborate with Security Engineers, IT teams, Developers, and various other stakeholders to create security solutions that strengthen our defence mechanisms. You'll help shape our security practices across operations, transforming vulnerabilities into fortified defences that drive performance, transparency, and growth.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities**
* Support our Security Engineer with our vulnerability management program, provide reporting and assist IT owners with security weaknesses
* Own the penetration test schedule for Odevo, co-ordinating with third parties who provide our pen tests
* Work with software developers to help ensure secure coding practices are in place
* Assist in security incidents, determine root cause, and recommend corrective actions
* Participate in the design and implementation of security solutions
* Stay up-to-date on the latest security threats, vulnerabilities, and best practices
* Collaborate with other IT teams to ensure the security of systems and applications


**Who You Are**
 You possess strong communication skills, enabling you to effectively engage with both technical and non-technical stakeholders. Your detail-oriented nature and proactive approach to problem-solving and solution design make you adept at working with complex security challenges, translating them into clear and actionable security insights.
   

  

**Experience**
* 2+ years of proven experience in a Cyber Security role.
* Strong understanding of security principles, concepts, and technologies, particularly in vulnerability management.
* Excellent analytical, problem-solving, and communication skills.


**Desired Experience (but Not Required)**
* Degree in Information Security or a related field
* Experience with Cloud Security in Microsoft Azure and Google Workspace environments
* Proficiency in scripting languages such as Bash, Python, and Kusto Query Language (KQL).
* Cyber security-related certifications (e.g., GIAC)


**What We Offer**
* Professional growth - to work with the most talented developers in the industry.
* Modern technology - we invest in the latest technologies and tools and encourage our team members to share their ideas and take ownership of their work.
* Innovation - to work on exciting projects that push the boundaries of our industry and make a real impact.
* Commitment to quality - a dynamic and forward-thinking company that values profitable and long-term product development.


**Excited?**
 If you are excited about being part of a successful team, apply for this position!
   

  

 👉🏽 Why we formed Odevo
   

  

 🔍 About Odevo
   

  

 🌐 Our Software
   

  

 #a

title: HPC System Manager
description:
**Job Description**
 PDC is expanding its group of system administrators. We are looking for one new system manager to become an integral part of our System Operations team currently consisting of nine people, running PDC's computational and storage infrastructure. The work includes administration of the HPC and storage infrastructures and services, development of these services based on user needs and technological advances, and close interaction with the PDC application experts, users and suppliers of computing systems and software.
   

  

 PDC operates state-of-the-art computational and storage resources for a variety of scientific application domains, including mechanics, computational chemistry, life sciences and physics. PDC's current flagship system is an The center currently operates the most powerful academic computer in Sweden, an HPE Cray EX with 1282 CPU nodes and 70 GPU nodes with just over 500 GPUs in total. Please see https://www.pdc.kth.se for more information.
   

  

 What we offer
   

  

* A position at a leading technical university that generates knowledge and skills for a sustainable future.
* Engaged and ambitious colleagues along with a creative, international and dynamic working environment
* Work in Stockholm , in close proximity to nature
* Opportunities to attend training and conferences.


 Read more about what it's like to work at KTH and our benefits.
   

  

**Qualifications**
**Requirements**
* An academic degree in computer/computing science or in an area that uses HPC calculations or equivalent experience/skills.
* Extensive experience using, deploying, and administrating large Linux-based systems and services, as well as experience operating large HPC systems, preferably in an academic/research environment.
* Excellent knowledge of Linux, standard programming and scripting languages.
* A good command of English. However, it is not necessary to be able to speak Swedish as PDC is an international environment and the work language is English.
* It is very important that you are able to both work well independently and collaborate effectively.


**Preferred Qualifications**
* Cluster management systems (e.g. HPCM, Xcat).
* Management of physical server infrastructure (e.g. IPMI, Redfish).
* PC-specific APIs and technologies (e.g. Slurm, MPI, OpenMP, CUDA).
* Virtualisation (e.g. OpenStack, Docker, Singularity).
* Storage systems and technologies (e.g. Lustre, TSM).
* Networking (High speed interconnects, TCP/IP, LAN, WAN).
* Computer hall infrastructure.


 Great emphasis will be placed on personal skills.
   

  

**Trade union representatives**
 Contact information to trade union representatives.
   

  

**To apply for the position**
 Log into KTH's recruitment system in order to apply for this position. You are responsible to ensure that your application is complete according to the instructions in the ad. Your complete application must be received by KTH no later than the last day of application, midnight CET/CEST (Central European Time/Central European Summer Time).
   

  

 The application must include:
   

  

* CV including relevant professional experience and knowledge.
* A personal letter describing why the applicant is interested in this position.


**About The Employment**
 The employment is valid until further notice (permanent post) according to agreement.
   

  

 The employment begins with a six-month probationary period.
   

  

**Other Information**
 Striving towards gender equality, diversity and equal conditions is both a question of quality for KTH and a given part of our values.
   

  

 For information about processing of personal data in the recruitment process.
   

  

 It may be the case that a position at KTH is classified as a security-sensitive role in accordance with the Protective Security Act (2018:585). If this applies to the specific position, a security clearance will be conducted for the applicant in accordance with the same law with the applicant's consent. In such cases, a prerequisite for employment is that the applicant is approved following the security clearance.
   

  

 We firmly decline all contact with staffing and recruitment agencies and job ad salespersons.
   

  

 Disclaimer:
 *In case of discrepancy between the Swedish original and the English translation of the job announcement, the Swedish version takes precedence*
 About KTH KTH Royal Institute of Technology in Stockholm has grown to become one of Europe’s leading technical and engineering universities, as well as a key centre of intellectual talent and innovation. We are Sweden’s largest technical research and learning institution and home to students, researchers and faculty from around the world. Our research and education covers a wide area including natural sciences and all branches of engineering, as well as architecture, industrial management, urban planning, history and philosophy. Read more here

title: Group Head of Professional Services
job_function: Information Technology, Customer Service, and Consulting
company_industry: Software Development, IT System Custom Software Development, and Construction
description:
*Aceve is in business to back the builders of society. We are the SaaS powerhouse, built by engineers, developers, salespeople, administrators, marketeers, controllers, and much mor. With over 500 employees, more than 950 million SEK in revenue and extensive experience in the field, we combine tradition and tech to provide a pioneering platform that helps our customers to achieve more.* 




  





  





**What will you do?** 




 We are looking for an experienced and hands-on Head of Professional Services to establish and lead this function at Group level. This role will define the strategic direction, operational standards, and performance model for professional services across all Aceve entities.
 



  





 The Professional Services organization encompasses:
 



 - Customer onboarding and implementation
 



 - Consulting and training services
 



 - Advisory on workflow optimization
 



 - Revenue realization through billable services
 



  





 You will own the frameworks, tooling, delivery methodology, KPIs, and financial model that ensures services are delivered efficiently, profitably, and with consistent quality across markets.
 



**Group-Level Strategy & Operating Model** 




 -Build and implement the group-wide Professional Services operating model — including structure, processes, playbooks, pricing, and KPIs
 



 - Define the service tiers, commercial offerings, and delivery methodology (e.g., white-glove vs. self-serve)
 



 - Drive alignment across local teams to ensure consistency in delivery and customer experience
 



**Customer Onboarding & Time to Value** 




 - Define and enforce onboarding standards to reduce implementation time, lower onboarding cost, and maximize onboarding revenue
 



 - Develop segmentation-specific onboarding paths (e.g., SMB, Mid-Market, Enterprise)
 



 - Establish and track KPIs like Time to Value (TTV), Implementation Margin, and Activation Rates
 



**Consulting & Value-Add Services** 




 - Create packaged and custom consulting services (workflow audits, process reengineering, system integrations)
 



 - Drive cross-sell of services into existing customer base in partnership with Sales and Customer Success
 



**Commercial Model & P&L Accountability** 




 - Define commercial structure (rate cards, margins, utilization targets) for all professional services
 



 - Support budgeting, forecasting, and performance tracking across countries
 



 - Partner with finance to improve gross margin from service delivery
 



**Performance Management & Enablement** 




 - Standardize delivery KPIs: billable utilization, CSAT/NPS, delivery velocity, attach rate
 



 - Implement tools and systems to support service delivery (e.g., PSA systems, playbooks, project trackers)
 



 - Recruit, train, and develop a high-performing professional services leadership layer across geographies
 



 - Identify best practices and roll-out on group level
 



**Cross-functional Alignment** 




 - Collaborate closely with Sales, Customer Success, Product, and R&D to drive end-to-end customer success
 



 - Ensure readiness to support international expansion and product launches from a delivery standpoint
 



  





  





**Qualifications & Skills:** 



* 8–12+ years in a Professional Services, Customer Success, or SaaS Delivery leadership role
* Proven track record building or scaling professional services in a B2B SaaS company
* Experience with both direct implementation and partner-led delivery models
* Strong grasp of delivery metrics: time to value, utilization, margin, attach rate, CSAT
* Experience working in or with private equity-owned businesses is a strong plus
* International exposure (especially across Nordic or European markets)
* Structured, analytical, and outcomes-driven; thrives in operational design and execution
* Commercially savvy; understands revenue and cost drivers in services P&L
* Strong cross-functional leadership, collaboration and stakeholder management
* Can operate in a high-growth, fast-paced, and often ambiguous environment
* Fluent in English; additional Nordic or Germanic languages are a plus



  





  





**Not ticking every box?** 
 No worries! We value potential and drive, so apply anyway or connect with us- you might be just what we're looking for in our growing organisation! Join Aceve and take your expertise to the next level, together we are redefining what’s possible in craft and construction solutions!
 



  





  





*Aceve is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees. Our selection process is conducted continuously and without discrimination, ensuring an equal opportunity for all candidates.*

title: Delivery Practice Manager
job_function: Project Management, Management, and Product Management
description:
**Description**
 At Amazon Web Services (AWS), we’re looking for an experienced leader to build our Engagement Management Professional Services specialty team. As the person in this role, you will be responsible for ensuring the successful delivery of engagements. You will partner with other AWS ProServe organizational leaders to expedite stakeholder alignment, team cohesion and risk mitigation while ensuring feedback loops close the engagement lifecycle. You will be a strategic business partner assisting in development of internal teams in agile frameworks best practices and AWS’ prescriptive practices to accelerate both innovation and migration scenarios with customers.
   

  

 Professional Services engage in a wide variety of projects for customers and partners, providing collective experience from across the AWS customer base and are obsessed about strong success for the Customer. Our team collaborates across the entire AWS organization to bring access to product and service teams, to get the right solution delivered and drive feature innovation based upon customer needs.
   

  

**Eligibility Requirement**
* This role requires you to be a Swedish National and have business level proficiency in the Swedish language


 Key job responsibilities
   

  

* Engage customers - collaborate with enterprise sales managers to develop strong customer and partner relationships and build a growing business in a geographic territory, driving AWS adoption in key markets and accounts.
* Leadership – build and lead a team of individuals who will be responsible for the successful delivery of projects with our most strategic customers.
* Advisory – work as a strategic business partner to help customers achieve their business outcomes and help to drive innovation throughout the engagement life cycle.
* Talent Development and Training – Enable customers, partners and internal teams on our agile delivery framework, AWS’ prescriptive way of working, and continue to develop and iterate on the current methodology.
* Drive a consistent project/engagement experience for our customers through our Engagement Manager community.
* Solutions - This includes participating in pre-sales, on-site visits, understanding customer requirements, proposing and delivering ProServe offerings such as mass migration programs, and help develop custom solution engagements.
* Expertise - Collaborate with AWS field sales, pre-sales, training and support teams to help partners and customers learn and use AWS services in key market verticals & regulated industries such as financial services, media/entertainment, and healthcare/life sciences.
* Delivery - Deliver and manage multi-stream technical engagements with partners and customers. Provide oversight at executive level and enable communication on program or project’s progress and financials tailored to the audience. The Engagement Manager is responsible for managing customer expectations, managing AWS delivery consultants, and managing the scope and budget of each individual project.
* Feedback - Work with AWS engineering, support and business teams to convey partner and customer feedback and lessons learned.


 A day in the life
   

  

 AWS Global Services includes experts from across AWS who help our customers design, build, operate, and secure their cloud environments. Customers innovate with AWS Professional Services, upskill with AWS Training and Certification, optimize with AWS Support and Managed Services, and meet objectives with AWS Security Assurance Services. Our expertise and emerging technologies include AWS Partners, AWS Sovereign Cloud, AWS International Product, and the Generative AI Innovation Center. You’ll join a diverse team of technical experts in dozens of countries who help customers achieve more with the AWS cloud.
   

  

**About The Team**
 AWS Global Services
   

  

 AWS Global Services includes experts from across AWS who help our customers design, build, operate, and secure their cloud environments. Customers innovate with AWS Professional Services, upskill with AWS Training and Certification, optimize with AWS Support and Managed Services, and meet objectives with AWS Security Assurance Services. Our expertise and emerging technologies include AWS Partners, AWS Sovereign Cloud, AWS International Product, and the Generative AI Innovation Center. You’ll join a diverse team of technical experts in dozens of countries who help customers achieve more with the AWS cloud.
   

  

 Diverse Experiences
   

  

 AWS values diverse experiences. Even if you do not meet all of the preferred qualifications and skills listed in the job description, we encourage candidates to apply. If your career is just starting, hasn’t followed a traditional path, or includes alternative experiences, don’t let it stop you from applying.
   

  

 Why AWS?
   

  

 Amazon Web Services (AWS) is the world’s most comprehensive and broadly adopted cloud platform. We pioneered cloud computing and never stopped innovating — that’s why customers from the most successful startups to Global 500 companies trust our robust suite of products and services to power their businesses.
   

  

 Inclusive Team Culture
   

  

 AWS values curiosity and connection. Our employee-led and company-sponsored affinity groups promote inclusion and empower our people to take pride in what makes us unique. Our inclusion events foster stronger, more collaborative teams. Our continual innovation is fueled by the bold ideas, fresh perspectives, and passionate voices our teams bring to everything we do.
   

  

 Mentorship & Career Growth
   

  

 We’re continuously raising our performance bar as we strive to become Earth’s Best Employer. That’s why you’ll find endless knowledge-sharing, mentorship and other career-advancing resources here to help you develop into a better-rounded professional.
   

  

 Work/Life Balance
   

  

 We value work-life harmony. Achieving success at work should never come at the expense of sacrifices at home, which is why we strive for flexibility as part of our working culture. When we feel supported in the workplace and at home, there’s nothing we can’t achieve.
   

  

**Basic Qualifications**
* Managed a team whose primary responsibility is program/project management in a professional services environment
* Extensive, hands on experience leading the delivery of multiple enterprise-level IT consulting projects using Agile/Iterative and Waterfall methodologies
* Experience developing and maintaining executive relationships (C-level CIO, CTO, CISO, etc) with the ability to articulate complex concepts concisely to collaborate among technical and non-technical stakeholders.
* Ability to manage internal and external cross-functional teams in fast-paced matrix partner and customer organizations.


**Preferred Qualifications**
* Extensive experience managing and leading delivery of large portfolios or programs across one or more industry verticals such as Media and Entertainment, and Telecommunications
* Proficiency in cloud technology value proposition, principles, and services including infrastructure, business applications, data management, security, application platforms, and consumer facing technology
* AWS certifications, AWS engagement delivery experience or other public cloud certifications
* Project Management certification (PMP, PRINCE) and/or Agile (e.g., APM, CSM, PMI-ACP, SAFe SM, CSPO) certification
* Post Graduate Degree (e.g., MBA, MS Computer Science, etc.)


 Amazon is an equal opportunities employer. We believe passionately that employing a diverse workforce is central to our success. We make recruiting decisions based on your experience and skills. We value your passion to discover, invent, simplify and build. Protecting your privacy and the security of your data is a longstanding top priority for Amazon. Please consult our Privacy Notice (https://www.amazon.jobs/en/privacy\_page) to know more about how we collect, use and transfer the personal data of our candidates.
   

  

 Our inclusive culture empowers Amazonians to deliver the best results for our customers. If you have a disability and need a workplace accommodation or adjustment during the application and hiring process, including support for the interview or onboarding process, please visit https://amazon.jobs/content/en/how-we-hire/accommodations for more information. If the country/region you’re applying in isn’t listed, please contact your Recruiting Partner.
   

  

  

**Company** 
 - AWS EMEA SARL (Sweden Branch)
   

  

 Job ID: A3025204

title: Marknadskoordinator
description:
Marknadskoordinator
 



*Autoexperten är en rikstäckande butiks- och bilverkstadskedja och är en ledande aktör på den svenska fordonsmarknaden med cirka 54 butiker och 360 anslutna verkstäder och mer än 4.500 företagskunder. På Autoexperten jobbar vi långsiktigt för att få bilar att leva längre genom att underhålla, serva och reparera. Vi har dessutom en trygghet och styrka med KG Knutsson AB i ryggen, ett familjeägt bolag som har drygt 950 medarbetare och en omsättning på ca 4 miljarder kronor. Läs mer om oss på www.autoexperten.se  och www.kgk.se eller på våra sociala medier.* 




  





 Ansökan gör du på https://kgk.se/karriar/
 



**Sista ansökningsdag:** 
  2025-08-31
 



  





 Vill du vara med där det händer och bidra till att stärka Autoexpertens varumärke? Som marknadskoordinator hos oss får du en varierad vardag med både kreativt och operativt arbete. Du blir en viktig del av ett sammansvetsat team där vi stöttar varandra och utvecklas tillsammans. Om du drivs av att göra skillnad varje så tror vi att detta kan vara tjänsten för dig, välkommen med din ansökan!
 



  





**Om tjänsten** 




 Då en av våra medarbetare i teamet kliver in i en ny roll internt söker vi därför en marknadskoordinator. På en marknadsavdelning om 18 personer består teamet som arbetar med varumärket Autoexperten av fem personer som tillsammans säkerställer att rätt budskap når våra verkstäder och butiker. Det som utmärker teamet är deras höga tempo och kreativa ådra. Man samarbetar nära varandra i teamet men också med andra funktioner. Den här tjänsten ger dig möjligheten att växa och utvecklas inom marknadsföring, både strategiskt och praktiskt.
 



  





**Arbetsuppgifter, bland annat** 



* Samordna och ansvara för utskick av nyhetsbrev till verkstad och butik
* Uppdatera skärminnehåll på digitala skärmar i butik och verkstad
* Publicera material på intranätet
* Uppdatera olika CMS-system
* Samarbeta med vår inhouse produktion
* Bidra till utveckling av vår kommunikation
* Delta i framtagandet av kampanjer och kommunikationsinsatser
* Ta fram och publicera rekryteringsannonser
* Delta på olika events
* Vara behjälplig med Sociala medier



  





 "Det bästa med mitt team är att vi har ett starkt driv och ett öppet klimat där idéer snabbt blir verklighet. Som marknadskoordinator får du vara med och påverka – och du ser resultatet av ditt arbete direkt ute i våra butiker och verkstäder." Petra Binken, Marknadschef Autoexperten
 



  





**Vi söker dig som** 



* Har en avslutad gymnasieexamen
* Har erfarenhet av att arbeta på en marknadsavdelning eller reklambyrå
* Talar och skriver obehindrat på både svenska och engelska
* Har B-körkort
* Är van vid digitala plattformar såsom sociala medier, nyhetsbrev och CMS-system
* Behärskar Officepaketet väl



  





**Det är meriterande om du** 



* Har arbetat i Marketing Cloud eller liknande system
* CRM, gärna Salesforce
* Har erfarenhet av AI i ditt arbete



  





 För att trivas i rollen tror vi att du tycker att det är viktigt med layout, färg och form. Du tar gärna egna initiativ och eftersom du jobbar mot tajta deadlines är du van att ta ansvar för ditt arbete. Självklart har du en stark servicekänsla och god social kompetens eftersom du arbetar över gränserna och därför befinner dig i många olika sammanhang.
 



  





**Du erbjuds** 



* En utvecklande roll i ett engagerat team
* Möjlighet att påverka och ta egna initiativ
* Ett stabilt svenskt företag med starka varumärken



  





**Övrigt** 



* Heltid, tillsvidareanställning, vi tillämpar provanställning
* Placering: Sollentuna, Stockholm
* Vi tillämpar löpande urval – tjänsten kan tillsättas innan sista ansökningsdag. Rekryteringsprocessen kan dröja något på grund av sommarledighet.



  





 Vi ser fram emot möjligheten att välkomna dig till KGK / Autoexperten.

title: Machine Learning Engineer | AI Foundations
description:
**About The Team**
 Schibsted's AI Foundations team is looking for a machine learning engineer to help advance AI across the company, facilitating AI experiments and development.
   

  

 Located in Sweden and Norway, the team is responsible for building and maintaining core AI infrastructure and ML platform services for the company, as well as supporting the development of AI models and solutions. We collaborate with many other parts of the organisation to enable new AI initiatives, including experiment teams, product development, security & privacy, as well as journalists.
   

  

 What will you do in this role?
   

  

 You’ll play an important role in shaping our AI platform offering. Specifically, you will:
   

  

* Work together with product teams to develop and augment our vector store products to serve article, podcast, video, or user embeddings for personalisation and search.
* Partner with AI experiment and data infrastructure teams to develop LLM agents, RAG solutions and other pipelines that interact with our own data products
* Develop and deploy novel models for Schibsted's recommender systems, text-to-speech or video.
* Monitor, maintain, and build out our hybrid infrastructure to serve internal (LLM, RL, etc.) models cost-effectively.
* Refine our batch ML workload orchestration platform together with our users.
* Develop self-serve API solutions for accessing external LLM providers and internal LLM endpoints.
* Support experimentation and testing of new AI solutions facing millions of users (e.g., Hej Aftonbladet).
* Contribute to AI operations: setting up dashboards and alerts for our infrastructure and models.
* Contribute to a shared understanding of ML/AI knowledge and expertise and promote machine learning literacy across the company.
* Challenge and inspire the team by staying current with the latest advancements in machine learning and related technologies.


 What we’re looking for
   

  

 You bring a strong engineering mindset, a structured approach to problem-solving, and the ability to collaborate effectively with cross-functional stakeholders. More specifically, you have:
   

  

* 2-5 years of proven experience as a machine learning engineer, or equivalent.
* Master's degree in Computer Science, Artificial Intelligence, or a related field.
* Solid understanding of machine learning lifecycle and fundamentals, and are up-to-date with recent LLM advancements.
* Expertise in Python.
* Familiarity with common development tools like GitHub and GitHub Actions, Copilot.
* Passion for delivering products with a great developer experience.
* A clear and compelling communication style - able to translate complex engineering solutions to non-technical audiences, including journalists.


 Bonus qualifications:
   

  

* Experience with embedding models, and/or vector stores such as Vespa or Weaviate.
* Experience with training (Pytorch) and serving LLM models, generative AI, and RAG applications.
* Comfortable working with multi-cloud setup and experience with AWS and/or GCP and containerised environments like Kubernetes in combination with Terraform.
* Experience working in media, content, or digital product environments.


 Our tech stack:
   

  

* Cloud infrastructure: Hybrid AWS/GCP, Kubernetes
* CI/CD: Terraform, Github Actions
* Model serving: Triton Inference Server, vLLM
* Vector/Feature serving: Vespa, Tecton
* Workload orchestration: Flyte, Ray
* LLM access: OpenWebUI, LiteLLM
* Monitoring & alerting: Grafana
* Coding: Python, HCL, Javascript/Typescript


 Why we enjoy working here:
   

  

 At Schibsted, we value openness, curiosity, and collaboration. You’ll be part of a diverse, inclusive workplace that encourages bold thinking and continuous learning. Our work directly supports public interest journalism—and we take that responsibility seriously.
   

  

 Our engineering culture is built on trust and autonomy. You’ll have significant freedom to choose your tools, influence how we work, and explore the technologies you find most compelling. Whether you're passionate about advancing LLM architectures, refining ML Ops pipelines, or diving into new AI tools and frameworks, we support continuous learning and specialization.

title: AD DS Migreringsspecialist / Senior AD-tekniker
description:
Du kommer ansvara för det tekniska genomförandet av en domänmigrering från befintlig Active Directory-miljö till en ny domänstruktur. Målet är att byta primärt DNS-namn och etablera en ny AD-forest utan driftavbrott, i en miljö med integrerade tjänster med bl.a Google Cloud Platform.
   

  

 Rollen innefattar hands-on arbete med migrering av användare, datorer och tjänstekonton samt tekniska anpassningar av DNS, GPO, identitetstjänster och integrationer. Specialisten ansvarar även för tester, verktygsanvändning, felsökning och dokumentation av förändringen.
   

  

**Ansvar & arbetsuppgifter:**
* Utföra konfiguration, test och migrering av objekt från källdomän till måldomän med verktyg som ADMT, PowerShell och eventuellt ForensiT för profilmigrering.
* Etablera och verifiera domäntrusts, SIDHistory och DNS-forwarders
* Implementera GPO-överföring och anpassning från gammal till ny domänstruktur
* Förbereda och utföra batchmigrering av användare och datorer i olika regioner
* Samarbeta med arkitekt kring miljödesign, riskreducering och återställningsplaner
* Identifiera och hantera domänberoenden i applikationer och tjänster
* Arbeta enligt runbook och checklistor för säker migrering utan påverkan på produktion
* Dokumentera tekniska åtgärder, konfigurationsändringar och migreringsutfall
* Delta i dagliga tekniska avstämningar och bidra med status och incidentrapportering


**Erfarenhet & kompetens:**
* Minst 5 års erfarenhet av arbete med Active Directory-miljöer (AD DS, DNS, FSMO, GPO)
* Erfarenhet av domänmigreringar, helst inter-forest (inklusive SIDHistory)
* Färdighet i PowerShell för automatisering och felsökning
* Praktisk erfarenhet av ADMT eller motsvarande verktyg
* Förståelse för infrastrukturkomponenter såsom DHCP, DNS, DFS, certifikat (PKI)
* God förståelse av certifikat- och autentiseringsmodeller (Kerberos, NTLM, ADFS)
* Praktisk erfarenhet av att läsa loggar och analysera problem i loggböcker, Event Viewer och AD Replication
* Svenska: flytande


**Meriterande:**
* Erfarenhet av LAPS eller Hybrid-AD-integrationer
* Kännedom om Google Cloud IAM
* Erfarenhet från globala organisationer med flera AD Sites och GPO-hantering i stor skala


**Personliga egenskaper:**
* Noggrann, strukturerad och van att arbeta enligt mallar och process
* God kommunikationsförmåga, särskilt i teknisk samverkan med arkitekter och andra specialister
* Ansvarstagande - levererar enligt plan och hanterar avvikelser proaktivt
* Bekväm med att dokumentera sitt arbete och kommunicera teknisk status


**Projektstruktur:**
* Arbetet leds av en senior IT-arkitekt med övergripande ansvar för design, planering, beroendehantering och kommunikation
* Specialisten arbetar självständigt inom givna ramar och ansvarar för teknik, verktyg och migreringsutförande enligt plan


**Uppdragstid:**
* Projektanställning eller konsultuppdrag i ca 6 månader
* Start: Snarast möjlig
* Omfattning: Heltid


**💚 Humanit**
 Humanit handlar om att göra saker lite annorlunda, att på riktigt sätta våra anställda i fokus. Vi växer tillsammans och värdesätter engagemang och ambition. För oss är det viktigt att du får chansen att vara med och påverka vägen framåt.
   

  

 I utbyte erbjuder vi kompetens- och karriärutveckling genom varierande och utmanande uppdrag. Vi är inte branschinriktade och kan därför erbjuda en fantastisk variation bland uppdragen för dig som konsult. Självklart ser vi till att du får rätt utbildning och vi är väl medvetna om att det är det livslånga lärandet som bygger vår framgång.
   

  

 Tillsammans skapar vi framtiden 🚀
   

  

* Tillsvidareanställning med fast månadslön
* Kollektivavtal
* Vi tillämpar sex månaders provanställning, inklusive maxat friskvårdsbidrag
* Utvecklingsplan
* Hälsoförsäkring + pension
* Förskottssemester


**Start** 
 : Omgående med hänsyn till uppsägningstid och när säkerhetskontroll är genomförd. Uppdraget är på heltid och är tillsvidare.
   

  

**Plats** 
 : Stockholm
   

  

**Ansökan** 
 : Vi rekryterar löpande. Så skicka in din ansökan redan idag!
   

  

*Humanit arbetar tillsammans med Great Place To Work för att vi skall bli Sveriges bästa arbetsplats.*
**Och förresten:**
*Som en aktiv del i ett samhälle med kulturell och social mångfald är Humanit’s ambition att präglas av inkludering och bred representation, samt vara en arbetsplats med lika möjligheter för alla. Humanit anställer, bibehåller, befordrar och i övrigt behandlar alla medarbetare och kandidater efter erfarenhet, kvalifikationer och kompetens, oavsett kön, religion, ursprung, ålder, sexuell läggning, könsidentitet eller funktionsvariationer.*

title: Sr. Enterprise Account Manager, Europe North Enterprise Greenfield
description:
**Description**
 Would you like to be part of a talented team of experienced technical sales professionals focused on winning and growing new business with some of Sweden's largest Enterprises as they transform their business? As an Amazon Web Services (AWS) Senior Enterprise Account Manager in our Enterprise Growth team, you will have the exciting opportunity of driving digital transformation across the strategic accounts you manage, promoting the entire AWS products and services portfolio.
   

  

 AWS Global Sales drives adoption of the AWS cloud worldwide, enabling customers of all sizes to innovate and expand in the cloud. Our team empowers every customer to grow by providing tailored service, unmatched technology and support. We dive deep to understand each customer's unique challenges, then craft innovative solutions that accelerate their success. This customer-first approach is how we built the world's most adopted cloud. Join us and help us grow.
   

  

 Key job responsibilities
   

  

 As an AWS Senior Enterprise Account Manager in our Enterprise Greenfield (new business) team, you are driving digital transformations through effective engagement with C-level executives, business development executives, IT leaders, architects, developers, and various lines of businesses. You are establishing AWS as the key cloud technology provider across the strategic accounts you manage, promoting the entire AWS products and services portfolio to Enterprise Customers.
   

  

 On a daily basis you empower your customers to solve challenges while attaining both their operational and innovation goals. You deliver business outcomes while guiding them to become more agile, innovative, and efficient. With AWS, our customers benefit from the fastest pace of innovation, the broadest and deepest functionality, the most secure computing environment, and the most proven operational expertise.
   

  

 Do you look around corners for ways to engage and service customers? Are you passionate about using technology to solve business problems that have big customer impact?
   

  

 Come build the future with us.
   

  

**About The Team**
 Diverse Experiences
   

  

 AWS values diverse experiences. Even if you do not meet all of the preferred qualifications and skills listed in the job description, we encourage candidates to apply. If your career is just starting, hasn’t followed a traditional path, or includes alternative experiences, don’t let it stop you from applying.
   

  

 Why AWS?
   

  

 Amazon Web Services (AWS) is the world’s most comprehensive and broadly adopted cloud platform. We pioneered cloud computing and never stopped innovating — that’s why customers from the most successful startups to Global 500 companies trust our robust suite of products and services to power their businesses.
   

  

 Inclusive Team Culture
   

  

 AWS values curiosity and connection. Our employee-led and company-sponsored affinity groups promote inclusion and empower our people to take pride in what makes us unique. Our inclusion events foster stronger, more collaborative teams. Our continual innovation is fueled by the bold ideas, fresh perspectives, and passionate voices our teams bring to everything we do.
   

  

 Mentorship & Career Growth
   

  

 We’re continuously raising our performance bar as we strive to become Earth’s Best Employer. That’s why you’ll find endless knowledge-sharing, mentorship and other career-advancing resources here to help you develop into a better-rounded professional.
   

  

 Work/Life Balance
   

  

 We value work-life harmony. Achieving success at work should never come at the expense of sacrifices at home, which is why we strive for flexibility as part of our working culture. When we feel supported in the workplace and at home, there’s nothing we can’t achieve.
   

  

**Basic Qualifications**
* Experience as a quota carrying technology enterprise field sales or business development account manager, including complex account management and greenfield/new business experience.
* The ideal candidate will have experience developing relationships across industry verticals, including: Financial Services Industry (FSI), Manufacturing, Media & Entertainment and/or Retail/CPG.
* Experience increasing technology adoption and creating long term transformational account strategies.
* Demonstrated success in identifying, developing, negotiating, and closing large-scale technology projects to Enterprise Customers, including working with and presenting to C-level executives, IT, and other lines of business.
* University degree or a technical background in business, engineering, or computer science, BA/BS degree or equivalent work experience.


**Preferred Qualifications**
* 10 years+ of technology field sales or business development experience, ideally selling cloud solutions
* Experience developing long term customer relationships, with multiple lines of business, including senior CxO stakeholders
* Active listener and effective communicator with demonstrated success in effective deal closing skills on large, complex deals
* Extensive working knowledge with CRMs (e.g. Salesforce), forecasting, account plan creation and ownership
* Demonstrated success in identifying, developing, negotiating, and closing large-scale technology projects to Enterprise customers
* A passionate, self-starter, ready to take AWS Sweden Enterprise customer experience to the next level


 Amazon is an equal opportunities employer. We believe passionately that employing a diverse workforce is central to our success. We make recruiting decisions based on your experience and skills. We value your passion to discover, invent, simplify and build. Protecting your privacy and the security of your data is a longstanding top priority for Amazon. Please consult our Privacy Notice (https://www.amazon.jobs/en/privacy\_page) to know more about how we collect, use and transfer the personal data of our candidates.
   

  

 Our inclusive culture empowers Amazonians to deliver the best results for our customers. If you have a disability and need a workplace accommodation or adjustment during the application and hiring process, including support for the interview or onboarding process, please visit https://amazon.jobs/content/en/how-we-hire/accommodations for more information. If the country/region you’re applying in isn’t listed, please contact your Recruiting Partner.
   

  

  

**Company** 
 - AWS EMEA SARL (Sweden Branch)
