title: Data Platform Architect
description:
Title: Data Platform Architect
   

  

 Reports to: Head of Architecture
   

  

 Entity: Digital and Synthetic
   

  

 Group: Digital and Synthetic Capability: Architecture
   

  

 Work Arrangement: Hybrid
   

  

**Company Overview**
 Metrea is a defense company dedicated to translating commercial innovation into solutions for the hardest problems in national security. With deep mission expertise, Metrea focuses on delivering effects-as-a-service across Aerospace, Electromagnetic & Cyber, Digital & Synthetic domains via its capability groups. Metrea also consists of six support groups (Operations, People, Finance, Legal, Strategy and Solutions) that guide the development of specific capabilities that Metrea's files (product, projects, programs etc ) leverage to achieve their targets.
   

  

 Group Overview
   

  

 The Digital and Synthetic Capability Unit (D&S) is committed to providing mission-driven information solutions that seamlessly bridge the digital and physical realms. Leveraging cutting-edge technologies and advanced platforms, we empower operational readiness and elevate situational awareness across diverse domains—including air, maritime, and space.
   

  

 Position Summary
   

  

 We are seeking an experienced Data Platform Architect to lead a cross-functional data & cloud engineering team in the design and implementation of our next-generation cloud-native data platform.
   

  

 This role will be responsible for architecting a comprehensive data ecosystem that supports diverse data ingestion and consumption patterns, advanced data structures, and appropriate storage solutions while owning and adhering to our data ontology.
   

  

 Role and Responsibilities
   

  

 Architecture & Design
   

  

* Design and architect scalable, cloud-native data platform solutions supporting both real-time and batch processing workloads
* Define data architecture patterns, data models, and integration strategies across heterogeneous data sources
* Establish API-first design principles and create comprehensive API specifications for data services
* Design data governance frameworks, security models, and compliance strategies
* Create technical roadmaps and guide technology stack decisions


 Technical Leadership
   

  

* Lead a cross-functional team including data engineers, cloud engineers, and software engineers
* Collaborate with data scientists and analytics teams to understand platform requirements for advanced use cases
* Drive architectural reviews and technical decision-making processes
* Mentor engineering teams on best practices for data platform development
* Establish coding standards, design patterns, and operational procedures


 Platform Strategy
   

  

* Evaluate and recommend technologies for data ingestion, processing, storage, and serving layers
* Design multi-tenant, self-service data platform capabilities
* Architect solutions for data lineage, quality monitoring, and observability
* Plan for platform scalability, performance optimization, and cost management
* Ensure platform supports diverse data types (structured, semi-structured, streaming)


 Stakeholder Collaboration
   

  

* Work closely with product managers to translate business requirements into technical solutions
* Partner with security and compliance teams to ensure data protection and regulatory adherence
* Collaborate with infrastructure teams on cloud resource planning and optimization
* Present architectural decisions and trade-offs to leadership and technical teams


**Skills And Experience**
* 8+ years of experience in data engineering, platform architecture, or related fields
* Technologist with proven experience in building innovative and ground-breaking data solutions.
* Proven experience architecting large-scale data platforms in cloud environments (AWS, Azure, GCP) and leading technical teams
* Deep understanding of data processing frameworks (Spark, Kafka, Flink, Airflow)
* Strong knowledge of data storage technologies (data lakes, data warehouses, NoSQL, streaming)
* Experience with containerization, orchestration (Kubernetes, Docker), and microservices and event-driven architectures
* Proficiency in API design and development (REST, GraphQL , gRPC , JSON, Kafka )
* Understanding of data governance, security, and compliance frameworks
* Excellent communication skills with ability to present complex technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders
* Solid programming fundamentals with ability to review code and guide technical decisions across multiple languages
* Experience with Infrastructure as Code (Terraform, CloudFormation)
* Familiarity with CI/CD pipelines and DevOps practices
* Knowledge of monitoring and observability tools (Prometheus, Grafana, ELK stack)
* Experience with data catalog and metadata management tools


**Additional Eligibility Qualifications**
* Advanced degree in Computer Science or Engineering
* Understanding of analytics and data science workflows
* Certification in major cloud platforms
* Experience with data mesh or federated data architecture patterns


 Our Culture
   

  

 Metrea’s  single core value, “rooted in humility,” is supported by four key attributes: entrepreneurial, systematic, discerning, and over-deliver. These attributes, combined, form our Teammate Firmware, our culture. We explore these attributes during the hiring process when we grow our teams and continually support the growth of our culture. We are a hyper-collaborative, dynamically hierarchical organization united by a passion for what we do, how we do it, who we do it with, and who we do it for.
   

  

**Benefits**
 D&S - UK
   

  

 Private Medical Insurance
   

  

 Subsided gym membership / plans through Wellhub
   

  

 Electric Car scheme
   

  

 Cycle to work scheme
   

  

 £1500 Training Allowance
   

  

 30 days annual PTO plus b/h
   

  

 Eye Tests
   

  

 D&S Sweden
   

  

 Friskvård of 5K annually
   

  

 Personal development budget (2K for books, courses, subscriptions etc)
   

  

 Parental leave
   

  

 5% occupational pension ( swe. tjänstepension ),
   

  

 30 days of leave
   

  

 Discretionary Bonus
   

  

 Right to Work
   

  

 The employee will have the legal right to work in the United Kingdom and will be able to produce right to work documentation.
   

  

 Work Authorization / Security Clearance
   

  

 Ability to achieve and maintain a Security Clearance.
   

  

 Equal Opportunities Statement
   

  

 Metrea is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Employment decisions are made without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or other characteristics protected by law.
   

  

 Position Type and Expected Hours of Work
   

  

 This is a full-time non-exempt position with typical working hours of Monday through Friday, 9:00 a.m. to 6:00 p.m. Hours and work shifts may change in accordance with department and business needs. Exempt Employees must have the ability to be on-call and available, as business needs require. Non-Exempt employees may be required to work over 40 hours per week with approval from the department manager.
   

  

 Work Location
   

  

 UK / Sweden
   

  

 Work Environment
   

  

 This job operates in an office setting

title: Senior Test Engineer
description:
Gothenburg, Västra Götaland County


Job ID JR2025459589 Category Information Technology Role Type Hybrid Post Date Jul. 04, 2025  

**Job Description**


At Boeing, we innovate and collaborate to make the world a better place. We’re committed to fostering an environment for every teammate that’s welcoming, respectful and inclusive, with great opportunity for professional growth. Find your future with us.


Jeppesen, a subsidiary of The Boeing Company, is one of the largest software development companies in Gothenburg. We develop innovative optimization solutions for the world’s leading airlines. We are dedicated to continuous improvement, delivering more value to our clients, and exploring emerging technologies such as quantum computing, AI and big data analytics.


At Jeppesen’s office in central Gothenburg you will work in a one-of-a-kind software development organization with fascinating solutions that make a real difference to people around the world. You will be working in an agile learning organization, surrounded by a team of talented, creative and dedicated colleagues. You will learn and broaden your perspective by working with 400 professionals from more than 30 different nations, but also be part of a global organization allowing for collaboration with customers and colleagues across the world. Most importantly, you will be expected to make a difference.


To find out more about the current product and solutions, please click the following link:

  

https://ww2.jeppesen.com/airline-crew-optimization-solutions/

**Position Responsibilities:**


We are currently seeking a **senior Test Engineer** to join our office in Gothenburg, Sweden, as part of one of our development teams. This team is focused on building our 24/7 Tracking product, which supports customers globally in their everyday crew operations—from pre-planning to day-of-operation. We are in an exciting phase of integrating various products from our suite, moving towards a SaaS solution, and launching this solution to additional airline customers.


Join our team as a Test Engineer, where you'll work with skilled engineering professionals who value quality in software development. We thrive on exploring new technologies and continuously innovating to elevate our products.


As a cross-functional team, we take pride in managing all facets of the DevSecOps cycle, and we are eager to enhance our capabilities in quality assurance and testing. With a robust quality mindset, we excel in technical testing, and we are now seeking a talented individual to help us grow in other parts related to quality such as UI, end-to-end, integration and performance testing. Your expertise will be crucial in finding the right balance to ensure our products meet the highest standards of quality.

**Basic Qualifications:**


As a person, we believe that you:


have a bachelor’s or a master’s degree within Computer Science, Software Engineering or similar* .

have a technical background as a develope* r

have a deep interest in and experience from software development testing in various area* s

are a problem solver, with an eye for making the complex simpl* e

are a team playe* r

are happy to experiment, fail fast and share your learnings with u* s

embrace agile ways-of-workin* g

are fluent in English (written and spoken)
**Preferred Qualifications:**


have an interest or background in Aviatio* n

have experience with large, complex systems* .

are curious about AI’s role in future software development* .

**Relocation:** This position does not offer relocation. Candidates must live in the immediate area or relocate at their own expense.

**Visa Sponsorship:** Employer will initiate the visa application; however, the successful candidate will cover the cost of visa.

**Please apply by sending your CV in English.**

  

Applications for this position will be accepted until **Jul. 18, 2025**

 **Export Control Requirements:** This is not an Export Control position. **Relocation**

Relocation assistance is not a negotiable benefit for this position.

**Visa Sponsorship**

Employer will not sponsor applicants for employment visa status.

**Shift**

Not a Shift Worker (Sweden)

 **Equal Opportunity Employer:**


We are an equal opportunity employer. We do not accept unlawful discrimination in our recruitment or employment practices on any grounds including but not limited to; race, color, ethnicity, religion, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, physical or mental disability, genetic factors, military and veteran status, or other characteristics covered by applicable law.


We have teams in more than 65 countries, and each person plays a role in helping us become one of the world’s most innovative, diverse and inclusive companies. We are proud members of the Valuable 500 and welcome applications from candidates with disabilities. Applicants are encouraged to share with our recruitment team any accommodations required during the recruitment process. Accommodations may include but are not limited to: conducting interviews in accessible locations that accommodate mobility needs, encouraging candidates to bring and use any existing assistive technology such as screen readers and offering flexible interview formats such as virtual or phone interviews.

title: Senior Functional Safety Engineer
description:
##### **Project description**

DXC Luxoft is a leading global software services company, delivering professional services across multiple business verticals such as finance, automotive, and digital transformation.  

  

The Automotive practice inside DXC Luxoft delivers software projects to a majority of the world's car manufacturers and suppliers for both personal and commercial vehicles. We are known for our Automotive software expertise and for helping our customers with high quality services and deliveries.  

Currently we are growing for our Swedish customers and are looking for Functional Safety experts to join our team. You will be part of our growing organization in Sweden and will be part of developing next generation systems for the Automotive industry in the era of connected, autonomous, electric vehicles.


##### **Responsibilities**


Functional Safety implementation of electronic vehicle functions as per the Safety process at System and Software level, which includes Safety Concept definition and Safety Management activities.


Lead and perform system safety work products e.g., TSC, Safety Case, HARA.

Lead and perform Safety Analysis like FMEA, FTA, DFA.

Support in implementation of Safety process in the project.

Qualification as AFSP (Automotive Functional Safety Professional) from SGS-TÜV Saar or a comparable qualification from an accredited provider.

Part 3, Part 4, HARA).


Excellent leadership and communication skills.

team players, practical and pragmatic by nature


great communication skills to successfully advise and support the organization

Driver licence

title: Food Application Engineer
description:
Overview ...:

Are you passionate about technology and food? Ready to help transform the future of food processing? Join JBT Marel, as a **Food Application Engineer**. Whether you are a recent graduate or an experienced engineer looking for a new challenge, this is an exciting opportunity to grow your career in a fast-evolving, global environment.

  


The Opportunity ...:

As a **Food Application Engineer**, you will be the crucial link between our innovative vision-guided waterjet portioning systems and our customers in the food processing industry. Your mission is to:

* Gather and prioritize customer requirements
* Assess production situations and identify optimal solutions
* Configure system software to meet unique needs
* Support sales teams with technical expertise
* Ensure seamless implementation and customer satisfaction


You will frequently travel to customer sites, building strong relationships with clients and collaborating closely with colleagues in sales, engineering, operations, and management.

 **Main responsibilities**

* **Meet Customer Needs**  

Engage with clients to understand requirements, explore options, configure equipment and software, measure improvements, and communicate results.
* **Travel and On-Site Support**  

Plan and coordinate customer visits, provide on-site and remote support, and ensure smooth equipment operation.
* **Cross-Functional Collaboration**  

Develop productive working relationships across teams and share insights to continuously improve our solutions.
* **Software Proficiency and Development**  

Achieve expertise in DSI™ software applications and communicate requirements for new cut-solution development to our Software team.

 **Your profile**

* Degree in Engineering or Food Technology (or equivalent experience)
* Aptitude for technical concepts involving software, robotics, and automation
* Strong organizational, communication, and interpersonal skills
* Ability to creatively translate customer requirements into practical application
* Comfortable with hands-on technical work (“turning a wrench”)
* Proactive, self-motivated, and flexible team player
* Excellent spoken and written English (additional languages are a plus)

  

Travel: Up to 70% travel can be expected in this role.


Why work at JBT ...:

At JBT Marel, what we do matters. Our purpose—Transforming the Future of Food—guides everything we do. We are committed to:

* Serving with integrity
* Creating with collaboration
* Growing with excellence
* Advancing with innovation

title: Test Solutions Engineer
description:
**Test Solutions Engineer inom Automotive till Vector i Göteborg!**


Är du en erfaren ingenjör med djup teknisk förståelse för testmiljöer inom fordonsindustrin? Vill du arbeta med den senaste tekniken inom säkerhetskritiska system och samtidigt vara en del av ett globalt företag med en stark lokal kultur? Då är du välkommen att söka denna tjänst.

**Om rollen**


Som **Test Solutions Engineer** hos Vector kommer du att arbeta nära våra kunder och internationella kollegor med att den senaste tekniken. Du kommer att vara en teknisk expert inom testmiljöer och verktyg som CANoe, VT System och virtualisering.


Du får möjlighet att påverka framtidens mobilitet i en bransch som just nu genomgår en teknisk revolution. Vi söker dig som vill vara med och driva den utvecklingen framåt **’From Software Factory to HIL Farms’**.

**Dina huvudsakliga arbetsuppgifter:**

* Rådgivning kring design och implementation av testlösningar för inbyggda system inom automotive och/eller MedTech
* Att som expert hjälpa våra kunder med avancerad felsökning och analys
* Samarbete med internationella team och deltagande i globala projekt
* Bidra till tekniska presentationer, seminarier och kunskapsdelning

**Vi tror att du har:**

* Flera års erfarenhet av test och verifiering och hög servicenivå
* Du bör ha programeringserfarenhet av **C/C++**
* Djup kunskap i HIL så väl som SIL
* God förståelse för inbyggda system och realtidssystem
* Flytande svenska och engelska i tal och skrift

**Vi erbjuder:**

* Ett sammansvetsat team med hög teknisk kompetens och hjälpsam kultur
* Flexibla arbetstider och möjlighet till hybridarbete. För denna tjänst är kontorsnärvaro viktig. Vi erbjuder ett modernt kontor med härliga kollegor på Lindholmen i Göteborg.
* Kontinuerlig kompetensutveckling
* En arbetsmiljö där frihet, tillit och balans mellan arbete och privatliv är centrala värden
* Möjlighet att arbeta med världsledande teknik inom en global organisation med lokal närvaro

**Om Vector**


Vector är ett globalt teknikföretag med över 4500 medarbetare på 30+ platser världen över. Vi utvecklar verktyg, mjukvara och tjänster för att förenkla utvecklingen av inbyggda system. I Sverige har vi kontor i Göteborg (Lindholmen Science Park) och Linköping, där vi kombinerar det lilla företagets närhet med det stora företagets resurser.

**Låter det intressant?**


Sök gärna idag. **Vänligen notera att vi för närvarande är på semesterledighet men vi återkommer så snart vi kan i början av augusti.**

  

Läs mer om oss på vector.com

title: Senior Test Automations Ingenjör inom mjukvara för inbyggda system
description:
### **JOB DESCRIPTION**



Är du en erfaren Test Automations ingenjör som drivs av teknik, användarvänlighet och kvalité? Har du passion för mjukvarutestning, kvalité och testautomation? Då kan du vara rätt för oss!



Vi söker en Test Automations ingenjörer inom mjukvara som vill hjälpa våra kunder inom Q/A området och samtidigt komplettera Mekatronikchefen genom att driva utveckling inom ditt expertområde.



Du har ett genuint intresse för teknikutveckling och vi tror att du på fritiden håller dig uppdaterad inom branschen. Din passion för teknik, människan och affären driver dig att ständigt utforska nya lösningar och möjligheter.



Som Senior Test Automation ingenjör på Sigma Industry Development kommer du att hjälpa våra kunder med att driva strategier och samtidigt vara hands-on inom:


* testramverksutveckling där Python och/eller Java är primära språket
* skriva testfall inom kundens domänområde
* underhålla ramverk och test automations pipe
* programmering med Python och/eller Java
* vana att använda byggsystem och ramverk för mjukvarutestning
* vana att jobba med Continuous Integration/Continuous Deployment (CI/CD)
* vana att jobba med kvalitativ versionskontroll för källkodshantering ex. GitHub eller GitLab
* vana att jobba med nightly test & daily test ex. Jenkins, GitLab CI eller Travis CI
* vana att jobba med orkestrering och container teknologier såsom Docker

### **BASIC QUALIFICATIONS**



Vi söker en person som vill vara nära tekniken och är vana och trygga i att tekniskt leda andra.


* Har 5-10 års professionell erfarenhet inom inbyggda system
* Lång erfarenhet och intresse av att delvis jobba i lab-miljö med kombinationen hårdvara och mjukvara.
* Minst 5 års professionell erfarenhet inom Test Automation området nära R&D och inbyggda system med Python och/eller Java som primärt språk
* Lång erfarenhet som mjukvarutestare i större projekt där produkten innefattar hårdvara och mjukvara
* Erfarenhet av flertalet Linux distributioner för inbyggda system
* Meriterande med professionell erfarenhet inom inbyggda system med C/C++ som primärt språk
* Säkerhet – Förståelse för bästa praxis inom säkerhet för infrastruktur och applikationer.
* Nätverk – Kännedom om nätverkskoncept i Linux miljö.
* Agila metoder – Kännedom om agila ramverk som Scrum eller Kanban.
* Flytande i svenska och engelska, både i tal och skrift.


**Utbildning:**



* Civilingenjörsexamen inom datavetenskap, elektroteknik eller motsvarande område.


Urval sker under sommaren och återkoppling kan dröja till tidigast vecka 33.


### **WE OFFER**



Vi är stora nog för att kunna erbjuda en bred kundbas och vi har ett gott rykte i branschen, samtidigt som vi är små nog att se dig som individ. För oss är gemenskap viktigt – här ska alla känna sig sedda och välkomna. Som en följd av detta har vi bland annat gemensamma sektionsaktiviteter, ett nätverk för kvinnor och icke-binära, ett mentorskapsprogam och utbildningar inom olika kompetensområden. Vi strävar efter att skapa en miljö där alla kan växa och utvecklas tillsammans. Vår ambition är att tillgodose konsultens önskemål gällande uppdragslängd, sektor och arbetsuppgifter. För oss är en bra balans mellan arbete och privatliv en självklarhet och vi är stolta över att vara en av Sveriges mest attraktiva arbetsgivare. Givetvis har vi också kollektivavtal.


Nyfiken på hur det känns att vara en del av vårt gäng? I den här filmen delar några av våra medarbetare med sig av sina tankar om vardagen, gemenskapen och varför de valt just oss: **https://vimeo.com/1058313176?share=copy#t=0**  



  

**OM SID**


Sigma Industry Development är ett teknik- och konsultbolag inom Sigmagruppen som hjälper både ledande svenska och internationella teknikföretag och innovativa och nytänkande start-ups och scale-ups. Vi verkar inom sektorer så som den gröna energisektorn, fordonsindustrin, transportindustrin, medtech, försvarsbranchen och hållbarhet.


Vår vision är att vara det ledande teknikkonsultbolaget och vår kultur präglas av familjär samhörighet där människan är i centrum. Med över 100 engagerade medarbetare är vi i en stark tillväxtfas. Vår kärnverksamhet ligger i konsultuppdrag ute hos kund, men vi har även ett in-house-team som arbetar uteslutande från kontoret. Precis som vårt namn antyder, är utveckling kärnan i allt vi gör och våra medarbetare engageras av att ta Sigma Industry Development till nästa nivå.  



  

**OM SIGMA GROUP**


Sigma Industry Development AB (SID) är ett av sex dotterbolag som ingår i koncernen Sigma Industry East/North Group, vilka i sin tur ingår i Sigma Group (som ägs av familjekoncernen Danir AB). Läs mer om Sigma Industry Development **HÄR**och om Sigma Group på **HÄR**.


Utöver att vara del av ett företag som värnar om teknologisk utveckling, arbetar för en bättre miljö och som främjar jämställdhet, så är en viktig del av vår verksamhet socialt ansvarstagande. Mer information om detta hittar du **HÄR**.


### **MORE INFORMATION**

  



Kristoffer Billqvist, Sektionschef Mekatronik  

+46 708102082  

Kristoffer.Billqvist@sigma.se

Senior Test Automations Ingenjör inom mjukvara för inbyggda system

title: Capacity Engineer Senior Associate (m/f/d)
description:
**Who are we?**


Equinix is the world’s digital infrastructure company®, operating over 260 data centers across the globe. Digital leaders harness Equinix's trusted platform to bring together and interconnect foundational infrastructure at software speed. Equinix enables organizations to access all the right places, partners and possibilities to scale with agility, speed the launch of digital services, deliver world-class experiences and multiply their value, while supporting their sustainability goals.

  


Joining our operations team means that you will be at the forefront of all we do, maintaining critical facilities infrastructure as part of a close-knit team delivering best-in-class service to our data center customers. We embrace diversity in thought and contribution and are committed to providing an equitable work environment that is foundational to our core values as a company and is vital to our success.



**Job Summary**


The Capacity Engineer is a seasoned experienced professional with a full understanding of data management, design and design drawings for installations within a diverse scope. Collaborates with others to maintain data consistency and integrity.

 **Responsibilities**  

Space Planning & Design

* Creates various/experienced Cage-Cabinet design options that respond to customer requirements, Equinix requirements and physical site constraints within a diverse scope
* Prepares notional Cage-Cabinet layouts, area calculations and diagrams for each individual data center and specializes in more complex, larger sites
* Maximizes space utilization to develop the best design solution for the Data Center and the customer
* Acts as a mentor to more junior members


Engineering

* Utilizes experienced knowledge of electrical/mechanical infrastructure to notionally attribute complex Cage-Cabinet designs against Data Center infrastructure within a diverse scope
* Participates in high-density review cases, seeking opinions of SME's or local sites where required
* Performs the validation and updating of Data Center infrastructure data within capacity systems in a diverse scope
* Identifies issues or constraints in infrastructure capacity and may prepare notional solutions for review by management
* Acts as a mentor to more junior members

  

Problem Solving

* Solves various/complex, cross-functional issues that span multiple groups
* Uses experienced skills to identify and understand underlying issues
* Understands when and to whom to escalate, but tries to solve problem first

  

Data & Drawing Management

* Works with site operations to address discrepancies with documentation of facility infrastructure and installation of customer cages
* Ensures that AutoCAD drawings and capacity systems correctly represent existing status of the Data Center
* Identifies and makes corrections as necessary
* Identifies and leads the investigation of experienced data issues without support
* Produces drawings and space plans for use by Sales, Site operation and other teams
* Creates diverse spatial layouts of each customer cage which are used by the other capacity teams for their reviews, and by the Sales Engineers and site teams for customer installations
* Drawing and inventory preparation, which may be reviewed by manager
* Creates numbering plans for new sites, compiling inventory list, and preparing the drawings files used to track assignments
* Compiles as-built underground utility drawings as required to create a comprehensive record drawing for each site within a diverse scope

  

Collaboration

* Collaborates with various teams to identify any power/cooling issues that affect space capacity
* Answers experienced inventory-related questions from cross-functional departments
* Ability to engage and gather input from appropriate stakeholders to reach the right solution for the company and the customer within a diverse scope
* Where planning decisions are in dispute between sales and operational needs, the engineer is expected to escalate to the right level
* Coordinates with various departments for the monthly reporting of capacity trends, availability and accuracy of records for the site

  

Capacity Feasibility & Optimization

* Works with Capacity and/or site engineers to identify power and cooling limitations, discuss potential modifications, and develop experienced solutioning
* Acts as the first point of contact for the CFR process to ensure that space is being assigned maximizes the value of our data centers by optimizing the efficiency of our space within a diverse scope

  

**Qualifications**

* Degree in Mechanical Engineering or Electrical Engineering or equivalent experience
* Accomplishment to work and integrate in a diverse team where people appreciate and support each other
* Ability use AutoCAD 2D
* Driver to understand the background and consequences of actions in a bigger picture
* Motivation to directly engage with different stakeholders
* Identify, analyse, prioritize and solve challenges where different stakeholder needs are competing
* Above all, a great willingness to learn more and grow in this role and as a person
* Good English language communication and writing skills
* Basic understanding of the data center business & technical knowledge
* Knowledge to handle databases & CRM software
* Ideally knowledge in agile working & agile working tools (optimally Jira)
* Ideally knowledge in CFD (Computational Fluid Dynamics)
* Knowledge and experience with excel, PowerPoint and outlook


Equinix is committed to ensuring that our employment process is open to all individuals, including those with a disability. If you are a qualified candidate and need assistance or an accommodation, please let us know by completing this form.


Equinix is an Equal Employment Opportunity and, in the U.S., an Affirmative Action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to unlawful consideration of race, color, religion, creed, national or ethnic origin, ancestry, place of birth, citizenship, sex, pregnancy / childbirth or related medical conditions, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, marital or domestic partnership status, age, veteran or military status, physical or mental disability, medical condition, genetic information, political / organizational affiliation, status as a victim or family member of a victim of crime or abuse, or any other status protected by applicable law.

title: Full Stack Engineer
description:
Do you want to transform how Swedish manufacturing companies work with sales and customer relationships?
  
At Enabi, we’re on an exciting growth journey where your contribution will directly impact both our customers and the future of our company. We’re now looking for an full stack developer to our engineering team.
  
About Enabi
  
At Enabi, we’re reshaping the workday for sales teams at Sweden’s leading manufacturing companies. Our CRM replaces the chaos of inboxes, Excel sheets, and scattered notes with smart, integrated workflows that our customers love. We’re a startup with a clear product–market fit and a tight-knit team built on high ambition and deep trust – a place where work–life balance goes hand in hand with a strong product culture.
  
Full stack developer at Enabi
  
Programming has changed. Nobody knows where it'll go. With little legacy to hold us back, we can move quickly and stay flexible. We're looking for an experienced developer who wants to be on the frontline of using LLMs to ship more and better code. We believe that experienced developers with drive can help us push these boundaries.
  
We're looking for people who constantly improve their own ways of working and like to share and learn together with others. We think that this mindset will only become more important in the years ahead.
  
What you'll do
  
Build across the stack with React, Next.js, C#, .NET, and GraphQL
  
Fix nasty bugs, build well-defined features, and help us figure out the best way to build new stuff
  
Focus on delivering real value, fast
  
Figure out how LLMs can help us ship more and better code to create more value
  
Own the quality of what you build and take initiative when needed
  
Collaborate and grow with the team
  
  

Who we are
  
Two years in, solving real problems for users who already love the product
  
Team of 6 with a dev team of 3-4 people and counting
  
Small, experienced team with high trust and strong drive
  
We'd rather stay small and sharp than grow bloated and slow
  
We believe in balance. Great work shouldn't cost your health or family
  
We care about each other as people. Trust and connection make us grow
  
Based in Gothenburg, about two office days per week
  
  

You'll thrive here if you
  
Care deeply about what you build and do what's best for the company
  
Are excited about the future of LLM-based development
  
Believe that trust, clarity and shared ambition build great teams
  
Enjoy solving real problems that improve people's workday
  
Sometimes think about work problems, not because you have to, but because you care and can't help it
  
Want to be part of growing a fast-moving startup with strong product culture
  
Fluent in English and at least ok with Swedish
  
  

Nice to have
  
Built system integrations before
  
Experience with ERP or finance software
  
Worked with LLM-powered features
  
Have experience of doing peer-programming or code reviews
  
Previous experience at a product startup (not just consultancy work)
  
Experience working with microservices setup
  
  

Does this sound like you? You don't need to tick every box - we care more about your drive and hunger to build something great. Please apply and let's talk! Send an email to daniel@enabi.io.

title: Product Security Engineer
description:
Hej, Truecaller is calling you from Stockholm, Sweden! Ready to pick up?
  
Our goal is to make communication smarter, safer, and more efficient, all while building trust everywhere. We're all about bringing you smart services with a big social impact, keeping you safe from fraud, harassment, scam calls, or messages, so you can focus on the conversations that matter.
  
Top 20 most downloaded apps globally, and the world’s #1 caller ID and spam-blocking service for Android and iOS, with extensive AI capabilities, with more than 420 million active users per month.
  
Founded in 2009, listed on Nasdaq OMX Stockholm and is categorized as a Large Cap. Our focus on innovation, operational excellence, sustainable growth, and collaboration has resulted in consistently high profitability and strong EBITDA margins.
  
A team of 400 people from ~35 different nationalities spread across our headquarters in Stockholm and offices in Bangalore, Mumbai, Gurgaon, and Tel Aviv with high ambitions.
  
  

We at Truecaller's Security Team
  
At Truecaller, our Security Team is dedicated to proactively embedding security into every layer of our product development lifecycle, acting as a trusted partner and enabler for our engineering teams. We empower Truecaller to innovate rapidly and securely, ensuring our millions of users around the globe can communicate smarter and safer, knowing their data and interactions are protected by a world-class security posture.
  
As a Product Security Engineer
  
You will develop the future of Truecaller's application security by revealing potential weaknesses and working with the teams to implement creative solutions to remove those weaknesses. The work will include strategic thinking to solve systematic issues and deep technical work on specific vulnerabilities.
  
In your work, you will be responsible for driving security initiatives from start to finish, while being a trusted advisor for our employees on matters that involve software development! We offer a unique opportunity to build and define the foundational pillars of Truecaller's product security program from the ground up. You won't just be joining a team; you'll be instrumental in shaping its processes, tools, and culture. This is a chance to have a direct, measurable impact on how security is perceived and implemented across a global product.
  
  

**The impact you will create:**  

**Security Reviews:** assist our development teams with guidance and security reviews of features and services.
  
**Secure Coding:** provide education for our developers to write secure code. This is a key enabler for a proactive approach to security
  
**Security Tools:** work with and maintain a suite of security tools to enable rapid secure development that builds confidence in our products.
  
**Vulnerability Management:** act as the main responsible for triaging, verifying, and working with our business units to fix vulnerabilities that are reported to us through community efforts, mainly our bug bounty program, and other channels.
  
  

**What you bring in:**  

Experience working with software development or closely related fields.
  
Knowledge of various well-known security weaknesses and their mitigations.
  
Ability to perform internal penetration tests of new features and the ability to reproduce vulnerabilities.
  
Strong communication skills that enable you to effectively communicate and drive improvements throughout the organization.
  
  

**It would be great if you also have:**  

Track record of driving a significant organization-wide project from start to finish.
  
  

**Life at Truecaller - Behind the code:** https://www.instagram.com/lifeattruecaller/
  
Sounds like your dream job?
  
We will fill the position as soon as we find the right candidate, so please send your application as soon as possible. As part of the recruitment process, we will conduct a background check.
  
This position is based in Stockholm, Sweden.
  
We only accept applications in English.
  
  

**What we offer:**  

**A smart, talented, and agile team:** An international team where ~35 nationalities are working together in several locations and time zones with a learning, sharing, and fun environment.
  
**A great compensation package:** Competitive salary, 30 days of paid vacation, flexible working hours, private health insurance, parental leave top-up, pension contribution, Udemy membership to keep learning and improving, and free gym membership.
  
**Great tech tools:** Pick the computer and phone you fancy most within our budget ranges.
  
**Office life:** We strongly believe in in-person collaboration and follow an office-first approach while offering some flexibility. Enjoy your days with great colleagues with loads of good stuff to learn from, and a wide range of yummy snacks and beverages. In addition, every now and then, check out the playroom for a fun break or join our exciting parties and or team activities such as Lab days, Running team, movie nights in our cinema, or a Geek lunch. There’s something for everyone!
  
  

**Come as you are:**  

Truecaller is diverse, equal, and inclusive. We need a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, beliefs, and experiences to keep building our great products. No matter where you are based, which language you speak, your accent, race, religion, color, nationality, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, etc. All those things make you who you are, and that’s why we would love to meet you

title: Radioingenjör med fokus på säker kommunikation
description:
**Om tjänsten**  

Vi hjälper nu vår kund att hitta en radioingenjör inom försvars- och säkerhetssektorn till ett växande affärsområde med inriktning på radioteknik och säker kommunikation. Uppdraget erbjuder placering i Arboga, Stockholm, Linköping, Norrköping, Växjö, Göteborg eller Karlskrona. Rollen omfattar arbete med kravspecificering, tester och integration av avancerade kommunikationssystem, med syftet att stärka Sveriges kommunikationslösningar inom totalförsvaret.



Vår kund lägger stort fokus på hållbarhet, innovation och balans i arbetslivet. Med en trygg och långsiktig ägare inom försvars- och säkerhetsindustrin skapas stabila förutsättningar för utveckling och samhällsnytta. Medarbetarna ses som företagets viktigaste resurs och ges goda möjligheter till kompetensutveckling, återhämtning och flexibilitet i vardagen.


**Du erbjuds**  

* Möjlighet att utvecklas tekniskt i en vardag där ingen dag är den andra lik
* Arbeta i ett inkluderande team där kunskapsdelning och kollegialt stöd är en självklarhet
* Vara en del av ett företag med ett starkt samhällsuppdrag, där du får göra konkret skillnad

**Arbetsuppgifter**  

I rollen som radioingenjör förväntas du arbeta med utvärdering och provning av kommunikationssystem, antingen i laboratoriemiljö eller på plats hos slutkunden. Arbetsuppgifterna inkluderar även design och utveckling av testutrustning inom både hård- och mjukvara samt teknisk support och service av installerade system.



Du kommer att delta i flera delar av projektens livscykel, från kravställning och verifiering till testning och integration. Efter driftsättning ingår även att bistå med driftstöd, teknisk assistans samt genomföra såväl förebyggande som avhjälpande underhåll.



Utöver detta tillhandahålls expertstöd inom teknik, administration och projektledning till kundens organisation. Projekten varierar i omfattning beroende på fas och typ, men huvudfokus ligger på SDR (Software Defined Radio). Det kan även förekomma arbete inom områden som radio- och satellitkommunikation, IP-kommunikation, vågutbredning och antennteknik.



Tjänsten innebär nära samarbete med andra teknikgrupper och rollen erbjuder möjlighet att arbeta från flera kontor. Tjänsteresor, främst inom Sverige, förekommer och i vissa fall även internationellt.


**Din profil**  

* Teknisk bakgrund inom radioteknik, elektronik, datateknik eller angränsande ingenjörsområden
* God teknisk förståelse
* Flytande svenska och engelska i tal och skrift


Meriterande:  

* Erfarenhet av radiokommunikation, IP-kommunikation, test och verifiering
* Tidigare arbete inom försvarsmakten eller försvarsindustrin
* Erfarenhet av drift, underhåll och felsökning
* B-körkort (underlättar vid vissa tjänsteresor)


Den ideala kandidaten har en god förmåga att arbeta självständigt, ta egna initiativ och trivs i tekniska miljöer. Ett genuint intresse för ny teknik samt viljan att ständigt utvecklas värderas högt. Stor vikt läggs vid personlig lämplighet och förmågan att samarbeta i team.  

Eftersom tjänsten omfattar arbete inom totalförsvaret krävs att kandidaten genomgår och godkänns i en säkerhetsprövning med registerkontroll.
**Övrigt**  

Start: Enligt överenskommelse  

Omfattning: Heltid  

Placering: Arboga, Västerås eller Enköping.  

Urval och återkoppling sker efter sista ansökningsdag med hänsyn till sommarsemester.


**Om oss**  

På Cleverex Bemanning arbetar vi med att rekrytera och hyra ut rätt medarbetare till rätt kund. Vårt största fokus ligger på våra kunder, konsulter och kandidater och vårt mål är att du som kandidat ska känna att du hamnat helt rätt!


  
Kategori
**Teknik/Ingenjörstjänster**
Tjänsten
**Ingenjör, Elektronik**
Placeringsort
**Göteborg**
Yrkesområde
**Visstidsanställning**
Omfattning
**Heltid**
Sista ansökningsdag
**02/08/2025**

title: Powertrain Engineer
description:
**Want to help shape the future of waterborne transport and be part of a world-class team?**


At Candela, we design and build electric hydrofoil boats and ferries with performance previously unheard of in the industry. Our mission is to accelerate the transition to fossil fuel-free lakes and oceans.


The Candela P-12 is our latest innovation—the world’s first electric hydrofoil ferry in operation, serving commuters in Stockholm and soon expanding to several other countries. By combining lightweight carbon fiber hulls, sensors, computers, and advanced submerged hydrofoils, our vessels fly above the water, delivering unmatched efficiency compared to conventional diesel ferries.

  

We are now looking for a **Powertrain Engineer** to support Candela’s growth ambitions. In this role you will be driving the development for one or more components and functionalities in the Powertrain system throughout the complete lifecycle. We take responsibility and drives the development from concept through industrialization and all the way to our demanding customers.  

  

This is a team, that plays an instrumental role in the development of our vessels and consists of skilled engineers and experts with extended knowledge and experience of all critical high voltage components that is needed to make the boats fly. When joining Candela and the Powertrain team you will be part of a team that is in the forefront in the world of electrification.

**Your core responsibilities will include:**

  

* Own the Propulsion system, from charging inlet to electric machines, as well as cabin HVAC and low-voltage actuators.
* Define and set requirements for system, system behavior and components.
* Secure that the system can be certified according to applicable standards.
* Evaluate and test performance, functionality and quality of the system.
* Interact with and support the software team to help achieve ultimate functionality and performance of the control systems.
* Support after market and service to ensure the best possible customer experience.
* Support production and procurement to secure products with competitive quality and cost.

 **To be successful in the role:**


We’re looking for a future team member with experience and motivation to work with electrical components, high voltage applications and powertrain system. The new team member shouldn't be just technically skilled, but also a creative mind to push ideas further.

**Required qualifications**

* Master's degree in Engineering or similar
* You have prior experience, education or strong interest in high voltage powertrains and an engineering degree in a relevant field.
* You have fundamental knowledge of electrical rotational machines, motor controller topologies or batteries.
* You have system experience and a good understanding of how to integrate components into a system realizing complex functionality.
* Self propelled with a strong drive and feel confident to work in a dynamic environment with high pace, shifting focus and strong market presence.
* Excellent communication skills in English and team-oriented attitude

**Join a stellar team**


By bringing together some of the world’s brightest researchers and engineers, we are pushing the boundaries of marine transportation. We take great pride in building engagement within our teams. Our internal motto is “with a revolutionary spirit and kindness”, which translates into an open and honest work environment.


We are a 200-strong, multinational team of experts within dynamic modelling, hardware design, hydrodynamics, control theory, machine learning, structural engineering work and production to build the next generation of waterborne transport.


This is a full-time position at our headquarters in Frihamnen.

**Application**


The selection and interview process is ongoing, so send your application in English as soon as it’s ready. Kindly note that we cannot process applications sent via email due to GDPR laws.

**Please note that due to the holiday season, the application process may take a bit longer than usual. But rest assured, we will review every application and get back to all candidates by the end of summer.**


We welcome the opportunity to meet you!

title: Testingenjör Fordonsindustrin
description:
**Test Engineer**  

  

We are currently facing exciting challenges, with more new components in the pipeline than ever before. To meet these demands, we are looking for a skilled and hands-on test engineer to join our team and help evaluate these components to ensure they meet the company’s high standards.  

  

The group, is responsible for the pump and dosing units within the dosing system. These components come with significant challenges – they must be robust enough to withstand freezing without damage. Although the components are sourced from suppliers, their development is a close collaboration between us and our partners. In addition to component ownership, we have overall system responsibility for the dosing system. This means we need a solid understanding of how the system is used and what requirements it must fulfill. We are constantly engaged across projects to stay updated on emerging issues and maintain strong cross-functional connections.  

  

Within the team, you’ll find committed and helpful colleagues, many with extensive experience in the field. You’ll be part of a relatively small team with a broad scope of work. If you’re missing specific knowledge, don’t worry – we’ll build that together. What matters most is your curiosity and eagerness to learn.  

  

**Your Responsibilities**  

As a test engineer, you’ll be part of a small team focusing on testing individual components and complete systems. You will lead tests from planning to execution and provide feedback on results. Much of the work takes place in our new laboratory – a creative and innovative space that allows for hands-on problem-solving and deep understanding. You’ll set up your own test rigs, run tests, and perform mechanical work. You’ll also apply your analytical skills to interpret results and suggest improvements to both the product and the test methodology. The role requires attention to detail while maintaining a holistic perspective. If you're interested in vehicles, you'll also enjoy the connection to full-vehicle testing, as part of our validation occurs in-vehicle. You will build a broad cross-functional network, including colleagues from software, hardware, and aftermarket departments.  

  

**Your Profile**  

We’re looking for someone who enjoys combining hands-on work with analysis – a practical person who wants to be an integral part of a team. You should be curious, eager to explore issues from different angles, and able to identify and understand deviations.Perhaps you are a design engineer seeking a more practical role but still want to influence the design process. Or maybe you’re a rig technician aiming to develop your analytical capabilities and move closer to product development. What matters is that you’re structured, methodical, and motivated to support development based on physical principles. Since the dosing system is a mechatronic system, we expect an interest in both control systems and mechanical design. Experience with Matlab, data analysis, design engineering, and aftermarket support is a plus. Because much of the work is collaborative, it’s essential that you enjoy building and maintaining strong professional relationships. Fluency in both Swedish and English is required. Knowledge of German is an advantage.

title: Trade Compliance Representative to Components
description:
**Description**


We are seeking a Trade Compliance Representative to Components that is a key business unit within Hitachi Energy, based in Ludvika, Sweden. We develop, sell and produces Bushings and Tap-Changers, both vital for all Power Transformers. We are part of delivering a safe way of transferring electricity while keeping losses at a minimum. We are proud of our product portfolio, our global customer base as well as our modern production unit.


We are now looking for a driven person for the role as Trade Compliance Representative. In this role you will handle matters such as implementing policies, processes and systems to improve our trade compliance in line with global regulations.  

  

You will work closely with the Country Trade Compliance Officers as well as different stakeholders on trade related matters, such teams working with inbound and outbound, customs, design, SCM. As a person you know how to connect and build relations both globally and locally both internally and externally.

**Your Responsibilities**

* Ensure that all business transactions (selling and sourcing, direct or indirect business, binding offers, imports, exports, transit trade, of goods, services, software, documents, samples, marketing materials and technology) are carried out in accordance with Corporate Regulation, Standard Operating Procedures, processes and guidelines.
* Long-term Supplier declarations – Collaborate together with our external suppliers to ensure that long-term supplier declarations are available for required article numbers. Collect, compile, follow up and update.
* Export calculations – Perform calculations to ensure compliance with preferential origin.
* Harmonization System Codes (Tariff code) – Responsible for the classification of all items, products and parts with support from technical experts and Trade Compliance Officers. Maintain and update these codes in our business system.
* Country of origin – Ensure that all purchased items in our business systems have the correct country of origin.
* Forwarders – Main point of contact and responsible for forwarders (incoming/import).

**Your Background**

* Diploma and background within the field of logistic, forwarding, purchasing or sales
* Good knowledge of the Swedish free trade agreement
* Fluency in Swedish is a must plus good skills in English
* Used to work in Excel, Power BI

**What we offer**

* Collective agreement
* Flexible working time
* Health care and wellness allowance
* Fantastic career possibilities within Hitachi Energy both within Sweden and globally
* Mentor to support you throughout onboard phase
* Various trainings and education supporting employee development
* Diversified company with over 70+ nationalities working in Sweden
* Supplementary compensation for parental leave
* Employee Benefit Portal with thousands of discounts and perks
* More benefits could be connected to this specific role

**More about us**


Are you ready to join Hitachi Energy for a career with no limits and a place where you can be yourself? We are interested to learn more about you and what you can contribute with so don’t hesitate to apply even though you don’t meet all requirements. A team with great cooperation and with diverse backgrounds is waiting for you to join!


Recruiting manager Henrik Berglund, HENRIK.BERGLUND@hitachienergy.com, will answer your questions about the position. Union representatives - Sveriges Ingenjörer: Håkan Blomquist, +46107383152; Unionen: Tomas L. Gustafsson, +46 107-38 27 47; Ledarna: Frank Hollstedt, +46 10 7387043. Any other questions can be directed to Talent Partner Cajsa Fellerfeldt Eklund, cajsa.fellerfeldt-eklund@hitachienergy.com

**Qualified individuals with a disability may request a reasonable accommodation if you are unable or limited in your ability to use or access the Hitachi Energy career site as a result of your disability. You may request reasonable accommodations by completing a** **general inquiry form** **on our website. Please include your contact information and specific details about your required accommodation to support you during the job application process.**
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

**This is solely for job seekers with disabilities requiring accessibility assistance or an accommodation in the job application process. Messages left for other purposes will not receive a response.**

company_description: Advancing a sustainable energy future for all

title: Geotechnical Engineer
description:
**Would you like to contribute to the development of COWI's projects in geotechnical engineering and create the sustainable cities and places of the future? Are you interested in providing geotechnical expertise to demanding projects? Are you eager to be involved with guiding the upcoming workforce in our department? Then join us at COWI to take your career to the next level.**

**Join our innovative team in Geotechnical engineering, Heavy Civil**


Within the Executing unit Infrastructure, Heavy Civil, we have three national geotechnical teams, in total about 30 people, all enthusiastic about shaping the future of urban development and infrastructure. We offer a diverse range of assignments, from early stages investigations to multidisciplinary project planning, construction documents, and construction support.


Within the Executing unit, there are geotechnical engineers, structural bridge engineers, project managers, landscape architects, traffic planners, water/land/road and railway designers, risk analysts, air, climate and sustainability specialists, environmental engineers, hydrogeologists, construction managers, and more.


Joining our team represents an opportunity for professional development, involvement in stimulating tasks, and unity with a collaborative workforce. Our experts have a multidisciplinary perspective and foster a spirit of collaboration within the department.


We are currently seeking a passionate Geotechnical engineer to join our Geotechnical group, based in Gothenburg, Stockholm, Helsingborg or Malmö.

**Make a difference in Geotechnical engineering**


As a part of our global team of experts, you'll have the chance to work closely with colleagues across departments and across office boundaries. As we have received many exciting projects and won interesting framework agreements, we need to grow our geotechnical teams and are now searching for an experienced geotechnical engineer and an experienced structural geotechnical engineer.


The positions offer the chance to undertake tasks on your own as well as engage with various project teams at COWI. Our assignments range from large infrastructure assignments to assignments within urban development, construction technology, industry, and environment for both state, municipal and private clients. You will work closely with experienced colleagues, junior geotechnical engineers, and skilled geotechnical field engineers. You will also be a part of a large international network of geotechnical engineers within the entire COWI group.


We work both across borders and within the local market, in different business areas where we share our knowledge and build strong relationships with customers and colleagues. You contribute with your expertise while you get the opportunity to learn from the best.

**Some of your key responsibilities and tasks could be to:**

* Work within geotechnical assignments, from early stages to the construction phase
* Work with geotechnical investigations, analyze data and prepare reports.
* Present results and actively participate in project meetings.
* Collaborate with other disciplines within projects.
* Have contact with customers and authorities.
* Collaborate cross-functionally with engineers and project managers for analysis and design of foundations for bridges, marine structures, and large infrastructure, supporting all project phases.
* Analyze and design earth retaining structures, assess slope stability, and calculate settlements. If you work as a structural geotechnical engineer, you will use tools such as Plaxis and similar FEM software to perform advanced numerical modeling and design.
* Prepare design deliverables, offer detailed geotechnical design recommendations, and ensure quality control validation of calculations, drawings, and specifications.
* Implement design best practices, ensure compliance with codes, standards, and client requirements, and conduct site visits and client interactions as needed.
* Be a mentor to junior geotechnical engineers
* Be part of the process of changing the way we work at COWI, everything from innovating ideas that will change the business to smaller ideas that will change our day-to-day practice.


At COWI, we recognize that our employees are our greatest asset. We offer a unique opportunity to learn from the best, develop your potential, teach the next generation, and play a part in shaping the society of the future.


We believe in empowering our employees. We value differences and development and cultivate an environment of belonging and having fun. Because that is what brings out the best in you, at work and at home.

**Qualifications**


We're looking for a team player who is eager to take on challenging assignments within geotechnical assignments. As a person, you are a responsive team player, communicative and committed, and stimulated by developing business solutions together with colleagues and customers. You thrive in an environment where you can support and guide other geotechnical engineers, and at the same time continue to grow by learning from those with deeper experience.


To fit for the service, you also need to:

* Have a relevant civil engineering degree.
* Have at least 15 years of experience from projects within Geotechnical engineering (if you have more experience we are also interested in hearing from you).
* Be able to speak and write fluently in Swedish and communicate well in English.

**A place to work and so much more**


At COWI, we work together with our customers to shape a sustainable and liveable world. We do it by applying our knowledge and curiosity – and sometimes even our courage – to create the solutions the world needs today to enable a better tomorrow. That is why we say no to fossil-based projects and aspire to have 100 per cent of our revenue come from activities that move our customers towards sustainability.


We value differences and development and cultivate an environment of belonging and having fun. Because that is what brings out the best in you, at work and at home.


With offices primarily located in Scandinavia, the UK, North America and India, we are currently 7,300 people who bring their expertise in engineering, architecture, energy and environment into play.

**Got more questions?**


If you have any unanswered questions about the role as Engineering Professionals Geotechnical engineering or what we have to offer, please reach out to:


Christina Edström, Head of Discipline Gothenburg/Stockholm at +46 10 850 11 36 or ched@cowi.com.


Eli Martinez Szmyt, Head of Discipline Gothenburg at +46 10 850 11 84 or eimr@cowi.com.


Simon Carlsson, Head of Discipline Malmö at +46 73 401 60 04 or sico@cowi.com.


If you want to apply, apply via the link, we are eager to hear from you! Apply directly as the role may be filled before the ad's closing date.

 **How to apply**


We would like to hear from you, apply via the link. Apply as soon as possible as the position can be assigned before end date.

**Equal Opportunities for All**


At COWI, we value equal opportunities for all employees and applicants based on individual circumstances without regard to gender, gender identity, gender expression, ethnicity, sexual orientation, disability, or age.


#LI-hybrid


  
**Application deadline**


14 September 2025**Recruitment type**


Full-Time, Permanent**Country**


Sweden**Locations**


Göteborg, Helsingborg, Karlstad, Malmö, Skövde, Stenungsund, Stockholm, Vänersborg**Req. ID**

* Tidigare arbete inom försvarsmakten eller försvarsindustrin
* Erfarenhet av drift, underhåll och felsökning
* B-körkort (underlättar vid vissa tjänsteresor)


Den ideala kandidaten har en god förmåga att arbeta självständigt, ta egna initiativ och trivs i tekniska miljöer. Ett genuint intresse för ny teknik samt viljan att ständigt utvecklas värderas högt. Stor vikt läggs vid personlig lämplighet och förmågan att samarbeta i team.  

Eftersom tjänsten omfattar arbete inom totalförsvaret krävs att kandidaten genomgår och godkänns i en säkerhetsprövning med registerkontroll.
**Övrigt**  

Start: Enligt överenskommelse  

Omfattning: Heltid  

Placering: Arboga, Västerås eller Enköping.  

Urval och återkoppling sker efter sista ansökningsdag med hänsyn till sommarsemester.


**Om oss**  

På Cleverex Bemanning arbetar vi med att rekrytera och hyra ut rätt medarbetare till rätt kund. Vårt största fokus ligger på våra kunder, konsulter och kandidater och vårt mål är att du som kandidat ska känna att du hamnat helt rätt!

title: Embedded Softw. App. Engineer Associate
description:
Transport is at the core of modern society. Imagine using your expertise to shape sustainable transport and infrastructure solutions for the future? If you seek to make a difference on a global scale, working with next-gen technologies and the sharpest collaborative teams, then we could be a perfect match.

 **Look here, we're hiring!**

  

Volvo is again heavily investing in sustainable transportation solutions for the future: Electromobility. We are now looking to strengthen our team with a function developer.

 **About the role**


Design it, build it, test it, drive it, see your design come to life and be part of the electromobility revolution!


At Electromobility, Volvo Group Trucks Technology, we are currently looking for an Embedded SW Application Development Engineer to join the Propulsion System Control Team!

 **This is us,** your new colleagues


We are the Propulsion System Control team, a part of Volvo Group Trucks Technology’s Electromobility organization.

  

We are a team of highly skilled professionals from a wide variety of backgrounds, who share a passion for technology and developing products that make a difference for the Volvo Group’s customers and society and takes the heritage of an excellent conventional truck and turn that into environmentally friendly and sustainable top-notch electrical vehicle.

  

Our responsibility is to design, develop, test and verify an embedded application software, to control the final request for propulsion or retardation from the driver of the vehicle.

  

The Electromobility department combines the benefits of a large international company with the feeling of working at a small company, with close collaboration between everything from sales and purchasing to workshops and labs, all located in the modern, inspiring facility CampX. Teamwork and collaboration are the foundation of great products and an attractive workplace.

 **Who are we?**

  

In our team, cultural alignment is valued, and we are constantly working to improve the company’s diversity and inclusion statement. Diversity is an important factor as we now are expanding. We are targeting individuals from all walks of life, seeking to establish commonalities outside of the social labels. Together we can build a multifaceted team, and with the overall capability we can reach new levels in developing electric vehicles.

  

We offer a well working organization delivering to our brands for truck, buses, trucks, buses, construction equipment, marine and industrial powertrains.

 **Who are you?**

  

We are looking for an engineer who are highly collaborative, with a strong drive to deliver what the customer needs with in the highest technical standards in cooperation with others. You need to understand embedded function development.

  

You either have experience from the automotive industry, system development, software development or you are a junior Function Developer with a great attitude, working cross functional and a willingness to learn and gradually take more responsibility.

  

You need to be able to grasp over a wide technical area where automotive, embedded systems, batteries, transmissions, electric machines, charging system, testing, continues deployment are great assets. But you could become a specialist in one of the areas.

  

Some of our developers spends time in vehicle with a computer attached, some spend most of the time in office, both is important and depending on the current needs.

 **What will you do?**

  

In order to succeed in your new role we think you have some of the parts below:

* MSc Degree in Electrical Engineering, Physics, Mechatronics or equivalent
* Good teamworking and communication skills
* Experience in areas like embedded software development, TargetLink, Simulink, programming in C-code, python, Ascet,
* SystemWeaver, requirement management
* Vehicle or automotive experience, possibly a C-driving license or similar from other industries like trains, aircrafts, ships, robotics etc,
* Experience of virtual testing and verification and/or full scale testing in vehicles

 **Are we a perfect match?**

  

When joining us you will be a part of the biggest technology shift in the transport industry, with our innovative products we make our customers win. We want you to be in the front seat.

  

Volvo Group is the world’s leading manufacturers of trucks, buses, construction equipment and marine and industrial engines. We try to make maximum advantage of the strength inherent to differences in knowledge, experience, age, gender and nationality, among others. We find that well balanced work teams increase group dynamics creativity, and new approaches to solutions.

  

We value your data privacy and therefore do not accept applications via mail.

 **Who we are and what we believe in**  

We are committed to shaping the future landscape of efficient, safe, and sustainable transport solutions. Fulfilling our mission creates countless career opportunities for talents across the group’s leading brands and entities.

  

Applying to this job offers you the opportunity to join **Volvo Group**. Every day, you will be working with some of the sharpest and most creative brains in our field to be able to leave our society in better shape for the next generation. We are passionate about what we do, and we thrive on teamwork. We are almost 100,000 people united around the world by a culture of care, inclusiveness, and empowerment.

 **Group Trucks Technology** are seeking talents to help design sustainable transportation solutions for the future. As part of our team, you’ll help us by engineering exciting next-gen technologies and contribute to projects that determine new, sustainable solutions. Bring your love of developing systems, working collaboratively, and your advanced skills to a place where you can make an impact. Join our design shift that leaves society in good shape for the next generation.
company_description: Every day, we work with some of the sharpest and most creative brains in our field to leave our society in better shape for the next generation.

title: Backend Engineer – Payments
description:
**Location:** 
 Stockholm (In-office)
   

  

**Company:** 
 360Player
   

  

**Job Type:** 
 Full-time
   

  

**Join the Global Leader in Sports Technology**
 At 360Player, we are redefining how sports clubs operate, develop players, and manage teams. As the world’s leading all-in-one Club Operating System, we help clubs streamline every aspect of their operations—from scheduling and payments to player development and video analytics.
   

  

 Trusted by top clubs such as Rush Soccer, FC Barcelona, and Rafa Nadal Academy, our platform is transforming the sports world. With offices in Stockholm, Barcelona, and the US, we’re looking for passionate, driven individuals to join our team as we continue to grow globally.
   

  

**About The Role**
 We are looking for a
 **Backend Engineer** 
 to join our
 **Payments team** 
 , focusing on building and maintaining the systems that power payments within the 360Player platform.
   

  

 In this role, you will work on
 **integrations with payment providers, building payment flows, and developing reporting tools** 
 that support the diverse payment needs of sports clubs worldwide. You will collaborate closely with frontend engineers and other backend team members to ensure secure, reliable, and seamless payment experiences for our users.
   

  

 This role will allow you to work on meaningful projects that have a direct impact on how clubs handle payments globally, supporting their operations with stable, user-friendly solutions.
   

  

**What You’ll Do**
* Develop and maintain backend features for the payments domain within the 360Player platform.
* Build and maintain integrations with payment providers, ensuring reliability and security.
* Develop and improve checkout flows to support a wide variety of club needs.
* Build reporting tools to provide clear payment insights to clubs and internal teams.
* Work closely with frontend engineers to ensure seamless user experiences.
* Contribute to maintaining and improving backend systems to ensure stability and performance.
* Participate in code reviews and collaborate on improving backend practices.


**What We’re Looking For**
* 3+ years of experience in backend development.
* Proficiency in Go (Golang) or strong experience in another language with a willingness to learn Go.
* Experience working with relational databases and SQL.
* Experience working with or integrating payment providers such as Adyen, Stripe, or similar is a plus.
* Understanding of API design, clean code practices, and building scalable backend systems.
* Comfortable working collaboratively with frontend engineers and stakeholders.
* Strong attention to detail, especially related to payment flows and data handling.
* Fluent in English, both spoken and written.


**Personal Qualities**
* Structured and reliable with a proactive mindset.
* Collaborative and clear communicator.
* Curious and eager to learn and contribute to improvements.
* Enjoys problem-solving and building solutions that directly impact users.
* Interest in sports or technology that supports community operations is a plus.


**Why 360Player?**
* Work on payment systems trusted by sports clubs globally.
* Be part of a fast-growing company with opportunities for professional growth.
* Collaborate with a skilled, supportive, and international team.
* Build solutions that directly impact the daily operations of sports clubs worldwide.
* Enjoy a flexible, creative, and collaborative work environment where your input matters.


**How To Apply**
 If you are excited about backend development and want to build meaningful features that impact the sports world, we would love to hear from you.
   

  

 Apply with your
 **r** 
**esume and a short cover letter** 
 explaining why you are interested in this role at 360Player. We review applications on a rolling basis, so don’t wait to apply! Please note that due to summer vacations interviews will be conducted in August and responses may be delayed.

title: Software Engineer till Find My Factory
description:
**Om rollen**
 Vi söker nu en erfaren Software Engineer som vill vara med och designa, bygga och drifta molnbaserade tjänster som utgör hjärtat i vår plattform för Supplier Discovery. I rollen blir du en del av vårt tech-team och arbetar nära både AI-Engineers och andra kollegor, där du kommer att ta funktioner hela vägen från idé (RFC) till produktion, driftsättning och övervakning.
   

  

 Du får en central roll i vårt techteam där du kommer integrera funktionalitet och vidareutveckla vår plattform och vårt erbjudande. Vi arbetar med moderna tekniker och värdesätter best practices som automatiserade tester, kodgranskningar, CI/CD och GitOps. Vår arbetsprocess bygger på tvåveckors sprintar med ett pragmatiskt och lean-inspirerat arbetssätt.
   

  

 Teknikstacken du kommer att arbeta med inkluderar:
   

  

**Python** 
 ,
 **FastAPI** 
 ,
 **Kubernetes** 
 ,
 **Terraform** 
 ,
 **GCP/AWS** 
 ,
 **Pub/Sub/Kafka** 
 ,
 **PostgreSQL/BigQuery** 
 ,
 **Docker** 
 ,
 **GitLab** 
 ,
 **Airflow,** 
**LangChain** 
 ,
 **Elastic** 
 .
   

  

**Vi söker dig som har**
* Minst 4 års erfarenhet av att utveckla och driftsätta produktionstjänster (gärna med Python; Go eller TypeScript är meriterande)
* Dokumenterad erfarenhet av distribuerade system, containers och minst en större molnplattform (GCP, AWS eller motsvarande)
* Gedigen kunskap om REST/GraphQL API:er, datamodellering och eventdrivna arkitekturer
* Trygghet i att äga och ansvara för tjänster i produktion (metrics, loggning, incidenthantering)


**Meriterande**
 Vi ser det som ett plus om du har erfarenhet av:
   

  

* Data pipelines (ETL/ELT)
* Infrastructure-as-Code (t.ex. Terraform) och GitOps-arbetsflöden
* Driftsättning och träning av ML-modeller, samt utveckling av AI-agenter


**För att trivas i rollen tror vi** 
 att du uppskattar att arbeta i en teknikdriven kultur där frihet under ansvar och experimenterande är en självklar del av vardagen. Du gillar att bygga MVP:er, iterera snabbt och undvika onödigt komplexa lösningar. Du har en AI-först-mentalitet och ser värdet i att använda moderna verktyg för att effektivisera utvecklingen som agent-baserad kodning och automation.
   

  

**Om företaget**
 Find My Factory utvecklar nästa generations plattform för att lösa verkliga problem inom leveranskedjor med AI som kärna. Vi är ett litet och snabbfotat bolag där teknik och produkt står i centrum, och där din insats verkligen gör skillnad. Vi arbetar hybrid med kontor i Stockholm med stor flexibilitet. Fredagar varannan vecka ägnas åt kunskapsdelning och vi lägger stort fokus på att bygga ett lärande team.
   

  

**Frågor och kontakt**
 I denna rekrytering samarbetar Find My Factory med Amendo Tech. Vid frågor om tjänsten är du välkommen att kontakta Johanna Hallenberg på johanna.hallenberg@amendotech.se. Vi ser fram emot att höra från dig!
   

  

**Om Amendo Tech**
 Amendo Tech är det självklara konsult- och rekryteringsföretaget inom tech, IT och digital utveckling.
   

  

 Amendo Tech är en del av Amendo Group som har arbetat med kompetensförsörjning sedan 2001. I koncernen ingår även Lagotto Executive Search & Interim som är specialiserade på executive search och interima tillsättningar av ledare och specialister, samt Amendo Bemanning och Rekrytering som erbjuder rekryterings- och konsultlösningar inom ekonomi, bank, finans, försäkring, HR och kommunikation.
   

  

 Följ gärna Amendo Tech på Linkedin.
