title: Staff Software Engineer (FinTech) – Back End (Bangkok based, Relocation provided)
description:
**About Agoda**
 Agoda is an online travel booking platform for accommodations, flights, and more. We build and deploy cutting-edge technology that connects travelers with a global network of 4.7M hotels and holiday properties worldwide, plus flights, activities, and more . Based in Asia and part of Booking Holdings, our 7,100+ employees representing 95+ nationalities in 27 markets foster a work environment rich in diversity, creativity, and collaboration. We innovate through a culture of experimentation and ownership, enhancing the ability for our customers to experience the world.
   

  

**Our Purpose –** 
**Bridging the World Through Travel**
 We believe travel allows people to enjoy, learn and experience more of the amazing world we live in. It brings individuals and cultures closer together, fostering empathy, understanding and happiness.
   

  

 We are a skillful, driven and diverse team from across the globe, united by a passion to make an impact. Harnessing our innovative technologies and strong partnerships, we aim to make travel easy and rewarding for everyone.
   

  

**Get to Know Our Team**
 Fintech is one of the fastest growing areas in Agoda and we are rapidly expanding our tech team. We work closely with the finance business team and our Fintech product owners to reduce risk, drive efficiencies and move on new market opportunities in this exciting field. We have a wide range of projects from traditional finance to cutting-edge customer fintech. For example, reconciliation using Big Data technologies, growing and optimizing customer payments options, tax calculations in milli-second r esponse times and a mesh of supplier payment options like virtual credit cards. It ’ s a hot field and the perfect mix of data engineering and backend engineering.
   

  

**The Opportunity**
**In this role, you will not only develop robust backend systems but also architect and maintain scalable data pipelines and storage solutions that support complex data collection, processing, and analysis. Your dual expertise in backend and data engineering will play a crucial role in optimizing our financial technology solutions and driving informed business decisions through reliable data insights.**
**In This Role, You’ll Get to**
* Think and own the full life cycle of our products, not just a single piece of code – from business requirements, technology selection, coding standards, agile development, unit and application testing, to CI/CD and proper monitoring
* Design, develop and maintain platforms and data pipelines across fintech
* Boost System Performance: build systems that are stable, scalable, and highly performant to meet the dynamic demands of the financial landscape
* Write great code and help others write great code – mentor people in your team and wider
* Collaborate with other teams and departments
* Exceptional problem-solving skills coupled with a strategic mindset are essential. You possess the ability to adapt to new changes and the foresight to anticipate future needs. Leadership at Agoda isn’t just managing tasks but inspiring innovation and driving vision into reality
* Foster Cross-Functional Collaboration: work with diverse teams to drive forward product and technology goals
* Shape our future team: Play a pivotal role in recruiting and onboarding exceptional talent


**What You’ll Need To Succeed**
* 8+ years of experience with strong proficiency in Java, Kotlin, Scala, or C# with a proven track record of developing high-performance applications in production settings. Insightful experience with big data technologies like Hadoop, real-time processing frameworks (e.g., Apache Spark), and advanced knowledge of SQL and data architecture
* Thinks in systems: their edge cases, failure modes, and life cycles
* Uses a metrics driven approach and can make informed decisions using data
* You are passionate about the craft of software development and constantly work to improve your knowledge and skills
* Experience with Scrum/Agile development methodologies
* Excellent verbal and written English communication skills
* Experience with operational excellence and a deep understanding of metrics, alarms and dashboards


**It’s Great If You Have**
* Experience working in a modern FinTech or Payments organization
* Domain knowledge in any of these areas: financial reconciliation, financial reporting, tax, payout methods like virtual credit cards or customer payments
* Hands-on experience working with technologies like Spark for data processing, ETLs for data pipelines and queueing systems (Kafka, RabbitMQ)
* Core engineering infrastructure tools like GitLab for source control and Continuous Integration, Kubernetes
* Experience developing, maintaining and debugging large-scale distributed systems
* Experience in leading projects, initiatives and/or teams, with full ownership of the systems involved


**This position is based in Bangkok, Thailand (Relocation Provided)**

title: Senior Power System Engineer / Kraftsystemingenjör
description:
**About Us**
 We are the independent expert in assurance and risk management. Driven by our purpose, to safeguard life, property, and the environment, we empower our customers and their stakeholders with facts and reliable insights so that critical decisions can be made with confidence.
   

  

 As a trusted voice for many of the world’s most successful organizations, we use our knowledge to advance safety and performance, set industry benchmarks, and inspire and invent solutions to tackle global transformations.
   

  

**About Energy Systems**
 We help customers navigate the complex transition to a decarbonized and more sustainable energy future. We do this by assuring that energy systems work safely and effectively, using solutions that are increasingly digital. We also help industries and governments to navigate the many complex, interrelated transitions taking place globally and regionally, in the energy industry.
   

  

**About The Role**
 The Power Systems Analysis Nordics Team in DNV Energy Systems is seeking a Senior Power System Engineer.
   

  

 The ideal candidate should driven by the challenges of the energy transition and the future power grid, combined with experience in delivering services in power system analysis and system studies. The focus will be on the integration of renewable generation and other power system devices such as energy storage, HVDC, and FACTS devices. Experience with grid code compliance simulations and testing, as well as protection coordination and selectivity planning, would be an advantage.
   

  

 You will be part of the
 **Power System Analysis (PSA) Nordics** 
 team of DNV Energy Systems in the Northern Europe region. The main location will be the DNV office in
 **Gothenburg, Sweden** 
 . Other possible offices include Malmö and Solna in Sweden, and Oslo in Norway.
   

  

 The PSA Nordics team is part of the Power Grid Systems and Technology Northern Europe department, consisting of around 100 highly motivated engineers and consultants who support transmission and distribution system operators, industrial clients, and renewable plant owners and developers with specialized and innovative consultancy advisory services in the area of power systems and technology.
   

  

 You will be involved in national and international projects within and beyond the borders of the Nordics and Northern Europe region. The projects are often cross-functional, where we collaborate with other specialized teams within DNV, and sometimes with external partners. As a Senior Engineer, you will often take the role of Project Manager, or work as a technical expert in projects, delivering your own technical work or coaching younger colleagues and reviewing their work. You will also interact with customers, help identify market opportunities, develop our existing services, and establish new services. Management and leadership experience is also seen as a positive.
   

  

**Your Tasks And Responsibilities**
* Perform power system studies with modeling and analysis of the behavior of power systems and electric grids.
* Perform detailed analysis and investigations related to specific topics, such as:
+ Grid code compliance
+ Fault clearance, protection, and control
+ Voltage control, frequency control, and grid stability
+ Power quality and reliability
+ Grid integration of renewables, conventional generation, storage, and power electronics (e.g., HVDC, FACTS), etc.

* Take the lead in project and proposal work, as project/bid manager or as a technical lead.
* Prepare, review, or otherwise contribute to high-quality technical reports and commercial proposals.
* Report the findings of your and your team’s work in high-quality technical reports and presentations for customers, in professional networks, and to colleagues.


***På svenska***
 Den
 **Nordiska Kraftsystemanalysgruppen** 
 inom DNV Energy Systems söker en erfaren
 **Senior Kraftsystemingenjör** 
 .
   

  

 Vi söker en kandidat som drivs av utmaningarna inom energiomställningen och framtidens elnät, med tidigare erfarenhet av kraftsystemanalys och systemstudier. Fokus ligger på anslutning av förnybar produktion och andra elkraftsystem som energilager, HVDC och FACTS-enheter. Erfarenhet av nätkoder och nätkodsefterlevnad, samt reläskyddskoordinering och selektivitetsplanering är meriterande.
   

  

 Du kommer att vara en del av
 **Kraftsystemanalys (PSA) Nordics-teamet** 
 inom DNV Energy Systems, Nordeuropa. Placeringen är på DNV:s kontor i
 **Göteborg, Sverige.** 
 Andra kontor i Malmö och Solna (Sverige) eller Oslo (Norge) är också möjliga alternativ.
   

  

 PSA Nordics-gruppen är en del av avdelningen Power Grid Systems and Technology Northern Europe, som består av cirka 100 mycket motiverade ingenjörer. Teamet hjälper transmissions- och distributionssystemoperatörer, industrikunder, samt ägare och utvecklare av förnybara anläggningar med specialiserade och innovativa konsulttjänster inom kraftsystem och teknik.
   

  

 Du kommer att arbeta med nationella och internationella projekt både inom Norden och utanför Norra Europa. Projekten är ofta tvärfunktionella där vi samarbetar med andra specialiserade team inom DNV och ibland med externa partners. Som senior ingenjörkommer du ofta att ta rollen som projektledare eller fungera som teknisk expert i projekt, där du utför tekniskt arbete och även coachar yngre kollegor. Du kommer också att samarbeta med kunder, identifiera marknadsmöjligheter och utveckla både befintliga och nya tjänster.
   

  

**Dina Arbetsuppgifter Och Ansvarsområden**
* Genomföra kraftsystemstudier med modellering och analys av kraftsystem och elnät.
* Genomföra detaljerade analyser och utredningar inom specifika områden, såsom:
+ Simuleringar för efterlevnad av nätkoder,
+ Skydd och kontroll,
+ Spänningsreglering, frekvensreglering och nätstabilitet,
+ Elkvalitet och tillförlitlighet,
+ Anslutning av förnybara energikällor, konventionell produktion, energilager, kraftelektronik som HVDC, FACTS, m.m.

* Leda projekt och anbudsarbete, antingen som projekt-/anbudsansvarig eller som teknisk expert.
* Förbereda, granska eller på andra sätt bidra till högkvalitativa tekniska rapporter och kommersiella offerter.
* Rapportera och presentera resultaten av ditt och ditt teams arbete i högkvalitativa rapporter och presentationer för kunder, kollegor och olika professionella nätverk.


 What we offer
   

  

 At DNV, We Provide a Supportive And Inclusive Environment That Empowers You To Thrive And Make An Impact. Here’s What You Can Look Forward To
   

  

* A challenging and varied job in a dynamic and international environment, as part of a world-leading technical advisory company with a global reach and more than 15 000 employees around the world.
* Being a central part of a professional team of committed colleagues who value teamwork and support.
* Flexible working hours and focus on work/life balance.
* Plenty of opportunities for personal growth: based on your experience, we will create a plan together with you for your personal development for the next few years. We will do this through our 70-20-10 philosophy: 70% learning on the job, 20% coaching and 10% training.
* The opportunity to make a difference by actively contributing to shaping the energy transition.


 DNV is an Equal Opportunity Employer and gives consideration for employment to qualified applicants without regard to gender, religion, race, national or ethnic origin, cultural background, social group, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital status, age or political opinion. Diversity is fundamental to our culture and we invite you to be part of this inclusive and diverse workforce.
   

  

***På svenska***
 På DNV erbjuder vi en stöttande och inkluderande arbetsmiljö som ger dig möjlighet att blomstra och göra skillnad.
   

  

**Här Är Vad Du Kan Se Fram Emot**
* En utmanande och varierad tjänst i en dynamisk och internationell miljö, som en del av ett världsledande tekniskt konsultföretag med global räckvidd och mer än 15 000 anställda över hela världen.
* Att vara en central del av ett professionellt team av engagerade kollegor som värdesätter teamwork och stödjer varandra.
* Flexibla arbetstider och fokus på balans mellan arbete och privatliv.
* Många möjligheter till personlig utveckling: baserat på din erfarenhet kommer vi att skapa en plan tillsammans med dig för din personliga utveckling under de kommande åren. Vi kommer att göra detta genom vår 70-20-10 filosofi: 70% lärande på jobbet, 20% coaching och 10% utbildning.
* Möjligheten att göra skillnad genom att aktivt bidra till att forma energiomställningen.


 DNV är en arbetsgivare som erbjuder lika möjligheter och tar hänsyn till kvalificerade sökande utan hänsyn till kön, religion, ras, nationellt eller etniskt ursprung, kulturell bakgrund, social grupp, funktionshinder, sexuell läggning, könsidentitet, civilstånd, ålder eller politisk åsikt. Mångfald är grundläggande för vår kultur och vi inbjuder dig att vara en del av denna inkluderande och mångsidiga arbetsstyrka.
   

  

**About You**
 You have:
   

  

* MSc or PhD in Electrical Engineering with specialization in Power Systems.
* At least 5 or more years of relevant experience, ideally within consultancy.
* Knowledge and understanding of core technical areas: Power System Studies, Grid Integration of Generation, Grid Code Compliance, Testing & Modelling of Production Units, and/or Protection and Control.
* Experience with modeling and simulation of electrical components and networks with tools such as PowerFactory, PSS/E, PSCAD, ETAP, Neplan, or similar.
* Verbal and written communication skills in English, and ideally Swedish.
* Interest and proven ability in leading projects and interacting with customers and in professional networks.
* Ability to organize project work, support your project team to deliver, and create a good team spirit. Management and leadership experience is also seen as a positive.
* Structured way of working with high precision.
* High level of creativity, flexibility and initiative.
* Customer focus, ability to make new contacts and maintain professional relationships internally and externally.


***På svenska***
**Du Har**
* Civilingenjörsexamen (M.Sc.) eller doktorsexamen (PhD) i elektroteknik med inriktning kraftsystem.
* Minst 5 eller fler års relevant erfarenhet, helst inom konsultverksamhet.
* Kunskap och förståelse för kärntekniska områden: kraftsystemstudier, nätanslutning och integration av ny produktion, nätkodsefterlevnad, testning och modellering av produktionsenheter, och/eller skydd och kontroll.
* Erfarenhet av modellering och simulering av elektriska komponenter och nätverk med verktyg som PowerFactory, PSS/E, PSCAD, ETAP, Neplan, eller liknande.
* Muntliga och skriftliga kommunikationsfärdigheter på engelska, och helst svenska.
* Intresse och bevisad förmåga att leda projekt och interagera med kunder och i professionella nätverk.
* Förmåga att organisera projektarbete, stödja ditt projektteam att leverera och skapa en god teamanda. Erfarenhet av ledarskap ses också som positivt.
* Strukturerat arbetssätt med fokus på hög kvalité.
* Hög nivå av kreativitet, flexibilitet och initiativförmåga.
* Kundfokus, förmåga att skapa nya kontakter och upprätthålla professionella relationer internt och externt.

title: Consultant - PLM & CAD
description:
**PDSVISION is currently looking for consultants in the Nordic region! Join our dedicated team focusing on helping companies successfully get the most out of their PTC, Ansys and PDSVISION product portfolios!**
 PDSVISION is a global provider of services focused on helping companies successfully enable their Digital Transformation Journey. We specialize in delivering solutions and services around 3D Design (CAD), Product Lifecycle Management (PLM), Product Data Management (PDM), Simulation Modeling (CAE), Internet of Things (IoT), Augmented Reality (AR) and Aftermarket Solutions.
   

  

 We achieve this by combining best-in-class software solutions, technical support and professional training services with divisions located across the globe.
   

  

 We employ professionals in Sweden, Norway, Finland, Denmark, Germany, UK, USA & SEA. We are a strategic partner to both PTC (
 **ptc.com** 
 ) and Ansys (
 **ansys.com** 
 ), the global market leaders in Engineering & Simulation Software solutions.
   

  

**Your role**
 As a Technical Consultant in one of our project teams, you will help deliver a wide range of customer projects within the PTC product portfolio. These projects vary in size and complexity, and your combination of technical expertise and interpersonal skills will be essential to ensure successful implementations and long-term customer satisfaction.
   

  

 Typical assignments include:
   

  

* Installing and configuring enterprise-scale PLM and CAD systems on both Windows and Linux.
* Performing data migrations and system upgrades
* Configuring, customizing and testing customer environments to meet specific needs
* Supporting customers throughout the implementation process to secure a smooth transition


 A key part of your role is also to act as a Trusted Advisor to our customers. This means guiding them on how to get the most value out of their PLM investments, from understanding and challenging their current ways of working to drive them towards best practices, to educating teams and shaping effective processes that support their business objectives
   

  

 Beyond technical deliveries, you will collaborate closely with customers and colleagues to understand requirements, identify improvement opportunities, and contribute to the continuous development of our delivery processes.
   

  

**What’s In It For You**
 Many of our employees have been with us for a long time, mainly because of what we offer:
   

  

* A clear career path: We have a solid plan to help you grow and take the next steps in your career.
* Continuous learning and mentorship: You’ll be supported by experienced colleagues who guide you through training, certifications, and real-world challenges that broaden your skills.
* A strong professional network: Build valuable connections with peers, experts, and a wide range of companies, from global enterprises to innovative local firms across our 950+ customers.
* Technical variety: Work hands-on with a diverse mix of technologies including, large-scale PLM enterprise systems, databases, on-premise and cloud servers, and Active Directory.
* A knowledge-sharing culture: Join a team that values collaboration and continuous improvement, where you’ll grow both technically and as a trusted advisor to our customers.
* Exciting projects: Enjoy the variety and challenge of delivering solutions across different industries, always with strong support from your team.


**Why you?**
 To be successful in the role of at PDSVISION as a consultant you should be able to relate to the following characteristics as a description of yourself:
   

  

* Solution-oriented and driven
* Ability to work independently while still being an active member of a project team
* Social and optimistic
* Relevant Academic degree such as Mechanical engineering, Software Engineer, IT or other relevant experience such as IT Specialist/Programmer


 We will help you to further develop your skills, but experience and knowledge related to the following areas are of use and a plus in a future role at PDSVISION:
   

  

* PTC knowledge
* Creo Parametric and Windchill are our core products
* Ansys knowledge
* Ansys are a growing area for PDSVISION hence a growing need of experience
* Other CAD/PLM systems
* Our customers often work in multi-CAD environments
* Product development through CAD
* This is what our customers do
* Product Lifecycle Management, PLM
* This is vital for many of our customers
* IT systems such as servers/VPNs/AD/database
* This is a common way for us to access different customers’ environments
* SQL
* Programming & IT knowledge
* Useful languages: java
* AR & IIoT knowledge
* Useful applications: Vuforia & Thingworx


**Other Information:**
 Full-time probation period for 6 months to move over to permanent employment.
   

  

**Salary:**
**Individual Salary Dependent On Skills And Experience**
**Excited?**
 Please apply for the job here.
   

  

 Recommendations, resumes and diplomas should be brought if you are selected for an interview. We will not contact your current employer without your consent.
   

  

 PDSVISION does not offer sponsorship to non-European applicants.

title: Senior/Staff Data Engineer (Fintech team) (Bangkok based, relocation provided)
description:
****About Agoda****
 Agoda is an online travel booking platform for accommodations, flights, and more. We build and deploy cutting-edge technology that connects travelers with a global network of 4.7M hotels and holiday properties worldwide, plus flights, activities, and more . Based in Asia and part of Booking Holdings, our 7,100+ employees representing 95+ nationalities in 27 markets foster a work environment rich in diversity, creativity, and collaboration. We innovate through a culture of experimentation and ownership, enhancing the ability for our customers to experience the world.
   

  

**Our Purpose –** 
**Bridging the World Through Travel**
 We believe travel allows people to enjoy, learn and experience more of the amazing world we live in. It brings individuals and cultures closer together, fostering empathy, understanding and happiness.
   

  

 We are a skillful, driven and diverse team from across the globe, united by a passion to make an impact. Harnessing our innovative technologies and strong partnerships, we aim to make travel easy and rewarding for everyone.
   

  

****About Agoda****
 Agoda is an online travel booking platform for accommodation, flights, and more. We build and deploy cutting edge technology that connects travelers with more than 2.5 million accommodations globally. Based in Asia and part of Booking Holdings, our 4,000+ talents coming from 90+ different nationalities foster a work environment rich in diversity, creativity, and collaboration. We innovate through a culture of experimentation and ownership, enabling our customers to experience the world
   

  

**Get to Know Our Team**
 Fintech is a rapidly expanding industry with endless opportunities for growth and innovation. At Agoda, we are proud to be at the forefront of this exciting field, working closely with our finance business team and product owners to reduce risk, increase efficiency, and seize new market opportunities. Our fintech projects are diverse and varied, ranging from traditional finance to cutting-edge customer-facing solutions. Whether using big data technologies for reconciliation, expanding and enhancing payment options for our customers, or developing lightning-fast tax calculation systems, we are constantly pushing the boundaries of what’s possible in fintech. With a talented team of data and backend engineers, we are well-equipped to tackle any challenge that comes our way. Agoda is the perfect place for you if you’re passionate about fintech and looking to make a real impact in this dynamic industry.
   

  

**The Opportunity**
 We are seeking highly skilled engineers with a range of experience in fintech to join our team. Whether you are a seasoned expert or just starting out in the field, we welcome your application. We are looking for intelligent and agile engineers with strong attention to detail and the ability to work on both back-end and data engineering tasks. If you have a passion for fintech technology and are excited about the opportunity to build and innovate, we would love to hear from you. We value a wide range of experience and backgrounds and encourage all qualified candidates to apply.
   

  

**In this Role, you will get to**
* Think and own the full life cycle of our products, not just a single piece of code – from business requirements, technology selection, coding standards, agile development, unit and application testing, to CI/CD and proper monitoring
* Design, develop and maintain platforms and data pipelines across fintech
* Improve scalability, stability, and efficiency of our existing systems
* Write great code and help others write great code – mentor people in your team and the wider organisation
* Collaborate with other teams and departments
* Help us hire extraordinary talent such as yourself!


****What You’ll Need To Succeed****
* Minimum 7 years of experience under your belt developing performance-critical applications that run in a production environment using Scala, Java, C# or Kotlin
* Experience with data tooling: Spark, Kafka, Workflow Orchestration Tools
* Advanced working SQL knowledge and experience working with relational databases, query authoring (SQL) as well as working familiarity with a variety of databases
* Experience building and optimizing ‘big data’ data pipelines, architectures and data sets. In depth knowledge of Model and Design of DB schemas for read and write performance
* Experience performing root cause analysis on internal and external data and processes to answer specific business questions and identify opportunities for improvement
* Build processes supporting data transformation, data structures, metadata, dependency and workload management
* Experience supporting and working with Scrum in Agile Cross-functional teams
* Excellent verbal and written English communication skills


**It’s great if you have**
* Deep experience with spark based distributed data pipelines. Able to deep dive and solve challenges in spark query plans and optimize code. Experience in Spark streaming is a plus
* Strong experience building finance stack applications including ledgers, revenue recognition, monetary transfers and reconciliations, financial accounting platforms etc
* Experience handling financial data risk management and data governance projects.
* Experience supporting internal and external financial audits
* Experience with data profiling, data lineage, data cataloging to enhance data governance and documentation
* Experience in leading projects, initiatives and/or teams, with full ownership of the systems involved
* Experience with building data pipelines to integrate 3rd parties is plus

**Equal Opportunity Employer**
 At Agoda, we pride ourselves on being a company represented by people of all different backgrounds and orientations. We prioritize attracting diverse talent and cultivating an inclusive environment that encourages collaboration and innovation. Employment at Agoda is based solely on a person’s merit and qualifications. We are committed to providing equal employment opportunity regardless of sex, age, race, color, national origin, religion, marital status, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, citizenship, veteran or military status, and other legally protected characteristics.
   

  

 We will keep your application on file so that we can consider you for future vacancies and you can always ask to have your details removed from the file. For more details please read our privacy policy .
   

  

**Disclaimer**
 We do not accept any terms or conditions, nor do we recognize any agency’s representation of a candidate, from unsolicited third-party or agency submissions. If we receive unsolicited or speculative CVs, we reserve the right to contact and hire the candidate directly without any obligation to pay a recruitment fee.
